Job Description:

Full time content writer for developing unique content for client websites, company web properties and newsletter, including technical writing. The copy writer will also edit and revise existing content based on client’s keywords. Successful candidate will be trained on our content optimization techniques and will utilize his/her content writing abilities with our techniques for best search engine required content. Collaboration with programmers/engineers will be necessary to define and deliver necessary documentation solutions. Candidate will also perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein. This is an exciting position that will allow you to expand your knowledge in the areas of Internet marketing and search engine optimization. We are looking for a quick learner that can multitask and perform projects under tight deadlines. You need to be able to work under little supervision and be a team player. We are a fast paced Internet company and on the cutting edge of technology.

Recommended Experience:
1 or more years of previous writing experience as a sole contributor.
Bachelors Degree with preferred majors in English, Journalism, Marketing, Advertising or Communications.
Would prefer someone with knowledge of HTML editing applications (i.e.: Dreamweaver) and some Photoshop.
Knowledge of website marketing and search engine marketing very helpful.
Experience and ability to thrive in a fast-paced company preferred.
Salary:

Depending on experience, a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as the opportunity for career growth.

About Our Company:

Submit Express Inc. is a leading Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and internet marketing company in business over 15 years. Our company also offers reputation management, link building, content writing, press release services and email marketing. Our sister company iClimber.com offers social media marketing services. Our clients are mainly mid-size to large businesses, including Fortune 1000 companies. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Nebo is a creative digital agency committed to doing great work and never settling for "good enough." The culture is friendly, and the work is challenging, because that's the way we like it. Located in Midtown Atlanta, we're at the heart of the Southeast's digital and marketing scenes, and we're also conveniently located behind the best coffee in town.

We're looking for someone to be a leader on our search engine optimization team in strategy, client communication and the creation of a variety of deliverables including keyword strategies, complete website audits and creative, buzz-generating campaigns from brief to post-launch. The right person has a thorough understanding of technical SEO, but frames it within a larger understanding of digital marketing strategy.

We don't care about how many years of experience you have, just what you've done and what you're capable of doing. We also appreciate a good sense of humor.

Practical Requirements
Communicating with clients, helping them understand relevant metrics, what we do, and the progress of their project
Create highly refined keyword strategies that lay the foundation for the rest of a client's SEO project
Performing thorough, detailed website analysis, identifying current problems and opportunities, with a focus on crawlability, site architecture and site content
Performing competitive research, identifying what the client's competitors are doing right, what they're doing wrong, and how these tactics influence the client
Participating in strategic brainstorming sessions and leading the team in the creation and execution of off-page campaigns that drive awareness, build buzz and indicate relevance to the search engines
Staying up to date on current industry practices, news, and algorithm updates
Training other employees in on-page and off-page SEO
Beneficial Skills
A working knowledge of HTML & CSS
The ability to write coherent, compelling copy that is not only keyword-rich, but also user-friendly
An understanding of social media and its role in SEO
Experience with Google Analytics, a variety of content management systems, and industry specific tools

PACIFIC is founded on the premise that the massive amount of data readily available to brand advertisers can be combined with the best practices of search engine optimization to deliver a more relevant and engaging experience to consumers.

PACIFIC is looking to change the way brand marketers view SEO. To us, it’s no longer about results on a page. Instead, we believe it’s about:
Crafting delightful and engaging digital experiences for visitors.
Extending brands beyond websites and into mobile, social media, and the open web.
Understanding the influence of geography on shopper behavior.
Translating discovery to action.
We are seeking an SEO Manager to join our San Diego Team. The Organic Search manager will play a key role within our company. The position is for someone who has an entrepreneurial attitude, is passionate about all things related to organic search, social and digital, and deeply cares for their team and their clients. In short, if you consider yourself a digital marketer, curious about exploring the connections between search, technology, and consumer behavior, then let’s connect.

We’d like you to be very familiar with the best practices of the search marketing industry. You understand the core concepts behind the best available practices of organic search, know how to develop and execute keyword rich on page content, and know how to pull intelligence from analytics.

If you can do all these things, then drop us a line. You’ll love it here.


WHAT YOU’LL DO


The core responsibility for the role will be to understand, communicate and execute all things related to organic search. You’ll be involved with our clients in all aspects of their business activities, from reporting to executing strategies originating from campaign performance:
Convey key fundamentals of SEO to both technical and lay persons alike.
Be a specialist in your space by staying on top of current search news, search engine feature and algorithmic adjustments.
Work closely with the Head of Organic Search to conceptualize and implement SEO projects including, but not limited to on-page and off-page optimization activities.
Ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines.
Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
Work on multiple projects concurrently, demonstrating the ability to handle many things at once.
Work independently to recognize areas of opportunity and growth.
Exhibit a restless interest in advancing the success of our clients & agency.
YOUR BACKGROUND


We embrace diversity and non-traditional people, but at a minimum we really need someone that fits the following profile:
Experience in the organic search space (min. 2-3 years), managing a combination of organic search accounts & preferably has experience in the digital agency field.
A strong understanding of Search.
Proficient in keyword research and build-out.
Experience in the travel industry is a plus.
Experience with traffic and analytics tools.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.

Hello, all! I'm Ben, owner of Ben's Repurposed Cabinetry, where we recycle high-end kitchens all up and down the Front Range and get them into the hands of average, hardworking Americans, like you and me. I'm also a 5th and 6th grade teacher up here in Loveland, CO, and a father of four little ones, so life is exciting : ) I'm looking for someone who can spend probably 5-10 hours a week helping us with our SEO efforts, although more time more be needed initially.

The way I see it, there are four main categories we should be focusing on here. The first is SEO specialist: someone who will collaborate with us to find the right keywords/phrases for us to go after. Second is web developer: someone who will modify our website to be search engine friendly and help with the creation of new pages. Third is web producer: someone who formulates a plan to increase our online user experience and conversion rate. Fourth is content writer: someone to make keyword-rich blog content for our website that people are actually excited to find. This is the area I'm most focused on. For real success, I believe it's vital that we have amazing content. I would like to add to hire someone for each of these areas and have us all collaborate as a team.

Please understand that I just put a price on the ad because I had to, but I have no idea what that should be. Obviously, cost is a major consideration, especially with the current situation, but I also want to make sure you are adequately compensated for top quality work that produces results. I'm very excited about executing this. You will find I'm extremely passionate about what I do, and I truly believe we can start crushing it online with your help.

If you think this is the right fit for you, please include a cover letter with your resume. To be clear, you will not be considered if this isn't included. I find this vetting process always me to get to know you better and weeds out most of the people who aren't truly interested. In the cover letter, please explain why you believe you'd be a great addition to our team and what you think about my SEO categories breakdown above. Would you agree those are the four main areas I should focus on, or am I way off on that? Finally, please include a couple references for me to contact and/or some way for me to view your work. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Thanks, Ben

iPullRank is an ambitious five-year-old digital marketing agency based in New York City and founded by industry thought leader Michael King. Our mission is to drive results for our clients by delivering marketing work that we can be PROUD of. Oh, and our value set is PROUD: P – Proactive; R – Reliable; O – Outstanding; U – Useful; D – Dedicated. We keep that front and center on a day-to-day basis.

If you’re curious about what types of clients we work with, they range from Fortune 500 brands to mid-sized enterprises and exciting small businesses. Our team executes and consults on campaigns in a variety of industries, but many of our clients tend to be media, finance or fashion companies. The iPullRank team is adept at providing a range of digital marketing services, but most of our work is in some combination of Content Strategy, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Analytics and Conversion Rate Optimization. Our employees are duly encouraged to specialize deeply in a specific category that they are passionate about and grow into well-rounded marketers through collaboration, training and real-world experience.

As an employer, we look to cultivate an environment where employees feel taken care of. Despite our size, we offer competitive salaries and benefits. We want our employees to grow with us. We don’t want you to just fill a role, we want you to take ownership and make an impact.We’re not a big agency and our clients appreciate that because our size allows us to make things happen. We’re a nimble group that believes the best idea can come from anyone in the company -- and we're always after the best idea. We’re looking for creative and smart people to join our team and help us in our missions to find the best idea. If that’s you, we’d love to hear from you.

Position Description

iPullRank is looking for an account manager to join our team and help with process implementation, execution, client retention, and account growth. This account manager serves as the primary business contact responsible for client success and project delivery for a subset of our client accounts. The role provides excellent client service, manages client growth and facilitates communication across the team. For the right person, this is the opportunity to really put your stamp on how a business operates.

What You’ll Do
Manage client communications, conflict resolution, and compliance on client deliverables. Foster and cultivate client success and relationships
Review all client deliverables to ensure quality standards and client expectations are met
Determine and pursue opportunities for account growth
Ensure client retention
Ensure that client issues are dealt with in an efficient manner
Work closely with the project team in order to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status and to proactively identify potential issues and/or opportunities within or related to the project.
Manage internal and external projects
Lead client on-boarding and work with the team to develop project plans
Develop innovative solutions to help clients drive results and exceed campaign goals
Develop proposals for clients by securing internal business approvals, products, and research to support a wide range of client solutions.
Prepare client campaign reports
Contribute to new business through inbound marketing efforts
Requirements
A deep desire to build something
A sense of urgency for internal and client needs
Proven Account Management skills required in order to create, maintain and enhance customer relationships
Proven Project Management skills required in order to ensure on-time and high quality delivery
2-3 years of agency experience account or project management experience
Working knowledge of HTML and CSS
Working knowledge of Search Engine Optimization, Social Media or Content Marketing
Working knowledge of Google Analytics or similar analytics packages
Demonstrated ability to retain and grow accounts
Extremely detail oriented
Motivated, goal oriented, persistent and a skilled negotiator
High level of initiative and work well in a team environment
Ability to communicate effectively with a team of varying personalities
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Handles stressful situations and deadline pressures well
Plans and carries out responsibilities with minimal direction

SEO Manager

Job Description

SEO Manager

Job Description
*_Drive organic growth through best-in-class SEO strategy and execution_**
As **SEO Manager** on our SEO (search engine optimization) team, you will leverage your deep experience in search engine optimization strategy and technical execution to drive significant organic search traffic and user engagement growth for the Apartments.com Network of rental brands including Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, Apartamentos.com and WestsideRentals.com.

You will be joining a best-in-class team that has relentlessly high standards, is never satisfied with the status quo, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Our industry-leading SEO team is the driving force for our business and has exceeded our performance goals each year.

Our success is dependent on our ability optimize our Apartments.com Network sites to beat the competition and earn the most qualified traffic from search engines like Google and Bing. Google is taking an AI-first approach (artificial intelligence) company-wide, including their search algorithms, and we need to raise our bar to continue our levels of unprecedented growth and exceed our future SEO goals.

We are counting on you to bring a genuine curiosity about how consumers search for information, and pair that with a strong technical aptitude and ability to analyse large datasets, uncover trends and insights, then turn those findings into actionable recommendations.
*_Make a significant impact in the first 90 days_**
Create a comprehensive SEO strategy for each of our Apartments.com Network sites and prioritize a roadmap of the top 10+ projects to implement for each rental brand. This will begin with an in-depth technical SEO audit, detailed log file analysis, and a robust competitive assessment to benchmark our performance and identify meaningful areas of opportunity to propel significant growth.

Design and develop dashboards and/or visualizations with our team of data analysts to track the organic search performance for our network of sites, and setup alerts and notification to monitor key metrics, spot issues, and uncover compelling insights based on KPIs, goals and objectives (ex. using data from Google Analytics, plus other internal and external tools).

Spearhead two to three key SEO projects from concept to completion. Start by identifying the project via research and analysis, working with our data analysts to quantify the impact, make an informed recommendation of how to execute this project, and work with our product and development teams to implement the project, see it through to perfect execution and finally track performance to show the value and benefit to the organization.
*_Build our organization's SEO capabilities_**
You will collaborate cross-functionally across internal teams (marketing, product, technology, analytics, research, etc.) to evaluate SEO opportunities that deliver business goals. Proactively identify new potential SEO projects and highlight key opportunities for to drive our organization forward.

Take the time to have your SEO projects reviewed by other team members, coordinate across departments and with our agency and vendor partners to work through your plans with others, establish best practices and troubleshoot then resolve potential issues upfront.

Share results of your analyses with our team members and across other relevant departments and teams. This includes the conclusions you are drawing to derive meaning from the data, and what business actions you think should be taken as a result of the analysis, plus any learnings from your analysis for how we can improve the collection and upkeep of our datasets.

You will act as a role model throughout our team, but also our organization by maintaining the highest professional standards, promoting data governance, data management, creative thinking and pushing us to always be our best.
*Skills & Qualifications** **:**
+ 5+ years of in-house or agency SEO work experience with a proven track-record of growing organic visibility and traffic for industry leading brands in competitive search landscapes

+ Strong technical aptitude with the ability to analyse data, interpret information and trends in large amounts of data to develop actionable recommendations

+ Excellent problem solving, attention to detail, objectivity and the ability to think strategically

+ Excellent communication (both written and verbal) and presentation skills - proven experience of presenting data to a non-technical audience

+ Results orientated - ability to prioritize, drive and achieve whilst working to deadlines under pressure

+ Analytical approach with the ability to interpret information and trends

+ Ability to organize workload in a fast-paced work environment

+ Ability to learn new systems and adapt quickly in a technology led environment

+ Bachelors or Master's Degree in Marketing, Analytics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or another data-driven field

+ Expertise using Google Analytics, Google Search Console & Bing Webmaster Tools

+ Google Analytics Individual Qualification (IQ)

+ Expert knowledge of Excel (VLOOKUP, pivot tables, conditional formatting, etc.)

+ Advanced proficiency with HTML5, CSS3 and front-end web programing languages
*Company** **Overview** **:**
CoStar Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: CSGP) is the number one provider of mission-critical information, analytics and online marketplaces for the commercial real estate industry.

Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar's team of 3,000 worldwide includes the industry's largest professional real estate research organization. CoStar Group's suite of products including CoStar.com; Loopnet.com and Apartments.com offers marketing and information solutions to commercial real estate professionals and consumers throughout North America and Europe.
*Why** **join** **the** **CoStar** **team** **?**
Our culture of innovation and excellence attracts and encourages the best and brightest in a broad range of disciplines, which makes CoStar a fun and supportive place to work. CoStar's benefits plan ranked among the top 10% of employers nationwide. Besides generous pay and performance-based incentives, the company also provides a 401(k) with company match. We support our employees' professional and academic growth with internal training and tuition reimbursement.

With a state of the art in-house gym and healthy snacks in every kitchen, we were recently recognized by the Alliance for Workplace Excellence with their Seal of Workplace Excellence and their Health & Wellness Trailblazers award. Our 10-point commuter assistance program, which resulted in traveling 4.8 million fewer vehicle miles and saving 242,000 gallons of gasoline per year, also recently won the Commuter Connections Incentive Award!

At CoStar we believe in working hard and playing hard. While we take our work seriously, we make plenty of time for fun. Join the team and check out our fleet of loaner bicycles and Segways to take a break. Give back to the community and participate in the CoStar Builds service program. Restore and rejuvenate with onsite yoga classes or in our state of the art gym.

We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the Unites States to apply. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.

Founded in 1987, CoStar Group, Inc. (Nasdaq:CSGP) is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces.

CoStar conducts expansive, ongoing research to produce and maintain the largest and most comprehensive database of commercial real estate information. CoStar data powers the $17 trillion world of real estate - delivering the sale, lease, property, tenant, contact, reporting and industry information that makes connections happen. We help our clients make smart investments and decisions. Eighty-three percent of the nation's commercial real estate transactions involve a CoStar subscriber, and the top 95% of the leading 1,000 brokerage firms use CoStar to inform their decisions.

We also help create lasting experiences through our family of marketplaces. In addition to CoStar, CoStar Group brands and marketplaces include LoopNet, Apartments.com, BizBuySell, and Lands of America - collectively attracting more than 25 million monthly unique visitors. The Apartments.com Network is the nation's #1 most visited apartment listing network, with 45 million monthly visits, allowing renters to find their perfect homes. LAND.com connects landowners to their perfect properties, spots and open spaces. BizBuySell allows small business owners to bring their dreams to life. And LoopNet connects investors, sellers and brokers with clients who fall in love with their properties.

Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe and Toronto, Canada with a staff of approximately 3,700 worldwide, including the industry's largest professional research organization.

Senior SEO Manager (m/w/d) (in Vollzeit, unbefristet) Die Bike24 GmbH ist ein junges E-Commerce-Unternehmen für Fahrrad- und Sportartikel mit Sitz in Dresden. Unsere Erfolgsgeschichte begann im Jahr 2002 mit einer handvoll Mitarbeiter. Mittlerweile gehört Bike24 europaweit zu den führenden Onlinehändlern dieser Branche und beschäftigt rund 350 Mitarbeiter, die täglich im Interesse zufriedener Kunden im Einsatz sind. Der Versand unserer rund 120.000 Produkte erfolgt heute weltweit in mehr als 70 Länder. Was Dich bei uns erwartet: Ein etablierter Arbeitgeber an einem zukunftsträchtigen Standort, der deiner Leidenschaft absolut gerecht wird - ob Radfahren in der Dresdner Heide, Klettern in der Sächsischen Schweiz oder Wassersport auf der Elbe. Eine wöchentliche Arbeitszeit von 40 Stunden - Wenn Du nicht in Vollzeit arbeiten möchtest, finden wir auch das für Dich passende Arbeitszeitmodell! Ein freundschaftliches und lockeres Arbeitsklima, bei dem Dich unsere Du-Kultur bereits ab dem ersten Kennenlernen von unseren flachen Hierarchien überzeugen wird. Ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld in hellen Räumen und kleinen Teams, in denen der fachliche Austausch gewünscht und gelebter Alltag ist. Minutengenaue Zeiterfassung und ein arbeitnehmerfreundliches Überstundenmodell bei flexiblen Arbeitszeiten. Homeoffice in Absprache. Attraktive Sozialleistungen bzw. die Möglichkeit zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge. Tolle Mitarbeiterkonditionen in unserem Onlineshop. Ein voll ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz mit Notebook & Mobiltelefon. Weiterbildung durch Schulungen und Messen sowie Entwicklungstrainings & Workshops. Bike Leasing für dein Dienstfahrrad oder Jobticket für den ÖPNV. Freistarts und Tickets für gesponserte Radsport- und Laufveranstaltungen sowie Mitarbeiter-Aktionen. Sonderkonditionen im nahegelegenen Fitnessstudio. Deine neue Herausforderung: Du bist verantwortlich für alle strategischen und operativen SEO-Themen bei BIKE24. Hierbei identifizierst du proaktiv SEO-Potenziale bzw. SEO-Problematiken. Du unterstützt den Fachbereich Marketing und Redaktion bei themenbasierten Keyword-Recherchen. Du stellst sicher, dass unser Content auch unter SEO-Gesichtspunkten gut performt. Neben der Durchführung regelmäßiger Wettbewerbsanalysen bist du für das fortlaufende Monitoring und die Überprüfung unserer relevanten SEO-KPIs zuständig. Für unsere Mitarbeiter bist du Ansprechpartner und Coach zugleich und richtest interne Trainings sowie Workshops aus. Du agierst als Schnittstelle zwischen verschiedenen Fachbereichen wie dem Marketing und der IT und stehst in engem Austausch mit diesen. Ebenso gehört die Steuerung unserer externen Dienstleister und Partner zu deinem Aufgabenportfolio. Was Du mitbringen solltest: Du verfügst über mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Inhouse-SEO oder in einer SEO-Agentur und hast bereits eigenständig SEO- bzw. Kundenprojekte erfolgreich betreut und weiterentwickelt. Du bringst Erfahrungen im Umgang mit den gängigen SEO-Tools (z. B. Google Search Console, Google Analytics, SISTRIX und Screaming Frog) mit. Du weißt, wie Google und Co. funktionieren, insbesondere kennst du dich mit Crawling- und Indexierungsmanagement, Internationalisierung, strukturierten Daten und Seitenarchitekturen von Websites aus. Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in gängigen Web-Technologien wie JavaScript, HTML und CSS. Neben deiner ausgeprägten Hands-on-Mentalität bist dir auch für operative Umsetzungen nicht zu schade. Du hast mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklungsteams und kennst agile Entwicklungsmethoden wie Scrum oder Kanban. Du hast ausgeprägte Erfahrung mit Projektmanagement-Tools wie Jira oder Asana. Der Umgang mit den gängigen MS-Office-Programmen ist kein Problem für dich. Du arbeitest strukturiert, nachhaltig und mit einer hohe Selbstdisziplin. Du nimmst gern die Herausforderung einer komplizierten Aufgabe an, bei der du deine lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise einsetzen kannst.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Confidential Information

This position has access to confidential information such as logins pertaining to client work.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience

0-2 year(s) of SEO experience; or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.

Language Skills

Strong reading comprehension, writing, and correspondence skills. Ability to review written content for accuracy, phrasing, and grammatical errors.

Mathematical Skills

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent, and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

Reasoning Ability

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Computer Skills

Knowledge of Internet browsers, business directories; Google Analytics; Google My Business; Google Search Console; and standard Microsoft Office Suite software.

Attributes

To perform the job successfully, an individual should possess and/or demonstrate the following:

Oral Communication – Speaks clearly; listens and gets clarification; responds thoroughly and patiently to questions.

Teamwork – Exhibits objectivity and openness to others’ views; gives and welcomes feedback; puts success of team above own interests; supports everyone’s efforts to succeed; shares expertise with others.

Ethics – Treats people with respect; observes and maintains confidentiality; upholds organizational values.

Judgment –Displays willingness to make decisions; exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions; includes appropriate people in decision-making process; makes timely decisions.

Quality – Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; applies feedback to improve performance.

Motivation – Demonstrates persistence in overcoming obstacles; takes initiative; volunteers for and readily takes on new challenges; looks for and takes advantage of opportunities; asks for and offers help when needed.

Professionalism – Approaches others in a tactful manner; reacts well under pressure; treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; accepts responsibility for own actions; follows through on commitments.

Adaptability – Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands; changes approach or method to best fit the situation; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

Attendance/Punctuality – Is consistently at work and on time; ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; arrives at meetings and appointments on time.

Dependability – Follows instructions, responds to management direction; takes responsibility for own actions; keeps commitments.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be regularly required to sit for extended periods of time; use a computer keyboard and mouse for all work; and look at a computer screen for the majority of working hours. Close vision will be required (ability to see clearly at 20-inch distance or less).

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee may occasionally be exposed to fumes or airborne particles. The noise level in the work environment is quiet to moderate. The worksite is located on the second floor of a building, which, in the event of elevator maintenance or malfunction, would only be accessible by ascending a staircase. The worksite is primarily lit with fluorescent lighting, which will occasionally flicker.

SEO Specialist


Description:
We need someone who is passionate about SEO and Digital Marketing to help deliver amazing SEO results for our growing roster of clients. The ideal candidate will not only be proficient in the latest and greatest techniques and tools, but will also have the ability to think strategically about projects and play a role in putting together integrated campaigns blending organic search, PPC, display, and remarketing. You’ll be working on multiple client accounts across a variety of industries and verticals, but you’ll always have the same goal: to get the client the best possible results.

The right candidate will be able to multitask across diverse environments, communicate with clients and internal team members, and be passionate about learning new technologies and processes. We’re looking for someone who can think strategically, but who isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and get some serious work done. They should have at least 2-3 years of direct SEO experience at an agency.

Responsibilities include:

Assisting with strategic development for SEO campaigns, starting from kick-off and extending through post-launch and analysis
Defining and building keyword lists based on clients’ objectives and market opportunity, using a mix of proprietary tools, analytics data, and PPC data
Preparing and executing on-page optimization strategies to achieve organic visibility for our clients
Reviewing and editing page content to comply with SEO guidelines and best practices, and to ensure proper messaging, use of value propositions, and call to action statements to drive conversions
Preparing website technical audits to identify areas of concern from an SEO perspective
Reviewing website server logs, crawl reports, and analytics reports to come up with strategies to improve indexation
Reviewing web analytics data to provide feedback to our internal team on performance, and to analyze visitor behavior and trends to come up with next steps
Working with our internal resources to prepare, plan, and execute link building and content marketing strategies
Coordinating regularly with our website development, SEM, design, and business development teams, as well as with senior management, to ensure that clients are getting positive results
Collaborate with content and outreach team to help identify opportunities to create, distribute, and promote web content.

Required Skills:

Strong face-to-face, telephone, and email communications skills
Organized and detail-oriented
Strong writing and content editing skills
Demonstrated track record of delivering organic traffic related outcomes that move the needle in competitive markets
Ability to think strategically to identify and define keyword opportunities for optimization
Familiarity with website analytics platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Knowledge of factors that influence search engine rankings
Knowledge of SEO software such as Moz, BrightEdge, DeepCrawl, Conductor, SEMRush, SEOBook, ScreamingFrog, and others
Experience with paid search (Google Ads, Bing Ads, etc) is a plus
A strong passion for SEO!

An amazing team of developers, designers, marketers, project managers, and the occasional four-legged office pet.

Position Title: SEO Manager

Reports to: VP, Digital Marketing

Location: New York City

Duration: Full-time permanent

Start: ASAP

Work hours: Standard 9-5

Interview process: Phone Screen, Assignment, Group Zoom, Decision.

Reason for opening: Media company that specialized in defining, managing, and executing online marketing strategies looking to add a highly motivated and accomplished SEO Manager to join our growing team and to contribute to our continued success.

Position Summary:

They will take a lead role in creating and delivering Search Engine Optimization and Search Engine Marketing Strategies across our client portfolio. This individual must be deadline, target and results driven and thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. The ideal candidate thrives working independently yet also is a collaborative and team player, enjoys interacting externally and internally for mutual success and is eager to learn and succeed.

Responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to:

Act as the SEO expert for clients

Develop and evolve the SEO content strategies for our clients, keeping in mind best practices for SEO

Research and implement SEO keyword content strategies for key web properties, advancing

keyword rankings and outperforming competitors in Google and other search engines

Conduct SEO content audits and monitor client websites to bring up to current usability and SEO standards

Provide reporting (weekly and monthly) of traffic performance and keyword rankings

Daily involvement in monitoring results of projects, identifying problem areas and their root causes,

providing recommendations based on findings and leverage learnings

Work closely with the Client Services team to communicate and pitch SEO strategy/ recommendations,

provide timely and relevant SEO proposals

Collaborate with SEM team and key stakeholders in planning meetings and discussions

Provide best practices for new content, redesigns, taxonomies, and migrations

Stay up-to-date on SEO trends, latest algorithm updates, and news and their respective impact on our

metrics, leverage learnings in day to day practices

Expand SEO Team as needed, including hiring, onboarding, training and mentoring a junior SEO team member dependent on Team needs

Required Experience:

Solid and demonstrable SEO background

Minimum of 3-5 years proven SEO marketing experience, preferably in an agency environment

High degree of understanding and familiarity across all digital channels

Experience in managing multiple projects with a multitude of stakeholders

Deep understanding of HTML and programming knowledge

Ability to evaluate and modify HTML and JavaScript for SEO purposes

A thorough understanding of key search engine ranking factors

Ability to conduct relevant keyword research and make recommendations

Experience with keyword research and content optimization

Excellent communication skills and ability to liaise with clients

Strong numerical and analytical skills

Experience using and setting up Google Analytics and SEO tools

Solid understanding of website architecture

Proven track record of successfully optimizing eCommerce sites for competitive head terms and long tail terms

Experience with Google Search Console and Google Analytics

Familiarity and experience with Screaming Frog, MOZ, SEMRush, Brightedge, Conductor, and/or other industry tools

A history of presenting SEO recommendations to clients in a clear, concise, and thoughtful way

Master presentation and storytelling skills

Problem-solving skills and comfortable working in a hands-on, rapidly changing environment

An ability to stick to strict deadlines and prioritize along with a keen eye for detail

Emotional intelligence, positive attitude, enthusiasm and a sense of humor

About the Company

We specialize in defining, managing, and executing online marketing strategies. We are marketing professionals, business consultants, and technology experts dedicated to doing whatever it takes to help our clients succeed. Our cutting-edge tools and comprehensive approach provide clients with real-time information and immediate results. We have built an environment that provides our employees with the opportunity to achieve great personal and corporate success. Our management team has confidence in our employees and empowers them to think on their feet, make decisions, and deliver results that contribute directly to our bottom line.

WebStrategies, voted one of the Best Places to Work in Virginia in 2018 and 2019, is growing, and we want you to be a part of it. We're looking for a bright and motivated individual with a passion for SEO to join our team and create ravings fans of our clients. If you love SEO, keep reading. We think you'll like what you see...

Note: This position requires the person to be located in, or willing to relocate to Richmond Virginia. If that's not you, then please don't apply.


What you'll do
Work directly with WebStrategies team members to develop and execute clients’ SEO campaigns
Work directly with and support the WebStrategies internal SEO team
SEO tasks to include:
SEO research and strategy development
Onsite SEO implementation
Site structure/internal link audits
Local SEO strategy and execution
Keyword and content topic research
Link building strategy and execution
SEO site audit implementation
Schema development and implementation
Who You Are
Someone who loves SEO and how it can help businesses. We emphasize driving measurable results for our clients and we use SEO to help do that.
Someone who loves finding keyword opportunities in a crowded space
Someone who gets a thrill seeing a keyword ranking make it to the first page of Google
Someone who gets excited watching their rankings result in traffic and leads for clients
Someone who understands how to use data to find insights and create an effective strategy.
Someone who wants to grow their knowledge and experience in SEO.
What You'll Get
A digitally-obsessed team in which you learn from professionals in one of the top online marketing teams in the area.
A positive, healthy company culture steeped in our core values of Growth, Empathy, Essentialism, Accountability, and (doing what's) Right. Or GEEAR.
Working for a growing agency voted one of the Best Places to Work in Virginia in 2018 and 2019.
Working for a Hubspot Certified and Google Partner
Flexible work from home policy. While we have a physical office in Midlothian and meet together regularly, you are not required to come in every day (most employees split their time between their home office and our office).
Training - you will be trained and certified on the latest inbound and digital marketing methods and platforms.
A clear track for career growth, increased responsibilities, and increased compensation.
Qualifications
2-4 years hands on experience creating and implementing SEO strategies
Hands-on experience with Google Analytics or other web analytics platform
Hands on experience with SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, SEMRush, Ahrefs, SkyFu, Moz, and Searchmetrics.
HTML experience for making onpage changes
Google Tag Manager experience for implementing site schema
Ability to analyze data to drive recommendations and decisions
Creative, forward-thinking self-starter with an attention to detail and drive to produce consistent and quality work
Superior written and verbal communications skills, coupled with highly developed interpersonal skills
High EQ (emotional intelligence)
Highly organized with excellent time management skills
How to stand out


We'd love to know what types of influencers or publications you follow to improve yourself as a professional, marketer, or person. Similarly, any side projects or freelance work that demonstrates your passion for the space. If you'd like to stand out from the other applications, send Chris Leone some examples directly.


Compensation


We are proud to offer a very competitive compensation and benefits package, which we'll share with you during the interview process.


A little more about us...


We were voted one of the Top Places to Work in Virginia in 2018 and 2019 and one of the Fastest Growing Companies in Richmond in 2018. And while those are nice, we believe our best days are still ahead of us, and we want you to be a part of that journey. We will invest in you, challenge you, and develop you.

We can't wait to hear from you.

Minimum of 5+ years of relevant SEO experience required, SEO at large e-commerce organization or a well-known marketing agency a big plus.
Very strong analytical ability, read SEO reports to get insights and find new opportunities.

Functional knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Experience designing SEO performance reports.
Experience working with SEO web developers.
Experience working with UX designers, a plus.
Experience with creation and/or execution of SEO strategies.
Define requirements, tasks, and resources associated to SEO strategy
Manage and execute implementation of SEO strategy
Communication to clients, team, and management on strategy/project development, timelines, and results
Collaborate on client strategy and goal definition for success
Keep pace with SEO, search engine, social media and internet marketing industry trends and development
Strong understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) life cycle - On Page Basics like Meta Tags, Website Interlinking, Breadcrumbs, URL Optimization, Image Optimization, Off Page - Links from High Domain authority websites, Guest Blogging, Image Sharing, Link Analysis to track spamming, Keyword Research & Tracking to find new scopes
Provide competitor backlink analysis and suggest recommendations for internal and external linking along with ensuring outreach execution.
Operational
Technical Analysis: Conduct comprehensive technical site audits on desktop as well as mobile to identify gaps like page indexing, text to HTML ratio, broken links, etc. and suggest recommendations. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.
On Page Optimization: Conduct detailed analysis of all on-page attributes like H1 tags, meta-tags, title tags, etc. and provide recommendations based on SEO best practices for optimization. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.
Content Strategy: With keyword research as the fundamental input conduct a deep dive on site content to contribute to a content strategy. The strategy needs to provide keyword to page mapping, identify content gaps and suggestions in the form of content calendars for both on and off the site. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.
Off page: Conduct in-depth link analysis by evaluating multiple link data points and properties. Categorize the links as positive or negative impact links and create action plans around link building or removal. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.
SEO Analytics: Conduct data analysis on SEO and derive actionable insights to enable continuous optimization. Be analytical and creative in representing SEO data in different reports and dashboards. Provide SEO insights on the client deliverables

We're Happy Cog, a growing interactive agency located in the NoMad District of Manhattan. We’re on the Ad Age top 10 best places to work list and have been on the Inc 5000 fastest-growing companies list seven years in a row.

Looking to work with awesome clients? Well, we've got an impressive list including Google, Airbnb, Etsy, The Associated Press, New York City, and Columbia University to name but a few. We've got an incredible road ahead, and are looking for a full-time SEO Specialist to join us on that journey!

We need someone who is passionate about SEO and Digital Marketing to help deliver amazing SEO results for our growing roster of clients. The ideal candidate will not only be proficient in the latest and greatest techniques and tools, but will also have the ability to think strategically about projects and play a role in putting together integrated campaigns blending organic search, PPC, display, and remarketing. You’ll be working on multiple client accounts across a variety of industries and verticals, but you’ll always have the same goal: to get the client the best possible results.

The right candidate will be able to multitask across diverse environments, communicate with clients and internal team members, and be passionate about learning new technologies and processes. We’re looking for someone who can think strategically, but who isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and get some serious work done. They should have at least 2-3 years of direct SEO experience at an agency.


Responsibilities include:
Assisting with strategic development for SEO campaigns, starting from kick-off and extending through post-launch and analysis
Defining and building keyword lists based on clients’ objectives and market opportunity, using a mix of proprietary tools, analytics data, and PPC data
Preparing and executing on-page optimization strategies to achieve organic visibility for our clients
Reviewing and editing page content to comply with SEO guidelines and best practices, and to ensure proper messaging, use of value propositions, and call to action statements to drive conversions
Preparing website technical audits to identify areas of concern from an SEO perspective
Reviewing website server logs, crawl reports, and analytics reports to come up with strategies to improve indexation
Reviewing web analytics data to provide feedback to our internal team on performance, and to analyze visitor behavior and trends to come up with next steps
Working with our internal resources to prepare, plan, and execute link building and content marketing strategies
Coordinating regularly with our website development, SEM, design, and business development teams, as well as with senior management, to ensure that clients are getting positive results
Collaborate with content and outreach team to help identify opportunities to create, distribute, and promote web content.

Strong face-to-face, telephone, and email communications skills
Organized and detail-oriented
Strong writing and content editing skills
Demonstrated track record of delivering organic traffic related outcomes that move the needle in competitive markets

Familiarity with website analytics platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Knowledge of factors that influence search engine rankings
Knowledge of SEO software such as Moz, BrightEdge, DeepCrawl, Conductor, SEMRush, SEOBook, ScreamingFrog, and others
Experience with paid search (Google Ads, Bing Ads, etc) is a plus
A strong passion for SEO!

Job title: SEO Expert for SaaS company (Remote opportunity)
Description:
Job description

AppFollow is an App Monitoring, App Store Optimization, and Customer Support platform. Our main goal is to ease the everyday routines of app developers, product managers, marketing teams, customer support etc. AppFollow helps you gather and manage your apps and games data, increase app conversion rate, improve app store rankings and app user loyalty.

We are looking for a person to accelerate our growth. This is a fully remote opportunity for a SEO Expert who is analytically driven, results-oriented, accountable and looking for a challenge in his next career step. You will be responsible for day-to-day oversight, management, and search engine performance of our website and blog. You know how to grow quality organic traffic that converts as you will be responsible for driving organic lead generation worldwide with a particular focus on the US.

While there is no dedicated SEO team yet, you’ll be able to hire various freelancers and we will provide full support (budget, tech team and writers) in order to reach our business goals.

You won’t stop if a goal is not achieved. You also are capable of working on your own, as we don't have an office. We really don't care where you are located as long as you deliver results on business goals.

Your responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Set the strategic direction for SEO as well as managing the planning and execution of SEO activities;
Drive and increase quality traffic to our website and lead generation using both on-page and off-page techniques; Perform regular technical SEO site, content, backlinks audits. Report and present results.
Manage web SEO performance across multiple regions, business units, verticals, and products.
Provide analytics insight and recommendations on off-page optimization for driving organic lead generation; Conduct competitor and market leaders analysis;
Help define our content strategy by partnering with content authors to ensure SEO guidelines are incorporated into the content production process; Educate content creators on SEO best practices;
Managing day to day relationships with various stakeholders. Closely work with AppFollow’s marketing and dev teams in order to reach KPIs;
Generate and present monthly SEO reports including but not limited to budget and performance reports
Evangelize and enforce global SEO content/site guidelines.
Benefits we offer:
The biggest benefit is our awesome AppFollow team. We're an open, friendly, talented team that enjoys creating a great product, working together, growing together, and supporting each other.
Experience of working in a fast-growing company
Freedom of experiments in different countries and with different audiences
No micromanagement
These benefits are also worthy! We offer:
Full-time remote job. Though you’re always welcome to spend time with us in our office in Helsinki.
Paid Vacation. Take the time you need to stay motivated, charged, and balanced. By prior agreement, you can have days off for special occasions.
Paid Corporate Meet-ups. We get together twice a year at various locations (St.Petersburg, Moscow, Helsinki, Riga etc.) to work and spend time together offline. We bear all the travel costs for your accommodation, flights, lodging, and other business travel expenses.
We are also passionate about professional development and always invest in education for our team members!
You’ll have executive-level visibility into how the company is run and performing.
We’re always ready to provide dedicated support and fast-track your on-boarding, give you the tools you need to be successful.
Job requirements
Minimum 5 years of proven experience as a SEO Expert / Professional
A proven record of organic growth of blogs and websites in the US and can easily do it from scratch
Knowledge and understanding of every aspect of on- and off-page SEO from technical to backlink acquisition, ranking factors and search engine algorithms;
Experience of building and managing an SEO team or close work with freelancers
Strong knowledge of SEO tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Google Search Console) and analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics)
Understanding of the mobile industry
Knowledge of CRO and UX principles and methodologies.
The ability to communicate well with other teams within the group as well as business unit constituents.
Strong analytical thought process and ability to interpret findings.
Fluent English

Company DescriptionWhen we launched the little white reader, we invented mobile, ubiquitous payments and enabled anyone to start, run, and grow a business. Ten years and billions of transactions later we’re reimagining commerce for businesses of all types and sizes—we’re enabling the independent electrician to send invoices, helping the beauty salon pay its employees, and giving the burgeoning coffee chain capital for a second, third, and fourth location. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.Job Description

Square is looking for a SEO Marketing Manager to join our growing marketing and acquisition team. This role will be responsible for overseeing the organic growth and visibility for several key Square products--working to identify key opportunities and ensure strong performance of all owned initiatives. Candidates should have strong SEO experience, with a proven ability to unify cross-functional teams to drive exponential organic growth. Candidates should thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment, possesses strong communication skills, and is quick to take initiative.

You will:
Drive high-volume organic search growth for key emerging Square Products
Plan and execute SEO programs, including (but not limited to) opportunity analysis, campaign planning, audits and management
Provide tactical SEO recommendations for new product launches, website updates and international expansions, work on implementation in cross-functional teams
Identify and implement forward-facing opportunities and tactics that exponentially grow our search visibility
Help advocate for SEO best practices and adoption by core cross-functional teams, including content, front-end engineering, and creative teams
Monitor Organic Search performance of Square and top competitor sites for all owned products
Qualifications

You have:
4+ years of professional experience in SEO (preferably in-house SEO in e-commerce / online retail), with a proven track record of successfully developing and implementing SEO programs and significantly improving Organic Search performance for online businesses
Understanding of semantic content optimization best practices at scale
Deep knowledge of technical SEO best practices and optimizations
A proven track record of developing and managing SEO initiatives and delivering effective results
Extensive knowledge of SEO best practices, search engine algorithms and ranking strategies, and passion to stay abreast of news and trends in SEO and online marketing
Some experience implementing successful large-scale SEO initiatives, including external link building, site architecture and international localization
Ability to work cross-functionally with content, design, communications and product teams to drive SEO programs forward in a highly-effective manner
Expertise in managing SEO projects, roadmap and reporting to ensure SEO fixes are being shipped accordingly
Understanding of critical SEO analytics and research platforms (e.g. Google & Bing Webmaster Tool, Google Analytics, Google Adwords Keyword Tool etc.), as well as familiarity with various third party SEO analytics solutions such as Brightedge, SEOClarity, Moz, Ahrefs, SEMrush etc.
Bachelor's degree in a related field

Description:
Course Hero is scaling! We are seeking a highly motivated, passionate Head of SEO Strategy to help drive our SEO efforts. We are tackling SEO at scale - 100M+ indexed pages, 1B+ page views/year, 100M+ users/year, Alexa top ~300 US site. In this role, you will hire, manage, and mentor SEO Strategists. You will work with dedicated engineering and AI resources to build solutions at scale.

The SEO team is a key part of our growth strategy at Course Hero. We are a company that understands SEO, it's in our DNA, and the way we communicate about growth.

Here are some ways you will make an impact!
Develop and oversee the execution of a multi-year organic growth strategy, which includes site architecture, link-building, content quality, and content development
Develop and execute against forecast goals to grow organic traffic and revenue
Partner with key stakeholders in Engineering, Product, Marketing, and Analytics to execute against our technical SEO roadmap
Stay on the cutting edge of technical SEO knowledge and skills with experimentation, networking, and collaboration with peers across the industry
Develop, grow, and retain a team of world-class SEO Strategists
Lead and inspire a functional team to be: product obsessed, innovative, fast-moving, and team-oriented
Source, craft, refine, and implement page-level tests to increase traffic and evaluate experimental results and push forward next steps at a rigorous pace
Demonstrate grit and break down complex problems into actionable development plans
Identify and analyze competitor techniques, as well as benchmark Course Hero's performance against theirs
Are you our Head of SEO Strategy?
BA/BS degree in a quantitative field, eg. Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics, or equivalent work experience
8+ years of SEO experience with a proven track record of innovative SEO strategies
3+ years of people management in SEO
Managed large sites (over 10 million pages) with significant organic search traffic
Proven success in utilizing analytics to provide strategic recommendations and drive concrete action
Solid understanding of web analytics, algorithm changes, and the nuances of links within the SEO ecosystem
Deep understanding and experience with Google Search Console and Google Analytics
Savvy with the following (or similar): SQL, SEMRush, Screaming Frog, Excel, Tableau, and Botify
Expertise working with and managing external vendor/partner relationships including negotiating contracts and terms
Ability to clearly articulate SEO ideas, strategies, and tactics to audiences with varying knowledge of SEO (novices to technical experts)
Bonus Points!
Savvy with SEO A/B testing
Knowledge with user-generated content
Proficiency with SQL
Technically-minded with strong familiarity with HTML and Javascript
About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 245th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019's One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about us to see what it is like to work with our team.

Competitive salary and stock options
Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)
401(k) program with match
Education Reimbursement
Quarterly team events and outings (Sporting Events, Escape Rooms, Go-Kart Racing, Karaoke, Bowling and much more!)
Free lunches twice a week, on-site cafe discount, plus an endless snack and drink supply
Onsite gym – Pacific Shores Center – Classes – Pool – Spa – Rock Wall - Massages!
Commuter benefits, shuttle service from Redwood City, and cell-phone allowance
Local move benefits to move within 10 miles of our office!
8 hours per quarter paid time for volunteering for a cause of your choice

SEO Director

We are one of the fastest growing digital marketing agencies in St. Louis with clients located throughout the country. Our team... experienced critical thinkers, creatives, planners, and doers who live and breathe organic and paid digital marketing.

As the SEO Director, you are responsible for inspiring and leading a team of SEO specialists and partners to drive progress across relevant key performance metrics that vary per client’s goal set (e.g. data accumulation and insights, organic traffic growth, and revenue growth) and industry (e.g. professional services, hospitality, healthcare, e-commerce). Furthermore, the SEO Director will work closely with relevant teams to efficiently and effectively progress and scale Clix’s SEO approach and initiatives.

Our style is entrepreneurial, dynamic, and ever-evolving. We thrive on constant improvement, lessons learned, and proactive searching for impactful ways to service our clients in an exceptional capacity. This is a part-time/contract opportunity with Seer's PPC team. All contract engagements start with a 3-month commitment and the opportunity to extend on a month-to-month basis thereafter.


At Seer, we pride ourselves on innovation; standing out among the rest and enabling our clients to do the same. We strive to live into our motto of ‘Stop Guessing’ by leveraging big data to drive holistic digital marketing strategy. We get excited at the thought of bringing together millions of data points from disparate data sets, including qualitative data to drive empathy-fueled opportunities and insights. Big Data, automation, and problem solving at scale: it's what's for breakfast. Could this be love? Maybe.


What about you? You’re a natural-born consultant and will spend your days creating digital marketing strategies that tie into clients’ overall marketing plans. You are passionately engaged with the ever-evolving digital marketing landscape, and have a finger on the changes that can help drive client success. You’re intellectually curious, not afraid to think big and build innovative client strategies—Oh, and you have an affinity for anticipating client needs before they even have to ask, too.
Here are some highlights of what you'll be doing...
You’ll work closely with a handful of clients, researching far beyond the SEO landscape to understand their specific challenges. With that knowledge, you’ll execute strategies designed to solve a problem for a very specific audience
You understand that at the end of the day, your client's’ ultimate goal is to drive organic traffic to their site and increase their ROI—to do this, you’ll work closely with clients to develop innovative assets after conducting in-depth content gap analyses, competitive & audience analysis, keyword research, and SERP landscape analysis
You’re a whiz when it comes to making data & results digestible and you’ll share campaign success as it relates to your clients’ goals on a monthly basis using various analytics platforms like Google Analytics and Adobe SiteCatalyst
You understand that other channels play a role in the SEO process, so you’ll often partner with the PPC, Analytics, Content and Design teams to solve client needs
The skills you'll bring to the table...
Experience building and driving SEO strategy across multiple industries is an absolute must, but your ability to tie outcomes to campaign goals and measure impact is what gives you an edge
SEO is your thing, but you're confident using Analytics to make data-driven decisions—You understand that Content Strategy is really about providing resources to solve users’ problems
When questions or challenges present themselves, you don’t sweat it for a second; you’re extremely comfortable interfacing with clients and driving conversations
There’s always a method (and some data) behind our madness! Because of that, critical and strategic thinking skills are a must
We move fast and you’ll be juggling lots of priorities. You’ll need solid project management skills to get the job done. You’re comfortable managing your own deadlines and when things get a little crazy, you’re okay with asking for help
Things change quickly in the digital space and your ability to measure strategy effectiveness (changes to rankings, traffic, conversions) and make decisions based on that data is killer. Your clients love you for it
You’re passionate about staying “in-the-know” on SEO trends
Bonus Points
Have your own website or blog? We’d love to see it.
Worked in a fast-paced, digital agency? Awesome.
Created awesome content for specific audience personas? Sweet!
Bringing some Technical SEO skills like HTML or Javascript? Jackpot!
Google Analytics IQ and Google Ads certified? Let's talk :)
Sometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here-- you are welcome. If you read this job description with a belly full of excitement, we’re just as excited about you. You’ve gotta apply though :)

GENERAL SUMMARY

A Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for analyzing, reviewing and implementing websites that are optimized to be picked up by search engines. SEO specialists conduct various testing methods in design, layout and advertising techniques in order to gain the most organic and paid traffic.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Your duties and responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

· Analyze client website architecture, content, backlink profile and other factors to identify and execute initiatives to improve organic search visibility in Google.

· Conduct comprehensive technical SEO audits of websites and create an actionable plan for improvement and site optimization.

· Understanding of SEO technical concepts (sitemaps, crawl stats, robots.txt, http status codes, HTML elements, hyperlinks, etc.)

· Understanding search engine ranking factors

· Assist with non-incentivized link building strategies (Off-page SEO) and execution.

· Perform On-page optimization.

· Manage site content, proofread and edit content for SEO, working with department manager to establish topics and the timeline for workflow.

· Use various third-party SEO tools such as Ahrefs, MOZ, Screaming Frog to monitor website performance and identify opportunities to improve organic visibility.

· Work with team to improve and expand our SEO services and help grow our SEO customer base and services we offer.

· Work with manager on improving processes and strategies for: keyword list development and competitor analysis other strategies that maximize on-site conversion of organic traffic.

· Understanding basic SEO concepts such as CTR, bounce rates, pageviews, DA, Spam Score, etc.

· Conduct analysis at least quarterly to identify further optimization opportunities for SEO.

· Closely monitor algorithm updates and anticipate future shifts in SEO best practices.

· Identify opportunities for both short term and long-term objectives to increase search engine visibility.

· Strong experience using Google Analytics and Google Search Console.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

· Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing preferred with minimum of 2 years of Digital Marketing experience focused on SEO or related field.

· Excellent English oral and written communication

· Experience with a content management system such as WordPress and/or Joomla is a plus.

· Excellent oral and written communication skills and experience working with cross-functional teams, both within and between organizations.

· Strong interpersonal, communication, self-management and organizational skills.

· Experience working on SEO for multiple sites simultaneously

· Experience with conversion optimization and A/B testing is a plus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Remote position available

Company description

OutReach Frog is a growing company that provides high quality SEO services mainly focused on high quality techniques to businesses in the US. We focus on quality SEO that generates real results. We serve agencies, growing businesses as well as a large number of significant and well known online sites

Job description

Hey There!

Are you passionate about SEO and eager to learn? Do you know how to run keyword lists, proficient with ahrefs or semrush to assess the quality of a sites backlink structure?

Then you need to apply!

Why Outreach Frog?

We are looking for a SEO specialist who can provide useful information to our clients to help them succeed with SEO. Most customers order directly online, however the role provides a point of contact for any customer queries and to help details and explain the scope of services that we provide.

Outreach Frog provides organic search engine optimization services to clients throughout the world. We have a growing number of business and agency clients who rely on us for their SEO needs. We offer link building products designed to be resold by other agencies or purchased directly by end users.

SEO Knowledge Essential

A requirement of the role is a solid SEO understanding and knowledge from the past. We know SEO and are happy to share and provide training, however SEO fundamentals are a required pre-requisite.

Any prior sales experience is also viewed favorably. As we are growing there is the opportunity for the role to be more 'analytic' focused with minimal client interaction or more client facing. We let our results sell themselves,

Our Mission:

B2B marketing is dated and ineffective. Marketers are overstretched, trying to catch up to quickly-evolving modern methods. Most of the help available offers productized solutions focused on justifying a retainer rather than driving business success.

We guide each client toward digital marketing success through modern websites, tools, and initiatives that address their unique needs, with great communication and powerful processes.


Our customers grow in their businesses and their careers — by better supporting sales and increasing their own knowledge and experience.

By connecting thoughtful modern marketing with innovative companies, we help propel the world forward.

Learn more about our mission and team culture at https://www.windmillstrategy.com/careers/

About the Opportunity:

Windmill Strategy is seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to join our marketing team. Qualified applicants will have direct SEO and PPC/SEM experience and agency experience or B2B experience, as well as a broad understanding of digital marketing principles. This is not a junior or entry-level position.

The Digital Marketing Specialist is expected to be an advocate and go-to expert for a wide range of digital marketing-related activities, projects and initiatives spanning SEO (On-site, On-site, Technical and Content), PPC, and Paid Social.

This person must be comfortable meeting with and presenting big-picture planning to clients and new business prospects, as well as rolling up her or his sleeves to bring strategic recommendations to life in partnership with copy- design- and code-focused counterparts.

He or she will also be the leader and core driver of Windmill’s Digital Marketing team and its digital marketing policies, best practices, and offerings.

About You:

The role is that of a hands-on leader who sets and implements digital marketing strategies with a multi-functional team, ensuring Windmill delivers the best possible results and customer experience for its clients and customers.

Windmill Strategy believes the following personal traits are essential to be successful in this role:

Innovation
Adaptability
Humbly confident
Collaboration
Patience
Passion
Motivated

Responsibilities:
Strategize, plan, and execute SEO, pay-per-click, social media, display, inbound and outbound marketing campaigns on behalf of clients
Craft and manage PPC campaigns in Google Adwords, Microsoft Advertising, LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter, and ABM platforms
Define content development, syndication, distribution, and link-building strategies
Draft detailed SEO site audits and reports through a technical, content and off-site lens to ensure that they consistently adhere to SEO best practices
Analyze and translate data from web analytics into actionable plans
Advise clients on SEO best practices
Create digital marketing plans and discuss them with clients and prospects, in collaboration with an account manager.
Work with internal team to ensure that UX, design, development, content strategy is contributing to the success of our clients’ overall digital marketing goals and plans.
Build and optimize powerful B2B campaigns in Google, Bing & Yahoo across several partners to build brand and interest for our clients, who primarily serve niche markets and industries
Daily and weekly reporting and communication regarding campaign development, timelines, analysis, and results.
Manage digital advertising budget and spend, including bid management
Execute bid changes based on pacing and performance
Continuous analysis of paid search campaigns to identify potential opportunities, providing recommendations for optimization through ad copy, keywords, ad groups, targeting, bidding, and landing pages.
Monitor SEO performance by utilizing SEO tools such as SEMRush, Search Console, Google Analytics and Google Data Studio.
Synthesize information to clearly communicate key learnings, actionable strategy, testing opportunities, and recommend new opportunities to internal stakeholders and partners.
Communicate to a diverse set of teams; use data and insight to make a case for what you need to be successful
Develop annual, quarterly and project-level SEO strategies designed to maximize performance across Technical, Content and Off-site SEO to achieve business goals
Conduct ongoing keyword research to apply a customer-first lens to marketing initiatives; use these insights to support strategic and tactical recommendations across clients’ digital ecosystems
Maintain and manage search tools to identify site issues and collaborate with the development team to resolve defects
Ensure alignment between paid search and organic search strategies
Advise on content types, topics, and keywords to explore to maximize clients’ search rankings
Provide training to others in the organization on issues important to SEO
Constantly monitor and communicate changes in industry trends and search engine algorithms both internally and to clients.
Estimate, strategize and support the sell-in of new SEO initiatives, in conjunction with sales and account team members
Develop working plans for upcoming and in-motion SEO engagements (weekly/monthly resource planning, initiative prioritization, key milestones, etc.) in collaboration with the project management team

INTOUCH GROUP is a full-service network, providing a diverse suite of capabilities for our clients, including creative services, media buying, enterprise solutions and data analytics.


At Intouch, we offer innovative solutions to life science companies that want to connect with consumers, healthcare professionals and payers. We get fired up when people talk about getting—and staying—healthy. That’s where we find our inspiration: in the very human experiences of patients, doctors and even each other. Then, we collaborate on ways to make caring for one’s health more achievable, connecting patients and physicians with the information and tools they need.


The Intouch affiliates within the Intouch Group network include: Intouch Solutions, Intouch Proto, Intouch International, Intouch B2D, Intouch Media and Intouch Analytics.


Our passion makes it happen


At Intouch, you’ll discover what it’s like to turn that passion into practice. Putting your experience to work — from Account to Creative to Development and beyond — you’ll make a difference in people’s lives every day.
As an Intouch intern, you’ll work on real projects with actual clients, so you can grow your enthusiasm and experience right along with us.


Each year, we bring in the best and the brightest for a 10-week intensive program. Our interns receive hands-on experience under the guidance and mentorship of their supervisor while taking part in a highly collaborative project with their fellow interns, where they solve a real business problem as a team. The exact dates for this program may vary by office, but typically our interns start in early June and wrap up in mid-August.


A day in the life of an SEO Intern:


Armed with experience and an understanding of how to integrate search with client business goals, the SEO team believes great content deserves to be found. These inbound heroes search and destroy bad rankings to rescue websites from obscurity. As an SEO intern, you will assist in consumer behavior research, report generation, website health assessment and best practice implementation. You will gain an understanding of how SEO fits into the overall digital marketing effort and how these efforts affect the performance of our clients’ sites. The result? Finding your spot at the top.
What you’ll bring:
Knowledge of SEO best practices
Passion for search and desire to continuously learn and educate
Flexibility and innovative thinking
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
