Description:
Growth Machine is expanding quickly, and we need your help to continue being the best SEO and content marketing agency on the internet.

We’re hiring a SEO project manager to lead client projects focused on SEO and content marketing. You'll work closely with our operations, editorial, and link building teams to ensure our clients are getting the white glove service we pride ourselves on, and that we're delivering premium content that earns our clients the top spots in Google for the search terms relevant to their business.

You'll be responsible for nurturing the client relationship and establishing the successful momentum of new and ongoing projects, and you'll personally oversee accounts worth over $1mm in annual revenue. You'll also be responsible for implementing new systems as necessary (or improving existing ones) to make sure we are operating as seamlessly and efficiently as we can, and producing great results on a large scale.

This is the perfect role for someone experienced in project management, account management, and campaign planning within an agency environment, particularly if you have experience in content marketing specifically, and are excited by the idea of helping a dynamic internet-based company grow quickly. You'll be given a huge amount of freedom to grow this part of our business, so if that kind of ownership excites you, read on.


Your Responsibilities


The Project Manager's job is to make sure that everything is running smoothly, seamlessly, and on schedule at all times. To do that, the manager has to split their time between coordinating the editorial planning process and being available for clients' needs. Here's what you'd be responsible for:

Project Management, and Editorial Strategy Responsibilities
Perform keyword research, and create and manage content plans for up to 20 clients in multiple industries.
Stay one step ahead of the writers and editors by making sure each article for each client is thought through ahead of time, and provide everything they need in advance so they can complete the article without issues or delays.
Organize content plans in Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, and Asana, making sure every editorial calendar is up to date, and planned out sufficiently in advance, at all times.
Assist the editors in sourcing and screening writers to find the perfect fit for our projects.
Miscellaneous problem solving as the point person for writers' and editors' concerns, questions, scheduling issues, and anything else related to the editorial plan and schedule.
Client Relationship Management Responsibilities:
Serve as the primary contact for your clients at Growth Machine. That means managing the relationship from the moment the contract is signed through the lifecycle of the project. Touch-points would include: leading client calls; answering questions, allaying concerns, and requests; coordinate changes to the content plan as requested by clients; and more as needed. We pride ourselves on the white glove service we offer our clients, and you would be free to adjust and improve the process as you see fit.
Learn the client's category and business inside and out, and employ a strategic approach to planning content, analyzing project performance, and reporting results.
Serve as the liaison between clients and the writing team during the ramp up period between project kickoff and beginning of publishing.
Deliver weekly progress updates (via email) for clients on the status of their project.
Requirements
You're a critical thinker, always looking for ways to improve a process or creatively solve a problem.
You have an insatiable thirst for organization and efficiency, and a keen eye for detail.
Prioritizing comes easily to you. You're detail-oriented, organized, and efficient, you don't flinch when five different people need five different things from you at the same time, and you're not intimidated by juggling a lot of different projects and responsibilities at once.
You have a proven track record of client relationship management in an agency - or similarly fast-paced - environment.
You have great communication and people skills, and you're experienced in and comfortable managing client expectations and making sure clients are well taken care of.
You can't help but take ownership of your job. You're always looking for ways to improve the process, whether by adjusting, automating, or another way.
You're a flexible and agile. You don't bat an eye at a fast pace or a rapidly growing and changing work environment.
You're capable of working autonomously. You're happy with the freedom and you don’t need or want to be managed.
You're friendly, eager to jump in and make the job your own, and love to contribute to tangible business growth and success.
Benefits
Remote Work: Some of us are based in Austin, but you don't have to be. You can work from anywhere in a US timezone.
Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance 100% covered for you and 50% for your family.
Life Insurance: We cover life insurance for 2x your salary up to 200k, and you can add up to 500k in additional coverage.
401k: You'll have access to a 401k with a 6% company match.
Profit Sharing: Each quarter we're profitable, a portion of that profit is split amongst the team.
Vacation and Holiday: 20 days paid vacation time, and we take off all major holidays, including a week over the New Year. Additional days per year with the company.
Team Retreats: Team trips each year to cities like Austin, LA, Chicago to get some time together in person.

SEO & Content Marketing Specialist Job Description:


MAGNETIC Creative is hiring a talented SEO and Content Marketing Specialist. This job function will be responsible for identifying and executing opportunities to improve our company’s, our client's and our content's search rankings for key terms.

This position requires a highly motivated, self starting mindset and work ethic. Collaborative and able to adaptively implement your skills across variety clients, industries and verticals. You should be able to develop a solid on-page SEO strategy from scratch, then work with our copywriters and developers to implement through short and long term content marketing campaigns.

The SEO and Content Marketing Specialist should have working knowledge and experience with Inbound Marketing concepts and be well rounded with all digital marketing channels and their interdependencies. The core responsibility will be to expand the digital footprint, awareness, subscribers, and leads of MAGNETIC and our client roster. This role requires creativity, attention to detail, and project management skills.


Responsibilities:
Manage both on-page SEO and off-page SEO for the company.
Collaborate with content marketing and blog contributors to create high-quality content around important, relevant terms.
Manage and improve organic search engine performance and goal-setting based on clickthrough rates, traffic, and conversions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and changes with SEO and major search engines.
Contribute to blog on an ongoing basis to support and promote your offering and to attract site visitors through search, social media, and email subscribers.
Grow subscriber base by providing them with regular, helpful content that’s aligned with their needs and interests.
Collaborate with designers, product marketers, sales professionals, and external influencers and industry experts to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both key stakeholders and our audience.
Convince others that your creative ideas are worth investing time and effort in. This role is at the core of the marketing team, and others will rely on your work every single day.
Requirements:



Thorough knowledge of search ranking and optimization factors and key algorithm updates.
Proficiency in web analytics software (Google Analytics) and keyword tools (MOZ, SEM Rush).
Experience with data-driven SEO analysis and optimization.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Past experience producing content for the web specifically, as well as channel-specific knowledge (blog, SlideShare, Facebook, Twitter, etc.).
Past experience building audiences either online or offline.
A dual-minded approach: You’re highly creative and an excellent writer but can also be process-driven, think scale, and rely on data to make decisions.
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, common web platforms and marketing automation platforms.

If this sounds like your kind of job, then we'd like to hear from you.

Bulletproof Overview:

Bulletproof is an omni-channel content driven consumer products company. Our vision is to tap into the unlimited power of being human and we do this by holding true to our mission of creating products and providing information that radically improve lives. Bulletproof helps people live better by providing information and products that help them use fat for fuel, say goodbye to sugar and supercharge mitochondria increasing their energy.

Bulletproof has a team of experienced entrepreneurs and biohackers working to make high performance a daily reality for everyone on the planet. While our culture is casual and our workplace flexible, the team is passionate, customer driven, meaningfully connected, smart, and results focused.

Our customers know that our coffee, beverages, food, and supplements are the purest you can get anywhere, and you can expect to feel a difference in how you perform the first time you experience them. Environmentally conscious and ethically sourced products build a sustainable foundation for future generations to thrive. Bulletproof coffee has developed a cult following across the nation as a drink that provides sustained energy, while also programming your body to burn fat for energy. In addition to providing convenient access to products through eCommerce, brick and mortar retail stores (e.g. Whole Foods Market) and Bulletproof Cafes, Bulletproof has developed a specialized diet, which is based on eating high amounts of healthy fats, moderate amounts of high-quality protein, and tons of organic vegetables eaten at the right time in order to create unbelievable levels of energy and weight loss.

Position Overview:

Bulletproof is looking for a SEO Manager who loves the exploration and challenges of optimizing natural search traffic to Bulletproof.com and it's sub-domains. Position reports to VP of eCommerce and is responsible for crafting the strategy and executing the levers across technical, content, and credentialing solutions to drive branded and non-branded organic traffic.

You will work closely with the ecommerce, content, brand, and marketing teams to build a SEO roadmap. This will require a keen ability to build strong cross-functional relationships, develop and communication strategy, and manage outside agencies. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with day-to-day responsibilities ranging from diving into Google Analytics, auditing page structure and tags, diving into search console for ranking/ impression data, and participating in site architecture questions.

This position requires a detail-oriented individual who has project management skills and an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have ability to set and meet deadlines, collaborate with a distributed workforce, and hit/ exceed core metric.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop, strategize and prioritize implementation of SEO recommendations for Bulletproof's website.
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords, and work with developers to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented with newly developed code.
Define, measure and report SEO KPIs on current and new initiatives and identify opportunities based on these metrics.
Stay on top of search innovations/trends; identify and propose new search opportunities appropriate for the brand.
Retrieve, aggregate, and analyze large data-sets from various sources to assist in providing actionable insights and recommendations to optimize site content.
Work with content creators to identify and coordinate information needs, and provide ongoing analysis and recommendations.
Assist in developing and maintaining dashboards, metric reports and other ad hoc analyses.
Deliver regular reporting on key metrics, site enhancements and other change impacts.
Understand critical paths, conversion events, segmentation types, referring channels, marketing campaigns, and specific attribute correlations.
Research and recommend potential content partners to drive SEO, Domain Authority, and brand awareness with our target audiences.
Create and manage agency partnerships for technical SEO, link-building and overall onsite development.
Identify and implement UI/UX and testing opportunities to increase on-page engagement through in-house or agency expertise, and implement tracking innovation (objects, scroll mapping) to aid in mapping user journey
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience analyzing website and third-party data for an online editorial or ecommerce brand, with an understanding of how to leverage data to make informed decisions.
3+ years of experience in SEO programs and principles.
Experience scaling SEO-driven traffic and revenue for an ecommerce and/or editorial site, and can articulate the operational, strategic and tactical approach on how it was achieved.
Deep understanding of E-A-T principles, both content-based and technical
Understanding of the inputs and outputs for Google's knowledge graph, entity extraction, and schema.org markup.
Experience with advanced SEO techniques, tracking/reporting tools, algorithms, analysis and ranking factors.
Strong PowerPoint and spreadsheet abilities, including the ability to use formulas, functions, pivot tables, and the ability to analyze and compile performance reports.
Proficiency with web analytics and industry-standard web analytics platforms such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics.
Experience with Google Search Console, search analytics software (e.g. Moz.com) and social listening tools (e.g. Crimson Hexagon).
Background in A/B and multivariate testing, leveraging tools such as Optimize or Optimizely.
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Proven ability in collaborating with cross-functional partners.
Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills.
Working knowledge of Shopify and WordPress a plus.
Working knowledge of SQL and Big Query a plus.
Knowledge of nutrition, health and human performance a plus.
Experience in paid search (SEM) or other online marketing experience a plus.

Exhibits excellent judgment

Job title: Remote - Technical SEO Expert - Web Development
Description:
Technical SEO Expert - Web Development

This position is remote! You have the flexibility to work from anywhere in the world or out of the downtown Bellevue, WA headquarters.

321 Ignition is at the forefront of mobile user-friendly website platform with car shopping productivity tools. We are a tech start-up focused on helping dealerships attract younger customers (millennials and Gen Z) and improving the car shopping experience on any device. 321 Ignition’s modern, mobile-first platform ensures an easier, more engaging, timesaving, and more convenient car buying experience, ultimately leading to higher customer satisfaction, loyalty, and return business for car dealerships. We’re on a mission to help dealerships win young customers for life.

We’re a start-up, which means what we’re doing is exciting, and we work in a fast-paced environment with an all-hands-on-deck culture. Join us as we disrupt the auto industry by elevating the online car shopping experience & engaging younger buyers.

About the job

We’re looking for a web developer who is a technical SEO expert to work on 321 Ignition and our customer's websites and blogs. You’ll be responsible for optimizing websites traffic by conducting the technical audits, analysis, and implementation of technical recommendations to help reduce website page speed, uncover and remedy web crawling issues, analyze JavaScript rendering, and more. We’re a mobile-first company, so you must be a subject matter expert in technical and local SEO for desktop and mobile. Communication is a big part of the job; you’ll need to lead and collaborate internally as well as across departments and get things done. We’re looking for SEO expert passionate about disrupting an antiquated industry and helping dealerships increase their profit.

Responsibilities
Our dealer website is a custom-built platform, so this will be a technical position. You will be responsible for making technical changes or updates.
Create customized reports and present findings to business stakeholders, customers, senior and executive leadership teams
Build cross-functional relationships by providing SEO insights and strategic recommendations that can have a profound impact on the organization
Implement processes to educate UX, content managers, web developers, business stakeholders, and others on SEO best practices and content optimization
Stay current with industry developments and participate in the SEO online community
Identify gaps and opportunities and make recommendations and tracking improvements to lift organic rankings and traffic 321 Ignition properties (mobile and web)
Manage keyword rank tracking and reporting
Conduct in-depth keyword research
Collaborate and support our Product Dev and Paid Media team to help dealerships increase their organic ranking
Skills
Expert technical knowledge of how to apply structure data and schema markup to get listed in SERP Rich results, Featured Snippets, Reviews, Knowledge Panel, Sitelinks, Images, People Also Ask, Top Stories, Videos, and Local SEO
WordPress skills are great to have since we might end up building our blog on that platform, but the day to day work will be done in our custom-built platform.
Detail-oriented and organized
High energy, pro-active, self-starter
Comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously and under tight deadlines
Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team
Passionate about SEO with a pulse on the industry
Requirements
2+ years of relevant SEO experience required.
Knowledge of Conversion Rate Optimization and UX principles and methodologies... we don't just make changes for search engines; this job is focused on user-first experiences!
Proficient in JavaScript/HTML5/CSS/YAML, with an emphasis on how they impact SEO performance.
Understanding of how to reduce crawl budget, remedy site performance issues, and implement/troubleshoot structured data using a variety of tools like Moz, Conductor, Screaming Frog, DeepCrawl, Copyscape, Xenu Sleuth, GA, GSC, and BWMT
Extensive experience using Google Webmaster tools and keyword research tools (e.g., SEM Rush, Ahref, SpyFu, Keyword Planner)
Background designing URL structures and navigation elements
Experience implementing and troubleshooting tags via Google Tag Manager
Ability to analyze log files
Capable of providing detailed but easy-to-understand analysis and recommendations
Experience optimizing robots.txt files, implementing canonical tags, pagination pages, and identifying/ fixing redirect loops
Smart, resourceful and energized by staying at the forefront of a field that is always changing
Superior knowledge of search engine criteria/algorithms, best practices, trends, and industry developments
Strong communication and time management skills
Additional Details
This job can be remote, or you can work out of the office in Bellevue, Washington.
This is a full-time position, and very fast-paced
Our CEO is located in Bellevue, Washington and while you can be located anywhere, in any time zone, some conference calls required to be during business hours in PST, and you must be fluent in English.
To be considered, please provide a portfolio of keywords and links that you successfully got to rank in the Google:
Featured snippet
People also ask
Top stories
Rich snippet
Reviews
Knowledge panel
Local SEO
Videos
Images

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

This person is responsible for developing, executing, analyzing and reporting on paid search campaigns. This role is also focused on managing SEO activities such as content strategy, link building and keyword strategy to increase rankings on all major search networks.

Web Analytics: Configuration and optimization of onsite tracking code to enable collection and interpretation of data on visitor traffic and engagement on client sites

We are travelers, artists, athletes, and animal lovers creating an incredibly strong, fully remote team and providing amazing results, no matter where we are. Why work at KoMarketing? We’re a team of online marketing professionals that take pride in exceeding the expectations of our clients. We genuinely have a passion for search, social media, and content marketing, and in driving the success of our clients’ online marketing initiatives.

Take a look at our careers page to learn more about working at KoMarketing and please review the job description below to find out if you have the skills necessary for this role.


Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Analyst


The SEO Analyst is responsible for implementing SEO and social media strategies for clients. The SEO Analyst can quickly understand and support initiatives that will contribute to the goals and success of client campaigns.


Key Functional Areas of Responsibility
Perform keyword research in coordination with client business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities
Provide SEO analysis and recommendations in coordination with elements and structure of websites and web pages
Provide recommendations and execute strategies for content development in coordination with SEO goals – general and keyword specific
Administer search engine programs (XML sitemaps, shopping feeds, webmaster tools) for purposes of diagnostic reporting on client projects
Help to create and support marketing content to socialize and use for social media purposes (e.g. customer videos briefs, customer case studies, blog posts, posts from analysts and customers)
Implement link building campaigns in coordination with client SEO goals
Assist in development and execution of communication/content strategies via social communities in coordination with SEO goals
Keep pace with SEO, search engine, social media and internet marketing industry trends and developments
Research and administer social media tools in support of clients’ social media strategy
Monitor and administer web analytics dashboards, reports and key reporting tools, and point out key areas of importance in accordance client goals
Monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels
Communication to team and management on project development, timelines, and results
Work closely with the other team members to meet client goals
Professional Competencies
Passion for SEO and internet marketing
Outstanding ability to think creatively, and identify and resolve problems
Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere
Ability to clearly and effectively articulate thoughts and points
High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation
Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills
Professional Skills & Qualifications
1 – 2 years experience in Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Experience with website analysis using a variety of analytics tools including Google Analytics as well as internal reporting tool
Experience working with popular keyword tools (Google, WordTracker, Keyword Discovery, etc)
Experience working with CMS and building/administering content in CMS environments
Desired: Knowledge of HTML/CSS and website administrations
BS/BA degree preferred
Compensation & Benefits
Competitive salary plus performance incentives
Participation in company health (medical, dental) insurance plans after 60 days full-time employment
Paid vacation and sick days
Company laptop
Opportunity to advance your career
How to Apply


To apply for this position, send an email to our careers mailbox with “SEO/SMO Analyst Application” in the subject line. In the email, make sure to include your resume (in word or PDF preferred), cover letter, salary requirements, and any additional information you would feel relevant for this role.

Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for exceptional new team members to add to our teams and will help take us to the next level. One team, one score.


We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. We are looking for team members that want to help us build upon what we have accomplished so far and make it better every day. N+1 > N.


Auth0 is looking for a SEO Analyst to join our Growth Marketing Team. This newly created role will work directly with the Growth and Demand Generation teams to build and deploy search engine marketing programs along with providing SEO analytics and reporting.


This role can be based remotely from a home office.
What You Will Do

Provide SEO analysis and recommendations

Experience working with popular keyword tools (Moz, SEMRush, Google, WordTracker, Keyword Discovery, etc)
Experience with website analysis using a variety of analytics tools including Google Analytics, Heap, or Moz as well as internal reporting tools

Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills
Strong verbal and written communication
Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case.


We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles.


Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

Solid writing skills.
Solid verbal communication skills.
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

General understanding of SEO.

And now a little bit about us…. Incredible Health is a fast-growing, venture-backed career marketplace for healthcare workers. Our software and service helps healthcare workers like nurses find and do their best work. We’re using technology to give health care recruiting a much-needed speed and quality boost while solving the number one problem of our hospital partners - how to get the staff they need. Working here is awesome because:

We are a very high caliber team of medical doctors, nurses, software engineers, designers, sales leaders, account managers and more.

What we’re looking for:


You are passionate about search and broader digital marketing, and up-to-date on best practices and breaking trends in SEO.
You are thrilled at the opportunity to work on and scale an SEO channel acquiring millions of users per month across 40 countries.
You have managed or directly worked on a large scale consumer SEO channel that utilized dynamic landing pages, SEO split testing and data driven link acquisition.
You thrive in complex, fast-paced environments that require you to unravel complicated problems and create detailed cross team planning from high-level strategy to execution specs.
You are proficient at being hands-on with HTML, CSS, XML, Javascript and SQL. Ability to write tools in Python or Node is a plus.
You are detail-oriented, but enjoy thinking about and tackling the “big picture” business priorities and how SEO relates to and fits in with all marketing channels.
You make data-driven decisions based on analytics and are comfortable working with large data sets and keywords. You use data to support your decisions, and to seek out trends and identify issues and opportunities. You follow organic traffic past initial landing to down funnel conversions, trends and value to the business.
You can show us new ways to think about and improve Wanderu’s SEO.

What you’ll be doing:


Create analyses of existing traffic and conversion trends to identify areas of opportunity and running split and other testing methodologies.

Optimizing existing content and site structure to increase organic rankings and traffic.
Develop new content to target high-volume queries that are not currently being targeted.
Internationalize content and site structure to help global SEO growth.
Improve internal linking structures to maximize the flow of pagerank throughout the site.
Research individual markets and provide insights to drive product growth strategies.
Collaborate with Community and PR teams for developing content that attracts new users, media attention and inbound links from relevant websites.
Grow the SEO team by recruiting other team members.

What you’ve got:


Ability to write clear and concise plans and project specifications and communicate those requirements to the development team for implementation.
3+ years of in-house SEO experience with an industry leading brand/website acquiring over 1 million users.
Working experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and SQL. Python, Node and other programming experience a big added bonus.
Expertise in using Web Analytics Platforms (including Google Analytics, Omniture, RJ Metrics, etc.) to mine SEO insights.
Fluent at querying and utilizing data in SQL/Redshift data warehouses.
Strong on-the-job knowledge of search engine webmaster tools.

Able to identify SEO KPIs and build reports to demonstrate performance.

SEO performance research tools, technical seo analysis tools and competitor research tools
Experience with content management systems and data structures a plus.
Proven experience in creating scalable link building models.

Benefits

We can't take care of others (our customers) without taking care of ourselves (our people) first. That's why we pay extremely competitive salaries and offer a variety of perks to help you optimize your health. We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their interest in health to help us build an organization that makes a difference in the world. �� Salary: We pay competitively because we want the best people at our company.

�� Office Hours: You design your own workday. Work whenever you want, from wherever you want.

�� Continued Learning: We cover anything that increases your work skills and provide a monthly budget for developing any personal skills you desire. You want to learn Spanish? How to do pottery? We have you covered.

❤️ Free product: You need to be able to brag about how awesome Perfect Keto products are, so team members get free product for their personal use.

��️ Retreats: Having fun is one of our core values. Join us on our all expenses paid retreats to fantastic locations.

�� Parental Leave: Take the time you need to take care of your baby and yourself. Work will be there when you come back.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

SUMMARY


Join a young digital agency to help service the search engine optimization needs of an existing roster of clients.

You are someone who actively stays on top of whats really working and have strong opinions about the implications of strategic SEO approaches. Of course, youre a data junkie and can perform magic with Excel to discover new opportunities and insights. Youre at home with all the usual tools: Ahrefs, MOZ, Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and plenty more. If youre like us, you have cool browser add-ons that make you more productive.

We are looking for a quick learner who is highly organized and comfortable working across many projects.

Everyone on our team balances working from our White Plains, NY office with working remotely, so if you are good at keeping yourself busy without constant oversight, please read on.


WHAT IS THE ROLE?


The SEO Specialist is a crucial position so you will need to work well within cross-disciplinary teams and comfortable multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment where providing clients with a high-level service is expected.

You will be expected to show resourcefulness, exhibit accountability, and understand the role well enough to work independently and demonstrate initiative.

The SEO Specialist should want to be an active participant in our internal and client meetings. You should plan to take a speaking role from day one, with an increasing level of contribution as your experience builds.

You will need to contribute in the planning, presenting, implementing and maintaining of search engine optimization campaigns across multiple clients ranging from competitive analysis, link building, keyword research, and content optimization.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES?
Engages with the client and the internal team to establish goals, objectives, and strategies.
Creates content recommendations for and research on multiple client verticals (e.g., automotive, financial, ecommerce, etc.).
Develops comprehensive recommendations for on- and off-site content optimization; focuses on keyword coverage and maximizing performance including press release optimization
Works cross-functionally (particularly with Paid Search, Analytics and web development).
Contributes to department thought leadership (department blog, presenting industry topics internally).
Monitors client SEO performance and performs keyword-level research using industry-standard tools, including third-party software and Web Analytics packages.
Utilizes social media outlets and assets for the benefit of SEO campaign performance.
Assists with audits of clients web architecture to ensure the site is properly constructed to maximize visibility.
Crafts heavily-researched keyword lists and documentation backed by multiple data sets for ensured relevancy and performance.
DOES THIS DESCRIBE YOU?
Sense of humor
Strong analytical skills
Strong organizational skills
Excellent written and communication skills
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Ability to work autonomously
Two to three years of relevant SEO experience
2+ years client facing experience at an agency
Coding skills are a bonus
WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

iPullRank is an ambitious five-year-old digital marketing agency based in New York City and founded by industry thought leader Michael King. Our mission is to drive results for our clients by delivering marketing work that we can be PROUD of. Oh, and our value set is PROUD: P – Proactive; R – Reliable; O – Outstanding; U – Useful; D – Dedicated. We keep that front and center on a day-to-day basis.

If you’re curious about what types of clients we work with, they range from Fortune 500 brands to mid-sized enterprises and exciting small businesses. Our team executes and consults on campaigns in a variety of industries, but many of our clients tend to be media, finance or fashion companies. The iPullRank team is adept at providing a range of digital marketing services, but most of our work is in some combination of Content Strategy, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Analytics and Conversion Rate Optimization. Our employees are duly encouraged to specialize deeply in a specific category that they are passionate about and grow into well-rounded marketers through collaboration, training and real-world experience.

As an employer, we look to cultivate an environment where employees feel taken care of. Despite our size, we offer competitive salaries and benefits. We want our employees to grow with us. We don’t want you to just fill a role, we want you to take ownership and make an impact.We’re not a big agency and our clients appreciate that because our size allows us to make things happen. We’re a nimble group that believes the best idea can come from anyone in the company -- and we're always after the best idea. We’re looking for creative and smart people to join our team and help us in our missions to find the best idea. If that’s you, we’d love to hear from you.

iPullRank is looking for a search engine optimization manager to join our team and help with site auditing, keyword research, competitive analysis, link building, content marketing and client reporting. This SEO Manager is a master of all things Google, with an interest in learning more about how Organic Search plays with the rest of the marketing mix. The client-facing role works directly with Client teams to deliver best-in-class SEO that drives results. This person will lead SEO efforts and collaborate extensively with Mike King to actively contribute to SEO research to develop new strategies and with the SEO community.

What You'll Do
Proactively identify on-page SEO opportunities
Perform comprehensive Site Audits
Perform in-depth log file analysis
Improve conversion of Organic Search traffic
Own performance monitoring reports and KPIs
Work with Content Strategy to determine keyword content opportunities for client sites
Work with Analysts to perform Persona-Driven Keyword Research
Perform competitive analysis to identify actionable insights
Identify creative white hat link building opportunities and oversee outreach team
Present deliverables and results to clients
Work with Development and Content Creation teams to implement SEO processes
Contribute to new business through iPullRank inbound marketing efforts and research for new business pitches
Requirements
Minimum 3 years of search engine optimization experience
Thorough knowledge of search engine ranking factors
Previous client-facing experience
Proficiency with HTML, CSS required
Working knowledge of Paid Search preferred
Understanding of SEO for JavaScript and relevant frameworks such as React and Angular required
Extremely detail-oriented
Strong analytical mindset and skills, excellent problem-solving skills
Familiar with industry-standard SEO software
Possess strong written, analytical and verbal skills
Avid reader of SEO blogs
Possess up-to-date knowledge and maintains current SEO practices
Proficiency with Analytics packages and Google Search Console
High level of initiative and work well in a team environment
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications such as Excel and PowerPoint
Handles stressful situations and deadline pressures well
Plans and carries out responsibilities with minimal direction

100% of Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance Coverage
Four weeks of vacation

$1K towards career related learning

SEO Specialist Position Summary:

We are seeking an analytical SEO Specialist to join our marketing team with Catalyst Media in our corporate office located in Malvern, PA.

Partnering with our Digital Marketing Specialist and reporting to the VP of Marketing, you’ll improve the organic search performance of B2B publishing, lead generation and ecommerce websites such as www.betterbuys.com, www.hrmorning.com, www.resourcefulmanager.com, www.resourcefulcompliance.com, and other web properties. Ability to work remote 1/day a week.

You will work with cross-functionally with our internal marketing, editorial, IT, and creative teams, as well as outside agencies, freelancers and virtual assistants to execute technical SEO, link building, and content campaigns that improve site rankings, traffic, and conversions.

This is a unique opportunity to work across different types of websites, business models, and markets – and make a significant impact on the business while broadening your skills.
What You’ll Be Doing
Executing technical SEO audits and on page optimizations such as content pruning, updating title tags, meta descriptions and internal links, etc.
Conducing robust competitive and keyword research and developing SEO execution plans for several B2B websites and markets.
Collaborate with editorial to create linkable content assets and build content outlines around relevant keywords with high business value.
Plan and implement internal link building initiatives and deploy 3rd party link building resources.
Partner with the marketing team and editorial to come up with and create new offers for lead gen and opt-in acquisition campaigns.
Benchmark search ranking, traffic and conversions, and track the effectiveness of our SEO initiatives and make recommendations for adjustments to the strategy.
Create and automate performance reporting, and proactively communicate key metrics and insights to internal stakeholders and leadership on a weekly and monthly basis.
Success Criteria
Increased website traffic growth from search, social and referral sources
Increased rankings, brand mentions / queries and backlink velocity
Conversions from search (first touch acquisition source and last touch attribution)

Go Fish Digital is looking for a bright, motivated individual to bolster our team of top-notch online marketers.

We need someone who works quickly and efficiently, but takes pride in producing high-quality, error-free products. The right candidate is comfortable hanging around big spreadsheets, can do pivot tables and vlookups in their sleep, and is always excited about a new data source to analyze. Google Analytics, web crawl results, and rank data are a big part of this job, and you'll be happy analyzing them and discovering actionable opportunities. Communication is key, so messages won't sit in your inbox for long before receiving your well-crafted response.

You will:
Spend time analyzing datasets to identify issues and opportunities
Enhance your current SEO knowledge with the ins and outs of many powerful SEO tools
Uncover SEO opportunities for clients by manually investigating their site along with cross-referencing tools and your own data analysis
Work in a team setting, leading up SEO efforts
You should have some or all of the following attributes:
Experience with SEO tools such a Moz, Raven, Screaming Frog, SpyFu, etc.
Experience with WordPress and/or building websites
Comfortable looking at and reviewing HTML and CSS. (You don't need to write it from scratch, but you must be able to look and it and understand what it is doing.)
Deeply understand all aspects of Google Analytics, and be willing to get GA certified (if you're not already)
Comfortable working with Microsoft Excel (and its Google counterpart, Sheets)
A desire to work with data and be technical
The ability to turn analysis into a deliverable that a non-technical person can understand
Strong, clear writing skills
The capability to work well with a team
Strong problem solving skills - if you don't know something but a client needs it, you will do everything you can to quickly figure it out
Work Location

Our office is located in downtown Raleigh. We offer a flexible work schedule, so you'll be able to work about 40% remote (home, coffee shop, etc) and 60% in the office with the rest of the team. This is not a remote position - you must be available to work in our Raleigh office 3 days per week.

Benefits & Culture

Go Fish Digital offers great health care benefits (with a significant portion paid by the company) and a flexible, balanced work schedule. We offer a generous 401(k) program. We're employee-friendly, and include small but fun perks like free Netflix and Spotify subscriptions, a Kindle reader, a free eBook every quarter, a free run/race entry per year, and more. With our trusting and flexible work culture comes responsibility, so you'll need to be the type of worker who is disciplined enough to get things done without someone watching over your shoulder. We are looking for someone to bring great ideas to the table, and to work above and beyond our core hours of 8:00 to 4:00 each day when needed.

Instructions for Applying

For consideration, please write a custom two-paragraph cover letter and include your salary requirements. (The two-paragraph suggestion is so you don't feel obligated to write something super long.) We'll read your cover letter first, so really personalize it and let it showcase your personality and strengths. This should not be a stiff, boilerplate piece of writing. Be real, be yourself, and make us want to learn more about you. Stand out from the crowd!

If the website you're using to apply doesn't allow you to attach a separate cover letter, combine it with your resume into a single document or email it to us separately. This is extremely important, as you will not be considered without it. This ensures you can follow directions and have read all the way down to the bottom. :)

Knucklepuck is searching for an ambitious, motivated individual to join our rapidly growing team of digital-first marketers as a full-time SEO Consultant.

About Knucklepuck

We are a digital marketing agency dedicated to driving sustainable, bottom-line growth for our clients. To accomplish these goals, we become an extension of our clients' marketing teams to create extraordinary web experiences. Our team is comprised of top-notch marketers specializing in content production, search engine optimization, paid media advertising, and web development. We mirror our own industry â quick, quirky, innovate, creative, growing explosively and born of the digital revolution. Our clients span industries from e-commerce to local businesses to Fortune 500 companies.

We are seeking a self-starter who is passionate about driving organic growth through search. In exchange for your insatiable curiosity and SEO chops, we offer the opportunity to make an impact growing our own business and our clients' businesses, to develop technical skills, and to share in the success of the company. Our team is well suited to grit hustlers who value a hard day's work, the comforts of a beanbag chair and a quality pun.

About the Position

The ideal candidate already has a high-level foundation in SEO and is ready to take their skills to the next level. The SEO Consultant is a true team player who will be called upon to drive search engine optimization strategies, communicate directly with clients, and work internally to coordinate with members of our SEO, Paid Media, Content and Web Development teams. It is essential that this person has the desire to cultivate strong professional working relationships with colleagues at all levels within the company.

To succeed in this position, you must have:
1-3 years of demonstrated experience in organic (SEO) search marketing.
Experience working with WordPress or similar CMS.
Familiarity with important Google Algorithm updates, including Mobile-First Index, Penguin, Panda, and RankBrain.
A basic understanding of important on-page SEO factors that impact a site's ranking potential, including quality content, keyword focus, URL structure, title tags, meta descriptions, [h] tags, image alt text and anchor text.
A proven ability to combine and analyze data from multiple sources to interpret business performance and drive strategy.
Familiarity with social media and its role in enhancing SEO initiatives, particularly through relationship-building and link curation.
High-level knowledge of technical website elements that may inhibit search engine crawling and indexation, including information architecture, HTTP status codes and redirects, meta data, breadcrumb linking, canonical tagging, Robots.txt, crawl budget, site speed optimization, .htaccess, pagination and Schema markups.
Proficiency in Google Analytics, social media marketing applications (ex. - Buffer, HootSuite, Tweetdeck) and leading content management systems (ex. - WordPress, Shopify).
Exceptional working knowledge of Excel and other data analysis and business intelligence tools, as well as other MS Office and Google products.
Familiarity with reporting and opportunity analysis tools such as Ahrefs, Moz, SEMRush, Buzzsumo, and Screaming Frog.
Efficient analytical and organizational skills.
A tireless work ethic and passion for digital marketing.
Your primary responsibilities will include:
Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of SEO's role in brand development, digital PR, and content marketing as part of Knucklepuck's integrated digital marketing approach.
Apply a strong business acumen to establish and monitor appropriate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to ensure campaigns deliver results that positively impact our clients' business objectives.
Develop and implement a comprehensive and strategic roadmap for SEO designed to produce sustainable results that maximize search performance.
Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimization to execute on-page strategies that support a consistent content theme.
Leverage a combination of tools and manual research to perform competitive research identifying opportunities for pursuing search engine optimization strategies based upon those factors that the search engines are valuing for target queries.
Collaborate with Paid Media team to leverage complementary insights to ensure SEO strategy is consistent with paid search efforts.
Collaborate with Content resources to identify opportunities to create, distribute, and promote web content appropriately among target communities.
Contribute subject-matter expertise to internal and external thought leadership initiatives, including blog posts, lunch & learn sessions, and networking events.
It would be great if you have:
An understanding of search engine friendly design, development, conversion rate optimization, and user experience best practices.
Google Analytics certified
Agency experience.
How do you apply?

Please complete the application on this page and upload your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements. Your cover letter should include explicit examples of how your skills are a match for Knucklepuck and specifically the SEO Consultant position. As a reminder, your cover letter is your opportunity to demonstrate what you can bring to this role and why you are the best fit to help us reach our goals, so make it count!

In the first line of your cover letter, please let us know where you think the name Knucklepuck originated from.

Non-traditional benefits: Flexible work hours; casual dress code; Work From Home opportunities; snacks; beer fridge; Clifton StrengthsFinder; monthly company social events; beanbag chairs; the occasional Nerf gun battle; birthday celebrations; Lunch & Learn lectures; startup business mentality

1-2 Years of SEO Experience
Creating and executing Search Engine Optimization strategies
Creating and executing review generation strategies
Developing content for our client's websites
Managing link building efforts
Using Google Analytics to identify opportunities and report results
Requirements:


Knowledge of SEO and the latest techniques & algorithms
Experience managing link building campaigns
Experience with tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console and Google Tag Manager
Experience with SEO tools like Moz
Why You Want to Work at Coalmarch


Coalmarch is a small business with big ideas. Joining us now means getting in on the ground floor in a company that’s growing fast - but not too fast. We’re all about sustainable growth for our clients, our company, and ourselves. As a part of the team at Coalmarch, you’re encouraged to discover and hone your strengths and passions, and collaborate with your peers to create a role that’s truly suited to you.

Coalmarch has the fast paced work environment of an agency without the 80 hour weeks, in fact our work weeks end at 38 hours. Also, you can leave the suit and tie at home, as we have a casual dress code.

We’re proud to offer the following benefits to full-time employees:
Paid vacation, sick, and volunteer days
Health insurance
401k match
Monthly fitness stipend
Flexible schedules including summer hours & work from home days
In-house training and continued education allowance
Career advancement opportunities
Great work/life balance
And so much more...like happy hour, karaoke, and in-office snacks to name a few!
Who is Coalmarch?


Coalmarch is a digital marketing and website design agency based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and provides its services to clients throughout the United States and Canada. We currently stand at 28 full-time employees, with plans for continued growth in 2018. Our ideal candidate will live in Raleigh, NC or is willing to move. We are seeking exceptional people to join our team and be part of something amazing. If you think you have what it takes, let’s talk. No calls please!


What does Coalmarch provide?


Coalmarch provides digital marketing services for our clients. We create a central, CMS-based platform and responsive website to drive traffic and conversion. We do this through a combination of branding and usability, on page optimization, technical SEO, content creation, PPC, and local search strategies. Our strategic, website and digital marketing services utilize our knowledge of website and digital marketing to help our service-based businesses succeed!


Why does Coalmarch exist?


To help people understand how internet marketing works, and more importantly the right way to get it done. Through continuing education, improvement, and thought leadership, we strive to increase and share our knowledge base with our customers, vendors, and community. We believe the more people understand about how the internet, and internet marketing, works - the more successful they will be.

We’re passionate about marketing, technology, design, research, usability, and practical strategies that get results for our clients. We believe in excellence, and in HUPPSA - that's our motto! It stands for:
Helpful
Upstanding
Passionate
Positive
Smart
Authentic
We look for these characteristics in each and every person we consider hiring, so if these don't align with your values we probably aren't the right fit. But if you think you have what it takes, apply for this position and we'll be in touch as soon as we've reviewed all applications!

Full Time

00 to 45000.00 per year

Digital Marketing Specialist (SEO) - Q3 2019


Description


Coalmarch is looking for an Organic Search Analyst to join our team in Raleigh, NC!

As an Organic Search Analyst, you walk a tightrope between analysis and creativity. You’re fluent in the Google best practices and stellar user experience, working to drive local visibility for small businesses. You’re curious, excited to test new ideas, and see algorithm updates as a challenge and an opportunity to propel our clients above their competition.


What You Bring to the Table:


Coalmarch is looking for a candidate who is passionate about the future of digital marketing and interested in the bigger picture of how search strategy can impact local businesses. You will be a foundational player in managing the overall SEO strategy for our home service industry clients, developing new ways to turn internet traffic into qualified leads.

You must have 1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing role and foundational knowledge of digital marketing principles (including search engine optimization and pay-per-click advertising).

An ideal candidate will know their way around tools like Moz, Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.

As an Organic Search Analyst, you will:
Develop, manage, and implement SEO strategies for small business clients, including local listing management, review generation, on-page, and off-page optimization.
Develop highly optimized content and link building campaigns to improve the relevance and authority of our clients and advance their organic visibility.
Track, analyze, optimize and report the performance and success of SEO marketing campaigns.
Who is Coalmarch?


Coalmarch is a digital marketing agency based in Raleigh, focused on providing small business owners in the home services industries (lawn care, pest control, & HVAC) with the tools they need to grow.

We create a central, CMS-based platform and responsive website to drive traffic and conversion. Using on-page optimization, technical SEO, content creation, PPC, and other local search strategies, we drive visibility and lead generation for small businesses across the country. We also provide hiring people management software solutions for business owners in these industries.

We’re small but mighty - which is the perfect environment if you’re the kind of person who likes to make a visible difference on the team.

At Coalmarch, you’ll be encouraged to discover and hone your strengths and passions.

(We’re passionate about marketing, technology, design, research, and strategy that helps our small business clients grow - so if you’re passionate about those things, too, we’re going to get along great!)

We have the fast-paced work environment of an agency without the 80-hour weeks. (In fact, our workweek ends at 38 hours!) You can leave the suit and tie at home - every day is Casual Friday.

It’s not unusual to find coworkers snuggling with office dogs or grabbing a beer at Happy Hour together, and once a month, we all call it quits a few hours early to compete in a skee-ball tournament at Boxcar, catch a movie, or volunteer our time at the soup kitchen or Habitat for Humanity.


Benefits


We also offer benefits to full-time employees:
Paid vacation, sick, and volunteer days
Health and dental insurance
401(k) match
Monthly fitness stipend
Annual professional development allowance
100% company-paid parking space
38 hour work week with year-round summer hours
Career advancement at a growing company

Full Time

Undertake content marketing initiatives that align with business goals

Push engaging content consistently

Experience with SEO and Google Analytics is required

Experience with various social media platforms (Facebook, Linkedin, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube)
Project management skills and high attention to detail

The StormwaterONE marketing department is seeking an intern to assist with generating engaging, original content for our website.

As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to work on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn, as well as suggest ideas for future content, engage with stormwater audiences and delve into each of our social media and web analytics. We're looking for someone who isn't afraid of taking on several tasks at one time and is excited about any new ideas that come to you. Interns must be proficient in copywriting and targeted online research.

Upon the completion of the internship, you will be exposed to a large number of marketing and business operation platforms, which can be added to your resume. Exposure to these systems is a great advantage for those seeking to enter a professional work environment after graduation.

You have an amazing ability to work in an entrepreneurial culture and take on new challenges as needed.
Proven ability to produce creative content in a variety of complicated business topics.
Plan and write stormwater specific content for web and mobile (interaction flows, emails, product messaging). Choose subject matter that intrigues readers.
You will write permit guides, training tips, construction guides, white papers, training materials, blog posts, and other relevant content
Have an ability to create relevant content for beginners and intermediate targets
Assist with creating content for marketing - social posts, post email templates. Collaborate with design partners to influence the content layout and visual design of your content.
Graphic design skills are a plus.
Exceptional copywriting, communication and time management skills.
Highly detail-oriented with quality-driven deliverables in documents, reports, and sheets.
You will be working within an open office environment and exposed to all aspects of the business. Our business is expanding so permanent employment is a strong possibility.

This internship is unpaid.

This internship is 15 hours/week for 15 weeks.

About StormwaterONE
StormwaterONE.com is an occupational trade school that Designs, Develops, and Delivers online training to support compliance with the Clean Water Act. Our company operates as an internet retailer. If you have an interest in marketing, sales, business operations, or Instructional Design, we would love to hear from you!

BEDU es una empresa educativa dedicada a ayudar a las personas a convertirse en las mejores versiones de sí mismas al ofrecer cursos de alta calidad en habilidades profesionales y para la vida. Nuestra combinación única de role-plays interactivos, juegos, estudios de casos y entrenamiento personal ayuda a los estudiantes a SER las mejores versiones de sí mismos y HACER las cosas que hacen que su vida emocional, social y profesional sea más exitosa. Actualmente estamos buscando ofrecer cursos de capacitación en emprendedores en la Ciudad de México.

Estamos buscando instructores y generadores de contenido con experiencia como SEO (Posicionamiento web) que no solo sean profesionales apasionados, sino que también estén ansiosos por compartir sus conocimientos. Los instructores trabajarán con el equipo de diseño de cursos de Bedu para impartir un curso basado en proyectos del mundo real. Este curso se imparte a tiempo parcial donde los estudiantes aprenderán las habilidades y conocimientos necesarios para desarrollar los elementos que integran una estrategia de optimización en motores de búsqueda o SEO, generando un conjunto de acciones orientadas a mejorar el posicionamiento de un sitio web en la lista de resultados de los principales buscadores de internet.

Responsabilidades:
Impartir 4 horas por semana a tiempo parcial, en horario sabatino.
Guiar a los estudiantes a través del desarrollo de una experiencia práctica de aprendizaje, desarrollando un proyecto final que concentre sus resultados de aprendizaje.
Ayudar a los estudiantes fuera de clase en al menos una sesión de tutoría por semana. (no aplica, pero aplica una Masterclass)
Proporcionar retroalimentación continua al equipo de desarrollo del curso.
Participar en discusiones internas relacionadas con las prácticas de enseñanza y la tecnología educativa.

Mínimo 2 años trabajando como SEO Specialist.
Licenciatura en Mercadotecnia, comunicación.
Habilidades
Gestión de Excel intermedia o avanzada.
Conocimiento en casos prácticos aplicables a la clase.
Análisis comparativo.
Fuerte compromiso de proporcionar a los estudiantes la mejor experiencia educativa, está ansioso por dar forma a las habilidades, mentes y trayectorias de los estudiantes beduinos.
Capacidad para transmitir material del curso de manera efectiva, compromiso de contribuir a actividades extra curriculares y experiencias educativas para los estudiantes.
Fuertes habilidades de gestión del aula / equipo y excelentes habilidades interpersonales.

We are looking for a Jr. SEO Specialist to join our in-house digital marketing team.
Delmain is a full-service digital marketing, web design, and SEO agency. We help small businesses get more leads, clients, patients, and customers through their websites.

Open and honest communication, ambitious and creative problem solving, and a commitment to respect and equality are just a few of our core values. We’re always learning and looking for ways we can work smarter, not harder.

We’re looking to add a data-driven, creative, and aspiring Junior SEO Specialist to our team.

Most of all, we’re looking for someone who is excited about building or furthering their career in digital marketing and becoming an integral and positive member of our team. We’ll help you develop the skills you need to excel in this role. All we ask is that you’re willing to learn and want to be in the industry for the long haul.

We encourage people of all backgrounds and all experiences to apply.
Responsibilities
40% - Local SEO - Manage Google My Business profiles and ensure consistent business information across the web
30% - Link Acquisition - Uncover quality links around the web, perform link audits and competitive analysis
10% - Keyword Research - Conduct keyword research, document existing site architectures, and assist the sales team with pitch materials
5% - Website Audits - Conduct website audits to uncover broken links, slow page load times, duplicate content, and other errors
5% - Metrics Monitoring - Use Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and other tools to analyze SEO efforts
5% - Research Support - Assist other team members in data collection and reporting
5% - Misc. Projects - Work closely with cross-functional teams (Content, Design, Account Management) to support and grow our clients’ online marketing strategies and goals
*
Qualifications

Required Qualifications
4-year degree in marketing, business, statistics, or similar – the person who joins our team for this position will be expected to start work reasonably soon.
0-2 years of relevant professional experience, ideally in an agency setting
Familiarity with major local and organic SEO ranking factors
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational and project management abilities
Creativity to find solutions to challenging problems
Ability to work in a supportive environment with little supervision while tackling several projects simultaneously
Passionate about digital marketing and the opportunity to grow with Delmain
*
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in a team environment to develop or execute effective SEO strategies
Knowledge of best practices for digital marketing, SEO, and analytics
Working knowledge of Google Analytics and other analytics tools
Experience using Wordpress and other content management systems
Experience using project management tools like Asana (what we use at Delmain), Trello, Basecamp, etc.
*
The formalities
Hours: Full-time / Salaried
Paid Time Off
Health/Dental Insurance
Retirement Plan
Pay: DOE
*
How to apply
Please send a resume and cover letter to careers(at)delmain.co. In your cover letter, briefly tell us how you align with our core values:
Curiosity – We are open to the possibility that there is a better way to do things.
Neighborly – We share in mutual communication, respect, and trust.
Balanced – We maintain a healthy work-life balance in all of our relationships.
Positivity – We see the best in everyone and every opportunity.

Job title: Senior Front End Engineer Growth/SEO - ePharmacy - Orange County - California
Description:
About Us

Vezeeta is a global booking powerhouse serving and empowering patients in each step of their healthcare journey with knowledge and data. We build tech-enabled solutions to solve the healthcare pains of patients around the globe. Trusted by patients, healthcare providers and medical industry leaders around the globe to facilitate and enhance healthcare accessibility and quality, Vezeeta has grown to become a mainstream digital leader of health-tech solutions in the global marketplace. Currently serving more than 4 million patients across 5 countries, with over 20,000 healthcare providers listed on our platform, Vezeeta is transforming the healthcare experience of patients, by digitally streamlining their healthcare journey, and enabling them to search, book and review the best doctors and medical services in just one minute.

Our organization is quickly growing, generating demanding roles for like-minded, forward-thinking individuals - with plenty of room for professional and personal growth. If you think you share our belief in redirecting possible healthcare pains into productive tech-enabled solutions, and can add to our positive culture, we’d love to hear from you.

Why Join Us?

The Role

With our brand-new, stunning and elegant office in Orange County Irvine, we are aggressively searching for a talented workforce in the market. As a fundamental member of the Engineering Team, you will play a significant role in contributing to the growth and success of our new business venture in Vezeeta.

Vezeeta has an amazing new opportunity for the best talented individuals, who are bursting with ideas and enthusiasm, to join our new Engineering Team in LA. We are looking for motivated people, who are searching for a rewarding challenge in their career. We want you to be a part of our journey and to play a key role in establishing our presence in the market to produce engaging clients.

This is a position that will see you gain experience and skills in a wide range of areas as well as working at the forefront of the Health-tech industry.

We’re currently looking for a Senior SEO Engineer:

As a senior SEO engineer, you will lead the development of all website content and configuration necessary to drive growth of organic and paid search engine traffic for all Vezeeta web properties. You will work closely with our product and marketing operations teams on implementation and optimization strategies. The ideal candidate will manage regional execution of the company’s SEO strategy and deliver on all SEO related functions including but not limited to front-end coding, content updates, SEO analysis, page optimization, keyword research, site audits, and web analytics analysis.

You may be a part of or may be building a team of SEO engineers who will design, build and deliver the company’s SEO strategy to increase web leads, site traffic, conversion, brand recognition and more.

Responsibilities:
Take a leadership role as part of a fully remote team of highly skilled engineers.
Own development, maintenance, optimization, testing strategy, design discussions and operations of front-end code as needed with HTML, CSS, and ReactJS.
Practice Scrum/Agile methodology with focus on building code that is effective, efficient, scalable, and extensible.
Collaborate with content authors and help define content strategy to incorporate SEO guidelines early and as part of the software development lifecycle.
Support regular site audits for all SEO related functions and present results.
Provide SEO expertise and recommendations as needed.
Evangelize and help enforce global SEO content/site guidelines.
Configure and manage properties, code, and components related to SEO.
Maintain an updated understanding of what the major search engines, and especially Google, are using as criteria for SERP.
Be ready to work at a fast pace, deliver quickly, and pivot as needed while still delivery high quality code.
Guide your team and others in design sessions and help deliver high quality work.
Partner with teams to identify software components in their products that can be optimized.
Troubleshoot issues and identify bottlenecks to improve performance.
Participate in code reviews, design reviews, and debugging sessions.
Requirements
5+ years of experience with modern HTML, CSS and JavaScript frameworks – preferably ReactJS.
3+ years of experience in SEO engineering with demonstrated understanding of how all content, functions, components, links, and other factors impact SEO.
Building and leading SEO strategy for a global company.
One or more programming languages and familiarity with a variety of operating systems and hardware platforms.
A degree/education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant field.
Ability to work with a remote/distributed team.
Knowledge of popular search engine algorithms and requirements.
Web server architecture and configuration related to SEO.
Using web crawlers and similar tools to perform site audits.
Understanding of search engine rankings and factors affecting them.
Strong presentation and communication skills.
Designing and developing for accessibility and internationalization is a strong plus.
Web content development/publishing experience using an enterprise content management system (CMS) is a plus.
Benefits

Life at Vezeeta
Dress for Success: Going strong, relaxed attire
Flex is bigger than ever: our office accommodates VEEZ 24 hours
Unlimited paid annual leave

Job Description:

Leverage Marketing is looking for an SEO Team Lead / Strategist to join our team to help capitalize on our clients’ opportunities and drive growth of the department. Leverage Marketing is a digital marketing agency that is dedicated to offering our clients winning solutions across multiple online marketing channels. With a tight-knit team and a startup mentality, we benefit from the knowledge and ideas of all of our team members.

Our SEO Team Lead / Strategist will create strategic campaigns for our clients utilizing tactics from the core SEO focus areas of: on-site content, technical SEO, off-site strategies and conversion rate optimization. Our team of SEO specialists, developers, content writers, and graphic designers are ready to support the strategy that our SEO Team Lead / Strategist outlines. This role converses directly with clients to outline tactics, report results and discuss next steps as well as oversees the work being done by the team. Remaining in the know about the latest developments in organic search and the opportunities they present to our clients is key. A willingness to learn and experiment is also vital to a Leverage Marketing team member's success.

Requirements / What We're Looking For:

-Have 2 - 4 years of experience in search marketing and/or content marketing. Ideally, you'll have already led a team.

-Be able to efficiently audit a site and analytics reports and determine the opportunities that are available to our clients.

-Be able to create strategic SEO campaigns based on various company goals and budgets.

-Be able to execute on your own, utilize existing resources, and/or source talent to execute on the tactics and strategies identified during these audits.

-Have experience publishing content and performing SEO tasks within WordPress.

-Possess a clear understanding of all of the important metrics in evaluating traffic, conversions and keyword visibility.

-Have experience utilizing a variety of online marketing tools including Google Analytics, Google Search Console, a backlink checker, a rank checker, and a web crawler.

-Have the ability to perform in-depth keyword research and prioritize keyword targeting to specific pages of a site.

-Have close attention to detail related to all client deliverables and communications.

-Be a student of the industry / be coachable. One of the most exciting but also the toughest things about search is that it’s always changing. We're constantly learning how to get better at what we do and expect you to as well.

-Have great communication skills. Whether communicating with clients on occasion or with your peers, you must be able to get your points across clearly and effectively - verbally and nonverbally.

-Have great time management skills. This position is all about getting things done right the first time and on-time.

-Have a high level of proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Docs.

Bonus Points for:

-Bringing your own book of business.

-Bringing your own network of reliable freelancers/partners.

-Knowledge of or experience in other areas of digital marketing such as PPC, Social Media, Email Marketing, Blogging, etc.

-Technical SEO experience

-HTML and CSS proficiency.

-JavaScript proficiency.

-Google Tag Manager proficiency.

-Online public relations experience.

-Adobe Creative Suite proficiency.

-Foreign language fluency.

About Leverage Marketing:

-Located on the increasingly trendy E Cesar Chavez with proximity to restaurants, coffee shops, yoga studios, Town Lake, etc.

-Easy going professional office environment that is dog-friendly.

-Flextime comes with experience at our company. Life can be tough enough without having to take time off for anything and everything you need to do during regular work hours.

Notes:

-Salary expected to be in the range of $50k - $85k based on experience.

Forward Note: Some companies come to play the game; WE are a Game Changer. We don't adhere to the market, we Disrupt it.

Is this YOU: Are you a BEAST in SEO Marketing? Can you Build a client base so vast in a short span of time that makes other people’s head spin? If WE gave you over 125+ Financial Products and Services, would you be happier than a Pig in a Peach Orchard? If so, we need to discuss you joining the team as a Strategic Partner with Next Level Business Concepts Group.

Fine Print: Now the Meat & Potatoes, This is a 1099 Position where it's your business, your success, you’re the Captain of this Ship, Let me be crystal clear, If you are not working for yourself, you are fulfilling someone else’s dream.

Skills: If you are a SEO Marketing genius or a Closer, this position is worth your time to find out more. If you have built landing pages, sales funnels, pounded the pavement this position is in your wheelhouse. Yes, we could hire any SEO Marketing Company to complete our projects, but why not give an ongoing commission to our strategic partners instead.

History: The Company of 5-GENTS. With over 100 years of sales, services, financial, operational experience in entrepreneurship and corporate culture. Our vision of grandeur to gain a foothold in the marketplace while being stewards of giving back.

The Business: We are a fee-based boutique financial consulting firm specializing in arranging alternative and non-traditional capital acquisition financing. We provide direct domestic and international commercial financing for a wide array of Clientele.

We work with enterprises of all scales; from start-ups to well established corporations looking to expand, acquire, merge or divest. We work closely with our Clients to develop the most beneficial type and structure of financing from fully collateralized asset-based loans to unsecured business lines of credit.

We are a domestic and international Commercial capital management brokerage. We have developed an extensive partner network of private investment groups. Through this network, we have access to virtually unlimited capital resources. We can broker deals from a start-up enterprise to a multinational multi-billion-dollar construction project.

We provide world class analysis, pragmatic funding solutions and fast high impact results for our Clients; we are trusted, experienced and connected. We have developed compelling relationships with numerous national and international Funding Sources over the years so our Clients are able to benefit greatly from our many
engagement platforms.

But wait there’s more….Apply within and find out.

Vyond is seeking a Marketing Specialist with excellent analytical, communication, and research skills to support our SEO (search engine optimization) and marketing operations efforts.
