Digital Marketing SEO Analyst - Q1 2020


Description


Coalmarch is looking for an SEO Analyst to join our team in Raleigh, NC!

As an SEO Analyst, you walk a tightrope between analysis and creativity. You’re fluent in the Google best practices and stellar user experience, working to drive local visibility for small businesses. You’re curious, excited to test new ideas, and see algorithm updates as a challenge and an opportunity to propel our clients above their competition.


What You Bring to the Table:


Coalmarch is looking for a candidate who is passionate about the future of digital marketing and interested in the bigger picture of how search strategy can impact local businesses. You will be a foundational player in managing the overall SEO strategy for our home service industry clients, developing new ways to turn internet traffic into qualified leads.

You must have 1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing role and foundational knowledge of digital marketing principles (including search engine optimization and pay-per-click advertising).

An ideal candidate will know their way around tools like Moz, Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.

As an SEO Analyst, you will:
Develop, manage, and implement SEO strategies for small business clients, including local listing management, review generation, on-page, and off-page optimization.
Develop highly optimized content and link building campaigns to improve the relevance and authority of our clients and advance their organic visibility.
Track, analyze, optimize and report the performance and success of SEO marketing campaigns.
Who is Coalmarch?


Coalmarch is a digital marketing agency based in Raleigh, focused on providing small business owners in the home services industries (lawn care, pest control, & HVAC) with the tools they need to grow.

We create a central, CMS-based platform and responsive website to drive traffic and conversion. Using on-page optimization, technical SEO, content creation, PPC, and other local search strategies, we drive visibility and lead generation for small businesses across the country. We also provide hiring people management software solutions for business owners in these industries.

We’re small but mighty - which is the perfect environment if you’re the kind of person who likes to make a visible difference on the team.

At Coalmarch, you’ll be encouraged to discover and hone your strengths and passions.

(We’re passionate about marketing, technology, design, research, and strategy that helps our small business clients grow - so if you’re passionate about those things, too, we’re going to get along great!)

We have the fast-paced work environment of an agency without the 80-hour weeks. (In fact, our workweek ends at 38 hours!) You can leave the suit and tie at home - every day is Casual Friday.

It’s not unusual to find coworkers snuggling with office dogs or grabbing a beer at Happy Hour together, and once a month, we all call it quits a few hours early to compete in a skee-ball tournament at Boxcar, catch a movie, or volunteer our time at the soup kitchen or Habitat for Humanity.


Benefits


We also offer benefits to full-time employees:
Paid vacation, sick, and volunteer days
Health and dental insurance
401(k) match
Monthly fitness stipend
Annual professional development allowance
100% company-paid parking space
38 hour work week with year-round summer hours
Career advancement at a growing company
Employment Type
Full Time

Job title: Digital Marketing Associate (SEO, SEM, PR, Content)
Description:
Are you a talented freelance digital marketer looking to smooth out the ups and downs of client work? Maybe let someone else handle the sales, reporting, billing, and other administrative chores so you can focus on the creative marketing part you love? How about collaborating with other specialists so you can take on larger and more challenging projects?

Let’s team up!

We’re CanIRank, a 100% distributed digital marketing agency with a unique model that combines the best of machine learning-based software and a team of dynamic specialists working from home to collaborate on interesting and challenging client projects without the overhead of a traditional agency.

As our new Digital Marketing Associate, you’ll join our 22-person strong team of specialists in SEO, content marketing, SEM / PPC, social media, PR, technical, and design. Our clients are primarily SaaS, startup, and ecommerce businesses, and they rely on us to come up with creative, attention-getting content campaigns that will help them compete against Mega Brands currently dominating the search engine results.

A typical day's work might include tasks such as pitching a journalist, relationship building with industry bloggers, optimizing a new product page for both conversions and search engine rankings, debugging a Wordpress duplicate content issue, or revising a client website's information architecture.

Yep, that's a lot! We're big on continuous improvement here at CanIRank, so you can expect to sharpen your skillset through our 6-week Onboarding Program, Biweekly Trainings, and Team Huddles, as well as be asked to share knowledge of your own.

With experience and expertise you’ll have the opportunity to take the lead developing the overall marketing strategy for a client and leading other consultants in its execution.

We’re primarily looking for remote freelancers to help out on an as-needed basis. However, if the fit is good we can also hire for PT or FT employee roles including a full benefits package (subsidized health insurance, unlimited PTO, tech stipend, learning stipend, flex time). Depending on the task and your skill level, freelancer rates range from $18 - 26 / hr or $25 - $300 / task. Perks include regular paid training, culture events, performance bonuses, and the opportunity to work with (and learn from) some pretty badass digital marketers!

Although our team is distributed throughout the US, we’re looking to build up a talent pool in the Central Oregon region with an eye towards opening a Bend office in the future.

ABOUT YOU
1-5 years professional work experience, or internships of extraordinary relevance and quality
Exceptional persuasive writing ability: your college application essay made the Dean cry, and your status updates win more “likes” than a skateboarding puppy doing the Harlem Shake.
Citizen Web: you have a strong affinity for internet culture, spend time contributing and sharing online, and may even have dabbled in Wordpress, HTML, web design, or coding.
Startup compatibility: you're comfortable with changing roles, blistering speed, and figuring it out as you go along
Passion for helping small businesses succeed
Self-disciplined: you prefer to structure your own tasks, all the better to try out that new hyper-productivity system you read about last weekend
Virtually extraverted: it's OK if you're shy at parties, but on the internet you're not afraid to speak up, always remembering that there's a real person on the other side of your monitor, and connecting in an authentic manner whether you're pitching a TechCrunch writer or helping Milfred find a new web host for her gluten free dog biscuit store.
DEFINITELY APPLY IF ANY OF THE FOLLOWING ALSO APPLY TO YOU:
You regularly contribute to Tier 1 online or print publications
Experience in a startup or SME-focused PR, SEO, or Content Marketing Agency
Prior success generating exceptional ROI on AdWords campaigns
You’ve built a blog to > 50,000 monthly uniques
You can make your colleagues laugh even over an awkward Google Hangouts video call
Please apply here: https://goo.gl/forms/CotzsAvbKjsxIKU52

Hearst Magazines is looking for a creative and talented SEO manager to work with our Enthusiast brands Runner's World, Bicycling, and Popular Mechanics. Combined, these sites generate more than 15 million users each month who are as obsessed with our brands as we are. From millennials to marathon runners, tech nerds to space geeks, you'll be able to help shape content creation each and every day.

As a company, Search plays an important role and produces a healthy variety of traffic. We're seeking a rock-star of sorts that can assist our associate SEO director to bring our strong Search foundation to the next level. Working directly with our digital editors, you'll get a front line view of the latest gadgets, record-breaking athletes, ecommerce everything, and at times, you'll get to help be part of the testing process (hello, new running shoes).

While this is mainly an SEO role, we are also looking for someone with an analytical mind. As we continue to make smarter decisions based on data, this role will be responsible for providing insights to help shape content strategy, whether that be organic search, paid, or even newsletter.

Here's what you'll be responsible for:

Create a unique SEO content strategy for each site that seamlessly mixes into their editorial calendar and voice. Sure we're talking about keyword ideas, but also new areas of content opportunity overall, emerging trends, ever-changing seasonal opportunities, and innovative takes on what's buzzing on the InterWebs. #TourDeFrance

Optimize content on the regular, whether it's on-page headlines, meta titles, slugs, or body copy, you know what the page needs to rank in Google.

Work directly in our CMS updating meta info, creating URLs, working on all sorts of internal linking, creating collection pages, and monitoring redirects.

Use our analytics tools to provide reporting to stakeholders on what's working and what's not working. Analyze data to provide recommendations on what we should be doing more of.

Keep tabs on keywords that have been assigned, completed, and published. You'll see a story through from start to finish.

Live and breathe all things Search. Stay on top of the industry, test out new product features, and ensure we're always playing nicely with every algorithm update. You're basically like the algo police.

Knucklepuck is searching for an ambitious, motivated individual to join our rapidly growing team of digital-first marketers as a full-time Junior SEO Consultant.

About Knucklepuck

We are a digital marketing agency dedicated to driving sustainable, bottom-line growth for our clients. To accomplish these goals, we become an extension of our clients' marketing teams to create extraordinary web experiences. Our team is comprised of top-notch marketers specializing in content production, search engine optimization, paid media advertising, and web development. We mirror our own industry â quick, quirky, innovate, creative, growing explosively and born of the digital revolution. Our clients span industries from e-commerce to local businesses to Fortune 500 companies.

We are seeking a self-starter who is passionate about driving organic growth through search. In exchange for your insatiable curiosity and SEO chops, we offer the opportunity to make an impact growing our own business and our clients' businesses, to develop technical skills, and to reap the rewards of a job well done. Our team is well suited to grit hustlers who value a hard day's work, the comforts of a beanbag chair and a quality pun.

About the Position

The Junior SEO Consultant will provide support for Knucklepuck's SEO clients. The Junior SEO Consultant will report to the Director of Marketing but will also take direction from the lead Project Manager for each of their 3-6 assigned accounts.

Although extensive training will be provided, the Junior SEO Consultant must be independent, self-motivated, and able to interact directly with clients in a professional manner. The Junior SEO Consultant must be able to take direction and cultivate strong professional relationships both externally (with clients, experts, sources, etc.) and internally (with colleagues across departments at all levels within the company). We are looking for a true team player who will be called upon to execute search engine optimization strategies and work internally to coordinate with members of our SEO, Paid Media, Content and Web Development teams.

To succeed in this position, you must have:
Creative, problem-solving and strategic thinking skills and an ability to execute tactical action items
Quick learning tendencies and a thirst for knowledge that will facilitate your immediate contribution to a rapidly growing agency
A track record of experiences demonstrating an action-oriented personality
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to independently manage tasks to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and results-oriented culture
The ability to communicate well verbally and in writing to foster client relationships
A data-driven mentality and analytical mindset that will inform strategy
Working familiarity with Google Docs, Google Sheets and Google Drive (as well as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
Passion! Knucklepuck thrives on growth from within. This role will serve an integral part of our SEO team and be afforded significant growth opportunities across the organization
As you receive sufficient training in SEO, your primary responsibilities will include:
Use an arsenal of on-page, off-page, tech and outreach techniques to perform search engine optimization, including competitive research
Perform ongoing keyword research to execute on-page strategies, such as writing content growth opportunity outlines, that support a consistent and consolidated content theme
Leverage a combination of tools and manual research to perform competitive research identifying opportunities for pursuing search engine optimization strategies based upon those factors that the search engines are valuing for target queries
Write optimized meta data and on-page content that contains target keywords, improves clickthrough rates, and enhances user experience
Push SEO updates live on client content platforms such as Wordpress
Contribute to internal team discussions, including brainstorms and lectures
Track client analytics and creating reports to inform clients of their progress
Support SEO Consultants with client tasks including client meetings and assignments. This is a client-facing role
It would be great if you have:
A track record of leadership roles and experiences
Digital agency experience
Experience with WordPress and/or website development
Familiarity with web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics) and opportunity analysis tools such as Ahrefs, Moz, SEMRush, Buzzsumo, and Screaming Frog.
How do you apply?

Please complete the application on this page and upload your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements. Your cover letter should include explicit examples of how your skills are a match for Knucklepuck and specifically the SEO Consultant position. As a reminder, your cover letter is your opportunity to demonstrate what you can bring to this role and why you are the best fit to help us reach our goals, so make it count!

In the first line of your cover letter, please let us know where you think the name Knucklepuck originated from.

Benefits

Traditional benefits: Macbook; 15 days PTO; 401k matching; contributions toward a competitive medical plan; the option to purchase additional benefits at reasonable rates such as dental and vision.

Non-traditional benefits: Flexible work hours; casual dress code; Work From Home opportunities; snacks; beer fridge; Clifton StrengthsFinder; monthly company social events; beanbag chairs; the occasional Nerf gun battle; birthday celebrations; Lunch & Learn lectures; startup business mentality

The Fine Print

This is an on-site, full-time position. We are an equal opportunity employer. If you can bring it, we will recognize your talent.

We are not accepting applications from agencies.

About The 2020 SEO Innovator Scholarship

Apply now to put $1,000 towards your education.

Huckabuy is a performance-based search engine optimization (SEO) platform that creates cutting-edge software products and services aligned with Google's strategic initiatives. We help businesses large and small in virtually every industry achieve tremendous growth in the organic search channel with a technology-first approach.

We think a lot differently about SEO than most people in the industry, focusing more on where the field is going instead of where it's been. We think that's a good thing. And we want to support people who are doing the same while in school.

Are you a marketing, design, or computer science student passionate about SEO? Do you have ideas about where the field is going and what really moves the needle in terms of performance? If so, we want to hear from you.

Submission Details

1. Follow us on LinkedIn, tag 2 of your favorite companies that you think need to improve their organic search presence, and tag our page in a 50 word post describing what excites you most about SEO.

2. Write an essay no longer than a page forecasting what you think the field of SEO will look like 2-3 years from and what actions you would take, whether from on-page, off-page, or technical standpoints in the intermediate term to align websites with those future ranking factors.

Scholarship Eligibility
Must be entering or enrolled at an accredited 2-year or 4-year college or university in the United States.
All application questions must be answered fully.
Must be a United States Citizen or Permanent Resident. Open to students from all states.
For terms and conditions, click here.
Open to undergraduate students pursuing marketing, design, or computer science degrees.
Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Scholarship winner must provide enrollment and GPA verification.
How To Apply

Once per year, the Huckabuy Scholarship Program will award one individual with innovative ideas and a demonstrated passion for search engine optimization (SEO) a $1,000 academic scholarship towards their educational expenses.

To apply, students must meet the minimum eligibility requirements and complete the application by the deadline listed below.

Application Opens: January 1st, 2020 at 12:01 AM.

Application Closes: March 31st, 2020 at 11:59 PM.

The SEO Expert is responsible for maximizing search engine rankings for B&H product/listing and landing pages, as well as increasing the overall volume of organic traffic from search engines to the B&H Website. The SEO Expert leverages data analytics to develop and deploy effective search strategies aligned with business objectives. They will take necessary steps to stay on top of latest trends and shifts in the industry.

The SEO team at Amazon has end-to-end responsibility for one of the largest managed marketing channels in the world. Our team optimizes the Amazon retail websites for search engines and manages the landing page experience from search engines for our customers. We develop world leading, proprietary enterprise technology including an automated experimentation system for measuring and driving SEO changes. Our organization is comprised of Marketing, Product, Engineering and Business Intelligence teams, and we are truly international with members of our teams in Seattle, Palo Alto, London, Paris, Madrid, Dubai, Bangalore, Sao Paulo, Beijing and Tokyo.
We are seeking a seasoned Senior SEO Marketing Manager capable of driving commercial success at scale while increasing customer satisfaction. The successful candidate will lead the SEO Marketing program for Amazon.com. You will have a vision of what the business needs to succeed, and you will collaborate with SEO Managers WW on multiple projects at once to help achieve that vision. You will manage, investigate and report on the SEO business performance of Amazon's sites, run campaigns and educate and advise multiple stakeholders. You will have the curiosity to seek out potential opportunities or investigate anomalies in business performance, dive deep into Amazon's data lakes to evaluate them, and utilize your learnings and insights to devise strategies and experiments that validate them.
This position offers an unparalleled opportunity to leverage your understanding of SEO on behalf of one of the world's leading consumer brands. As such, this role requires a highly analytical mindset, a strong business sense, and robust problem solving skills. You will be equally comfortable thinking big, diving deep and rolling up your sleeves to validate hypothesizes. You understand how to perform SEO at scale, and work closely with product and technical teams to help scale your successful experiments at an enterprise level.
This role has responsibility for both strategy and execution, and as such, the successful candidate will have a proven track record of making data driven decisions, and working closely with technical, product and marketing teams to achieve success. The successful candidate will be a clear and persuasive communicator (both verbally and in writing) who is able to effectively communicate with internal customers and executive stakeholders across the company. To guarantee your success, you will be coached by a strong team of leaders in the SEO field, who will work with you on your strengths and weaknesses to guide you to success. This position will be located at Amazon's Seattle HQ only.
The Senior SEO Marketing Manager will be responsible for:
Auditing and analyzing Amazon.com's SEO performance, identifying issues, finding root-causes, and experimenting with solutions to improve performance at scale.
Directly responsible for understanding and communicating Amazon.com's SEO channel business performance to leadership and other stakeholders in weekly and quarterly business reviews, while collaborating with Amazon's international SEO Managers to help leadership understand Amazon's broader WW SEO performance.
Managing and executing a robust search engine optimization strategy for Amazon.com, including creating a roadmap of experimental initiatives that can lead to scalable growth, and providing support for major events / initiatives
Leading efforts to solve complex SEO problems, moving quickly to implement ideas and deliver results. You will dive into issues and incidents as they occur, perform ad-hoc cause and effect analysis to derive action plans for specific issues, find root causes, experiment with solutions at scale and/or help escalate them to drive to resolution.
Conducting SEO experiments in US and / or in partnership with international SEO Managers, using rigorous approaches and measurement methods (A/B tests, statistical methods) to evaluate their effectiveness
Working closely with product, technology and business intelligence teams to make sure the company's infrastructure, architecture, and site features support and enhance the effectiveness of our SEO.
Contributing to company-wide knowledge sharing and engaging with stakeholders to determine optimal SEO improvements globally.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required
4+ years' experience in the Search Engine Optimization field.
Proven track record assuming ownership, moving quickly to implement ideas, and delivering results and in a fast-paced online environment.
Ability to drive clear, thoughtful, and comprehensive analyses of marketing programs
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, drive rationale, discover root causes and identify opportunities
Resourceful problem-solver with ability to excel in an ambiguous environment
Proven track record in managing SEO projects from inception to completion
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience with Excel and capable of manipulating data in order to perform both high level and more granular analysis. This includes familiarity with VLookups, Pivot tables, and other such functionalities

We’re seeking extraordinary people who want to contribute to a fast-growing digital marketing agency with a proven track record of success for clients around the world.
Team members carry a great work-life balance and directly make an impact on our company as well as the lives of our clients, communities, and fellow team members.

As a Content Marketing Specialist, you’ll be responsible for various styles of content and writing copy that appeals to varying target audiences to support our clients’ brand and goals. In addition to developing content, you’ll perform other activities critical to SEO and digital marketing success, such as keyword research, optimization, outreach, social media, and email marketing.

Why Work at DOM?

At a mid-sized agency, you have the opportunity to move the needle more than at a larger agency. Plus, you get to be part of a team of talented, hard-working individuals. We take our ‘No Jerks’ policy seriously here.

DOM is in the top 2% of all Google partner agencies worldwide, helping our clients grow their businesses through pay-per-click advertising, search engine optimization, social media advertising, and other forms of digital advertising. We’re a stable (established 2006) and growing leader delivering excellent results to our clients who say things like:
“DOM constantly pushes the envelope. They’re great communicators and are fun to work with, too.”
“Working with DOM is like working with colleagues who have our company’s best interest at heart.”
“I’m approached daily by other digital marketing agencies who want to pitch their company to me, but I never consider anyone else.”
We offer a competitive package that includes health, dental, vision, and short-term disability insurance; 401(k) with company match; and quarterly profit sharing.

About the Position

You’ll play a core role within our organic team, contributing heavily to how successfully we meet the marketing goals of clients within your portfolio. You will have a mix of clients in many industries, geographies, and sizes. Our clients’ goals are unique to them, but they all center around visitors taking a direct action, such as filling out a form, placing a call, or purchasing online.

Day to day work will vary; it includes a wide array of content production, including writing for blogs, websites, press releases, social posts, emails, and ads. In addition to content, you will also perform the following for our clients to assist in our SEO and overall marketing efforts for them, including: keyword research and optimization; on-site SEO analysis; outreach; working with analytics and SEO tools; and reporting. You will also contribute content to DOM’s marketing efforts, both via your knowledge and in interviewing team members.

**This position will be based in either our Pittsburgh, PA or Wheeling, WV offices and is not being offered remotely.**

Who You Are

You will have a minimum of 3-5 years in content creation for digital marketing purposes. This experience will include:
Content creation & optimization for multiple goals (e.g. lead generation, e-commerce sales) and in multiple industries
Writing long-form content, including whitepapers and technical blog posts
Building and adapting to multiple voices and styles
Development of graphical and video content pieces
Strong understanding of SEO theory
Social media and email marketing experience to meet business objectives
Hands-on execution in core aspects of SEO, including on-site optimization and off-site outreach
Performance analysis via website analytics and SEO tools (e.g. SEMRush, Moz, ahrefs, etc.)
Additionally, you have the following:
Experience in house or at an agency
Keyword research and selection
Competitive analysis
A Bachelor’s degree in a marketing related field or equivalent work experience
Outstanding computer skills
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong organization skills
These additional skills and experience are a plus:
Fluency in one or more foreign languages
Past responsibility for driving leads into a marketing funnel and nurturing them

About Gartner Digital Markets:
Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology decisions and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three leading brandsCapterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

Job Brief:
We're looking for an SEO Associate to join our GetApp team. We're seeking candidates with a passion for digital marketing and the skills to drive business growth for our portfolio of websites. The ideal candidate has a passion for SEO, keyword research, content optimization, data and keeping up with the latest algorithm updates. You must be excited to find creative solutions to interesting SEO challenges, and have the ability to produce deliverables and hit key milestones.

What You Will do:
Collaborate and communicate. You'll work with teammates and stakeholders on projects that produce positive SEO outcomes.
Work in spreadsheets. We measure and track everything, so we need someone who doesn't mind living and breathing in data.
Research. You'll work closely with our editorial team to create content that ranks for important industry keywords.
Site Optimization. You'll become an expert of on-page, off-page SEO concepts, and be expected to analyze data to figure out new ways to further optimize our websites.
Track and Measure Impact. You'll have the chance to conduct tests, monitor site performance, and report on key performance metrics.
What You Will Need:
Team First attitude. You're ready to roll up your sleeves to help the team hit ambitious organic traffic and revenue goals.
True Grit. You're not afraid of a challenge, and you persevere despite obstacles.
Time management skills, efficiency, attention to detail and excellent follow through.
Excellent oral and written communication skills (experience with email outreach campaigns and promotion are a plus).
1-2 years experience with digital marketing projects/campaigns.
Can multi-task. You can juggle a lot at once and never get stressed out when multiple projects are on your plate. Cool and collected is your middle name.
Proactive. In order to succeed, you'll need to be the type of person who identifies potential issues before they ever arise, not someone who only takes action when there is a problem.
What We Offer:
Limitless growth and learning opportunities.
A collaborative and positive culture Your team will be as smart and driven as you.
Outstanding compensation Plus competitive benefits and generous time off.
A chance to make an impact Your work will contribute directly to our strategy.

As the SEO Strategist, you will be a member of our Growth team. You will work closely with our Content, Product, Engineering, Design, and Digital Marketing teams to execute SEO strategies that measurably grow monthly acquisition. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced, self-starter to make a significant impact across multiple companies.

Responsibilities
Leverage your analytical skills to uncover actionable insights for growing monthly traffic
Develop and champion strategies to measurably improve monthly rankings, traffic, and conversions.
Champion the prioritization and resourcing of your strategies in the face of competing agendas and priorities.
Manage and coordinate the execution of your strategies via internal teams, external agencies as well as through your individual contributions and seeing them through to completion.
Dive into issues and incidents as they occur, perform ad hoc analyses as needed, and/or help escalate them to drive to resolution
Be on top of the latest trends such as HTTPS, AMP, Mobile First, Rank Brain etc.
Regularly Monitor and report on SEO KPI's such as rankings, traffic, and Google Webmaster Tools reports
Provide research and optimization consulting for other departments, stakeholders, and initiatives
Monitor and manage the overall SEO health of all portfolio companies including: indexation errors, crawling issues, internal linking, redirects, server response codes, sitemap issues, domain warnings, and more.
Proactively analyze and review site content, test modifications and scale optimizations across the domain.
Compile research, articulate POVs for senior stakeholders, and lead trainings for important colleagues in other departments possessing direct or indirect impacts on SEO
And more!
BS degree in business, quantitative field, marketing, journalism or related discipline
5 to 7 years of digital marketing experience with an emphasis on organic search engine optimization in a B2C environment
Excellent communication, collaboration, planning and execution skills
Very strong interpersonal skills with a proven track record of working collaboratively across teams, departments, and functions
Strong analytical and presentation skills including high level Excel, PowerPoint and MS Word skills
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience working within various CMS platforms

DESIRED SEO EXPERIENCE
Single Page App (SPA) SEO Familiar with the SEO challenges of an SPA environment including render budgets, rendering best practices, troubleshooting common JS issues and more.
Domain Migrations & Mergers Having successfully migrated and redirected entire domains while preserving or improving SEO performance is strongly desired.
Content Marketing Programs Develop and manage a content program that uses new and refreshed content to improve traffic, rankings, leads and conversions. Owning the topic identification, competitor analysis, keyword research, collaborating with content creators and tracking the results.
Working closely with UI/UX and Product Teams Work closely with teams responsible for the continuous optimization of product experiences across our portfolio to ensure SEO improvements are integrated at each step. This can include optimal nav structures for efficient crawling and targeting of link equity, page templates that load quickly, content that aligns with user intent, and more.
Proactive SEO - Listening for and mitigating potential SEO issues before they arise. This could include: making sure changes to the affiliate program don't incur a paid linking penalty, CRO testing is implemented in such a way as to avoid cloaking, product updates don't create duplicate content, and more.
Advanced Technical SEO Skills such as markup, JSON-LD, canonicals, Javascript, server vs. client side rendering, single page apps, PWAs, AMP, etc.
BONUS FEATURES
Previous Agency or enterprise level client side digital marketing experience (i.e. 10,000+ URLs)
Familiarity with and experience working in an agile product and development process
Experience writing for an audience or blogging
Social media experience (either organic or paid)
Previous experience working for a subscription-based, digital publishing or new media service

Are you a data-driven project manager who has the skills and experience to drive the continuous improvement of SEO strategies and tactics?

Are you the one who holds others accountable to the highest standard of SEO best practices because of your intimate understanding of them?

Do you have the skills and experience to see the big picture of multiple high-impact SEO projects, while being always ready to dive into the weeds to adjust the critical path for success?

Are you exceptional at using data and logic to defend recommendations to internal and external stakeholders, and are you always seeking to learn from each experience?

Do you want to join an award-winning and passionate SEO team that leverages proprietary artificial intelligence and machine-learning tools to drive traffic, engagement, and ultimately value to our clients?

If the answer is yes, then Arteric might be the perfect place to come and spend a couple of years. In this role, you will leverage our custom-built tools in addition to the industry's leading enterprise SEO tools, like Conductor, DeepCrawl, and Adobe Analytics.

You will learn to master these tools through regular training sessions while executing on the strategies informed by our data science practice.

Finally, we will send you to SEO conferences such as SMX East to further refine your skills.


About You
You have an extraordinary capacity to learn, adapt, and organize a complex multi-project team
You have led teams of multiple digital producers, software developers, or SEO specialists
You can execute against formal processes, and you want to learn from the smartest/best SEO people in the world
You can articulate the process and rationale for a content audit, a technical SEO audit, SERP analysis, and keyword research
You have the capacity and motivation to implement best practices, while at the same time innovating beyond them
You are not too proud to get your hands dirty by doing data collection, execution, etc.
You have confidently presented in front of the room to clients in a polished manner
You have a very strong understanding of Google Analytics, Search Console, Google Trends, and Excel
You are accountable for measurable and quantifiable results
You are obsessed with the details
You are insatiably curious about how search engines work and why different sites rank
As an SEO Project Manager, You Will
Coordinate and manage up to 30 concurrent SEO engagements supported by multiple SEO managers, analysts, and writers in collaboration with brand teams and other agencies
Serve as the primary point of contact for SEO tasks, receive and distribute tasks to the SEO team, and own all necessary follow-up
Run weekly SEO status meetings to advance projects with internal and external teams
Own the day-to-day operations to ensure that projects remain on track and within budget
Relay clear and specific expectations, timelines, priorities, challenges, and new developments in detail to key team members/parties
Coordinate internal reviews and implementation-related quality assurance efforts
Come from a place of perpetual learning, always seeking to improve and optimize processes, develop new ones, and participate in the overall growth of the department and agency
Work with JIRA, Smartsheet, or other project-management tools
Communicate issues, bug reports, and change orders to leadership
Document lessons learned, update best practices, and share this information with internal teams
Create and deliver customer-facing presentations of findings and recommendations
Contribute to content audits, technical SEO audits, SERP analysis, and keyword research
Requirements
Hands-on SEO experience for a large portfolio of brands
Hands-on multi-year SEO experience in pharmaceutical or biotechnology marketing
Agency experience in managing digital marketing and web development/design projects
SEO and PM work experience in healthcare/pharmaceutical experience required
Understanding of digital marketing and web development best practices
Regular use of and high degree of knowledge about SEO tools such as SEMrush, Moz, Raven Tools, Authority Labs, Google Lighthouse, Conductor, MarketMuse, and Screaming Frog (experience with other tools not listed here will be considered)
Strong understanding of Google Analytics, Search Console, Google Trends, and Excel
Exquisite communication skills
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Detail orientation
What's In It For You


If you've made it to this point in reading this post, then you are probably already thinking, this is all great, but what's in it for me?

At Arteric, you will work side-by-side with our incredibly seasoned and talented developers to identify new and unique ways to apply data science and machine learning to SEO challenges. For example, we have used AI technology to build proprietary tools to help inform our SEO work. One tool uses machine learning and natural language processing to identify signals hidden in hundreds of thousands of user interactions. Another tool analyzes competitors' content vs our client's website to assess relative power and authority across topics.

With those same teams, you will work to identify best practices for technical SEO that can be standardized into Arteric's technology-development process. This will allow you to expand your SEO skills with advanced analytics techniques in a one-of-a-kind way.


About Us


At Arteric, our mission is to explore the boundaries of the possible and create life-changing experiences through feature-rich, defect-free deliverables that work everywhere and every time. We do this every day by connecting patients, caregivers, and healthcare providers to the information patients need to live longer, healthier lives.

The hallmark of our work is superior execution and the relentless pursuit of quality. In 2018, Arteric was named to MM&M's Agency to Watch list. In 2019, MM&M included Arteric in their Agency 100, a list of the top 100 healthcare marketing agencies in the US. Earlier this year, Gartner described Arteric as an agency that is creating value with AI and machine learning. This was in recognition of the thought leadership on SEO and AI that the firm has demonstrated with speaking engagements at 20+ digital marketing conferences over the past two years. Additionally, in 2018 Arteric won 15 design/UX Awards and powered through the year with 40% growth, a trend that continues in 2019.

We do all of this without office politics and BS. We take pride in having a culture that is friendly and supportive. We know that together we can and do find the answers that we need for creating value and growth for our customersbecause together, we are the experts in digital marketing.

This is an onsite position at Arteric's office in Summit, NJ.

Arteric is an Equal Opportunity Employer in compliance with the laws prohibiting discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company's portfolio includes many of the world's most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others. Condé Nast Entertainment was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming.

Job Description

Our SEO team works closely with our editorial, audience development, and analytics groups to figure out ways to acquire new users from search and to ensure the highest level of discoverability for content across digital platforms. In this role, your work will make a huge impact on many Condé Nast's sites throughout the company.

We are looking for a data-driven highly organized individual with a search engine optimization background, specifically with in-house or agency experience with content SEO research & analytics in the digital content industry. This role will focus on SEO reporting and analytics using Google Search Console, Google Analytics, SEMrush and many other SEO tools. The Senior SEO Analyst will be responsible for identifying and sharing traffic, ranking, keyword, and KPI insights to drive content SEO decisions, while serving as an analytic subject matter expert to the SEO team and editorial and business stakeholders. Expertise with traffic analytics tools is a must but we are also looking for people with a proven track record with SEO, content insights experience, and who have used data to feed into content planning in previous positions. This is a full time position based in New York.

Primary Responsibilities:
Work closely with SEO Team and Audience Development Teams to define and meet growth KPIs
Analyze, identify & manage SEO initiatives and opportunities
Dedicated to supporting the SEO team for all data & traffic requests for 14+ brands at Condé Nast
Build and maintain weekly, monthly & quarterly SEO reports tracking content performance, traffic analytics and search trends
Provide insight that will grow search traffic to the websites and identify and reverse search traffic drops
Apply data mining and information gathering techniques to identify and interpret patterns and trends in search
Track keyword phrases & pages across multiple websites
Stay up-to-date on latest algorithm updates, new tools, industry trends & news
Implement enterprise keyword research at scale & content gap analyses across Conde Nast Brands
Technical audits & monitoring websites to ensure all sites are following SEO best practices
Proactively communicate traffic insights to SEO team
In conjunction with SEO team, develop case studies to help SEO team define best practices for SEO & Publishing Industry
Develop and maintain robust search traffic forecasts to support the SEO team and various brands in the organization
Desired Skills & Qualifications:
Committed to presenting a compelling story & actionable insights with data
Passion for problem-solving & curiosity-driven approach to research
Experience with working in content management systems (CMS)
A collaborative & proactive team player
Be able to weave information together from a variety of sources to form actionable insights
Ability to prioritize & balance projects and adhere to timelines
Ability to clearly articulate and present initiatives to creative and SEO teams alike
Requirements:
Minimum of 3 years in data analysis, digital marketing, and/or search engine marketing
2+ years SEO experience
Familiarity with SQL is a must
Must be fluent in Excel / Google Sheets
Expert user with Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Data Studio
Expert user SEO tools: SEMrush or Searchmetrics
Expert user with crawling tools: Botify, Screaming Frog SEO Spider.

Nebo is a creative digital agency committed to doing great work and never settling for "good enough." The culture is friendly, and the work is challenging, because that's the way we like it. Located in midtown Atlanta, we're at the heart of the Southeast's digital and marketing scenes, and we're also conveniently located behind the best coffee in town.

We're looking for someone who can serve as the technically-minded anchor of our Search Engine Optimization team. The right candidate has a holistic understanding of what makes a successful SEO campaign, but enjoys the technical aspects of SEO the most: a deep knowledge of search engine algorithms, experience putting together detailed site audits, and the ability to make a wide variety of on-site implementations using HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP and/or other programming languages.

We don't care about how many years of experience you have, just what you've done and what you're capable of doing. We also appreciate a good sense of humor.

Managing execution of SEO strategies, including keyword strategy implementation, technical recommendation implementation and executing tactical strategies based on competitive analysis
Staying up to date on current industry practices, news and algorithm updates
Training other employees about on-page SEO

The ability to write coherent, compelling copy that is not only keyword-rich, but also user-friendly
An understanding of social media and its role in SEO
Experience with Google Analytics, a variety of content management systems, and industry specific tools
Excellent interpersonal skills as this is a client facing role

Greenlane is looking for a passionate Account Manager (SEO)to join our team in Audubon, PA. In this role, you’ll create real value for our clients and support your fellow team members.

Our SEO channel helps clients, both large and small brands, make better decisions for their organic search visibility. If you’re an experienced SEO, love the challenges it brings, and enjoy building partnerships with clients, this could be a great opportunity for you.

The ideal candidate would be:
A committed and reliable Account Manager for our clients
Proactive, strategic, creative and willing to test new ideas
Experienced in all parts of SEO, from technical to on-page to link building

3+ years

About the role

As an SEO Account Manager, you’ll have a few clients who depend on you for flawless consulting. At Greenlane we practice an agile framework. This means each month’s focus could pivot depending on what you and the client determine is prioritized. You’ll be focused on tracking, sharing data and results. This isn’t a position where you throw the same items over the fence. Instead, you will become an integral part of your clients’ team.

All positions at Greenlane require a team-oriented person who is not afraid to challenge clients who are making missteps towards their digital marketing goals. We hire self-starters who show that they’re curious, passionate, and responsible.

Greenlane provides an intentional environment for efficient and happy team members. We work together 3 days a week in our Audubon office, and work from home on Thursdays and Fridays. Plus we hold monthly All Hands Days and offer internal training to help make you the best marketer you can be.

About you

We think that makes us pretty special. So, what makes you special? In addition to your resume, we’d like you to give us more detail about you. Let us know why you’re the team member we’re missing.

Job Description

Employ search marketing tactics to increase visibility and engagement with content, products, or services in Internet-enabled devices or interfaces. Examine search query behaviors on general or specialty search engines or other Internet-based content. Analyze research, data, or technology to understand user intent and measure outcomes for ongoing optimization.

Roles & Responsibilities
Collect and analyze Web metrics, such as visits, time on site, page views per visit, transaction volume and revenue, traffic mix, click-through rates, conversion rates, cost per acquisition, or cost per click.
Coordinate with developers to optimize Web site architecture, server configuration, or page construction for search engine consumption and optimal visibility.
Assist in setting up or optimizing analytics tools for tracking visitors' behaviors.
Conduct online marketing initiatives, such as paid ad placement, affiliate programs, sponsorship programs, email promotions, or viral marketing campaigns on social media Web sites.
Participate in the development or implementation of online marketing strategy.
Improve search-related activities through ongoing analysis, experimentation, or optimization tests, using A/B or multivariate methods.
Optimize digital assets, such as text, graphics, or multimedia assets, for search engine optimization (SEO) or for display and usability on internet-connected devices.
Prepare illustrations or rough sketches of material, discussing them with clients or supervisors and making necessary changes.
Manage tracking and reporting of search-related activities and provide analyses to marketing executives.
Optimize Web site exposure by analyzing search engine patterns to direct online placement of keywords or other content.
Evaluate new emerging media or technologies and make recommendations for their application within Internet marketing or search marketing campaigns.
Conduct market research analysis to identify search query trends, real-time search and news media activity, popular social media topics, electronic commerce trends, market opportunities, or competitor performance.
Collaborate with other EGC staff to integrate and complement marketing strategies across multiple sales channels.

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field.
Minimum 1 year in SEO role.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite; Google Analytics, AdWords, HubSpot, Moz, WebCEO, and Tag Manager.

SEO Manager

Job Description

SEO Manager

Job Description

Drive organic growth through best-in-class SEO strategy and execution

As
SEO Manager
on our SEO (search engine optimization) team, you will leverage your deep experience in search engine optimization strategy and technical execution to drive significant organic search traffic and user engagement growth for the Network of rental brands including , , , and .

You will be joining a best-in-class team that has relentlessly high standards, is never satisfied with the status quo, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Our industry-leading SEO team is the driving force for our business and has exceeded our performance goals each year.

Our success is dependent on our ability optimize our Network sites to beat the competition and earn the most qualified traffic from search engines like Google and Bing. Google is taking an AI-first approach (artificial intelligence) company-wide, including their search algorithms, and we need to raise our bar to continue our levels of unprecedented growth and exceed our future SEO goals.

We are counting on you to bring a genuine curiosity about how consumers search for information, and pair that with a strong technical aptitude and ability to analyse large datasets, uncover trends and insights, then turn those findings into actionable recommendations.

Make a significant impact in the first 90 days

Create a comprehensive SEO strategy for each of our Network sites and prioritize a roadmap of the top 10+ projects to implement for each rental brand. This will begin with an in-depth technical SEO audit, detailed log file analysis, and a robust competitive assessment to benchmark our performance and identify meaningful areas of opportunity to propel significant growth.

Design and develop dashboards and/or visualizations with our team of data analysts to track the organic search performance for our network of sites, and setup alerts and notification to monitor key metrics, spot issues, and uncover compelling insights based on KPIs, goals and objectives (ex. using data from Google Analytics, plus other internal and external tools).

Spearhead two to three key SEO projects from concept to completion. Start by identifying the project via research and analysis, working with our data analysts to quantify the impact, make an informed recommendation of how to execute this project, and work with our product and development teams to implement the project, see it through to perfect execution and finally track performance to show the value and benefit to the organization.

Build our organizations SEO capabilities

You will collaborate cross-functionally across internal teams (marketing, product, technology, analytics, research, etc.) to evaluate SEO opportunities that deliver business goals. Company Description

Afin Technologies is looking for a smart, team-oriented individual with a passion for getting things done. We believe that if we hire great people…we will attract more great people. Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do!

We are a digital-first company specializing in the distribution and marketing of discount offers and promotions throughout North America using our patented Midlay® technology. Our mobile applications for consumers include Buxbo, Entertainment®, Dining Advantage or SurveyMe.

Job Description

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING MOST OF THE TIME:

We are seeking a passionate SEO (Search Engine Optimization) Specialist who will formulate Afin Technologies’ SEO strategy and be accountable for developing, coordinating, and executing the SEO and SEM strategy for all Afin-owned domains. This role reports to the Associate Director of Marketing and will be located in Troy, Michigan. At Afin Technologies, we use email campaigns to do everything from selling products and services to helping with customer service and sending out subscriber information – and so much more.

We are seeking to hire an SEO Specialist that will perform search engine optimization. In this role, the SEO Specialist will be passionate about both front-end and back-end SEO and will demonstrate a track record of achieving business goals and relevant KPI’s through SEO. This individual should be able to make decisions that reflect a solid understanding of current SEO strategies, search engine algorithm changes, and will work cross-functionally with the marketing, product, and technology teams at Afin to implement a class-leading SEO strategy.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING SOME OF THE TIME
Own responsibility for the strategy and execution of large-scale organic search projects for a world-class brand
Dive into SEO-relevant data to transform data sets into actionable insights and develop tactical next steps to drive organic traffic
Provide strategic guidance and critical thinking for organic initiatives, serving as a key consultant for multiple products, domains or business units
Work closely and partner with internal and external teams, including product, brand marketing, project management and others
Proactively investigate potential opportunities for better visitor experiences on site
Develop strategies with the team to increase the deliverability success of campaigns.
Analyze and report on SEO channel performance to inform SEO KPI's
Recommend and prioritize fixes for technical issues that could impact SEO performance
Perform all other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

WHAT YOU NEED FOR THIS POSITION
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, advertising or related field.
Minimum 5 years of digital marketing with a focus in organic search optimization projects.
Strong knowledge of all elements of SEO: on-page, off-site, and technical
Familiarity with SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Moz, SEMrush, and Google Search Console
Understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Proficiency in HTML markup and Schema
Ability to analyze, synthesize, and communicate critical data and adjust strategies as needed.
Experience with Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, and other analytics platforms.
Strong initiative, ability to work independently, self-motivated and deadline-driven.
Enjoy finding creative solutions and thinking outside the box

About UniversalGiving

UniversalGiving’s Mission: To connect people to quality giving and volunteer opportunities worldwide.

UniversalGiving’s Vision: “To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life”®

UniversalGiving® is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model™ to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.

UniversalGiving Corporate consults with Fortune 500 companies on the Strategy, Operations and NGO Vetting for their international giving and volunteering programs all over the world. Some clients include Cisco, Symantec, Fluor, Sabre, Gap, BHP Billiton, RSF Social Finance, and inovia.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network, and has also been featured in BusinessWeek, Fast Company, CSRWire, WomenEntrepreneur, Oprah.com, NBC News, The Christian Science Monitor, The New York Times, The Financial Times, MarketWatch, CNNMoney.com, Change.org and See Change Magazine. UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.

To Apply:

Email your resume, cover letter, two writing samples (two pages max), and three professional references with contact information (phone and email) to volunteers@universalgiving.org with "SEO Return" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.

UniversalGiving® is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.

At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. Collaborate with social, audience development, and marketing teams on distribution strategies and opportunities for created content.

Course Hero is scaling! Help us build a world where every student graduates, confident and prepared, through innovative applications of data science and analytics.

Are you our dynamic Senior SEO Analyst? You will help drive one of our biggest channels for website traffic and revenue as we are tackling SEO at scale: 100M+ indexed pages, 1B+ pageviews/year, 100M+ users/year, and we're an Alexa top ~200 US site. You will analyze and derive insights from millions of data points from various SEO tools to inform critical SEO strategies—improving our site structure, ranking, and crawlabilty to drive growth for the business.

Here are some ways you'll make an impact!
Work with SEO Strategists and Data Scientists to understand SEO best practices and propose strategic ideas and turn them into validated product initiatives for driving growth.
Define and regularly monitor KPIs, success metrics, and other analytics to gauge SEO health and understand organic search performance.
Set up and evaluate SEO A/B tests results and push forward next steps at a rigorous pace.
Deliver reports and strategic insights through analysis and manual data extractions from various SEO tools and internal tracking to drive a significant change SEO strategy
Estimate the value of different SEO improvement strategies – from changes to the site structure, internal linking, indexation, and crawlability.
Effectively communicate findings to internal and external team members.
Manage research, development, and delivery of analytical models to be used for strategizing, testing, and implementing SEO optimizations.
Are you our next Senior SEO Data Analyst?
5+ years of total analytics experience with at least 2+ years in SEO Analytics
You are highly proficient with SQL and at least one scripting/statistical language (R, Python preferred)
You have hands-on experience with experimentation, including design, implementation, and methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing and regression analysis) for analyzing and interpreting results to stakeholders
You have experience using industry-standard database and analytics tools
You have proven success in utilizing analytics to provide strategic recommendations and drive concrete action.
You have excellent communication skills, both written and oral. You are able to clearly articulate SEO ideas, strategies, and tactics to audiences with varying knowledge of SEO (novices to technical experts).
You are comfortable functioning in spaces with high ambiguity and adapt easily to changing environments.
Bonus Points:
Knowledge of Google Analytics or Tableau
Worked in education or e-commerce domain
Experience with big data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, and Pig
BA/BS degree in a quantitative field, eg. Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline.

Job Summary:
Disney Streaming Services is seeking an SEO Manager for its Disney+ and ESPN+ services. The ideal candidate will have a track record of developing successful digital marketing strategies, launching and optimizing marketing programs, managing multiple large projects, partnering with marketing and cross-functional teams in a large, global organization, presenting to stakeholders and executives, and establishing and measuring against KPIs.

As SEO Manager you will lead the strategy and execution of organic traffic growth to Marketing Landing Pages and be a lead contributor to DSS and DCTI’s broader SEO efforts. The principal focus of this role will be to capture demand in the organic search channel for Disney+, ESPN+ and the Disney Bundle by analyzing prospect and subscriber behavior, creating and optimizing content, and running experiments to maximize conversion of organic traffic. You will collaborate closely with the Disney+ and ESPN+ Paid Media, Product Marketing, and Product teams; (Direct-to-Consumer & International) DCTI Brand and Digital Marketing teams; and Hulu Marketing team to expand reach and improve efficiency of paid and organic marketing programs. You will also bring and maintain an expert level understanding of the latest industry trends, guidelines, and algorithm changes.


Responsibilities:
Develop strategies for growing organic traffic to increase signups to Disney+, ESPN+ and the Disney Bundle
Define KPIs and clear, measurable, and actionable goals for the Disney+ and ESPN+ SEO programs
Execute on the SEO strategy for Disney+, ESPN+ and Disney Bundle in close coordination with the Disney+ and ESPN+ Paid Media, Product Marketing, and Product teams; DCTI Brand and Digital Marketing teams; and Hulu Marketing team
Coordinate with Marketing Landing Page production leads to create and optimize pages for SEO campaigns
Manage and measure success of Disney+, ESPN+, and Disney Bundle SEO campaigns
Partner with the DTCI Digital Marketing and DSS Product teams to document and execute on on-site optimizations
Develop and execute link building strategies for landing pages with Disney owned and operated properties and external partners, media and influencers.
Work with regional and local marketing teams to grow organic traffic in markets outside the U.S.
Work with Marketing Analytics to develop and enhance dashboards and reporting for organic traffic
Work with the DSS Marketing Experimentation team to identify, prioritize, execute and report on testing opportunities
Deliver regular reports on SEO performance to stakeholders and executives
Track changes to search engine algorithms and communicate as needed to internal teams
Basic Qualifications:


5+ years in an SEO marketing role
Demonstrated track record of growing organic traffic in a large global organization
Extensive experience with keyword research, information architecture, search engine algorithms, and ranking factors
Knowledge of structured data schemas, rich snippets, internal linking strategies, keyword usage, and semantic analysis.
Experience with CMS platforms for landing page management
Proficient in agile methodologies and working knowledge of Jira/Confluence
Attention to detail, with an ability to identify issues and quickly implement solutions
Passion for velocity, enabling the team to scale through superior project management
Experience analyzing data, monitoring and continually improving campaigns, and ensuring campaign goals are being met
Superior communication, writing, and presentation skills
Experience supporting globally distributed stakeholders
Self-motivated, with a drive to exceed expectations

Experience with A/B testing for SEO
Experience with experimentation platforms, such as Optimizely
Experience with marketing SVOD services and content

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience

Job Title

SEO Strategist

Job Description

I. Job Summary | Major goals and objectives.
The SEO content Strategist combines technical SEO, Internet content strategy, and SEO analytics to provide tactical and strategic support to the content production, product design, and product development teams with the goal of expanding the brand’s presence in organic search. The ideal candidate has experience as a content optimization strategy champion, has worked with a wide range of user experiences and audience acquisition paths, is experienced with technical SEO reviews and audits, and is comfortable providing strategic recommendations based on deep dives into data.

II. Essential Job Functions
Weight % Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results
30% Perform keyword-focused research to understand content gaps and opportunities. Provide content production teams with weekly, monthly and ad hoc content optimization data and requests.
20% Provide ongoing support and training to editors to create SEO-focused production workflows.
20% Provide reports and analytics to support senior management in making strategic business decisions in areas affected by organic search.
20% Work with information architecture and metadata to support content optimization and user experience initiatives..
10% Develop insights and provide recommendations for product development and adherence to SEO best practice

100%

III. Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements | All must be met to be considered.

Education:
• BA/BS in Information Science or related field.
Experience:
• 3+ years of SEO experience
• Experience working on a complex network of sites
• Experience in working with onsite, technical, content, video and social media optimization.
Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Experience with web analytics tools (Google Webmaster Tools, Google Analytics, Hitwise, etc.
• Solid understanding of search engine ranking factors, algorithms and core SEO principals
• Strong written and oral communication skills with technical and business constituents
• Strong web analytics skills

Job Description

The SEO Manager is responsible for managing every aspect of David’s Bridals organic search and local search presence, including technical applications to site content development, analytics and insights, agency and local listings management. As the subject matter expert, the SEO Manager will partner with marketing and digital, merchandising and technical teams to build page authority, increase rankings/results, and drive revenue and appointments in a highly competitive SEO environment.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:

• Manage SEO agency and work closely with digital marketing team on bidding strategies to optimize ROAS and increase conversion
• Use analytics and SEO best practices to increase qualified traffic to site; work with digital content and web merchandising to ensure an optimal landing page experience and conversion
• Write Requirements/QA/Review all site releases to ensure no negative SEO impact on new site changes or updates
• Identify and communicate technical aspects of site that require enhancements for SEO and monitor changes (redirects, canonical tags, meta data, page speed, etc.)
• Research and understand market changes due to impact of mobile, consumer search habits, site authority, and algorithms on SEO
• Drive change to increase site authority, brand awareness, and competitive positioning within the bridal and social occasion markets
• Work closely with internal analytics to identify opportunities for customer acquisition, engagement, and conversion
• Through regular site audit, identify technical SEO issues, recommend and project-manage fixes with product management and IT teams; work closely with technical resources to ensure SEO project prioritization and completion
• Optimize content (copy, images, video) through keyword and landing page analysis, and use competitive research to help guide content marketing strategy
• In conjunction with SEO agency, build and manage guidelines for blog, website content, products, and landing page copy using analytics and keyword expertise
• Manage off-page optimization projects (e.g. link-building) and local listings to ensure accuracy in content and optimal customer experience
• In conjunction with SEO agency, provide weekly and adhoc reporting on traffic, rankings, indexed pages, crawl reports and other SEO aspects
• Keep abreast of SEO and integrated marketing trends, best practices and news, particularly changes to the engines that impact organic search results
• Collaborate with editorial team to create high-quality content around important, relevant terms. Work with PR and social media to leverage The Blog, Pinterest, influencers and UGC to build site traffic, appointments and revenue

Other Duties & Responsibilities:
• Monitor competitors and prepare analysis on a regularly scheduled cadence.
• Stay abreast of SEO best practices and industry insights; educate and socialize SEO value and best practice throughout the organization
• Partner with web merchandising team on hindsight analysis and presentations
• Work closely with vendors to maximize best-in-class SEO marketing solutions

Years of related experience: 5-7+

Required Qualifications:

• Experience with leading web analytics tools (e.g., Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google Search Console)
• Experience using SEM Rush, Conductor, and/or other SEO monitoring tools
• Proficiency in MS Office Suite, with advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint
• Demonstrated understanding of key interactive marketing principles
• Ability to create actionable results under tight deadlines
• Demonstrated experience in optimizing an eCommerce website to build organic traffic and drive revenue
• Experience and understanding of high level SEO concepts such as faceted navigation and how that impacts indexation
• Ability to gather and evaluate information; industry, competition, market, and historical
• Ability to identify and execute priorities with a sense of urgency (makes it happen)
• Commits to results and maintains focus, solving roadblocks and delivering results
• Ability to quickly sense and communicate the best plan of action to accomplish a goal
• Organizes and expresses ideas clearly, concisely and accurately, verbally and in writing
• Ability to adapt the content, tone, style, and form to the reader, the subject, and the purpose of the communication. Uses plain talk to explain complex or technical concepts

Position Description:

POSITION PURPOSE

As an SEO Search Analyst at The Home Depot, you will help provide reporting, insights and utilize technical skills (writing SQL/code, etc.) to enable HomeDepot.com teams to identify optimization opportunities and make data-driven decisions that drive traffic and conversion.

It is critical this position uses data to discover underperforming areas and identifies opportunities to improve overall program performance, for the areas you oversee. The role will work across multiple Marketing, Analytics, MarTech, Business Intelligence and IT teams, requiring critical planning, excellent organizational skills and swift execution in a fast-paced environment.

This individual should possess a good understanding of the marketing landscape for maximizing the organic discoverability within search engines such as Google, YouTube, Pinterest and other Earned Media.
This position may also contribute to management of billing, funding, and budgeting aspects of Earned Media in coordination with Sr. Data & Financial Analyst and Sr. Manager.

As a Data Analyst you will:
Analyze KPIs and automate reporting via Google BigQuery and Tableau
Monitor performance for SEO best practices in alignment with enterprise reporting principals and homedepot.com systems
Utilize and/or establish APIs to push and pull data from various third party sources
Research and develop strategies to capture meaningful data that are continuously enhanced
Own daily monitoring of assigned SEO performance, weekly/monthly roadmap and delivery of ad-hoc reporting
MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
35% - Researches and analyzes trends/performance data to identify opportunities for program improvements and enhancements. Manages reporting platform and performs regular and ad hoc data pulls as groundwork for analysis. Provides key insights on business performance.
25% - Monitors campaign performance and executes daily operations
20% - Manages technical projects via Excel
20% - Writes and edits on-page and off-page content in bulk
NATURE AND SCOPE
The position reports to a Search Account Manager
No direct responsibility for supervising others.

ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS

Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

Additional Environmental Job Requirements:

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be eighteen years of age or older.

SEO -SME

Job Type – Contract

Location – Cincinnati, OH

Requirements

· Minimum of 5+ years of relevant SEO experience required, SEO at large e-commerce organization or a well-known marketing agency a big plus.

· Very strong analytical ability, read SEO reports to get insights and find new opportunities.

· Familiarity with Major SEO tools (e.g. SEMRush, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Deepcrawl, Moz, Ahrefs, BrightEdge, STAT, ScreamingFrog, Searchmetrics).

· Functional knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

· Experience designing SEO performance reports.

· Experience working with SEO web developers.

· Experience working with UX designers, a plus.

· Experience with creation and/or execution of SEO strategies.

· Define requirements, tasks, and resources associated to SEO strategy

· Manage and execute implementation of SEO strategy

· Communication to clients, team, and management on strategy/project development, timelines, and results

· Collaborate on client strategy and goal definition for success

· Keep pace with SEO, search engine, social media and internet marketing industry trends and development

· Strong understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) life cycle - On Page Basics like Meta Tags, Website Interlinking, Breadcrumbs, URL Optimization, Image Optimization, Off Page - Links from High Domain authority websites, Guest Blogging, Image Sharing, Link Analysis to track spamming, Keyword Research & Tracking to find new scopes

· Provide competitor backlink analysis and suggest recommendations for internal and external linking along with ensuring outreach execution.

Operational

1. Technical Analysis: Conduct comprehensive technical site audits on desktop as well as mobile to identify gaps like page indexing, text to HTML ratio, broken links, etc. and suggest recommendations. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.

2. On Page Optimization: Conduct detailed analysis of all on-page attributes like H1 tags, meta-tags, title tags, etc. and provide recommendations based on SEO best practices for optimization. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.

3. Content Strategy: With keyword research as the fundamental input conduct a deep dive on site content to contribute to a content strategy. The strategy needs to provide keyword to page mapping, identify content gaps and suggestions in the form of content calendars for both on and off the site. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.

4. Off page: Conduct in-depth link analysis by evaluating multiple link data points and properties. Categorize the links as positive or negative impact links and create action plans around link building or removal. Also enable the execution of optimization plans with the team leader and project managers.
SEO Analytics: Conduct data analysis on SEO and derive actionable insights to enable continuous optimization. Be analytical and creative in representing SEO data in different reports and dashboards. Provide SEO insights on the client deliverables
