Job Description:

What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you'll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We're the world's leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can't find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development - as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

About Gartner Digital Markets:

Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology decisions and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three leading brands-Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

Job Brief:

We're looking for an SEO Associate to join our GetApp team. We're seeking candidates with a passion for digital marketing and the skills to drive business growth for our portfolio of websites. The ideal candidate has a passion for SEO, keyword research, content optimization, data and keeping up with the latest algorithm updates. You must be excited to find creative solutions to interesting SEO challenges, and have the ability to produce deliverables and hit key milestones.

What You Will do:
Collaborate and communicate. You'll work with teammates and stakeholders on projects that produce positive SEO outcomes.
Work in spreadsheets. We measure and track everything, so we need someone who doesn't mind living and breathing in data.
Research. You'll work closely with our editorial team to create content that ranks for important industry keywords.
Site Optimization. You'll become an expert of on-page, off-page SEO concepts, and be expected to analyze data to figure out new ways to further optimize our websites.
Track and Measure Impact. You'll have the chance to conduct tests, monitor site performance, and report on key performance metrics.
What You Will Need:
"Team First" attitude. You're ready to roll up your sleeves to help the team hit ambitious organic traffic and revenue goals.
True Grit. You're not afraid of a challenge, and you persevere despite obstacles.
Time management skills, efficiency, attention to detail and excellent follow through.
Excellent oral and written communication skills (experience with email outreach campaigns and promotion are a plus).
1-2 years experience with digital marketing projects/campaigns.
Can multi-task. You can juggle a lot at once and never get stressed out when multiple projects are on your plate. Cool and collected is your middle name.
Proactive. In order to succeed, you'll need to be the type of person who identifies potential issues before they ever arise, not someone who only takes action when there is a problem.
What We Offer:
Limitless growth and learning opportunities.
A collaborative and positive culture - Your team will be as smart and driven as you.
Outstanding compensation - Plus competitive benefits and generous time off.
A chance to make an impact - Your work will contribute directly to our strategy.

Job Description

The Digital Engagement team at Terminix is looking for a Manager of SEO who will be leading the growth and the maximization of the revenue generated by online sales of Terminix products and services through our organic search channel for Terminix.com.

Job Responsibilities
Meet or exceed growth targets for the organic search channel. Drive increased impressions, clicks and conversions from organic search. Drive double-digit growth in revenue.
Develop and implement organic search optimization initiatives to attract new and incremental revenue.
Understand, implement, and evangelize SEO best practices. Stay up-to-date on the ever-changing landscape of organic search. Keep our site(s) continuously improving by managing on-page and off-page factors.
Manage risk by clearly understanding the difference between "white hat" (search engine policy-compliant) and "black hat" (search engine policy non-compliant) strategies and tactics. Employ white hat tactics to drive growth without incurring undue risk.
Closely and continuously monitor direct and indirect communications from and about key search engine partners, including Google, Bing, and others.
Work with our team to enhance our site & platform as needed to dominate organic search, representing our team when it comes to planning, developing, testing, and rolling out related fixes and enhancements.
Create or partner with content writers to develop keyword-rich content and improve the topical relevance of category, product and landing pages across the site.
Review the performance of campaigns using internal and external reporting and analytics tools. Distill data into actionable insights against which you can execute.
Deliver concise and literate reporting to key stakeholders, including performance, placement/partnership flight calendars, opportunity evaluations, and more. In addition to your channel-specific reporting, deliver integrated reporting with other channel managers.
Partner with internal teams to integrate executions into holistic marketing campaigns supporting our seasonal and promotional events.
Work with our Security, Privacy, and Legal teams to ensure our implementations comply with Company policies and state regulations.
Consistently innovate, explore, learn, test, execute and iterate. Develop and maintain a culture and discipline of testing, research, competitive analysis and data-driven decisions to optimize future plans.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in the industry. Closely monitor the competitive landscape. Evaluate new technologies, strategies, and tactics, bringing recommendations back to the team to ensure our continued evolution and growth.
Demonstrates the ability to develop team members.
Investigates and proposes unique competitive marketing strategies to support traffic growth.
Basic Qualifications
Minimum of 5 years of successful experience growing business from organic search channels for large scale business.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
History of continually making significant contributions to SEO team vision & strategy.
Deep hands-on experience with multiple industry-leading SEO research and crawling/auditing tools.
Skilled at getting buy-in from stakeholders - backing up suggestions/changes with solid data and compelling SEO reasoning.
Full-spectrum on-page SEO expertise.
Communicates effectively to all levels of internal audiences; drives communication cross-functionally.
Knowledge of HTML markup, JavaScript, and web development.
Knowledge of server technologies (caching, environments, logging).
Demonstrated passion and experience in data-driven and consumer-centric marketing.
Strategic thinker and fast learner.
Excellent partnership and collaboration skills.
Strong project management and organization skills.
Good understanding of digital marketing.
Strong communication and presentation skills with an ability to frame up succinct recommendations for leadership.
Strong knowledge of analytics, reporting, and data management tools.
Preferred Qualifications
Retail / e-Commerce experience
Expert-level knowledge, experience and skills using a variety of SEO tools. History of using and integrating results/output from these tools, applying them to websites and driving positive results.
Experience with CJ Affiliate and/or other affiliate aggregation networks
Experience with Google Analytics.
Experience with Tealium.
Experience with Salesforce Cloud and Marketing Cloud.
Experience with Microsoft Power BI and Tableau.
Strong personal network within the SEO community.
Ability to balance creativity and innovation with being analytical and financially driven
Ability to turn complex data and insights into easily understood data stories
Ability to understand and work with HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and XML.

Company Overview:

Founded in 2011 by executives at Equinox, Blink Fitness is a premium quality, value-based fitness brand with more than 90 locations open or in development throughout New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and California. Blink puts Mood Above Muscle™, which celebrates the positive feeling you get from exercise, not just the physical benefits.

Blink is a wholly-owned subsidiary and is a sister brand to Equinox, Soul Cycle, Pure Yoga, Rumble Boxing, and Equinox Hotels. Blink is based in Manhattan.

Blink recently launched a franchising system to complement its fast growing company-owned business model and has secured franchise development agreements in Georgia, Illinois, Massachusetts, Michigan, Virginia and upstate NY. This includes an agreement with Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green, two-time NBA Champion, All Star, Olympic Gold Medalist and Defensive Player of the Year, who announced a franchise development deal to bring 20 gyms to his home state of Michigan and to Illinois.

Blink is an exciting and dynamic business that is still in the start-up mode. We are a passionate team with a great entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to roll up our sleeves to get the work done.

While Blink has grown rapidly and has already achieved significant profitability, the business is just getting warmed-up. Its leadership has a very lofty vision and expects explosive growth over the coming years. At a minimum, the business expects to have more than 300 locations over the next five years through a combination of corporate and franchise development.

For more information visit Blink’s consumer website -- blinkfitness.com– and its franchise website– blinkfranchising.com.

As the industry pioneer behind Content Performance Marketing, BrightEdge has thoroughly redefined the concept of search engine optimization (SEO) by developing an award-winning platform that precisely measures and optimizes marketing content across online channels. Our cloud-based platform is powered by big data analysis that allows our customers to plan, optimize, and measure campaigns based on real-time content performance. BrightEdge has emerged as the leading international provider of cloud-based SEO Enterprise solutions due to its dynamic and results oriented entrepreneurial culture.


Our Professional Service Analysts work directly with the some of the largest BrightEdge customers to execute digital marketing campaigns and to solve their SEO/web-related problems by utilizing the BrightEdge platform and analytical skills. Your job is a consulting role, serving as an extension of our client’s Digital Marketing department.

•Collect and organize search engine data from internal databases, and external data sources

Advanced BrightEdge technology delivers visibility, executable recommendations, competitive insights, and dynamic performance metrics. With the largest technology, sales, and customer success teams in our industry, we help customers innovate and execute to achieve superior marketing performance.

hear.com is the fastest-growing hearing care company globally. We are driven by our belief that every person should hear well to live well. SEO Writer
Job Description


Are you a writer who loves a challenging assignment? As a linguistic architect, would you enjoy constantly researching new products and industries, learning to match each client’s branded voice and speak convincingly to their customers? We have an immediate need for a SEO Writer interested in creating engaging and informative web content for our SEO clients.

This is the new age of content writing. Search engines are the easiest and most frequent way that consumers explore, assess, and make purchases online. Outside of paid placements, how does a business “show up” in the “organic” search results that are algorithmically determined? That’s where ROI Revolution’s Search Engine Optimization Team comes in – optimizing our clients’ sites for the best possible placement in organic search results pages.

In this role, the goal is to produce engaging and compelling digital copy for client websites, reflecting the client’s brand voice and strategic marketing objectives. Content production involves a lot of research of clients’ products, markets, and keyword usage in order to compose targeted content.

We are looking for a strong writer with an inquisitive nature who can find something intrinsically interesting with any assignment. This role requires someone who can be creative with content strategy, who is self-motivated, organized and possesses strong self-editing skills. Ability to effectively collaborate with internal teams and clients is crucial for success.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Conduct keyword research and develop a content strategy for targeting and ranking for high-volume keywords.
Analyze competitor content and discover gaps in clients’ content.
Prioritize content creation based on organic opportunity.
Create optimized copy for category and informational pages.
Build strong client relationships by creating and sending call agendas and call follow-ups, leading calls, organizing client visits, and providing proactive communication regarding account strategy.
Monitor organic performance through a variety of tools like Google Analytics and Google Search Console.
Create monthly SEO performance reports and communicate findings and strategies to clients.
Perform other duties as needed, which could include (but are not limited to) helped with linking building and content marketing efforts or ad-hoc analysis.
Work with sales team to deliver SEO presentations to prospective clients.
Collaborate with team members from other marketing channels to ensure cohesive strategy for shared clients.
Interface regularly (mostly, via phone/email) with clients.
Manage multiple projects and topics simultaneously, seamlessly moving from niche to niche as needed.
Essential Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university (Communications, English, Journalism, Business or related degree)
1-2 years of SEO experience preferred.
Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills.
Passion for SEO and a proactive attitude toward enhancing SEO knowledge and self-development.

SEO Supervisor
SEO Supervisor
Heat is a full-service creative agency that believes in the power of surprise to build brands, solve problems, and kindly take over the world. Headquartered in San Francisco and with offices in Seattle, Chicago and New York, Heat brings to life integrated content for a wide array of brands. We are an internationally recognized award-winning agency, garnering over 40 awards in 2016 and nine Cannes Lions to our credit. In 2016, Heat was named the Effie’s Most Effective Independent Agency in North America and is one of the only advertising agencies to be named “Best Places to Work” in San Francisco. We were recently acquired by Deloitte Digital and with our combined capabilities, can now offer a wider creative canvas for both talent and clients alike. We prioritize creative thinking and take pride in what we do. We’re growing our search practice and are seeking an SEO Strategist in our NY or SF office.


What you'll do
The SEO Supervisor will play a key role in helping us continue to deliver on great work for our existing clients as well as helping lead new business pitches for the practice. The SEO Supervisor will be responsible for developing great relationships with their clients and focus on mining for growth opportunities. They’ll lead the development of effective strategies for our clients, ensuring we’re delivering on client objectives and helping bolster brands’ digital presence. They’ll oversee a team of more junior to mid-level SEO strategists and ensure effective project delivery, including strategic development, execution and reporting. The SEO Supervisor will report into the SEO practice lead and should show composure under pressure, be solution-orientated, and be a collaborative partner to fellow Heaters and clients alike.


The SEO Supervisor should be able to compile and analyze search data and metrics, and present formal recommendations to leaders. They should be able to lead training sessions or instructive meetings with junior to C-suit level clients and colleagues, and should possess a deep understanding of SEO strategies and tools. This is a great opportunity for the SEO Supervisor to get in on the ground floor of our growing team and play a key role in helping shape our practice.
Qualifications


Required:
•3-5 years of full-time agency or consulting SEO experience required
•Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
•Powerpoint and/or MS Excel skills a must
•Strong project management and vendor/supplier/agency management skills
•Ability to triage and prioritize many competing needs, monitor and maintain momentum on a number of concurrent projects for numerous internal stakeholders
•Deep understanding of web analytics; ability to creative diagnostic or analytical reports along with KPI definition and tracking
•In depth experience with SEO tools like DeepCrawl, Screaming Frog, x Brightedge, Conductor, Search Consol, etc.
•Extensive knowledge and experience in technical and content-driven SEO
•Experience in enterprise sites and large client organizations
•Experience supporting site migrations and redesigns
•Comfortable interacting regularly with both technical subject matter experts as well as business owners of all organizational levels, presenting complex information in a way that is easy to understand, and tailoring it to different audiences
•Ability to offer and defend solutions to business problems based on experience and best practices
•Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship now, or at any time in the future.


Preferred:
• Bachelor Degree or Associates Degree preferred
• Excited to work in a dynamic, fast-paced agency culture, with the flexibility to change gears for different clients
•Experience with major platforms Salesforce, Hybris, AEM, ATG a plus
•Experience with web development a plus
•SEM experience a plus
•Forecasting and performance modeling experience a plus
•Experience with VoC and UX testing (e.g., A/B, Optimizely) a plus


•Other technological experience with web development a plus:
•HTML, CSS – especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM, aka “CQ” products), JavaScript, ojQuery, oAJAX
•Experience with Salesforce and Hybris sites a plus
•Experience optimizing for Baidu a plus
•Ability to travel up to 30%.


The team
At Heat, we develop traditional, digital and social content for a wide array of consumer and B2B brands at the leading edge of today’s client marketing challenges. You’ll work with kind, smart, hardworking people (if we do say so ourselves) who care about the work we create. Learn more about Heat.


How you’ll grow
At Heat, we focus on helping people at every level of their career identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level to senior leadership, we believe there’s always room to grow. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills, and work alongside industry-leading talent on a daily basis. Our Heaters have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.


About Heat’s relationship with Deloitte Digital
We’ve recently joined forces with Deloitte Digital to offer our award-winning creative services to allow brands to realize their ambitions at a larger scale.


Benefits
At Heat, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and our partnership with Deloitte offers employees a broad range of benefits. We’ll see you at the benefits meeting. Learn more about what working at Heat can mean for you.


Heat’s culture

Senior SEO Analyst


Come drive Organic Growth at one of the worlds largest retailers. The SEO team is responsible for all Organic Search traffic. We are building a world-class organic search practice, combining a mix of product excellence (to build features that engage organic visitors), technical marketing (to identify new user intents and opportunities), and content science (to create high quality content at scale). As a senior analyst youll lead the strategy, execution, and own results for a vertical (eg. Furniture), brand (eg. AllModern) or engineering team (eg. content science). This entails identifying new opportunities, monitoring performance, furthering our understanding of the levers of SEO, and driving the pipeline of features, tools and tests we launch every month. As part of the SEO team, youll collaborate with a dedicated team of content, product and engineering experts. You'll cover a broad scope. In a given quarter you might find yourself launching features that boost semantic richness, investigating Google algo changes, optimizing the creation of programmatic pages, or advising the organic growth strategy of a billion dollar business. In no time youll be driving millions of new organic visits, and have gained a uniquely valuable expertise.


What You'll Do
Identify new traffic opportunities and unmet user intents
Build a pipeline of new features improving organic landing experiences and rankings
Design test plans to further our understanding of the levers of SEO
Apply NLP and other advanced models to improve page quality and relevance
Lead the research and insight implementation from activities including: competitor analysis, site audits, opportunity analysis, content strategy, merchandise planograms, and more.
Own measurement and performance reporting for your respective brand/vertica/product area
Coach brands/verticals at Wayfair to help them grow organically
What You'll Need
2+ years working in quantitative-driven, service fields like consulting, technical marketing, data science, etc.
1+ years experience in SEO a definite plus
Intellectually curious and persistent
Experience manipulating large datasets such as server logs
Effective communicator
Team player
Fundamental understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and how the web works
Coding and prototyping skills a plus
Ecommerce experience a plus

Knucklepuck is searching for an ambitious, motivated individual to join our rapidly growing team of digital-first marketers as a full-time Junior SEO Consultant.

About Knucklepuck

We are a digital marketing agency dedicated to driving sustainable, bottom-line growth for our clients. To accomplish these goals, we become an extension of our clients marketing teams to create extraordinary web experiences. Our team is comprised of top-notch marketers specializing in content production, search engine optimization, paid media advertising, and web development. We mirror our own industry quick, quirky, innovate, creative, growing explosively and born of the digital revolution. Our clients span industries from e-commerce to local businesses to Fortune 500 companies.

We are seeking a self-starter who is passionate about driving organic growth through search. In exchange for your insatiable curiosity and SEO chops, we offer the opportunity to make an impact growing our own business and our clients businesses, to develop technical skills, and to reap the rewards of a job well done. Our team is well suited to grit hustlers who value a hard days work, the comforts of a beanbag chair and a quality pun.

About the Position

The Junior SEO Consultant will provide support for Knucklepucks SEO clients. The Junior SEO Consultant will report to the Director of Marketing but will also take direction from the lead Project Manager for each of their 3-6 assigned accounts.

Although extensive training will be provided, the Junior SEO Consultant must be independent, self-motivated, and able to interact directly with clients in a professional manner. The Junior SEO Consultant must be able to take direction and cultivate strong professional relationships both externally (with clients, experts, sources, etc.) and internally (with colleagues across departments at all levels within the company). We are looking for a true team player who will be called upon to execute search engine optimization strategies and work internally to coordinate with members of our SEO, Paid Media, Content and Web Development teams.

To succeed in this position, you must have:
Creative, problem-solving and strategic thinking skills and an ability to execute tactical action items
Quick learning tendencies and a thirst for knowledge that will facilitate your immediate contribution to a rapidly growing agency
A track record of experiences demonstrating an action-oriented personality
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to independently manage tasks to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and results-oriented culture
The ability to communicate well verbally and in writing to foster client relationships
A data-driven mentality and analytical mindset that will inform strategy
Working familiarity with Google Docs, Google Sheets and Google Drive (as well as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
Passion! Knucklepuck thrives on growth from within. This role will serve an integral part of our SEO team and be afforded significant growth opportunities across the organization
As you receive sufficient training in SEO, your primary responsibilities will include:
Use an arsenal of on-page, off-page, tech and outreach techniques to perform search engine optimization, including competitive research
Perform ongoing keyword research to execute on-page strategies, such as writing content growth opportunity outlines, that support a consistent and consolidated content theme
Leverage a combination of tools and manual research to perform competitive research identifying opportunities for pursuing search engine optimization strategies based upon those factors that the search engines are valuing for target queries
Write optimized meta data and on-page content that contains target keywords, improves clickthrough rates, and enhances user experience
Push SEO updates live on client content platforms such as Wordpress
Contribute to internal team discussions, including brainstorms and lectures
Track client analytics and creating reports to inform clients of their progress
Support SEO Consultants with client tasks including client meetings and assignments. This is a client-facing role
It would be great if you have:
A track record of leadership roles and experiences
Digital agency experience
Experience with WordPress and/or website development
Familiarity with web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics) and opportunity analysis tools such as Ahrefs, Moz, SEMRush, Buzzsumo, and Screaming Frog.

Please complete the application on this page and upload your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements. Your cover letter should include explicit examples of how your skills are a match for Knucklepuck and specifically the SEO Consultant position. As a reminder, your cover letter is your opportunity to demonstrate what you can bring to this role and why you are the best fit to help us reach our goals, so make it count!

In the first line of your cover letter, please let us know where you think the name Knucklepuck originated from.

Job Title

Working with internal and external teams, this role will be responsible for the execution and implementation of SEO and content marketing strategies and tactics that help drive business goals. The SEO and Content Marketing Manager will collaborate with the Engagement team, Product team, Editorial team, faculty, external agencies, and business stakeholders to support content development, website optimizations, and organic search performance for multiple clients and websites.

Work closely with SEO team and agency to develop and implement comprehensive SEO and content marketing strategies for new clients and recommend enhancements for existing clients

Be Challenged

Visiture is a rapidly growing eCommerce agency headquartered in Charleston, SC with a thriving office in Midtown Atlanta as well. We are looking for an extraordinarily talented individual to join our team.

We are seeking someone who craves a challenge and is passionate about increasing conversion rates and increasing revenue. Visiture markets its services to a broad range of online merchants looking to increase their online sales and profitability including SPANX, Just for Men, Title Nine, Mitchell Gold Bob Williams, and more.

Position Summary

The Junior Account Coordinator (JAC) position is a unique and exciting opportunity as it is the launch pad for a full-time career at Visiture. We designed this position for college seniors about to graduate, recent graduates, and people simply wanting to break into the industry. The JAC role is intended to be a learning experience, forming the foundation for a career with a team of digital marketing experts.

While there will be training provided, JACs are also expected to work autonomously at times, educating themselves with the support of the SEO team. The JAC will also be responsible for performing various tasks to support the team. Successful JACs will demonstrate an ability to learn quickly and display an aptitude for adding value.

There will be a 90-day period of hourly compensation, working and training 20-30hrs/week. After this period, the JAC will be evaluated for a full-time salaried position as part of Visiture’s SEO team. Full-time salaried positions include content strategists, outreach specialists, and technical SEO managers.

The person holding this position will report to and work with the Director of Content and SEO, General Manager of SEO, client services managers, and other relevant team members. This role will involve various SEO management tasks including, but not limited to: assisting with content strategy tasks, content editing, posting content, writing meta tag information, posting meta tag information, performing outreach emails, prospecting for outreach leads, performing client service tasks, and other general SEO initiatives.

Principal Responsibilities

Learn and educate yourself on Search Engine Optimization as much as possible (materials will be provided).

Assisting SEO team members with various SEO tasks assigned to you.

Execute all SEO tasks assigned within the timeframes allocated.

Perform assigned tasks in the best way possible, no matter how big or small.

Continuously working toward self-improvement and bringing your “A game.”

Striving to make the SEO team better any way possible.

Bringing ideas and innovations to the table to help contribute to improving processes.

Doing whatever it takes to bring yourself into a position of adding value by the end of the 90-day JAC period (if not sooner).

Qualifications

4-year College Degree or working on College Degree

Experience with Google Analytics is a plus

Very basic knowledge of Search Engine Optimization

Training and Special Skills

Search engine optimization training will be provided by Visiture, but a good understanding of the industry is preferred.

Google AdWords Partner Certification and Bing Ads Accredited Professional Certification will be required to obtain within 60 days of hire.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is a must.

Solid work ethic, adaptable to a fast-paced environment and works well under pressure.

Strong, solid team player.

Strong self-motivator with the ability to prioritize and multi-task independently.

Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with internal and external customers.

Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.

Resourceful–with the ability to research and solve problems independently.

Experience with proofing, technical writing, and business writing.

Unwavering positive attitude.

Our Perks

Highly competitive compensation package (including 401K, comprehensive health/dental/vision package, paid parking) and opportunity to work for a fast-growing digital marketing firm.

Laid-back office, casual attire. Jeans and a t-shirt always okay, though we have some pretty snappy dressers on this team. The choice is yours.

A culture we care about deeply. People should be happy in their jobs and lives. There is a balance to strike to achieve this, and we respect it.

You’ll receive a laptop (MacBook Pro) with appropriate software installed to complete your work.

Free healthy snacks and drinks.

Ergonomic desk options from top to bottom.

Oh, and did we mention the unlimited vacations?

Details

Location: Downtown – Charleston, SC or Midtown – Atlanta, GA.

Job Type: Part-time for 90 days followed by performance evaluation and potential full-time position. JAC position starts at 20 hours a week minimum, 30 hours a week maximum.

Compensation: Hourly for initial 90-day period. Salary upon full-time employment offer.

How to Apply

Email cover letter and resume to: career AT visiture dot com (preferred method) with subject “SEO JAC” or submit via Indeed.

Please, no phone calls about this job!

As Manager of Content Strategy, the candidate will provide leadership to the content strategy and content governance teams by applying and disseminating content best practices as part of a larger, cross-functional team. S/he will work closely with the client’s Digital Experience team, and is able to understand their objectives and requirements, break them into executional content offerings, and collaborate with the creative, operations, and technology teams to get them implemented. S/he leads the creation and delivery of work in content strategy space. S/he brings together the varied aspects of strategic content such as user-experience and SEO to deliver a cohesive, brand-oriented and user-focused content experience.

Full-time and based near Alpharetta, GA

RESPONSIBILITIES

•Provide content evaluation and recommendations that help clients and their users achieve their goals based on information obtained through site audits, competitive assessments, user testing, site metrics, and SEO

•Collaborate with creative and technical teams as well as subject matter experts across product lines, brands, and/or regions to understand and help support strategic business objectives and customer requirements

•Work with different teams on implementation of SEO best practices and global optimization of content

•Create or review site structure and nomenclature for the most intuitive presentation of content

•Overseeing the process of content migration by working closely with the experience stakeholders and creating documentation such as content matrices and content models

•Defining governance/workflow of content creation

•Content assessment. Providing content revision/creation recommendations that help the business and its customers achieve their goals (based on brand documentation, competitive assessments, audience segmentation, SEO data, and site metrics)

•Creating taxonomy and tagging strategy, as needed

•Ensuring content is structured properly for any relevant backend systems including CMS and DAM.

•Managing 1-2 junior content strategists

REQUIREMENTS:

•5-7 years of relevant experience in digital content strategy, preferably in an agency/consulting environment

•At least 3 years of experience in leading content delivery in a client-facing role

•Above average stakeholder management skills

•Able to work as part of globally distributed teams in different domains and geographies

•Hands-on experience in creation and review of content strategy deliverables such as content assessments, content models, content matrix, taxonomy, competitive analysis

•Working knowledge of complex content management systems such as Adobe Experience Manager or OpenText

•Outstanding writing and communication skills

•Mid-level understanding of budgeting, resource-planning, delivery framework, and generic project management principles

•Ability to constantly monitor the quality and throughput of track work

EDUCATION

•Degree in English, Library Science, Journalism, Technical Writing, or equivalent military experience preferred

Dealer.com, a Cox Automotive Brand, is currently looking for a Digital Marketing Specialistto join our team in Burlington, VT or Mission, KS.


The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for delivering on Dealer.coms Advanced and Premium levels of Search Engine Optimization services to its subscribers to help them achieve their goals. This includes analyzing website performance data (traffic, rankings, etc.), evaluating the clients websites, determining what action to take to increase site performance, and collaborating with client, and internal stakeholders like the SEO Copywriter, on a monthly basis on strategy. The Digital Marketing Specialist is the clients point-of-contact for all organic search related questions and concerns. Besides the monthly scheduled calls to review work and strategize, the client also as direct access to the Specialist via email or phone as needed.


Your Role:
Communicate with clients via regular monthly conference calls to review website performance, work completed as part of the SEO program, present strategies for the following month, collaborate on additional strategies to help the client achieve their goals, and generally act as consultant for clients online search presence.

To improve client site performance in search engines, and utilizing Dealer.com's web platform, execute on strategies using strictly white-hat search engine optimization tactics. Including content writing and optimization, metadata optimization, schema markup implementation, canonicaling of URLs, 301 redirects, NAP alignment, and natural backlink building.
Utilizing Dealer.com's analytics platform, analyze and evaluate website performance including, but not limited to, organic visits, visitors, form submissions, conversion rate, bounce rate, and visibility (keyword ranking data) to determine level of client performance and identify areas of opportunities.
Write client-facing reports on how website is performing to help them understand the benefits of Dealer.com's SEO program. To assist with identification of potential site improvements, utilize 3rd party tools like Copyscape, Majestic SEO, Google Webmaster Tools, Google Trends, and Moz Pro.
Troubleshoot negative trends in key performance indicators and search engine visibility. With assistance, determine cause of trend and take corrective action.
Complete search engine related requests from clients like market research, webpage optimization, Google Local optimization, and analysis of analytics on demand.

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is a critical channel within our business. It drives a significant portion of the revenue and profits for the organization, and the goal is to increase the volume of move-ins that contribute to revenue. The SEO Team manages traffic optimization across many properties and user segments. This team uses core data analysis and insights to drive enhanced interactions with the end consumer that translates into a better experience for the user and a successful outcome for the business. This position works cross-functionally with multiple internal departments, including Product & Technology, Business Intelligence, and Content.

THE POSITION

The SEO Manager has ownership of an individual web property and will work with multiple internal teams, including Content, Business Intelligence, Technology, & Product. Reporting into the Head of SEO and working with key members of the executive team, you will provide leadership and strategy for the direction of a web property, as well as being a collaborative partner to the overall team. You will always be striving to stay ahead of trends in search while identifying and forecasting future growth opportunities. As a SEO leader, you will establish standards and procedures to drive and hold accountable high-quality performance in SEO. Success in this role will lead to increased traffic and conversion, resulting in delivering on the company’s financial goals.

Who you are:

You are a proven, passionate and outcome-driven individual, an expert at developing and executing comprehensive organic strategies that drive traffic and conversion. You will be experienced in data-driven SEO strategies, A/B testing, and possess a deep knowledge of all the functional areas of SEO (technical, content, local). You thrive working within and across teams to develop and implement business plans for emerging search opportunities.



Own the performance and success of the domain. Develop and execute comprehensive SEO strategy, informed by analytical assessment of opportunities, to deliver on company goals & drive long term growth.
Regularly monitor and report on domain performance and trends, including impact of strategies/initiatives to improve the site.
Drive development of dashboards and analyses needed to assess potential impact of initiatives, identify and understand drivers of performance, and measure progress against goals and success metrics.
Conduct comprehensive, regular SEO audits (across technical SEO, UX/UI elements, and content performance) to identify opportunities to improve performance and drive conversion and revenue.
Conduct keyword research, user behavior, and competitive analyses to identify current gaps and white space opportunities to better serve user’s intent through enhanced content and page improvements.
Work cross-functionally with internal teams (including Technology & Product, Business Intelligence, Content) and SEO agencies to prioritize site improvement opportunities and A/B tests to enhance conversion. Develop associated roadmaps to:
Improve organic visibility across SERPs and their products such as Knowledge Panel, FAQs, People Also Ask, and Answer Box.
Implement SEO best practices to bring domain up to best in class technical SEO standards.
Maximize on site conversion of highest quality leads.
Collaborate with Content team to share recommendations on opportunities to enhance SEO value of content and determine implications for content roadmap; Collaborate with Product and Technology teams as a critical, integrated member of Software Development Lifecycle.
Analyze performance data from tests and site improvements to identify and implement further optimizations that increase ROI.
Translate granular, technical details into clear insights and communicate results and recommendations, both orally and in written form, to a non-technical executive audience through regular updates.
Prepare site for migration to new technology stack:
Inject SEO expertise into page redesigns.
Eliminate low value content, prepare structured data for new pages, and optimize redirects, etc.
Partner with supporting SEO agency to minimize traffic risk of decline.
Continuously improve SEO skillsets, staying up to date with shifts in the marketplace.
Be a mentor and leader to increase knowledge sharing across the team.



Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Marketing, Advertising.
A minimum of 5 years of experience developing and implementing SEO strategies with full view of customer lifecycle.
Highly analytical, employing data-driven decision making in all aspects of managing the domain and demonstrating comfort with detailed analysis and data across sources to inform recommendations.
Enthusiasm for understanding the evolving best practices with regard to the technical aspects of crawling, indexing, ranking and driving qualified organic traffic.
Demonstrated understanding of mobile, video, local SEO.
Experience in the health/wellness, family and community verticals preferred.
Experience with keyword research, information architecture, search engine algorithms and ranking factors.
Deep knowledge of structured data schemas and rich snippets. Understanding of internal linking, keyword usage and semantic analysis.
Experience analyzing page, keyword, and content & site performance to develop prioritized roadmap to improve pages.
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience with site crawlers and log file analysis.

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is a critical channel within our business. It drives a significant portion of the revenue and profits for the organization, and the goal is to increase the volume of move-ins that contribute to revenue. The SEO Team manages traffic optimization across many properties and user segments. This team uses core data analysis and insights to drive enhanced interactions with the end consumer that translates into a better experience for the user and a successful outcome for the business. This position works cross-functionally with multiple internal departments, including Product & Technology, Business Intelligence, and Content.

THE POSITION

Based in our NYC office, the Lead SEO Analyst will play a critical role in identifying key organic traffic drivers on APFM domains and identify opportunities for where the team should focus their efforts. Reporting into the Director of SEO Strategy, this role will draw on deep data sets to understand customer intent better which in turn will drive recommendations for the SEO, Content and Product teams. Success in this role will help the SEO Marketing team increase conversions from leads to revenue and to contribute to the company’s financial targets.

Who you are:

You are a passionate, data-driven individual and enjoy digging into complex datasets. This role will be the analytical foundation of the A Place for Mom SEO team. The Lead Analyst will use data and insightful analyses to manage the channel’s performance as well as support, inform, and, where applicable, challenge decisions to help hone and serve APFM’s business goals. The ability to iterate and drive improvements quickly using data will be key to our success in the marketplace. This individual will also lead initiatives on internal tool development for consumption and analysis of large data sets from third-party systems that empower the SEO Marketing team to make actionable decisions at scale.



Enable SEO strategy development and decision-making through holistic organic data analytics and development of actionable recommendations.
Support key business initiatives by generating insights from multiple internal and secondary data sources.
Own insights and recommendations from the analyses and translate them to executive level audiences to communicate performance drivers and priorities.
Analyze current SEO performance to build descriptive and predictive models to optimize ongoing site improvements (e.g., through A/B test) and SEO updates for improved traffic and revenue return.
Optimize and manage Conductor platform configuration and drive adoption as single source of truth to monitor and analyze SEO performance.
Manage data and analyses across domains to enable analytical and reporting needs. Identify and drive the delivery of changes in data structures and metrics where needed to further support enhanced marketing analysis.
Create performance thresholds and regular monitoring dashboards, reports, and proactive alerts to flag performance changes .
Identify and prioritize opportunities for improvement in conversion along the customer online journey, grounded in internal conversion data to drive bottom line improvement.
[Preferred] Leverage API connections to common toolsets (SEMRush, Conductor, first party data from GA and GSC, CRM, etc.) plus knowledge of SQL and Python to build and automate regular recurring dashboards, reports, and analyses.


S. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics.
Proficiency of SQL required.
2-3 years of proven and successful analytics experience, with demonstrated increasing levels of consulting and corporate responsibility.
SEO expertise and experience supporting an SEO team.
Deep understanding of Google algorithm updates and NLP concepts.
Experience with a wide variety of SEO tools, including SEMRush, Conductor, Ahrefs, Majestic, Moz, Screaming Frog, AWR, DeepCrawl, Search Console, Google Analytics, Google Lighthouse, Bing WebMaster Tools as well as reporting platforms such as Amplitude or Mixpanel.
Conductor certification or experience preferred.
Experience with site crawlers and log file analysis.
Exceptional analytical and problem solving capabilities, including the ability to logically and efficiently structure ambiguous problems, identify sources of data for collection and discovery, conduct complicated analyses, identify key insights and develop practical workable solutions.
Experience connecting disparate data sets to enable analyses.
Highly collaborative and able to work across functions, geographies, and organizational levels to develop solutions; engages and involves key stakeholders.
Effective communicator able to translate complex analysis into insights and communicate results and recommendations, both orally and in written form, to a non-technical executive audience.
Deep knowledge of ecommerce, online marketing, and mobile trends.
Experience with Python preferred.

Job Posting Title:

SEO Manager

Job Description:

Who We're Looking For

Out of an abundance of caution due to the concerns surrounding the current situation with the Coronavirus (COVID-19), we will be conducting our hiring process completely virtually. That means that all interviews and onboarding activities will be held online or over the phone. The health of our employees and candidates is our main priority and we hope you will forgive any inconvenience that may arise from this non-conventional approach. While the day-to-day approach has changed a bit during this time, our commitment to hiring the best talent in the industry and helping them to thrive both personally and professionally is stronger than ever.

Our SEO Manager is integral to the development of the SEO Channel, training of our SEO Specialists and close oversight of ongoing strategies set for all our web properties.

The SEO Manager works closely with the Director of Earned Media and individual SEOs on each team in the planning, testing, and executing of SEO initiatives, developing process, and ensuring adherence to best practices.

The SEO Manager excels at coordination with Marketing Managers and each of the other marketing functions to advocate for SEO considerations and ensure consistency in SEO strategy and implementation across multiple properties.

Working to streamline SEO workflow the SEO Manager engages regularly in analysis, reporting, training and implementing SEO best practices for ongoing optimization, troubleshooting complex issues and having both a direct and indirect impact on Clearlink's profitability achieved via organic search.

Breaking Down Your Day to Day
Develop and execute SEO strategies for Clearlink and our partners, including optimizing current web pages and working with various channels on projects that are being developed or planned.
Create performance reports using Google Analytics or other similar tools.
Review and analyze Clearlink and Brand Partner sites for areas that need to be improved, deleted, revamped, etc; prepare detailed SEO strategy reports for management.
Carry out SEO functions, including keyword research, site audits, information architecture planning, domain valuation.
Identify keyword targeting opportunities for Brand Partner and Clearlink sites; organize and run projects and campaigns to improve website search result listings.
Opportunity, competitive and market analysis
Proposal development and partner communication
Conduct analysis to evaluate the performance of search engine optimization strategies; identify and evaluate current site goals and link building strategies;
Research data for future projects
Provide training and strategic oversight of SEO Specialists
Review and approve SEO strategies, forecasts and tactics
Other duties may be assigned as required.
What You Need
BA in Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing or a related field
4-6 years SEO experience in a B to C environment
Expert-level knowledge of SEO methods and best practices.
Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
Demonstrated ability to manage details, efficient work habits, and overall flexibility
Must be able to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to accept interruptions as part of the routine
Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives and willingness to take on additional responsibility
Proven ability to manage a diverse team excelling in identifying and capitalizing on individual contributor strengths
Advanced SEO tool, Google Analytics and Excel skills for data analysis and reporting
What We Offer

At Clearlink, our goal is to create opportunities for our people; if you're smart, hungry, and love to get things done, this is the perfect opportunity to build on your career in digital marketing. You'll have the opportunity to sharpen your skills by working with some of the biggest brands in the country.

We are an established and growing company with a start-up atmosphere, which means you'll have the opportunity to create and execute enterprise SEO strategies and the freedom to approach them in creative ways.

About Clearlink:

Clearlink's team of 1,700+ employees is headquartered in Salt Lake City and has been creating marketing content services for Fortune 500 companies for over 13 years. Clearlink has been recognized as a great place to work with awards such as Utah Business Magazine's Fast 50, Inc. Magazine's 500/5000 List, Salt Lake Tribune Top Workplaces, Utah Chapter of the American Marketing Association Internal Campaign, and many more. We are proud to offer our employees:
Up to 100% healthcare for your entire family
Over two weeks paid time off
Paid ski days, wellness activities, and team outings
Fully-stocked break room
Award-winning wellness program with free health coaching
All-expense paid vacations for top employees

Salt Lake City

Company Description

Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention; to care more about our clients’ brands; and to buy more products and services from them.

Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.

With a Millennial-friendly, bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.

Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights; content and creative production; communications and strategy; finance and marketing; and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

Job Description

The role of the Senior Search Analyst is to be the day-to-day steward of search media for assigned brands responsible for monitoring and maintaining search campaign development, activation and innovation. The Senior Search Analyst is required to develop and maintain a strong knowledge of their clients’ business and apply their search understanding accordingly to help deliver against the clients’ needs/objectives. The Senior Search Analyst will work closely with their manager in the development and communication of all search recommendations.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Gather and analyze keyword research necessary to build a new campaign
Responsible for gathering necessary data for plan development
Group keywords into ad groups and develop relevant ad copy and extensions with little direction from Manager
Responsible for presenting recommendation, soliciting and applying client feedback to keyword and copy proposal prior to client signoff
Upon campaign approval, responsible for building flowchart and loading authorized buys in Prisma
Generate paperwork necessary for purchase authorization and ensure vendor counter signature is received
Primary party responsible for trafficking approved plan into search engines
Primary party responsible for QA of all campaign components prior to launch
Monitor and maintain campaign budgets, pacing and bid adjustments
Proactively advocate for campaign adjustments based on performance trends
Active monitoring and management of performance and competitive landscape
Development and implementation of optimizations and/or testing plans (e.g. search query reports, negative keyword maintenance, keyword overlap, testing implementation)
Pulling and analyzing data to inform campaign reporting and develop strategic insights with clear actionable items
Build clear, concise and cohesive quantitative analyses inclusive of strong data visualization
Active participation in client status and reporting calls, including presentation of reporting
Responsible for granular maintenance of monthly billing cycle, including invoice tracking, buy actualization in Prisma, and compiling draft billing for manager approval
Responsible for resolving all billing discrepancies in partnership with client strategy and billing reconciliation team
Responsible for learning all relevant tools for reporting, analytics and competitive analysis - bid management platforms, Benchtools, Google Trends
Mastery of all core search metric calculations and relationships (e.g. CPC, CPA, CTR, SOV, weighted averages)
Serve as subject matter experts for Search Analysts and be a resource for training and ad hoc questions
Develop strong working relationship with client teams and partner agencies (where applicable) by helping to create a seamless communications process
Establish professional, productive rapport with sales representatives/media vendors
Demonstrate creativity and agility when problem solving
Work closely with manager to establish priorities and manage workload
Timely delivery of all work
Successful completion of training programs and requisite certifications
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university
A minimum of one year of search experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to prioritize and organize projects
Ability to accurately apply principles of media math
Demonstrated expertise in core MS Excel functions (vlookup, pivot tables)
Expertise in search engines and platforms
Demonstrate leadership ability
Demonstrates initiative/”hunger”
Collaborative approach/attitude
TECHNOLOGY AND SYSTEMS UTILIZED
MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Kenshoo, Dart Search, Marin (3rd party Search bidding platforms)
ComScore, Hitwise
Google Trends, Google Auction Insights
BUDGET RESPONSIBILITY
Monitor and maintain campaign budgets, pacing and bid adjustments
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Summary

The SEO (Search Engine Optimization) Manager will drive the coordination and implementation of the SEO and SEM strategies to drive new customer acquisition, revenue growth, and improved profitability for Universal Technical Institute. This data-driven, analytical individual will work with our SEO agency to manage SEO campaigns and develop content marketing strategies that result in a search lift for our blog and website-all for the purpose of driving organic traffic and raising uti.edu on SERP search pages.

Job Description:

The Search Engine Optimization Analyst will work with their clients and an account manager to audit the client’s existing SEO and social activities. Based on this audit, the SEO Analyst will define the program’s goals, strategies, and tactics.

Our new Analyst will identify target keywords and will provide on-page and off-page recommendations for technical SEO elements, site structure, on-page content optimizations, and linking best practices. The Analyst will track and report on the success of the engagement, providing monthly optimization recommendations. This role does not include design or development implementation, however, understanding of these is beneficial.

This position requires a candidate that excels in SEO knowledge, data analysis, project management, and balancing established processes with creative thinking. Successful applicants will be proactive, detail-oriented, and enthusiastic.

This position will be located in our offices in Austin, Texas.

Responsibilities:

Analyze trends and provide insights into KPIs for clients’ and prospects’ sites.
Quickly and effectively structuring data within in Excel to provide insights and actionable takeaways.
Conduct keyword research and page mapping with an understanding that this will be a driving part of client strategy.
Identify technical issues with client websites such as indexation bloat and ineffective robots.txt files.
Create in-depth audits of client websites and present them directly to clients via PPT.
Create customized SEO recommendations to meet your clients’ unique needs and to improve performance.
Analyze lead or sales performance data, rankings data, crawl logs, and site analysis tools to identify opportunities for search engine optimization. Communicate these recommendations to the client as necessary in order to achieve the client’s goals.
Create and deliver client performance report on varying cadences.
Use site audit and performance data to recommend projects for client roadmaps/initiatives.
Collaborate with other teams, including analytics, conversion rate optimization, creative, and paid search to add incremental value for clients.

Requirements:

Minimum 2 years of *SEO work experience* ; agency experience is a plus.
In-depth understanding of the three pillars of SEO. (Technical, On-page, & Off-page)
Understanding of the “New” SEO and what the term means.
Working knowledge of MS Office suite, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Excel skills are highly valued. Pivot tables are used multiple times in a given project. However, these should not be the only tools in your Excel arsenal.
Must have a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JS, and other common languages used for building and optimizing websites.
Experience working with SEO applications and web analytics tools (Google Analytics, WMT, Omniture, Coremetrics, WebTrends or ClickTracks).
Superior organizational and analytical skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to build strong working relationships across different teams.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, Math, Linguistics, English, or Economics preferred.

Company Description

Merkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices. For more than 30 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. Job Description

Opportunities available for winter 2019 and spring 2020 graduates and recent alumni.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position.

SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is the practice of improving a website to increase the number of visitors the site receives from search engines like Google. Sites that are poorly designed, irrelevant, or use black-hat techniques will be pushed lower in the list of results while high-quality and authoritative sites will rank higher. SEO Specialists at Merkle identify opportunities on clients’ websites to improve how search engines find and rank them. Leveraging a combination of technical, creative, and troubleshooting skills, SEO specialists help ensure clients are visible online.
Perform keyword research based on trends, target audiences, patterns, and competitor analysis
Create optimized page titles, meta descriptions, and content
Analyze client performance and identify recommendations for SEO opportunities
Extract insight from data, identify relevant trends, and provide proactive recommendations to reach client marketing goals.
Conduct industry, client, and competitive research
Provide regular communication to clients (written and verbal)
Identify strategies and trends for client accounts and create client presentations
Perform frequent data manipulation and interpretation exercises, with Excel and proprietary tools
Self-manage execution of activities against deadlines across multiple work-streams
Complete activities according to best practices, standard operations procedures, and team member guidance, consistently meeting quality standards, utilizing ethical approach and striving to add value in each activity
Active monitoring and sharing of industry news, online marketing trends, industry tools, and internal cross-team key learnings
Day to day engagement, collaboration, and partnering with internal teams, external tools, and client teams
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative, marketing, or related discipline preferred
Experience with HTML editing and CMS programs a plus
Experience with web analytics platforms (ex: Google Analytics, Omniture) a plus
A fundamental understanding of how the internet works
Well-versed in the core MS Office suite programs and an intermediate to advanced user of Excel including the ability to use formulas, functions, and pivot tables
Must be able to communicate effectively by phone; write clear emails and memos; be friendly, cheerful, and patient; and enjoy explaining complicated concepts to others
Ability to handle multiple projects, prioritize responsibilities and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment
Keen problem-solving and trouble-shooting abilities; high level of accuracy and attention to detail
Occasional travel required (5%) typically for client QBRs

In this role you will be responsible for helping Reprise clients improve their visibility in organic and eRetail search results. The senior analyst will contribute the majority of recommendations to one key client with the help of the SEO director. Applicants will be expected to be regularly client-facing. Candidates must have a strong grasp of core search techniques such as content strategy and technical analysis. The senior analyst must understand client goals and the SEO strategy and incorporate them into the appropriate SEO tactics. This role involves a great deal of collaboration with design, development, social media, and search engine marketing (SEM) teams.

Essential Functions
Collaborate with social, SEM, and offline marketing teams to implement SEO tactics designed to meet client's marketing goals
Optimize eRetail assets
Develop content recommendations and technical analysis presentations

Present findings and back up recommendations with hard data
Identify duplicates or other problems that can arise in reporting or optimization
Support business development and account teams as needed in SEO sales and presentations
Support marketing in the development of SEO case studies, white papers, blog posts, etc.
Perform other duties as assigned by director or associate director

Bachelor's degree or equivalent required
Work Experience:
2 - 4 years' experience in SEO
Experience with project management tools is a plus
Experience with Fortune 1000 brands and/or within an agency environment
Skills:
Expertise with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Knowledge of eCommerce SEO concepts
Comfortable with platforms including Adobe Analytics (Omniture SiteCatalyst) or Google Analytics
Understanding of basic web development technologies with the ability to hand code HTML
Familiar with multiple keyword research, reporting, and link building tools
Understanding of why certain search results appear for various keywords
Knowledge of local SEO, mobile SEO, and social media optimization (SMO) concepts
Innovative thinker, intuitive learner, with ability to quickly find solutions in fast-moving industry
Excellent research, writing, and presentation skills with an attention to detail
Ability to multi-task and handle other duties as assigned

At Reprise, we're reinventing digital experiences everywhere, every day. With end-to-end capabilities that include search, social media, content creation, product and web development, eRetail and strategy, we cut to the core of what truly drives customers by providing a holistic digital-first approach. Job Description

SEO & Paid Search Strategist

Savannah, GA

The TMX Finance? Family of Companies is looking for an experienced SEO & Paid Search Strategist to join the team and take ownership of an overall blueprint that will dictate the architecture and approach for driving growth. As a seasoned strategist with a complete understanding of Search Engine Optimization, you will manage and be responsible for a multi-million-dollar annual Paid Search campaign, continuously mine for new keyword opportunities, and optimize websites accordingly based on insights garnered from in depth analysis and the fusion of their SEO and Paid Search efforts. You're a subject matter expert in your field with advanced knowledge of trends, changes, applications, implementations, strategies, and realizations. While you're providing leadership and guidance for internal and external contributors, we'll provide you with the tools and technology to help you take your career to the next level.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

Own and manage SEO campaigns across all TMX Finance? Family of Companies brands and websites.

Create strategies to drive online traffic to the Company's website, track conversion rates and rankings as well as other KPIs, and work to make improvements using a range of techniques, SEO, and best web practices.

Raise brand awareness and recognition by managing the network's brand and product campaigns, improving the usability, design, content, and conversion of the network websites.

Evaluate customer research, market conditions, and competitor data, as well as develop online marketing concepts and strategies in order to proactively anticipate and prepare for emerging needs.

Work closely with outside SEO agencies on strategy development, prioritization of recommendations, content creation, keyword discovery, and link building development. Leverage their dashboard, data and reports to evaluate the degree of success of SEO efforts.

Perform detailed data monitoring and effectively interpret, analyze and report ongoing SEO efforts.

Research, analyze and gain full understanding of the competitive landscape in the industry with the goal to enhance the company's standing.

Partner with IT, front-end developers and digital marketing managers to implement on-page and SEO optimizations.

Identify technical issues with site performance and search engine crawls and provide easy-to-understand analysis and recommendations to improve SEO efforts ensuring that traffic and ROI goals are met or exceeded.

Implement SEO best practices and provide ongoing support for SEO initiatives, such as link building, on-site technical audits, keyword research and analytics.

Develop and manage paid search campaigns supporting brand objectives, including but not limited to, strategy, bid management, account architecture, and day-to-day monitoring.

Generate reporting on a regular basis for all major KPIs and goals.

Provide recommendations and execute strategies for new keyword opportunities, campaign structuring, targeting, and other facets of paid search in accordance with client goals.

Work closely with compliance department to continuously add and optimize new paid search ads.

18001, CORP, Marketing-18010, 18010, TBD

Job Requirements

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, Web Development, or a related field
5+ years of hands on experience in SEO and paid search
Experience in building inbound organic search traffic
An up to date, working knowledge of current, past and projected trends in the SEO industry
Extensive experience with developing and strategizing complex content marketing initiatives
Experience with website analysis and various analytical and reporting tools, such as SalesForce, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console, Conductor
Experience creating and maintaining websites via CMS (i.e. WordPress)
Knowledge and understanding of HTML and basic web structure
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and with accuracy and efficiency
Ability to adapt and learn quickly, with strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Must be flexible and willing to pivot to keep pace with evolving strategies
Must be self-sufficient, self-motivated, and easily self-managed
Must possess an innovative mindset, with strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
Advanced understanding of integrated marketing and lead generation strategies, and how they come together to provide measurable results
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Physical demands for this position frequently include: the ability to remain in a stationary position, move about freely inside and occasionally outside of the office, and the operation of mechanical controls, such as a keyboard.
Bonus Qualifications
Prior experience with Google Analytics 360 and Google Data Studio is a plus, but not required
Adwords certification preferred
Basic understanding of Adobe Photoshop is beneficial but not required

Job Description

Wynn Resorts is looking for a SEO Manager who can strategically and technically own the indexibility and overall exposure of our websites within search engines. This role is a unique opportunity to act as a crucial member of a fast-paced, collaborative team, which will play a huge role in driving towards our business' growth and success. As the Technical SEO Manager you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing our on-site SEO strategy. Deep understanding of leveraging Screaming Frog, hreflang tags, HTML, CSS, Javascript, schema, Webmaster Tools and deep technical audits are going to be crucial for success.

Responsibilities
Plan, develop and implement our technical SEO strategy to increase overall organic position and engagement.
Identify technical related errors preventing maximum efficiency and ROI.
Regularly perform thorough keywords research and highlight new content opportunities.
Identify and own all key SEO KPIs.
Monitor redirects, canonical tags, click rate, bounce rate, and other KPIs.
Identify and implement a strategy for optimizing website for mobile and voice search.
Prepare and present reports regularly to management on progress and organic growth.
Identify technical problems and deficiency and implement solutions with Product and IT teams in a timely manner.
Collaborate with paid search and metasearch teams to co-optimize SERP presence.
Stay up to date with the latest SEO and digital marketing latest trends and best practices.

3-5 years of experience in planning and implementing a successful SEO strategy as a SEO Manager or similar role
Technical SEO expertise (Canonicalization, Sitemaps, Crawl Budget, Schema, Page Speed etc.)
Comfortable retrieving and analyzing data from Google Search Console, Bing Webmaster Tools, and Google Analytics
Technical SEO audit experience on international enterprise websites (over 100 pages)
Deep level of experience with Screaming Frog, Conductor and other, similar SEO tools
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, look-up function and conditional functions)
Experience analyzing server logs is a plus
Experience with site migrations and consolidations is a plus
Deep understanding of the Sitecore CMS is a plus
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus

Business Insider is looking for an SEO Fellow to join the Business Insider Shopping Team.

Business Insider Shopping is our team that reviews thousands of products - ranging from clothing to technology to mattresses - to give our readers unbiased insights and help them purchase the perfect product for them. Google organic is a key source of traffic for us, and we need to ensure we rank as well as possible but also have titles that sound enticing to readers, so they visit our site.
