Interest in media, audience development/marketing, and e-commerce
Curiosity to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment
About us:

Insider Inc. is a global news and lifestyle publication with teams in New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and beyond. Our mission is to inform and inspire the digital generation and become the most influential and loved journalism brand in the world. To do this, we delight our audience, clients, and colleagues and we get better every day (you'll hear that mantra a lot). Our employees are world-class storytellers, excellent communicators, "good eggs", and-most of all-effective. We make things happen, love what we do, and have fun while we do it. You can read more about our Mission, Values, and Culture here and more about our company and brands here.

Our newsroom has three divisions: Business Insider, Insider News, and Insider Life. As the 4th largest digital media brand in the U.S, we tell stories that command attention and inspire action. We equip a curious and action-oriented audience of more than 375 million, including half of all U.S. millennials on the internet, with the information and inspiration they need to keep the world, and their lives, moving forward. The company started by building the world's largest digital business news site which and has continued to grow and evolve to match the changing passions and interests of its audience. Insider Inc. is home to 50+ content verticals, the #1 daily news show on Facebook, and we publish 16 global editions in 8 languages.

Company Overview

Brookfield Properties has an immediate need for a SEO & SEM Specialist at our corporate office in Chicago, IL

At Brookfield Properties, the foundation of our success is firmly rooted in our people.

Our company is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving to meet the needs of our communities and stakeholders. To meet this goal, we hire visionary, entrepreneurial talent who help us innovate and enhance our business. We build collaborative teams who value integrity, creativity and diversity.

Our teams operate an iconic portfolio of irreplaceable properties within the world's most dynamic markets. As one of the largest real estate services companies, we provide management and development expertise exclusively for properties owned by Brookfield Asset Management.

Our retail group operates destination, standalone retail real estate globally, including over 150 malls in the United States. Our regional shopping centers create a sense of place in the heart of the communities in which we do business: offering retail, lifestyle, dining and entertainment options.

Position Overview

This position will support the Sr. Manager of Search, SEO & SEM, by helping to develop and execute both organic and paid strategies related to key Marketing programs, including website optimizations, keyword research, pay-per-click advertisements, and more. The Specialist, SEO & SEM will partner with key stakeholders within and beyond the Marketing team, as well as with external resources.

Key Responsibilities:
Supporting the development and execution of a roadmap that addresses short- and long-term SEO & SEM goals
Collaborating with Marketing and IT to ensure proper implementation and effectiveness of on- and off-page SEO strategies
Monitoring and evaluating search results/performance across major search channels in order to improve rankings, as well as website metrics, in order to identify trends and help develop SEO strategies
Assisting with the development, creation, publishing, and optimization of B2B and B2C content, in collaboration with Marketing team members and Brookfield Properties' SEO agency
Leverage research and data to make keyword recommendations for PPC campaigns, content creation, and on-page SEO.
Maintain and optimize campaigns by reviewing CTRs, CPCs, and Conversions while also performing A/B tests for optimal engagement.
Collaborating with SEO & SEM lead to identify and provide guidance on strategies and synergies between paid and organic search activities
Assisting with the creation of key reports related to SEO and SEM
Keep up to date with industry trends and willing to implement new features/ideas to keep our strategies fresh and optimized.
Other relevant projects as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required
2+ years of experience in SEO & SEM, including 1+ year of technical SEO expertise (canonicalization, sitemaps, crawl budget, etc.)
Knowledge of and experience with helping execute SEM programs and optimizing based on data gathered from both organic and paid sources, including campaigns meant to drive revenue and/or leads
Knowledge of and experience with retailing and shopping centers preferred but not required
Driven marketing professional with up-to-date knowledge of SEO and SEM strategies and best practices
Strong creativity and forward-thinking mindset to see the big picture and long-term opportunities for the team
Comfortable with tackling ambiguous questions or situations in order to uncover potential insights; ability to build relationships across the Marketing team and with other key business partners
Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills, including an extreme attention to detail; ability to clearly communicate timelines and priorities
Excellent organizational and time-management skills; strong team player with ability to develop effective working relationships across the organization
Experience in using key drivers and performance metrics to enable superior marketing programs; an innate curiosity about data
Knowledge and hands-on experience with crawlability tools (i.e. ScreamingFrog); experience with keyword tools (i.e. Google Keyword Planner, SEMrush); experience working with CMS (i.e. Adobe AEM) and building/administering content in CMS environments; intermediate Excel skills; experience with web analytics tools (i.e. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics); proficiency with HTML/CSS; experience with Google Ads (certification a plus)

Company Culture

We're kind of like one big (or small depending on where you're from) family. We like to work hard and have fun. We're serious about getting it right and have a lot of laughs along the way. Job title: Technical SEO Analyst (Remote - Fluent in English)
Description:
Why You Should Apply

Our company is devoted to winning for clients, and our team members. You will work side by side top talent within a company that has a fun, fast-paced culture. We listen to your ideas and use them.

We provide training and opportunities for growth, all while working from home as our team is 100% remote. You will receive competitive pay, paid time off, paid holidays, full medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as other benefits.

Full-time employees have the option of taking a half day on Fridays as long as they have put in 40 hours for the week and all of their work is completed. Full-time employees are also eligible for quarterly profit sharing bonuses after 12 months of employment.

If you are organized, a solid communicator, motivated to succeed for clients and have the experience we are looking for, we would love to have you apply today!

Position Overview

The primary role of the Technical SEO Specialist is to analyze and execute search engine optimization campaigns for a small portfolio of client websites. This must be done within a defined scope, time and cost based on the requirements and constraints of specific campaigns.

The Technical SEO Specialist works closely with the Marketing Analyst, Digital Strategist and Digital Marketing Manager to consistently improve client ROI. While the primary focus of the role is on complete SEO-based work, conversion rate optimization (CRO) is also a part of the role.

Although this is primarily a technical role, you will be required to attend all internal meetings and the occasional video call with clients.

What You Will Do
Work closely within a team to provide value to clients
Complete all assigned technical SEO tasks
Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaigns
Track, report, and analyze website analytics and social media and campaigns
Manage campaign expenses, staying on budget, estimating monthly costs and reconciling discrepancies
Optimize copy and landing pages for search engine optimization
Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimization
Research and implement search engine optimization recommendations
Research and analyze competitor websites and online presence
Develop and implement link building strategy
Work with the development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code
Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content programming
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords
What We're Looking For
"A" players
Proactivity, ownership, confidence and motivation to grow
Ability to create digital marketing strategies and break them down to the task level
An ability to stay organized, meet multiple deadlines and pay attention to details in an open, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment
Proven technical SEO experience
Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
A true love of organization and keeping things organized
Data driven thinking as this is a very technical and data rich environment
Excellent communication skills - within the team, other departments and with external clients
Experience with optimizing WordPress websites
Ability to follow up on tasks so they get completed, without nagging team members
In-depth experience with common SEO tools (Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Majestic, Moz, DeepCrawl, etc)
Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms
Manage client budgets and campaign resources
Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets for data analysis including function mastery and pivot tables
Ability to create and help the team execute on digital marketing strategies
Experience working in the digital marketing and SEO industry
Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition
Ability to manage multiple campaign projects, clients and deadlines
Understanding of the legal industry and how law firms work is a plus
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO, SEM, PPC and social media
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Experience with Agile project management methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc) is a plus
A quiet dedicated home work environment with reliable high-speed internet access
What We Offer
A competitive salary based on your experience.
A great PTO package.
Quarterly profit-sharing bonuses and 401k participation after your first year of employment.
Health insurance benefits after your first 60 days with options for dental and vision.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company
In-house training and professional development through seminars and conferences (tell us what you want to learn, and we'll give you our support)
Our annual company conference, with training sessions, team-building activities, contests with fun prizes (an Amazon Echo or iPad, for instance), outstanding meals and highly competitive softball and bowling tournaments.
The opportunity to work with passionate, determined online marketing experts from across the country and around the globe who bring not only their talents to the table but their unique personalities and interests as well.
To apply, visit the Consultwebs Careers page.

Job title: Sr. SEO and SEM Specialist

Team: Marketing

Location: Ada, MI (Americas)

What do we need:

We are looking for an SEO (Search Engine Optimization) and SEM (Search Engine Marketing) specialist to lead the strategy and maintenance of SEO and SEM in our North America market.

What's special about this team:

You will be joining a small but impactful team that manages SEO/SEM and CRM in the North American Market. You will also be partnering with an outside agency. In the role, you'd have heavy collaboration with other Marketing team members as well as teams from Digital and Information Technology. You will report to the Manager of Digital Marketing Services.

How you would contribute to the role:

You will use your knowledge of SEO and SEM to design and execute the strategy for those concepts in text, print, and video content (YouTube). The market is moving to a search-focused content strategy and you will help develop and implement that strategy for the Marketing department. You'll have 3 main goals:
Develop and monitor SEO and SEM for Amway.com, the Amway Connections Blog, and any other Amway-owned sites that we spin up. You'll also do the same for Amway social platforms. Using Conductor and Deep Crawl, you have to ensure that our sites and be crawled and indexed.
Keep abreast of algorithm changes and be able to address what needs to changed in our approach.
Run analytics and reports to measure how your efforts are doing against the market's goals (scorecard).
This is a role that will rely on your ability to persuade and motivate others to get things done. You will collaborate with your partners in Marketing, IT, and Digital to fix the errors and issues that you uncover in your work.

Why would you want this role?

This is an opportunity to be an expert in SEO/SEM space for Amway. Search is a constantly evolving field, and we'll ensure you have the resources to keep up with the algorithm changes.

What skills and background will be important to be successful:
Significant experience with front-end content and back-end IT SEO and SEM concepts
Experience developing a holistic SEO and SEM strategy
Experience using data and analytics to inform strategy
Ability to be impactful by influencing others
This position is not eligible for sponsorship*

CarLotz has an exciting opportunity for a Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Manager in Richmond, VA. This teammate will report directly to our Director of Marketing and will plan and deploy SEO, social media and website initiatives to support each CarLotz location across the country. The best candidate will be a hard-charging team player who has significant experience in Search Engine Optimization. If you are excited about making a meaningful difference in the automotive industry, we want to talk to you.

General Duties:
Develop, execute and manage plans for search engine optimization efforts for each CarLotz location
Manage other digital marketing activities including website and social media and audits and Search Engine Optimization recommendations, establishing and documenting technical Search Engine Optimization best practices
Work cross-functionally with the Operations and Technology teams to push priority Search Engine Optimization projects through to completion
Requirements:
Proven success strategizing and running Google and Facebook campaigns
Proven success in SEO space at an agency or in house
Working knowledge of Google Analytics, Facebook, Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally to ensure project success
Experience with DNS, C-NAME, and URL Redirect configuration
Experience with UTM code and Javascript embedding
Analytical, curious problem-solver
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor's degree is required Preferred
Automotive experience is a plus, but not required
Proven examples of successfully working with digital third-party vendors
WordPress experience is a plus, but not required
Experience with data visualization software (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau etc.)
Background and drug screens required
WHO WE ARE AND WHY WE EXIST

"What if there was a better way to buy and sell vehicles?" This question started the problem-solving sessions that now have CarLotz disrupting the automotive industry. With our innovation consignment model, sellers get thousands more than trade-in and buyers get great cars for less than traditional retail prices. Our team is our future, so we've developed a training program. In our first class, participants learn to live the CarLotz values to build rapport and earn trust. We have an apprenticeship model, so get ready to learn.

If you think you have what it takes to succeed at CarLotz, please apply. CarLotz is committed to diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. CarLotz participates in E-verify.

We are currently looking for a SEO Senior Specialist to join our Marketing team in our US HQ.

The ideal candidate for this role fully understands SEO best practices and has demonstrable experience planning, executing and measuring SEO strategies. This includes monitoring several web properties for potential technical SEO problems such as broken links, redirect issues, site speed and insecure content. This is a hands-on position which requires working with cross functional teams to implement strategies and improve the overall health of our site Performance and SEO Rankings

Top Priorities:
Perform detailed website analysis and SEO audits to identify current problems and opportunities, and set priorities with a focus on crawlability, site architecture and site content.
Work with Marketing and Technical leaders to continuously assess, upgrade or recommend new web technologies & platforms to improve SEO goals.
Design and manage the execution of SEO strategies
Contribute data-driven technical and content recommendations to reach rankings goals.
Analyze site backlink profiles and provide recommendations for outreach opportunities that increase organic visibility and traffic.
Perform keyword research, write optimized HTML tags, provide recommendations on internal linking, content promotion, content creation and implementation of schema mark-up.
Determine ongoing plan and recommendations for A/B & multivariate testing, analysis and insight
Recommend and assist team with implementation & optimization of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager optimizations, CRO/Usability Recommendations to support customer user experiences and trigger engagement metrics.
Advise, collaborate and work cross-functionally with all areas to ensure technical SEO best practices.
Qualifications:
An in-depth understanding of search engine behavior, technical SEO and industry best practices.
Proven record of achieving SEO results on high traffic, relevant search engine keyword searches.
A working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or other programming languages.
A working knowledge of structured data schemas and rich snippets.
Familiarity with different CMS systems and industry tools such as Moz, Ahrefs, SEMRush, Google Search Console, CRO tools, Deepcrawl.
Experience working with back-end SEO elements, site migrations, and server log analysis.
Infragistics is an equals opportunity employer

About Denver Public Schools:

Denver Public Schools is committed to meeting the educational needs of every student with great schools in every neighborhood. Our goal is to provide every child in Denver with rigorous, enriching educational opportunities from preschool through high school graduation. DPS is comprised of nearly 200 schools including traditional, magnet, charter and alternative pathways schools, with an enrollment of more than 90,000 students.

As an Enterprise Marketer, you are responsible for helping the Enterprise Campaign Manager create a strategy for all of your team’s clients and fulfill the execution. We have a writing team, design team, programming team and video production team so you won’t be responsible for creating any content. Ideas for content and promotion of the content is executed by you and your team. There will be a lot of outreach and developing relationships with sites and individual influencers. Another big part of your role is handling on-page optimization for your client’s websites and social media accounts. All client communication and reporting is managed through your Lead but often you’ll be apart of it. Each team lead is different and leads her/his team differently, so ultimately your responsibility is to perform every task for which your Lead puts you in charge. This role is a lot to take on but we help you succeed with a great Lead, training and the best tools available.
Qualifications/Experience:
Good knowledge of all aspects of digital marketing (Content Marketing, SEO, Social Media, PPC, etc.) and excellent knowledge of how they all work together.
3+ years experience in at least one aspect of digital marketing.
Bachelor's Degree
Intermediate to advanced understanding of Google Analytics, Webmaster Tools and Adobe SiteCatalyst.
Experience with Moz, BuzzStream, GroupHigh, Link Research Tools, Majestic SEO, Ahrefs (not all required but definitely a plus).
Ability to organize and analyze data with Excel/Google Spreadsheets.
Extremely organized and detail oriented.
Self disciplined and motivated as well as a team player.
Thirst for knowledge...constantly reading, studying and testing.
Uber competitive but always compassionate and helpful to others.
Creative and innovative.
Ability to meet deadlines even if that means working weekends or late nights sometimes.
Love knowing everything and talking about it but nothing satisfies you more than DOING it!
Excellent communication skills via email, phone call, tweet, in-person, etc.
Not afraid of reaching out to complete strangers and able to quickly connect and build a bond with them...the more social you are the better.
Benefits And Perks
Health insurance: United Healthcare: 97th Floor pays for 100% of the employee’s premium and pays for 50% of the employee’s dependent’s premiums.
Dental insurance: MetLife: 97th Floor pays for 100% of the employee’s premium and pays for 50% of the employee’s dependent’s premiums.
Life insurance: MetLife: 97th Floor pays for 100% of the employee’s premium. Coverage is a term life policy that covers the employee for 1x of their salary (up to $100,000).
Vision insurance: MetLife: 97th Floor pays for 100% of the employee’s premium and pays for 50% of the employee’s dependent’s premiums
Health Savings Account (HSA): Employee is able to allocate pre-tax dollars to be used on medical care expenses. 97th Floor contributes $150/month ($1,800 per year) to the employee’s HSA. The money rolls over year over year and it remains the employee’s even after they leave 97th Floor.
Flexible Spending Account (FSA): Employee is able to allocate pre-tax dollars to be used on dependent care expenses. This is a use it or lose it plan. Whatever the employee doesn’t use in a year, they lose. If the employee leaves 97th Floor, whatever is remaining in their account stays with the company.
Commuter Benefits: Employee is able to allocate pre-tax dollars to be used on commuter expenses. Train, subway, bus, parking. 97th Floor contributes up to $50/month ($600 per year) to the employee’s commuter benefit plan. This is a use it or lose it plan. If the employee leaves 97th Floor, whatever is remaining in their account, stays with the company.
401k: 97th Floor matches up to 4% of the employees salary. Matching funds are immediately fully vested.
ROWE (results only work environment): Work whenever, wherever, and however you want as long as the work gets done. Employee gets 100% autonomy from 97th Floor. 97th Floor gets 100% accountability from the employee. No vacation policy. No vacation approval process. No time policy. No office policy.
Parental Leave: Same policy for both men and women. The employee will receive six consecutive weeks of paid time off. The employee can choose to take another consecutive six weeks of unpaid time off. During this time, their work is covered by other employees. Nothing is expected from the employee during their parental leave.
Perks
97th Floor Library: 97th Floor will buy practically any book the employee would like to read. The employee reads it, then puts in on the bookshelf in the office for others to use. There is already an extensive library of great books in the office that employees can take at anytime. No need to check it out or let anyone know. Just return it when finished.
97th Floor Book Club: Participate in our monthly book club. Get a free book and learn through a great discussion with co-workers.
Conferences and trainings: 97th Floor will pay for most online trainings/courses. 97th Floor will pay for most local conferences. 97th Floor will occasionally pay for travel, food, accommodations, and tickets for out of state conferences. Typically one per year.
Speaking opportunities: 97th Floor helps employees pitch to speak at industry conferences and events. If selected, 97th Floor pays for travel, food, and accommodations. This needs to be approved first.
On-site gym: Open 24/7 with employee’s access key card. Lockers and showers.

Red Ventures is seeking advanced marketers experienced in content marketing and technical SEO skillsets to partner with our world-class brands and creators to drive natural search growth for our growing portfolio of owned and operated assets.

As a SEO Manager, you'll lead one or more of our organic strategy teams while also having the opportunity to be very hands-on in SEO work itself. You can expect to drive innovation for some of the biggest sites in a wide range of verticals ranging from home services and healthcare to financial services, and more.

It means working alongside a data science and engineering team fully dedicated to creating SEO products and tools that give you access to more data and better insights, meaning you spend less time on SEMrush and more time making decisions that impact the business.

What You'll Do:
Develop talent by driving strong performance in technical SEO skills either by leading a small team directly or via influence.
Make decisions that affect critical aspects of your business and interact regularly with company leaders.
Test, innovate, and build custom solutions with our world-class digital marketing, data science, and big data talent.
Analyze organic search landscapes to find opportunities that drive valuable traffic and bottom-line value for the business in collaboration with our experience and business teams.
Set and experiment with content promotion strategy with experience and creative teams using a wide array of digital tools and channels
Leverage our proprietary primary source marketing stack to report on everything from operational (production) progress to upper funnel demand capture, rank position, and full funnel visibility to conversion and P&L metrics.
Keep our sites and pages technically optimized for mobile users and search performance - including information architecture, schema management, semantic HTML, page speed, and other components of crawling and indexing performance.
What We're Looking For:
Passionate about innovating in organic search, always curious and not accepting theories at face value, and enjoy testing to prove effectiveness of tactics.
A self-starting, proven performer with at least 3-5 years of experience in SEO and at least 2+ years of established leadership.
Innovative, on-the-spot, creative problem solver who demonstrates both technical and analytical skills; candidates must be comfortable measuring, interpreting, and making fast-paced decisions based on large volumes of sales and marketing performance data.
Very comfortable working in the weeds with data using tools such as Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Power BI, Tableau, Google Tag Manager, and other common reporting platforms.
Ability to work with HTML, CSS, and JS necessary to optimize page load speed.
Familiar with a number of SEO suites and tools including: STAT, Moz, SEMRush, Majestic, Botify, Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, Brightlocal, and DeepCrawl.
Comfortable working with a variety of different, and cross-functional, teams including business leaders in forecasting, budgeting, sensitivity analysis, and business modeling.
Even Better:
The ideal candidate will have strong data analytics skills with at least conceptual experience of data cleansing/wrangling/munging, joining disparate data sets (Bonus points for proficiency in R, Python, GREP/REGEX, or command line chops).
Experience with Google Cloud Projects/Big Query, Google Search Console, SQL.
At home in a fast-paced, hands-on environment.
A passion for training, L&D and driving process.
A great person to work with (https://blog.redventures.com/inside-rv-life-as-a-red-ventures-seo-pro/)!
Who We Are:

Founded in 2000, Red Ventures is a portfolio of growing digital businesses that bring consumers and brands together through integrated e-commerce, strategic partnerships and many proprietary brands including Bankrate, AllConnect.com and Reviews.com. Headquartered south of Charlotte, NC, Red Ventures has over 3000 employees in offices across the US, as well as London and Sao Paulo. For more information, visitwww.redventures.com.

At Red Ventures we believe that diversity makes us stronger - at work and in the world. Red Ventures is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at Red Ventures is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications.

About The 2020 SEO Innovator Scholarship


Apply now to put $1,000 towards your education.

Huckabuy is a performance-based search engine optimization (SEO) platform that creates cutting-edge software products and services aligned with Googles strategic initiatives. We help businesses large and small in virtually every industry achieve tremendous growth in the organic search channel with a technology-first approach.

We think a lot differently about SEO than most people in the industry, focusing more on where the field is going instead of where its been. We think thats a good thing. And we want to support people who are doing the same while in school.

Are you a marketing, design, or computer science student passionate about SEO? Do you have ideas about where the field is going and what really moves the needle in terms of performance? If so, we want to hear from you.


Submission Details


1. Follow us on LinkedIn, tag 2 of your favorite companies that you think need to improve their organic search presence, and tag our page in a 50 word post describing what excites you most about SEO.

2. Write an essay no longer than a page forecasting what you think the field of SEO will look like 2-3 years from and what actions you would take, whether from on-page, off-page, or technical standpoints in the intermediate term to align websites with those future ranking factors.


Scholarship Eligibility
Must be entering or enrolled at an accredited 2-year or 4-year college or university in the United States.
All application questions must be answered fully.
Must be a United States Citizen or Permanent Resident. Open to students from all states.
For terms and conditions, click here.
Open to undergraduate students pursuing marketing, design, or computer science degrees.
Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Scholarship winner must provide enrollment and GPA verification.
How To Apply


Once per year, the Huckabuy Scholarship Program will award one individual with innovative ideas and a demonstrated passion for search engine optimization (SEO) a $1,000 academic scholarship towards their educational expenses.

To apply, students must meet the minimum eligibility requirements and complete the application by the deadline listed below.

Gaia is seeking to expand its SEO performance by hiring an experienced SEO Strategist. The right candidate would have a BS degree and 5 to 7 years of digital marketing experience with an emphasis on search engine optimization (SEO) specifically. Significant experience with both the technical and content aspects of SEO are required.

Headquartered in Louisville, Colorado, Gaia (NASDAQ: GAIA) is comprised of a global digital video streaming service and online community that provides curated conscious media content to its expansive subscription community, reaching across the globe in over 150 countries. Gaia is charged with empowering the evolution of consciousness and supporting our subscriber community along its unique path to a conscious life. Our dynamic team of Seekers and Innovators works passionately, producing and delivering cutting-edge original content aimed to awaken a new reality. Because at Gaia, we believe when enough of us wake up, everyone wakes up.

As the SEO Strategist, you will be a member of our product organization. You will work closely with our Content, Product, Engineering, Design, and Digital Marketing teams to execute SEO strategies that measurably grow monthly subscriber acquisition. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced, self-starter to make a significant impact on a global subscription base.

Responsibilities
Be the sole architect, evangelist, and product owner for SEO on Gaia.com
Leverage your analytical skills to uncover actionable insights for growing monthly subscriber volume and leads
Develop and champion strategies to measurably improve monthly rankings, traffic, and conversions.
Champion the prioritization and resourcing of your strategies in the face of competing agendas and priorities.
Manage and coordinate the execution of your strategies via internal teams, external agencies as well as through your individual contributions and seeing them through to completion.
Dive into issues and incidents as they occur, perform ad hoc analyses as needed, and/or help escalate them to drive to resolution
Be on top of the latest trends such as HTTPS, AMP, Mobile First, Rank Brain etc.
Regularly Monitor and report on SEO KPI's such as rankings, traffic, and Google Webmaster Tools reports
Provide research and optimization consulting for other departments, stakeholders, and initiatives
Monitor and manage the overall SEO health of the Gaia.com domain including: indexation errors, crawling issues, internal linking, redirects, server response codes, sitemap issues, domain warnings, and more.
Proactively analyze and review site content, test modifications and scale optimizations across the domain.
Compile research, articulate POVs for senior stakeholders, and lead trainings for important colleagues in other departments possessing direct or indirect impacts on SEO
And more!
Qualifications

REQUIRED
BS degree in business, quantitative field, marketing, journalism or related discipline
5 to 7 years of digital marketing experience with an emphasis on organic search engine optimization in a B2C environment
Excellent communication, collaboration, planning and execution skills
Very strong interpersonal skills with a proven track record of working collaboratively across teams, departments, and functions
Strong analytical and presentation skills including high level Excel, PowerPoint and MS Word skills
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience working within various CMS platforms
Expert Knowledge of SEO Tools Including: Moz, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, Bing Webmaster Tools, and others.
An interest in Gaia's content is a prerequisite for applying
Previously existing Gaia membership is strongly preferred
Must be able to work in our office in Louisville, Colorado
US citizenship or an existing work visa is required
Non-smokers only
DESIRED SEO EXPERIENCE
Single Page App (SPA) SEO - Familiar with the SEO challenges of an SPA environment including render budgets, rendering best practices, troubleshooting common JS issues and more.
International SEO - Architecting sites for international expansion, serving multi-language content, proper geo-location, GSC administration and reporting.
Domain Migrations & Mergers - Having successfully migrated and redirected entire domains while preserving or improving SEO performance is strongly desired.
Content Marketing Programs - Develop and manage a content program that uses new and refreshed content to improve traffic, rankings, leads and conversions. Owning the topic identification, competitor analysis, keyword research, collaborating with content creators and tracking the results.
Working closely with UI/UX and Product Teams - Work closely with teams responsible for the continuous optimization of the Gaia.com product experience to ensure SEO improvements are integrated at each step. This can include optimal nav structures for efficient crawling and targeting of link equity, page templates that load quickly, content that aligns with user intent, and more.
Proactive SEO - Listening for and mitigating potential SEO issues before they arise. This could include: making sure changes to the affiliate program don't incur a paid linking penalty, CRO testing is implemented in such a way as to avoid cloaking, product updates don't create duplicate content, and more.
Advanced Technical SEO Skills such as markup, JSON-LD, canonicals, Javascript, server vs. client side rendering, single page apps, PWAs, AMP, etc.
BONUS FEATURES
Previous Agency or enterprise level client side digital marketing experience (i.e. 10,000+ URLs)
Familiarity with and experience working in an agile product and development process
Experience writing for an audience or blogging
Social media experience (either organic or paid)
Previous experience working for a Streaming Video on Demand (SVOD) service
Previous experience working for a subscription-based, digital publishing or new media service

Gaia exists as a transformational network to support a conscious global community. About

The associate director of SEO operations will be responsible for team excellence through the delivery of organizational efficiency across our search engine optimization department. The associate director of SEO operations will be expected to share news and research to benefit both clients and internal teams. The right person for the role will be a confident, persistent, entrepreneurial self-starter who can thrive in a fast-paced environment with coworkers in multiple locations. The candidate will be expected to earn the respect of teammates through both their subject matter authority and dedication shown in an ability to sustain department-wide adoption of technologies and processes.

Job responsibilities

Aid department head, team leads, and project managers in scoping projects and staffing
Work seamlessly with commercial operations, finance, and talent teams within the IPG family
Identify new opportunities for integrating with paid search, performance analytics, and others
Plan team events with our "people center of excellence" and secure funding from partners
Measure efficiency gained through time tracking and estimates of work saved
Support regional teams with client work when offices are overallocated
Operational expectations
Ensure the department has received training on both hard and soft skills to excel in their roles
Administer sources of truth and online channels such as Smartsheet, Asana, Microsoft Teams
Coach, mentor, and evaluate staffing needs to make recommendations for improving efficiency
Offer guidance and support as well as provide development opportunities and regular feedback
Be the first line of support for the team related to technology partners
Job qualifications
4+ years of digital marketing expertise with experience in SEO
Excellent written and verbal communication, plus organizational and project management skills
Solid understanding of organic search standards, projects, and implementation processes
Proficiency with enterprise SEO technologies and platforms including web analytics and audits
Consistent attention to detail and adherence to the highest levels of accuracy
Strong grasp of Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and project management tools
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

Company Description

Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention; to care more about our clients’ brands; and to buy more products and services from them.

Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.

With a Millennial-friendly, bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.

Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights; content and creative production; communications and strategy; finance and marketing; and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

Job Description

The SEO Manager will lead the design and execution of client SEO initiatives. The SEO Manager will work closely with the SEO Director and SEO Associate Director to develop strategies that meet and exceed our clients’ business objectives. This position requires a hands-on manager with astute attention to detail and process, and who possesses the ability to generate actionable insights and recommendations. The SEO Manager is responsible for managing client relationships on a day-to-day basis. This person might supervise and coach SEO analysts.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
• Develop and implement SEO strategies and tactics in line with client’s business objectives
• Manage on-page optimizations (metadata, keyword usage, internal linking, etc.)
• Manage offsite initiatives (link building, social media projects, etc.)
• Audit websites and provide technical recommendations for improving SEO performance
• Identify new opportunities and recommendations for improving client’s organic search rankings, traffic and conversions
• Manage monthly SEO reporting (keyword rankings, SEO traffic, conversion data)
• Develop insights to inform future optimizations and provide client with insights and optimization recommendations
• Contributing to new business pitches as needed
• Work with Associate Search Director to develop processes for improved work-flow within Performics and across agency partners and vendors
• Stay up-to-date on newest organic search, paid search and social media trends
• Research new ideas, trends, and technologies within the SEO space to educate clients and the Performics team
• Explain SEO best practices in simple terms to educate the client and third party stakeholder

Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree required
• 3+ years of SEO specific work experience, preferably in an agency environment
• Experience managing on-page optimizations (metadata, keyword usage, internal linking, etc.)
• Experience managing offsite initiatives to drive SEO performance improvements (link building, social media projects, etc.)
• Experience with link building and content creation for the purpose of improving SEO performance a major plus
• Technical knowledge/experience with the following: XML sitemaps, Robots.txt, HTTP responses and headers, and URL re-directs
• Content management systems and knowledge of HTML, XML, JavaScript, Flash, and CSS as they relate to SEO
• Common server-side scripting methods such as PHP
• Dynamic content-generating scripts and database integration scripts like jQuery, AJAX and JSON
• Knowledge of lead generation clients and SEO tactics necessary to generate conversions
• Experience in applying SEO to brand-building, direct response, and reputation management initiatives

Initiate research and insights for technical SEO, content, voice search, ecommerce, traffic growth, conversions and SEO efficiencies across multiple global sites and brands

Grand Canyon Education, formerly part of Grand Canyon University, became its own entity in July 2018 after the HLC approved GCU’s application to become a nonprofit institution. GCE will work in close partnership with GCU. Moreover, many positions with GCE are located on GCU’s main campus.

Grand Canyon Education’s Marketing department is seeking a full time Digital Marketing Specialist (DMS). This position will report to a Marketing Manager but work independently, collaborate with assigned marketing partners and University clients in planning, executing and overseeing digital marketing initiatives on GCE’s web properties. The DMS progressively will work on complex digital marketing initiatives and will work with higher visibility web properties as this role progresses through the department. The DMS a clients’ overall marketing campaigns, and works collaboratively with the marketing team project lead or the client on the implementation of web marketing plans which support the client’s total marketing strategy. Web marketing refers to marketing efforts that use website properties, which are leveraged to promote the University’s educational services and objectives.

Responsibilities:
Applies broad-based knowledge of digital marketing principles, techniques and project development in advising and assisting assigned University client group(s) in developing and implementing well-thought out and creative web marketing strategies and initiatives to meet the client’s organizational needs.
Builds, develops and maintains effective business relationships with University client(s) and marketing partners.
Serves as a key liaison with assigned client group and is perceived by key client as one of the strategic marketing representatives.
Facilitates and presents at all key client meetings in either developing or presenting web initiatives or strategies that would enhance the end-user experience with web properties.
May represent the digital marketing department with executive level groups in the University as needed.
In collaboration with the marketing campaign lead, interprets client’s needs and creates project plans for campaign launches to execute on time and accurately. Includes project planning, project plan creation and ongoing management, execution and implementation of web initiatives.
Coordinates with internal cross-functional project teams to create a strategic web marketing plan by utilizing both digital and traditional marketing methods/channels (i.e., brochures, flyers, posters, postcards, direct mail, billboards, apparel, emails, landing pages, micro sties, social media, radio, etc.), in order to create a cohesive and optimal user experience on web properties.
Responsible for the building, updating, publishing, status reporting, and stability of web properties that support the client, ensuring high quality standards delivery that meets or exceeds the client’s expectations, and the end-users needs.
Ensures defined brand strategy is consistently applied during development of web properties.
Supports the campaigns’ creative and messaging are connecting with the appropriate target audience(s), to research competitors, and find new and innovative ways to elevate the Brand, through web properties.
Develops performance metrics and reporting for ROI on designated web properties and recommends areas of improvement to marketing management.
Reviews effectiveness of implemented digital marketing projects and adjusts plans as necessary with project lead and/or clients; prepares and interprets associated digital marketing performance metrics.
Collaborates with other departments, including IT, to ensure that web projects are executed to their full potential, within deadline.
Provides advice, guidance and mentoring to prerequisite Digital Marketing Specialists as needed.
Manages web projects from start to finish, with designated University partners.
Stays abreast of current concepts, techniques, technology to offer contemporary solutions.
May provide direction, oversight and mentoring to less-experienced Marketing staff members, and student-workers.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, public relations, journalism or related field required from a regionally accredited institution. Master’s degree preferred.
A minimum of 5 years’ professional experience in web marketing.
Proven experience executing digital marketing campaigns for a variety of audiences.
An equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience may be substituted upon hiring manger’s approval.
Highly proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, (Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint), MS Project or similar project management software, social media platforms.
Proficient with Photoshop, Google Analytics, HTML/ CMS platforms.

Excellent oral and written communications; a good command of the English language and ability to provide clear communications among all stakeholders.
Ability to think quickly and respond immediately in strategy and information meetings.
Demonstrated knowledge of AP writing style.
Excellent planning, organizational and successful project management skills in order to translate, define, coordinate and manage project requirements based on stakeholders’ input.
An ability to help clients to clearly define needs and objectives.
Good attention to detail, analytical and networking skills.
Knowledge of media placement processes among multiple media channels.
Applied knowledge of marketing analytics, ROI metrics and earned value assessment.
An ability to work independently on a project or collaboratively as a team player and able to integrate with a diverse team with varying opinions and ideas.
Well-defined knowledge base in sales, marketing and business development concepts.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and cope professionally with changing priorities.

Provide a positive example to students by supporting the University’s Doctrinal Statement, Ethical Position Statement and Mission of Grand Canyon University.

NetCom Learning is an innovative leader in IT, business and executive training to companies, individuals, and government agencies. Do you love helping businesses with their digital marketing? Do you have a good grasp of how websites function? We’re a constantly growing internet marketing agency looking for an experienced search engine optimization specialist to join the team.

You’ll be responsible for generating SEO recommendations to increase web presence, drive traffic, build brands, and encourage conversions.

We’re proud to deliver the very best SEO services to a diverse group of local and national brands, and we’re committed to hiring SEO specialists with a proven track record of success for their clients.

We expect our SEO specialists to possess a thorough understanding of search engine optimization practices and principles, and to have experience implementing their recommendations and tracking the results.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
You’ll contribute to search engine optimization campaigns for clients. Every client is different, but this typically includes things like:
Conduct keyword research
Make on-site SEO recommendations, including site code, navigation, content, and usability recommendations.
Implement search engine optimization recommendations in a variety of content management systems.
Plan and execute campaign strategy.
Using analytics programs, show the benefits of SEO campaigns to clients, and interpret that data to help clients understand the value of SEO.
We believe in transparency, and each month we publish monthly reports and communicate campaign results to clients. You’ll also use web analytics data to make recommendations about what we can do next to help a client’s business.
We love our clients and take a lot of time to understand them and educate them in what we do. You’ll regularly meet and communicate with clients to understand their marketing needs, set their SEO strategy, and communicate successes and challenges.
Education is one of our core values. We’ll expect you to be a source of SEO expertise for our sales team, your team members and our clients. We’ll also expect you to be an aggressive learner working to fill gaps in your digital marketing knowledge and respond to changes in the industry.
We have a highly collaborative environment but also spend a lot of our time on solo projects. You’ll need a positive attitude, a team spirit, and the drive to master and be the owner of your own projects.
Job Requirements:
Understand SEO, online marketing, conversion optimization, and e-commerce best practices.
Understand the technical aspects of a website and how they affect SEO.
Stay abreast of industry developments and emerging strategies.
Create and execute SEO strategies. You should be able to speak comfortably to the value of different SEO activities and the returns they can gain for a client.
Know how to write. Fundamentals like grammar and spelling are a given but you also need to be able to write persuasive marketing copy and communicate effectively via email and written reports.
Juggle multiple projects, stakeholders and deadlines with confidence.
Understand how SEO objectives contribute to an overall marketing plan, and how to measure and adjust to make sure a client gets the most out of their campaign.
Meet deadlines, no matter what it takes, independently or as part of a team.
Talk to people, with ease. You don’t have to be a great public speaker but you should have good interpersonal and verbal communication skills.
Possess a good balance of a creative spirit and an analytical mind.
Be an aggressive learner: learn fast, be proactive, and contribute enthusiastically.
Education and/or Experience:
Minimum 1 year experience with SEO/internet marketing; more advanced position available depending on experience
A portfolio of relevant work or case studies (anonymized to protect client data is fine; we want to know what you did, what you measured, and how well it worked).
Experience with Google Analytics, Google Webmaster Tools and Google Keyword Planner
We spend most of our days online; you should have an enthusiasm for the internet and have already spent some time building a web presence.
Data analysis and critical thinking ability: You should be able to look at a set of data, draw conclusions about it, and communicate those conclusions.

Plan, develop and implement our SEO strategy work towards organic search optimization and ROI maximization regularly perform thorough keywords research strategies that guide the development & content processes.

Establishing and promote SEO guidelines, best practices and standards across business units.

THE POSITION
QuoteWizard, a LendingTree company, is seeking an Analyst to join our SEO/Content Marketing team. We focus on promoting the visibility of and traffic to our site through a multidisciplinary team of analysts, writers, and PR specialists.
The role includes the development of informational articles, tools and research used by thousands of consumers looking to learn about or purchase insurance products. Our goal is that Analysts will acquire a broad skill set with an understanding of how to develop a competitive consumer focused product. Analysts will grow proficiency and participate in article writing, consumer research, data collection, as well as gain expertise in the key metrics used to measure and improve the performance of their assigned verticals. This role will be heavily focused on creating the types of articles and guides that you see on our website.
This is a great opportunity to learn about digital and consumer marketing in financial industries, develop analytical skills, and partake in a successful and entrepreneurial environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Write and periodically revise in-depth guides and reviews of insurance products
Track and report on performance metrics for editorial content
Analyze informational guides and reviews of financial products and provide recommendations on ways to better meet user intent and expectations
Assist in data collection and basic analysis for development of tools and calculators on our website
Pitch and prioritize ideas for new content, guides and tools based on research into consumer needs and general trends
Propose hypotheses and lead tests to improve traffic, engagement, and conversions
Follow relevant news and conduct research into assigned topics to develop expertise
Track relevant industry and direct competitors' activity
Review and update in-house data resources for quality assurance purposes
Learn about and apply current SEO standards
QUALIFICATIONS
BA/BS with previous research experience or internship desired
Demonstrated history of being a self-starter with a strong work ethic and constant drive for improvement
Attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability and eagerness to interpret data
Collaborative team player with ability to work independently and manage multiple projects/tasks
Comfortable working with Microsoft's Excel (i.e. vlookup, pivot tables, graphs)
Comfortable with basic HTML
Background in the insurance industry
Background on digital marketing
Working knowledge of SEO best practices and tools including Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Microsoft PowerBI and SEMrush
About QuoteWizard Our office is located in downtown Seattle, in the heart of Pioneer Square. We cultivate a comfortable work environment, with plenty of onsite amenities (gym, locker room, lunch area, snacks, TVs, casual attire, ping pong, etc.). Come join a diverse and growing workforce of over 150 smart, driven people.
QuoteWizard by LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

What you’ll be doing...

The Digital Marketing & Demand Activation team at Verizon is hiring an SEO Strategist to play a key role in creating comprehensive online marketing strategies. In this role you will support an omni-channel strategy, execution, and analysis via SEO best practices and innovation. We are looking for a passionate search marketer with experience in technical SEO, content strategy, and data-driven marketing. You will actively contribute to our search strategy knowledge base as a subject matter expert, managing large-scale campaigns and projects for our consumer and business web properties. We expect you to come with hands-on experience with complex site architectures, and the benefits of thinking about SEO and SEM holistically. This is a unique role to work within a dynamic group that is defining the future of digital marketing for a Fortune 15 business.

Responsibilities:
Supporting cohesive, compelling SEO strategies that guide the development & content processes.
Serving as a trusted consultant, practitioner, and advocate for the SEO discipline.
Communicating strategic visions to internal stakeholders and partnering across business units (Marketing, IT, Consumer Insights).
Establishing and promote SEO guidelines, best practices and standards across business units.

But, we expect you to decompress and play with your peers during company-sponsored barbecues, ping-pong tournaments, and nights at Padres games.

As an SEO Manager, you’ll be responsible for managing all aspects of your clients’ organic search program. When we say all, we mean everything, so you can’t be afraid to get your hands dirty. From constructing the overarching strategy to executing the tactical recommendations, the SEO Manager does it all. As you can imagine, this is a client facing role so you are responsible for managing the client relationship and contributing to the growth and retention of each of you accounts. Your mission will be to drive organic performance to the client’s websites while offering solutions to their most pressing challenges in digital marketing.




/ What you'll do


The core responsibility for the role will be to understand, communicate and execute all things related to organic search. You’ll be involved with our clients in all aspects of their business activities, from reporting to executing strategies originating from campaign performance:
Convey key fundamentals of SEO to senior client stakeholders
Work closely with an SEO Supervisor to implement optimization strategies including, but not limited to technical audits, on-page optimizations, on-site content expansions, site migrations, competitive analysis, Internal linking, and structured data markup
Perform on-going research and develop reports by efficiently collecting data using various tools, such as Google Analytics, Omniture, Google Search Console, DeepCrawl, Ahrefs, and Buzzsumo
Demonstrate holistic awareness of SEO and emerging digital marketing trends, and contribute to thought leadership within the organization
Work on multiple projects concurrently, demonstrating the ability to multi-task while hitting tight client deadlines
Display a thorough understanding of each client, their business, and their competitive landscape
Work independently to recognize areas of opportunity and growth, while also working collaboratively with SEO team members and other teams within the organization
Exhibit a relentless interest in advancing the success of our clients & agency
Utilize critical thinking and problem-solving skills when fielding client requests in order to recommend the best possible solutions
Navigate client demands and expectations in relation to their scope

Experience in a client-facing role leading enterprise level accounts
A history of presenting SEO recommendations to clients in a clear, concise, and thoughtful way

Advanced technical SEO experience with enterprise level clients
A basic understanding of HTML and CSS

Knucklepuck is searching for an ambitious, motivated individual to join our rapidly growing team of digital-first marketers as a full-time SEO Consultant.

About Knucklepuck

We are a digital marketing agency dedicated to driving sustainable, bottom-line growth for our clients. To accomplish these goals, we become an extension of our clients marketing teams to create extraordinary web experiences. Our team is comprised of top-notch marketers specializing in content production, search engine optimization, paid media advertising, and web development. We mirror our own industry quick, quirky, innovate, creative, growing explosively and born of the digital revolution. Our clients span industries from e-commerce to local businesses to Fortune 500 companies.

We are seeking a self-starter who is passionate about driving organic growth through search. In exchange for your insatiable curiosity and SEO chops, we offer the opportunity to make an impact growing our own business and our clients businesses, to develop technical skills, and to share in the success of the company. Our team is well suited to grit hustlers who value a hard days work, the comforts of a beanbag chair and a quality pun.

About the Position

The ideal candidate already has a high-level foundation in SEO and is ready to take their skills to the next level. The SEO Consultant is a true team player who will be called upon to drive search engine optimization strategies, communicate directly with clients, and work internally to coordinate with members of our SEO, Paid Media, Content and Web Development teams. It is essential that this person has the desire to cultivate strong professional working relationships with colleagues at all levels within the company.

To succeed in this position, you must have:
1-3 years of demonstrated experience in organic (SEO) search marketing.
Experience working with WordPress or similar CMS.
Familiarity with important Google Algorithm updates, including Mobile-First Index, Penguin, Panda, and RankBrain.
A basic understanding of important on-page SEO factors that impact a sites ranking potential, including quality content, keyword focus, URL structure, title tags, meta descriptions, [h] tags, image alt text and anchor text.
A proven ability to combine and analyze data from multiple sources to interpret business performance and drive strategy.
Familiarity with social media and its role in enhancing SEO initiatives, particularly through relationship-building and link curation.
High-level knowledge of technical website elements that may inhibit search engine crawling and indexation, including information architecture, HTTP status codes and redirects, meta data, breadcrumb linking, canonical tagging, Robots.txt, crawl budget, site speed optimization, .htaccess, pagination and Schema markups.
Proficiency in Google Analytics, social media marketing applications (ex. Buffer, HootSuite, Tweetdeck) and leading content management systems (ex. WordPress, Shopify).
Exceptional working knowledge of Excel and other data analysis and business intelligence tools, as well as other MS Office and Google products.
Familiarity with reporting and opportunity analysis tools such as Ahrefs, Moz, SEMRush, Buzzsumo, and Screaming Frog.
Efficient analytical and organizational skills.
A tireless work ethic and passion for digital marketing.
Your primary responsibilities will include:
Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of SEOs role in brand development, digital PR, and content marketing as part of Knucklepucks integrated digital marketing approach.
Apply a strong business acumen to establish and monitor appropriate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to ensure campaigns deliver results that positively impact our clients business objectives.
Develop and implement a comprehensive and strategic roadmap for SEO designed to produce sustainable results that maximize search performance.
Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimization to execute on-page strategies that support a consistent content theme.
Leverage a combination of tools and manual research to perform competitive research identifying opportunities for pursuing search engine optimization strategies based upon those factors that the search engines are valuing for target queries.
Collaborate with Paid Media team to leverage complementary insights to ensure SEO strategy is consistent with paid search efforts.
Collaborate with Content resources to identify opportunities to create, distribute, and promote web content appropriately among target communities.
Contribute subject-matter expertise to internal and external thought leadership initiatives, including blog posts, lunch & learn sessions, and networking events.
It would be great if you have:
An understanding of search engine friendly design, development, conversion rate optimization, and user experience best practices.
Google Analytics certified
Agency experience.

Please complete the application on this page and upload your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements. Your cover letter should include explicit examples of how your skills are a match for Knucklepuck and specifically the SEO Consultant position. As a reminder, your cover letter is your opportunity to demonstrate what you can bring to this role and why you are the best fit to help us reach our goals, so make it count!

In the first line of your cover letter, please let us know where you think the name Knucklepuck originated from.

Solving the intricate challenges of companies that sell through complex channels has been our focus for over 30 years. We dig deep to gain insights, then build creative solutions that employ innovative technologies to measurably grow our clients’ brands and sales.

Established in 1981, we are a fast-paced, fun advertising agency located in Overland Park, Kansas. We’re seeking a Digital Media Coordinator (PPC & SEO) to fill an important function within our agency.

To be quite frank, our Digital Media Coordinator will benefit as a member of our team with:

An inspired group of professionals that know how to secure regular success and let lose

Solving the intricate challenges of companies that sell though complex channels has been our focus for over 30 years. We dig deep to gain insights, then build creative solutions that employ innovative technologies to measurably grow our clients’ brands and sales.
Established in 1981, we are a fast-paced, fun advertising agency located in Overland Park, Kansas

Job Description:

Basic Function: The Digital Media Coordinator provides entry-level contributions to the digital media team through the creation of deliverables including the development of reports, tracking and optimizing content and ad campaigns, and trend monitoring.

Specific Tasks/Responsibilities:
Maintain an understanding of the client's overall business and marketing objectives.
Knowledge of market research, current media channels and advertising options, and a willingness to follow media trends are essential.
Optimize media campaigns to both increase brand awareness and help achieve business objectives, as well as ensure ads reach target audiences through high-quality channels at the lowest possible prices.
Coordinate written requests such as a project scope of work or change requests.
Organizes thoughts in a logical, clear, and concise manner.
Provides detailed and thorough input to clarify ideas or goals
Stores all project-related documents on the Workamajig server as a reference.
Track and report Paid Search and Search Engine Optimization KPIs and trends in client-friendly format.
Conduct research, including target audience identification, competitive analysis, and website profiling, and search engine keyword analysis.
Understands insights and analytics across digital platforms.
Prepare optimization reports and bid recommendations based on crucial campaign metrics, including CTR, conversion rate, CPL, and ROI.
Trend and analyze results, make recommendations for future campaigns, and deliver relevant reports to the client team.
Is receptive to feedback, willing to learn and follow direction, and embrace continuous improvement.
Proactively communicate results with the digital leadership account team.
Produce strategic planning documents and competitive analyses.
Analyzes and recommend ways to optimize performance.
Execute digital marketing strategies to drive traffic and conversions to client websites.
Write creative copy.
Optimize performance through a digital media mix comprised of PPC/paid search, SEO, paid social, retargeting, and display media campaigns.
Analyze data and manage budgets, pacing, and client performance to goals.
Test the performance of ad creative, landing page design, beta opportunities, and other campaign elements to improve results
Mirror TfA's values:
Work collaboratively and inspire a sense of cooperation
Strive for success daily
Emphasize the detail, accuracy, and quality of your work and the work of others
Suggest clever and innovative ways to create company successes
Work hard and be dedicated to both internal and external clients
Continuously learn and better yourself through traditional and non-traditional methods
Take on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm
Special Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a marketing communications-related field
Fluent in Excel, PowerPoint, and proficient with various online tools.
Google AdWords certification a plus.
Familiarity with WordPress or similar platform preferred
Experience with design, publishing, web, and audiovisual production tools and software a plus
Avid media consumer with a keen interest in the effect of the Internet and digital technology on media consumption
Excellent communication skills including verbal communications, active listening and excellent written grammar and spelling
Anticipates client and team needs and offers help before it can be asked Strong interpersonal skills to foster optimal department relationships.
Detail-oriented and strong implementation skills.
Ability to create schedules and budgets and meet them.

Job title: Summer Digital Marketing Intern, SEO and Paid Social Focus
Description:
Summer Digital Marketing Intern, SEO and Paid Social Focus

Position Overview

Three Deep Marketing is searching for an ambitious, entrepreneurial spirit to join our team as a Digital Marketing Intern with an Organic Search and Paid Social focus. You will have the unique opportunity to work with every performance marketing team at Three Deep, but 50% of your role will be devoted to supporting and completing special projects for our SEO and Paid Social teams. Interns will also deliver a Three Deep Labs Project and present it to our entire organization.

Our work environment relies on our core values of Team First, Passionate, Problem-Solving and Accountability. We are looking for individuals who practice those core values daily. At the end of your internship, you will have gained broad digital and performance marketing experience and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced, professional work environment.

Scope

Calling all Jack's and Jill's-of-all-traits who are interested in a comprehensive look at performance marketing with an SEO and Paid Social focus. Your day-to-day responsibilities will range from internal marketing tasks to executing 1+ projects for each of our delivery teams: SEO, Paid Media, Email Marketing, Web Development, Analytics and Strategy. You'll also create a Three Deep Labs project, where you'll work with your Mentor on a real client pitch, demonstrating your marketing chops to our entire organization.

Key Responsibilities
Perform SEO Audits and Sales Scans.
Produce Keyword Analysis Reports.
Develop Meta Titles & Meta Descriptions.
Assist with various SEO projects such as content optimization, technical recommendations, local search strategy, organic traffic analysis, etc.
Research and propose marketing tactics to deploy across social platforms leveraging the always-evolving landscape of new tools and best practices.
Create, edit and publish social media content across various platforms.
Create social media posting calendars for various clients that ladder up to broader editorial content calendars.
Monitor and share competitor analysis across various channels including organic search, organic social media and paid social media.
Moderate customer comments across owned client channels.
Assist in Customer Journey Mapping for clients or sales team.
Shadow delivery teams and participate in projects related to SEO, Paid Media, Email Marketing, Analytics and Marketing Strategy.
Assist Marketing Team with agency marketing and internal efforts.
Develop a Three Deep Labs project with your mentor.
You'd be a good fit if you have:
Strong desire to learn along with professional drive. We're looking for candidates who are willing to make the most of this experience and ambitious about success.
Recently obtained degree in Marketing or related field or graduating with degree in 2020.
Passion for SEO and the performance marketing industry and its best practices.
Technologically literate with strong computer skills including being comfortable with the Microsoft Office Suite Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and other commonly used software.
Experience with SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads a plus.
Excellent understanding of punctuation and grammar.
Good organizational skills and record keeping (attention to detail is critical).
Ability to work well with all levels of internal management and staff.
Cheerful presence and people skills.
Skill in establishing priorities and managing workload.
Details
Start Date: May 25th, 2020 (flexible)
End Date: August 28th, 2020 (flexible)
Hours: 40 hrs per week
Paid Internship
Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of nondiscrimination in employment on any basis including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

Three Deep Marketing is a digital performance agency. We offer a full portfolio of professional services using proprietary technologies and business expertise to design, deploy and optimize marketing campaigns to support both Fortune 500 companies and small and medium business.

Our services include marketing strategy and planning, database marketing, search optimization, paid media, campaign management and execution, web development, and program reporting and analysis.

Trust is the center of our business. It governs everything we do and makes up the heart of our brand promise, "Today and every day, our neighbors trust us to help repower their lives". Our story began in 1988 with a single location in Green Bay, WI. Today, Batteries Plus Bulbs has over 700 retail store locations across the country.
