POSITION TITLE: Digital Marketing Specialist-SEO/SEM

FLSA STATUS: Exempt

POSITION TYPE: Full-time

REPORTS TO: Marketing Manager

SALARY RANGE: $55k-$60k

UPDATED: February 25th, 2020

Smart City is a hyper-personalized, human-centered apartment locating service that saves renters time and money when searching for a new place to live. A unique lead generation system paired with our proprietary internal technology has created over 4300% growth in six years. Smart City has caused a major disruption in an antiquated apartment locating industry, all while being able to scale to a significant $19m in revenue with no outside funding. Even more impressive and unlike many startups in the real estate space, Smart City has continued to remain profitable during all high growth periods.

The Position

The purpose of the Digital Marketing Specialist-SEO/SEM is to plan and execute a cohesive search engine marketing ecosystem based on a predetermined budget to optimize marketing lead gen efforts.

As a Digital Marketing Specialist-SEO/SEM, you will develop, optimize, and execute search engine marketing plans and campaigns to ensure revenue, budget, ROI, and other business goals are met. You will analyze data, identify trends in order to expand and optimize our client database, and manage all of our PPC accounts (Google Adwords, Bing, YELP etc.). Your goal is to reduce overall advertising spend while increasing lead gen and web traffic through organic and paid sources. The KPIs you are in charge of include the number of leads generated and cost per lead.

The Responsibilities/Key Expectations
SEM Account Management - manage, create, and execute on all PPC ad campaigns
Oversee all of our SEO and SEM/PPC initiatives to maximize local reach in all markets
Plan, setup, optimize and manage all campaigns
Manage and optimize budgets, A/B test ad creatives/copy, keyword research, set up audiences, and optimize for conversions and KPIs
Keep up to date on industry trends to educate the team and implement on best practices
Optimize copy, blogs and landing pages
Create new blogs and landing pages
Perform keyword discovery and optimization
Research and implement SEO recommendations
Research and analyze competitor advertising links
Develop and implement a link building strategy internally
Work with the in-house dev team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented
Project manage outsourced agencies as needed
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, and linking as needed
Report and analyze data
Seek out new opportunities and propose new ideas/platforms
Collaborate with the creative, email, and digital marketing teams to increase lead gen through paid media
Other duties as assigned including but not limited to managing other advertising platform and optimization
Experience/Qualifications
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in SEM, PPC, and SEO
2+ years of SEM copywriting experience
Experience working with Wordpress, HTML, CSS, Javascript
Proficient using SEO tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, TagManager, AdWords, and SEMRush.
Experience performing algorithm research and successfully implementing changes
Experience in lead generation and B2C marketing
Experience running A/B tests, retargeting, and remarketing
Experience executing and managing ad campaigns
Proven experience doing keyword research and implementing new SEO strategies
Must be comfortable managing relationships with stakeholders across the company and expectations for deliverables
Strong written and oral communication skills. We want someone who will not just produce the right numbers, but be able to clearly explain and make useful recommendations.
Attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy on work output
Able to work quickly and prioritize multiple projects
Critical and analytical thinking skills
Must be a team player
Google Certification(s) a plus
Hubspot experience preferred
TYPICAL OFFICE HOURS: Monday - Thursday: 8:30am - 5:30pm, Friday: 8:30am - 4:30pm

Who We Are

We are more than just an apartment locating company. We love what we do, and we work all the time because to us, it doesn't feel like work. We believe that professionalism is doing what you say you're going to do. We pride ourselves on teamwork, and we live for helping others. We get excited when faced with a tough challenge and go the extra mile to achieve our goals. We believe in quick communication, accessibility, transparency, and having fun while putting in good old fashioned hard work. We go above and beyond, we are hyper-personalized, and we make friends, not clients. You are not just another email address, and we are not just another real estate service. We are Smart City.

Here's what our company believes in:
Honor Bound – We do what we say we're going to do, and we don't need to wear a suit and tie to do it.
Overachievers – We always go the extra mile.
Never Settle – We are constantly striving for growth, both personally and professionally.
Optimistic – We are a genuine force of positivity, not like rainbows and butterflies, but like, life is good.
Real People- We treat everyone like friends, and we're real human beings who make mistakes sometimes. Let's learn from it and move forward.
Our team is extremely important to us and we're excited to have been recognized as one of Dallas Business Journal's ‘2019 Best Places to Work'.

Perks - you know you want ‘em
Competitive salary
Comprehensive and flexible health benefits plan
PTO
Monthly cell phone stipend
Annual professional self-development stipend
Casual dress code
Dogs as far as the eye can see
We Take Equality Seriously

Does the goal of increasing OnLogic’s organic traffic by 30% sound like a challenge you’d be thrilled to take on? Want to do more than just write what you're told? Are you eager for the opportunity to craft the message that will generate interest in our latest products?


As OnLogic strives to become the world’s First Choice in Industrial Computing, the SEO Content Writer needs to ensure OnLogic is top of mind -- and at the top of the list -- when prospective customers take to the internet to find an industrial computing partner that will help turn their ideas into reality.


The SEO Content Writer also conceptualizes and creates compelling content for our product marketing campaigns that convinces prospects that land on our site to engage with our technical sales team and try our products.


This is what your role looks like. You:
Create a plan each quarter that defines the content needed to reach our goals for organic traffic.
Perform keyword research and competitor benchmarking to uncover new topics and storylines for content pieces.
Collaborate with Engineering, Product Management, Tech Support and Sales to investigate and develop technically-oriented topics and write articles that provide value to our existing and prospective customers.
Analyze trends in impressions and traffic for onlogic.com and revise existing content to improve search rankings for target keywords and phrases.
Lead interactions with Design, Ecommerce & Digital Marketing teams to implement all content created.
Write all long-form and short-form content needed for product marketing campaigns, with direction provided by the Marketing Manager on pieces needed for the site, blog, ads, email, social, events, etc.


Who we are looking for:
You are a skilled writer that knows how to create content that addresses customer pain points while still being search engine-friendly. Not only are you adept at working independently on keyword research and content planning, but you’re also excited to collaborate with Marketing, Design, Engineering, Product Management and Sales to create all of the content pieces needed for product launches.

This is you!
You quickly learn and understand new products and technologies in order to create informed and relevant content.
You can analyze keywords in SEMRush and Google Search Console to independently identify content opportunities.
You’ve created content calendars and stick to them.
You can share examples of consistent streams of content you’ve written like weekly blogs or daily social posts.
You have a list of landing pages you have optimized to generate additional traffic by improving search rank.
You only put pen to paper once you know the keywords you’re optimizing for and what the ideal outcome/Call To Action is for a piece.
You’ve used Yoast SEO and know how to balance the scorecard with readability to create great content that people can actually find and want to read.
You can move between independence and collaboration, always maintaining open communication between all parties.


Why OnLogic?
OnLogic is growing, and we're offering you the opportunity to grow with us! At OnLogic you'll join our ambitious team, guided by our core values. We operate in an open environment, which extends to everything from our open salary policy and open office layout, to our commitment to having open and honest conversations about all aspects of our work and culture. Please click here to learn more about Life at OnLogic.


We strive to be fair in the decisions we make and the way we treat one another while encouraging input and feedback from every member of our team. Innovation is vital to our continued growth, and we depend on every team member to take initiative and ownership of both their own, and the company's success. At OnLogic you'll have the opportunity to truly build the future of technology while building your own career.


We offer:
A competitive Salary and comprehensive Benefits package
401k Plan with 3% Employer Safe Harbor Contribution
Participation in the Annual Profit Share Bonus
Paid Maternity & Paternity Leave, and Short & Long Term Disability
Optional Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Open ears for innovations and ideas
A personal development plan created to help you (and us) grow
Incredibly awesome colleagues, fun working environment and serious responsibilities

Who is OnLogic?
A global industrial PC company focused on hardware for the IoT edge, OnLogic designs highly-configurable computers engineered for reliability. Our systems operate in the harshest environments and power innovation in the evolving Internet of Things. Fueled by a unique direct-to-customer business model that combines vertical integration, modular product design and a powerful online platform, we create computers “designed to last, built to order, and delivered in days.” Founded in 2003 as Logic Supply, OnLogic has served more than 70,000 customers and has offices in the US, Netherlands, Taiwan, and Malaysia. Learn more about how builders, makers, and doers are making the impossible possible using OnLogic hardware at www.OnLogic.com or on Twitter @OnLogic.

OnLogic is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

THE POSITION
Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate - maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:
Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: creating a great resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You're not alone. In addition to the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money
RESPONSIBILITIES
Use SEO tools (Google Webmaster, Analytics, SEMRush) to track the performance of published content
Research, write and publish data-driven auto insurance content in accordance with ValuePenguin's search engine optimization (SEO) best practices
Continually evaluate and refresh ValuePenguin's insurance content in order to make it more useful to consumers and effective in driving traffic. Your goal will be to improve both user engagement and SEO performance
Conduct research to answer the questions: What tactics do other sites use to provide mobile-friendly web content? How can we improve our own process accordingly?
QUALIFICATIONS
Very bright (3.5+ GPA required) undergrad or grad student who will be graduating in December 2020 or May 2021 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered)
Very proficient in Excel (e.g. direct exp. with Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.)
Demonstrated writing proficiency, particularly in a style that is clear and accessible - writing samples will be required
Prior digital or organic marketing experience, a plus
Self starter who can work independently. The work will involve a summer-length independent project and will require comfort working with a high degree of autonomy
Willingness to roll up sleeves and GET STUFF DONE!
WHY LENDINGTREE?
We're making a real difference in the financial lives of consumers. The work you'll do here matters
Chance to work with top professionals who previously worked for other leading technology companies like Google, Apple, Microsoft and LinkedIn
Unique entrepreneurial environment filled with flip-flops, t-shirts and people that take their job seriously. LendingTree is a start-up company in publicly traded suit. Read: we have a lot of fun and can afford the latest toys!
COMPANY
LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices.
Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.
What else you should know:
We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.
CULTURE
We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, Get Stuff Done).
Come work with us!
LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Job title: Internship - SEO and Content Analyst - Summer
Description:
Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

THE POSITION
Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate - maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:
Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: creating a great resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You're not alone. In addition to the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern will give a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money
RESPONSIBILITIES
Conduct competitive and consumer research with tools like SimilarWeb, SEMRush, Ahrefs and Google Trends
Research insurance products to create consumer-focused analyses
Optimize content performance by running tests and tracking key metrics with Google Analytics, Webmaster and Excel
Assist with data collection, analysis and reporting to update and create new content, especially product roundups
Learn organic marketing best practices
Summarize test results and share findings with peers
Collaborate with a cross-functional team and participate in high-impact, idea-generation sessions
QUALIFICATIONS
Very bright (3.7+ GPA required) undergrad or grad student who will be graduating in December 2020 or May 2021 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered)
Very proficient in Excel (e.g. Pivot Tables and VLOOKUPs)
Excellent writing and quantitative analysis skills
Prior digital or organic marketing experience, a plus
Motivated self-starter, with a high capacity for rapid learning and the ability to work independently
Willingness to roll up sleeves and GET STUFF DONE!

JOB SUMMARY

As a Manager of Content Strategy / SEO, you will work cross-functionally with our Digital Marketing, Creative, Product and Development teams to lead Content and SEO initiatives to create a seamless customer journey throughout the entire shopping experience while driving organic growth across all web properties. This individual will manage our top-tier SEO agency and ensure we implement SEO best practices to grow traffic and increase conversion rates and revenue. You will be an expert in optimizing content, develop link-building initiatives, maximize keywords, and manage our copywriters to ensure that all our online marketing content is written with a direct-response focus, follows brand guidelines, and in a tone that helps customers through their buying process. In this role, you will be an integral part of our strategic marketing process so that our services (Spectrum TV, Internet, Voice, and Mobile) are accurately depicted throughout our websites. In addition, by owning this content, you will enable all pages to have improved search engine crawlability and indexation. As a high impact and highly visible position, there is strong support from the executive team to invest and succeed in driving continuous organic growth, as well as engineering resources to implement site enhancements.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate with people in a variety of UX design-related jobs to shape our customer's experience by creating useful, meaningful copy and help set the vision for content and drive cohesive product narratives across multiple websites.

Achieve a unified voice across websites so that customers are easily lead through their buying decision.

Experience leading usability studies, working with user research and analyzing customer feedback.

Ability to help define and maintain brand voice and tailor content for mobile experiences.

Write and maintain a Content Strategy and Offer playbook that clearly explains how we speak to our customers, what our Products entail, required legal language / disclaimers, and how we go to market within digital marketing.

Own the responsibility for the strategy and execution of large-scale organic search projects for America's fastest-growing TV, Internet and Voice provider.

Dive into SEO-relevant data to transform data sets into actionable insights and develop tactical next steps to drive organic acquisition.

Creation and ownership of overarching SEO strategy for various properties. Ensuring website technical health adheres to SEO best practices. Execution of on-page product and template meta data content optimization.

Provide strategic guidance and critical thinking for organic initiatives, serving as a key consultant for multiple groups with different goals and processes.

Partner closely with copywriters to create compelling content rooted in organic search data and best practices

Build relationships with and educate individuals on the value of organic and content marketing to turn strategies into actions.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge

Experience leading SEO strategy.

Experience developing relevant content.

Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with stakeholders across the company and facilitate communication between teams.

Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and analytics to determine page performance, opportunities to optimize sales and plan new testing strategies.

Strong attention to detail, balanced with the ability to think strategically.

Advanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint; proficient in other desktop applications.

Education

Bachelor's Degree and/or equivalent experience

Related Work Experience

SEO experience (agency side preferred); 3+ years

Managing website development; 3+ years

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge

Knowledge of cable television, high speed Internet and phone products and services preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment

R/GA is searching for an SEO Manager to join our growing Media team in New York. The SEO team is a critical part of the experience design process at R/GA that drives strategy, design and execution of web development projects. In this role, you will work closely with our design and technology team members to build high quality user experiences that are SEO forward thinking and driven by search data insights. As part of leading creative agency, you will also have a unique opportunity to influence creative decisions in situations on all sorts of projects.

We are looking for someone to not only act as a project lead, but manage and mentor other SEO strategists. In this role you will also be an important contributor to developing our unique brand of search strategy. If you consider yourself an SEO nerd, have an entrepreneurial spirit, love transforming data into action and want to work with one of the most well known creative teams in the world, then this may be the job for you!

Responsibilities
Act as a client facing SEO project lead on cross-discipline and SEO centric projects
Develop SEO strategies that drive experience roadmaps and content strategy
Work with department leadership to develop internal processes and roadmaps to expand our SEO practice and capabilities
Mentor and manage junior SEO team members
What you bring to the table
You love search! When you talk about SEO people find it interesting and exciting.
Not only are you data literate, you love working with data. Pivot tables, vlookups and complex Excel functions are part of your muscle memory.
You know your way around Google Analytics, Search Console and similar tools. You can quickly and efficiently leverage this data to guide teams to make decisions and develop strategy.
You have hands-on, basic front-end web development experience. If asked to, you could build a small locally hosted website using just HTML and CSS.
You have years of experience with popular SEO tools like Screaming Frog, Majestic and SEM Rush to name a few and probably use some that we've never heard of.
You have expertise solving SEO problems common to large websites such as implementing international SEO best practices, managing content migrations and addressing over-indexation issues.
You are comfortable leading meetings and are able to clearly communicate abstract problems and solutions to our clients and internal teams.
You are collaborative, mature, poised and work well with others during challenging project situations and tight timelines.
You have no problem managing deadlines across multiple projects. You know how to prioritize but also when to ask for help.
Our dream candidate also has some of the following
You cannot be defined as left-brained or right-brained. You may be known for your analytical skills but you always have a strong creative point of view.
You do not see SEO as the limit of your responsibilities or your interests. R/GA is constantly changing and so is our Media team. We want you to be part of shaping our unique offering and thinking beyond SEO.
You have experience with managing campaigns in paid search (SEM) and other paid media channels.
You have original thoughts about SEO and the SEO industry. You've published a blog post or two on an SEO topic and maybe even been a speaker at a conference or meet-up.
You have agency and non-agency experience. SEO has not been your entire career and you bring a diverse set of experiences to share with our team.

About The Position


We're looking for a dedicated, driven people-pleaser to help guide our customers in the overall SEO process.

As a part of the HOTH X team, you will be the main point of contact with our customers throughout the entirety on our monthly managed service, HOTH X. Daily tasks include hopping on the phone with clients for onboardings and consultations, production tasks pertaining to your customers' specific needs, conducting SEO research, and all around helping make our customer experience awesome.

The ideal candidate for this role is comfortable with speaking to clients over the phone, has great time-management skills, and is an all-star at building relationships. Prior SEO knowledge is not required (but certainly helps!) - since this is an entry-level role, we provide all the training and tools necessary to speak with our clients about SEO strategy.

This is a very important position and a high growth opportunity.

This role is a full-time position that will report to our beautiful Downtown St. Petersburg office and will be eligible for all full-time team member benefits as detailed on our Careers Page.

Also, we work with clients in a variety of time zones and have opportunities for early, late, and regular work shifts to accomodate all clients. If you're an early riser or night owl, let us know!


About You
You love helping people achieve what they set out to do.
You can systematically sort through problems and provide solution options.
You have a customer service background.
You're comfortable building client relationships over the phone and email.
You get energy and excitement from helping people.
You're ready to learn in a fast-paced environment.
You want more.
Skills/Knowledge You MUST Have
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent customer service skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
Systems oriented.
Ambition to learn and grow
About Us


We're one of the best types of companies to work for We're already successful and growing, but not so big that you can't be heard.

We began as a small, bootstrapped startup from Chicago and we have now grown to be one of the largest Search Engine Marketing providers in the world.

Thanks to our maniacal commitment to Hitting our customers Over The Head (aka. HOTHing) with awesome products and service, we've grown to well over 10,000+ high value users all over the world.

Our mission is to help as many people in the world with Search Engine Marketing as possible, and have a blast while doing it.

We currently have a core team distributed throughout the US with a central office in St. Pete Florida, as well as a large international team.

Here are some reasons you want to work with us:
We are a driven, successful, fun company that is experiencing insane growth.
We have awesome products, a great reputation, and systems for everything.
Our branding is nuts. Our mascot is The HOTH monster and we have a 6' tall HOTH costume.
We're awesome. 100% results driven. No bullshitters.
You will work with a small team to make sure our customers are getting world class support.
Cool office environment in downtown St. Pete - voted one of Tampa Bay's Coolest Office Spaces by the Tampa Bay Business Journal!
Our compensation package is very competitive. We're talking:
401ks
Healthcare

Job title: SEO Manager - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description:
SEO Manager, Hearst Enthusiast GroupHearst Magazines is looking for a creative and talented SEO manager to work with our Enthusiast brands Runners World, Bicycling, and Popular Mechanics. Combined, these sites generate more than 15 million users each month who are as obsessed with our brands as we are. From millennials to marathon runners, tech nerds to space geeks, youll be able to help shape content creation each and every day.

As a company, Search plays an important role and produces a healthy variety of traffic. Were seeking a rock-star of sorts that can assist our associate SEO director to bring our strong Search foundation to the next level. Working directly with our digital editors, youll get a front line view of the latest gadgets, record-breaking athletes, eCommerce everything, and at times, youll get to help be part of the testing process (hello, new running shoes).

While this is mainly an SEO role, we are also looking for someone with an analytical mind. As we continue to make smarter decisions based on data, this role will be responsible for providing insights to help shape content strategy, whether that be organic search, paid, or even newsletter.

Heres what youll be responsible for:
Create a unique SEO content strategy for each site that seamlessly mixes into their editorial calendar and voice. Sure were talking about keyword ideas, but also new areas of content opportunity overall, emerging trends, ever-changing seasonal opportunities, and innovative takes on whats buzzing on the InterWebs.

Optimize content on the regular, whether its on-page headlines, meta titles, slugs, or body copy, you know what the page needs to rank in Google.

Work directly in our CMS updating meta info, creating URLs, working on all sorts of internal linking, creating collection pages, and monitoring redirects.

Use our analytics tools to provide reporting to stakeholders on whats working and whats not working. Analyze data to provide recommendations on what we should be doing more of.

Keep tabs on keywords that have been assigned, completed, and published. Youll see a story through from start to finish.

Live and breathe all things Search. Stay on top of the industry, test out new product features, and ensure were always playing nicely with every algorithm update. Youre basically like the algo police.

Qualifications:
2-4 years of hands-on SEO experience
A minimum of 2 years of recommending/creating Search-specific content
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written
Strong analytical skills
Must be able to collaborate and foster positive relationships with colleagues
Extremely detail-oriented and thrives in a fast-paced environment
Experience with Google Webmaster Tools
Experience with Keyword Research Tools
Experience working with CMS
Proficient in Excel
Proficient in Google Analytics
Experience with YouTube and video optimization

*_Accountabilities_**
At Cardinal Health, the marketing organization is the central hub of business driving activity\. Marketing takes the lead on all aspects of the marketing mix - product, price, place, people and promotion\. Marketing analyzes customer behavior to understand their needs, and motivations, broadly defines and communicates the brand purpose and passionately delivers total solutions for our customers\.

As part of Cardinal Health's Digital Marketing Center of Excellence \(COE\), the SEO Analyst will champion the use of keyword research and content optimization by performing SEO research and providing and implementing updates to content across the enterprise that will improve the SERP rankings driving an increase in organic traffic to cardinalhealth\.com and subsequent subdomains\. Reporting to the Director, Digital Operations this role will have the following responsibilities:

Responsibilities:

+ Reviewing and analyzing internal client site sections for areas that can be improved and optimized
+ Working with our SEO solution and strategic partner to prioritize work, implement deliverables, perform research and analysis
+ Perform ongoing keyword research including discovery and expansion of keyword opportunities
+ Preparing detailed strategy reports
+ Identifying powerful keywords to drive the most valuable traffic
+ Writing powerful calls\-to\-action to convert visitors
+ Filling website\(s\) and other content with effective keywords
+ Prioritize and develop relevant, effective and engaging content\.
+ Developing link building strategies
+ Analyzing keywords and SEO techniques used by competitors
+ Keeping updated on both white hat and black hat SEO strategies to stay within search engine guidelines
+ Compiling and presenting SEO guidelines
+ Create and implement content update process with multiple internal clients across the enterprise
+ Create and implement testing of various search engine marketing techniques and web site layouts for search engine optimization\.
*Key Requirements \(preferred\)**
+ Prior experience in content marketing, content growth and SEO
+ Working knowledge of search engine optimization practices
+ Outstanding ability to think creatively, strategically, and identify and resolve problems
+ Excellent verbal and written communication skill
+ Ability to work within a team and independently
+ Familiarization digital analytics \(e\.g\. Adobe Analytics preferred or Google Analytics\)
+ Experience with website optimization tools \(e\.g\. SEMRush preferred or Conductor Searchlight\)
+ Strong organizational, time management, and analytical skills
*_Qualifications_**
+ Bachelors degree in related field, or equivalent work experience, preferred\.
+ 4\+ years experience in related field, preferred\.
*_What Digital Campaign Management Development contributes to Cardinal Health_**
Digital Campaign Management is responsible for developing and driving digital marketing campaigns and strategies that meet and/or exceed business objectives and provide additional insight about our customers across all digital channels\.

+ Creates compelling marketing programs to drive revenue and sales in support of business objectives\.
+ Plans, manages and executes all web, SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media, advertising, and promotional campaigns\.
+ Identifies trends and insights, and optimizes spend and performance based on the insights\.
+ Utilizes strong analytical ability to evaluate end\-to\-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points\.
+ Evaluates emerging technologies and provides thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate\.
+ Collaborates with internal teams and vendor partners to achieve desired results\.
*_What is expected of you and others at this level_**
+ Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
+ May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
+ Works on complex projects of large scope
+ Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems\. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
+ Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
+ Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
+ May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues

_Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer\. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status\._

Job title: SEO Manager - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description:
Job DescriptionWynn Resorts is looking for a SEO Manager who can strategically and technically own the indexibility and overall exposure of our websites within search engines. This role is a unique opportunity to act as a crucial member of a fast-paced, collaborative team, which will play a huge role in driving towards our business' growth and success. As the Technical SEO Manager you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing our on-site SEO strategy. Deep understanding of leveraging Screaming Frog, hreflang tags, HTML, CSS, Javascript, schema, Webmaster Tools and deep technical audits are going to be crucial for success.

Responsibilities
Plan, develop and implement our technical SEO strategy to increase overall organic position and engagement.
Identify technical related errors preventing maximum efficiency and ROI.
Regularly perform thorough keywords research and highlight new content opportunities.
Identify and own all key SEO KPIs.
Monitor redirects, canonical tags, click rate, bounce rate, and other KPIs.
Identify and implement a strategy for optimizing website for mobile and voice search.
Prepare and present reports regularly to management on progress and organic growth.
Identify technical problems and deficiency and implement solutions with Product and IT teams in a timely manner.
Collaborate with paid search and metasearch teams to co-optimize SERP presence.
Stay up to date with the latest SEO and digital marketing latest trends and best practices.

Job Requirements
3-5 years of experience in planning and implementing a successful SEO strategy as a SEO Manager or similar role
Technical SEO expertise (Canonicalization, Sitemaps, Crawl Budget, Schema, Page Speed etc.)
Comfortable retrieving and analyzing data from Google Search Console, Bing Webmaster Tools, and Google Analytics
Technical SEO audit experience on international enterprise websites (over 100 pages)
Deep level of experience with Screaming Frog, Conductor and other, similar SEO tools
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, look-up function and conditional functions)
Experience analyzing server logs is a plus
Experience with site migrations and consolidations is a plus
Deep understanding of the Sitecore CMS is a plus
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus

As an SEO Specialist, you'll be responsible for executing the SEO strategy for our clients. The ideal candidate will be a fast learner, willing and able to learn about various industries and treat each client's business as if it were your own!

Responsibilities:

*Company Overview**
Brookfield Properties has an immediate need for a SEO & SEM Specialist at our corporate office in Chicago, IL.

At Brookfield Properties, the foundation of our success is firmly rooted in our people.

Our company is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving to meet the needs of our communities and stakeholders. To meet this goal, we hire visionary, entrepreneurial talent who help us innovate and enhance our business. We build collaborative teams who value integrity, creativity and diversity.

Our teams operate an iconic portfolio of irreplaceable properties within the world's most dynamic markets. As one of the largest real estate services companies, we provide management and development expertise exclusively for properties owned by Brookfield Asset Management.

Our retail group operates destination, standalone retail real estate globally, including over 150 malls in the United States. Our regional shopping centers create a sense of place in the heart of the communities in which we do business: offering retail, lifestyle, dining and entertainment options.
*Position Overview**
This position will support the Sr. Manager of Search, SEO & SEM, by helping to develop and execute both organic and paid strategies related to key Marketing programs, including website optimizations, keyword research, pay-per-click advertisements, and more. The Specialist, SEO & SEM will partner with key stakeholders within and beyond the Marketing team, as well as with external resources.

Key Responsibilities:

+ Supporting the development and execution of a roadmap that addresses short- and long-term SEO & SEM goals

+ Collaborating with Marketing and IT to ensure proper implementation and effectiveness of on- and off-page SEO strategies

+ Monitoring and evaluating search results/performance across major search channels in order to improve rankings, as well as website metrics, in order to identify trends and help develop SEO strategies

+ Assisting with the development, creation, publishing, and optimization of B2B and B2C content, in collaboration with Marketing team members and Brookfield Properties' SEO agency

+ Leverage research and data to make keyword recommendations for PPC campaigns, content creation, and on-page SEO.

+ Maintain and optimize campaigns by reviewing CTRs, CPCs, and Conversions while also performing A/B tests for optimal engagement.

+ Collaborating with SEO & SEM lead to identify and provide guidance on strategies and synergies between paid and organic search activities

+ Assisting with the creation of key reports related to SEO and SEM

+ Keep up to date with industry trends and willing to implement new features/ideas to keep our strategies fresh and optimized.

+ Other relevant projects as assigned.
*Qualifications**
+ Bachelor's degree required

+ 2+ years of experience in SEO & SEM, including 1+ year of technical SEO expertise (canonicalization, sitemaps, crawl budget, etc.)

+ Knowledge of and experience with helping execute SEM programs and optimizing based on data gathered from both organic and paid sources, including campaigns meant to drive revenue and/or leads

+ Knowledge of and experience with retailing and shopping centers preferred but not required

+ Driven marketing professional with up-to-date knowledge of SEO and SEM strategies and best practices

+ Strong creativity and forward-thinking mindset to see the big picture and long-term opportunities for the team

+ Comfortable with tackling ambiguous questions or situations in order to uncover potential insights; ability to build relationships across the Marketing team and with other key business partners

+ Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills, including an extreme attention to detail; ability to clearly communicate timelines and priorities

+ Excellent organizational and time-management skills; strong team player with ability to develop effective working relationships across the organization

+ Experience in using key drivers and performance metrics to enable superior marketing programs; an innate curiosity about data

+ Knowledge and hands-on experience with crawlability tools (i.e. ScreamingFrog); experience with keyword tools (i.e. Google Keyword Planner, SEMrush); experience working with CMS (i.e. Adobe AEM) and building/administering content in CMS environments; intermediate Excel skills; experience with web analytics tools (i.e. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics); proficiency with HTML/CSS; experience with Google Ads (certification a plus)

The Search Engine Optimization Manager responsible for defining the market opportunities, marketing, & analysis/optimization of the organization's services and/or products which may include consumer & market insights, digital marketing, advertising, and analytics. He or she may be allocated to focus on a particular component of the marketing life cycle and or channel. This is Senior/Management level position which requires expert knowledge and little to no instruction.



**General Responsibilities**



Responsibilities are applicable based on the position focus/channel



+ Helps to identify, analyze/execute new and potential product/services, markets, and advertising opportunities.

+ Collects and analyzes data on established and prospective customers, competitors, and marketing channels/sources.

+ Prepares reports that interpret consumer behavior, market opportunities/conditions, marketing results, trends, and investment levels.

+ Investigates & evaluates marketing methods, consumer insights, advertising channels, and their results in an effort to continually improve results.

+ Prepares & presents materials/findings both internally and externally for the marketing focus/channel he or she supports.

+ Provides insights which facilitate the development of plans for partner promotion

+ Executes against partner marketing plans to deliver results that exceed defined objectives

+ Provides World Class Marketing Client Service Management by creating synergies with our internal teams & Academic Partners which empower us to exceed our objectives.

+ Creates buyin from multiple constituents in a collaborative crossfunctional environment

**General Qualifications**



+ 4-year degree from an accredited institution in Marketing or equivalent discipline OR appropriate combination of experience and education* Minimum 5 years' experience in SEO

+ Minimum 3 years' experience managing a team of SEO Analysts.

+ Sr. level position requires expert level experience in the following areas:



+ Specific knowledge about search engines and their ranking algo's.

+ Deep knowledge of SEO practice and methodology, including architectural and design competencies, content and writing knowledge; as well as off-page link and promotion understanding.

+ Expert understanding of SEO kpi's and reporting/analytical tools Moz., Raven Tools, Keyword Spy, Link Sleuth etc.

+ Very strong knowledge of Web Analytics applications such as Google Analytics Experience with a wide variety of Content Management Systems, Web Site Architecture, and knowledge of HTML

+ Experience with web analytics and a/b testing applications

+ Experience with the development, management, analysis, reporting and forecasting of media campaigns

+ Experience in or with digital marketing for lead generation, channels, sources, best practices and KPI's.

+ Experience managing out-sourced vendors

Manages a team of 4-6 SEO Analysts across multiple locations

Job Summary:

Reliant is seeking an experienced Sr. Search Engine Optimization Marketing Specialist with strong skills, experience and expertise in SEO strategy and implementation. This position is onsite and fulltime located at our office located in Houston, Texas. The Sr. SEO Marketing Specialist will manage and oversee the execution of a large company SEO strategy while developing and executing key individual strategic SEO plans designed to maximize traffic volume, conversion, and ROI. The ideal candidate will have experience in applying data insights to editorial decisions; ideally, you will have experience with performance metrics related to the marketing funnel.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Oversee all aspects of the SEO strategies and execution of reliant.com and other brands, including the electricity, Security by Reliant, and Reliant Home Services lines of business to maximize organic volume, conversion and ROI all while progressing towards the larger company SEO strategy.
Develop, manage, monitor, and execute a transparent larger SEO strategic plan and vision that aligns with the company's goals and metrics.
Ensure and constantly improve the SEO based organic enrollments that drive millions of dollars of business value to the supported brands and verticals.
Define, tune, execute, and capitalize on content gaps with our competitors, content growth, and content optimization opportunities.
Research, analyze, and keep abreast of SEO best practices, strategies, channel performance, and development changes, to provide guidance and consultation services to multiple implementation, marketing, and business teams.
Deliver insights, manage and support site optimization efforts using SiteCatalyst, Test & Target, Foresee and SDL Tridion.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and upper management to establish KPIs and related metrics for new products, site enhancements and site redesigns as well as with content strategists to optimize efficacy of messaging, branding and digital communications to all users.
Provide strategic and tactical recommendations and support to business managers, marketing, creative, IT, and UX pertaining to SEO.
Perform audits on sections of the site and make content recommendations on how to increase referral traffic from search; help writers improve their craft with an eye toward making long-term SEO gains.
Ability to write content for SEO
Extract insight from campaign data, identify relevant trends and provides well-developed proactive recommendations to enhance and exceed overall client search marketing goals and objectives.
Exhibit clear understanding of overall client brand messaging and goals, and manage the development of content for search engine marketing purposes, including but not limited to, keyword generation, blog and social media copy creation and website copywriting.
Manage SEO projects from end to end.
Develop, execute and monitor keyword rankings with proven data.
Weekly reporting of SEO strategies and results to management.
Keep current with trends and advancements in technology, SEO, UI/UX, Google algorithm updates, etc.
Manage vendors, vendor relationships, and systems utilized for SEO
Collaborate with SEM strategy/execution
Reputation management and local strategy
Minimum Requirements:
3-5 years of SEO experience with up-to-date understanding of organic search trends and proven ability to achieve top search ranking results
Bachelor's Master's degree in information systems, computer science, marketing, business and communications
Experience in developing and maintaining business reports and performing ad-hoc analysis with demonstrated skills in data interpretation and statistical analysis
Expertise in usability principles, website and SEO best practices
Experience working in the following Google Data Studio, Adobe T&T, Adobe Analytics, Google 360, Google Search Console,
Technical understanding of SEO:
On-Page SEO (Image Alts, Meta Tags, etc.)
Off-Page SEO (Link health review, Link Building, etc.)
Technical SEO (Page Speed Optimization, Rich Snippets, etc.)
Knowledge in Title Tagging and Meta Descriptions
SEO audits of client websites to ensure that all ranking factors are implemented correctly
Preferred Qualifications:
5 years of SEO experience with up-to-date understanding of organic search trends and proven ability to achieve top search ranking results
Experience working with and reporting web traffic, financial/business reporting and analysis; Ability to communicate clearly and effectively to various groups, including all management tiers
Understand Google Quality rater guidelines
Fluency with content marketing/working with other internal stakeholders to leverage things like PR for SEO benefits.
Google Analytics certification a plus.
Google AdWords certification a plus.
Experience in BrightEdge
Fluent speaking, reading and writing in Spanish is a plus.
Experience working on a complex network of sites
Experience in working with onsite, technical, content, video and social media optimization.
Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to work proactively and independently to meet multiple project deadlines Ability to multi-task and prioritize as needed.
Ability to learn new software and concepts quickly ability to learn and adapt to evolving conditions and fluid requirements.
Attention to detail and deadlines with a track record demonstrating initiative, drive and quality output.
Excellent oral, organizational and written communication skills troubleshooting and critical thinking skills.
Strong and demonstrated problem-solving skills, with the ability to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution.

SEO knowledge around technical topics.

Responsibilities

Develop and execute successful SEO strategies for all sites in the Wild Sky Media portfolio

Conduct keyword research to guide content teams

Review technical SEO issues to recommend prioritized fixes for the Engineering team

Lead Best Practice initiatives to optimize website content, landing pages and paid search copy

Direct ethical off-page optimization projects (e.g. link-building) that will not jeopardize good standing with Search Engines

Collect data and report regularly on traffic, rankings and other SEO aspects

Work with social media and Performance Marketing (PPC) teams to optimize SEM campaigns

Keep abreast of industry SEO trends, tools, and strategies. Bring those learnings into the companys standard practices and infuse the company culture with them.

Proactively provide consistent reporting and feedback of results and challenges to global stakeholders

Requirements

Proven experience as SEO Manager, SEM Manager or similar role

Knowledge of standard and current SEO practices

Knowledge of HTML/CSS

Experience with SEO reporting and ability to calculate SEO metrics

Familiarity with relevant tools (e.g. SearchMetrics, Conductor, BrightEdge, Screaming Frog, MOZ, SEMrush) and web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, WebTrends, Google Search Console)

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

Strong organizational, problem solving and leadership skills working across departments and regions (Bangkok, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, etc)

Analytical mindset with numerical aptitude

BSc/BA in Marketing, Business or related field

Must be Thai National or have a valid work permit

Wild Sky Medias evolution to a global entertainment and digital media company. The Digital Engagement team at Terminix is looking for a Manager of SEO who will be leading the growth and the maximization of the revenue generated by online sales of Terminix products and services through our organic search channel for Terminix.com.

Job title: Service Engineering Operations (SEO) - Technical Support Analyst - Cam
Description:
*33762BR**
*Job Title:**
Service Engineering Operations (SEO) - Technical Support Analyst - Cam
*Job Description & Qualifications:**
*Service Engineering Operations (SEO) - Technical Support Analyst - Campus Req**
Ford is looking for talented individuals to be our next generation of innovators and leaders. As part of Service Engineering Operations (SEO), the Technical Assistance Center team assists Dealers in solving complex vehicle concerns, shares technical information and emerging concerns with the problem-solving teams in the company such as engineering and plays a key role in the development of future leaders in SEO.

Technical Support Analysts work on specialized vehicle commodity teams using their critical thinking and problem solving skills to provide technically accurate and professionally communicated recommendations to the Dealers to help get vehicles fixed right the first time. It is a unique opportunity to demonstrate your passion to learn and be part of automotive and mobility leadership, apply your automotive knowledge and skillsets in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and make a difference while developing your own technical and professional skills.

You will be provided training on technical concepts and specialized vehicle commodity skills, repair capability and service processes, professional and soft-skills. You will also spend time with a trained mentor, to ensure that the combination of the knowledge and expertise gained in your college classes along with our specialized training, provide you with the skills required to jump into the role and successfully assist our Dealers.

Minimum Qualifications

?Bachelor's Degree in automotive-related programs such as, but not limited to, Automotive Technology, Automotive Technology Management, Field Service Operations, Advanced Vehicle Systems, Automotive Engineering Technology, Automotive Service Technology and Automotive Industry Management

?GPA of 2.8 or above

?Must be willing to relocate to SE MI

?Candidates must graduate and be available for work prior to September 2020

Preferred Qualifications

?Strong desire to learn and go further

?Excellent communication skills and emotional intelligence to build relationships with team members and customers while representing the Ford brand

?Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills that demonstrate the ability to use many resources to resolve complex technical and business-related concerns

?Ability to adapt to a dynamic, diverse working environment that fosters skilled and motivated people working together to deliver results Automotive dealership or independent hands-on diagnostic and vehicle repair experience

?Fluency in French or Spanish is a plus

?Proficient computer skills

Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to permanently work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

Identify and Resolve Technical SEO Issues
Set-up Google/Bing Webmaster Tools accounts for client websites, and monitor them regularly for crawling and indexing issues
Have a solid knowledge of the search engine spidering, crawling and indexing process, while understanding the importance of XML sitemaps, robots.txt files and 301 redirects to those processes
Have a solid knowledge of web server function, including common server error codes (e.g. 404)
Have a strong familiarity with the web development process, including the important points at which SEO must be considered
Demonstrate understanding of how duplicate content and page load speed affects SEO by advising clients on best practices for successful implementation and improvement
Expertise in resolving back end issues in web design
Monitor, Analyze and Report on SEO Performance
Monitor sites regularly for technical crawl issues and other relevant errors using a variety of SEO tools and expertise
Analyze backlinks to identify outdated links, 404s, incorrect redirects, or opportunities for competitive improvement
Prepare periodic reports (weekly/monthly/quarterly, as appropriate to the project) that surface important trends and campaign progress
Audit Websites for SEO Issues
Using a variety of tools (including Screaming Frog, FireBug, and others), inspect websites for on-page, off-page and technical issues
Conduct Keyword/Persona Research
Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover optimal keyword targets
Determine the persona of the ideal target, and align SEO strategies and tactics accordingly
Determine the metrics that are most important/relevant, and align SEO strategies and tactics to maximize impact (and ROI) within the budget available
Consult on Site-Level SEO Strategies
Develop content creation strategies/roadmaps
Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for site navigation, breadcrumbing, internal links (including anchor text optimization), and HTML sitemaps
Communications
Prepare project deliverables with a high-level of quality (in terms of both substance and format). Documents will be accurate, grammatical, easy to read, and spell-checked
Surface project/campaign issues to supervisor in a timely manner
Prepare for, attend, and contribute to internal and client-facing project meetings
Requirements

The ideal candidate for this position should be able to (or possess):
Communicate complex SEO strategies
Measure the success of SEO campaigns with use of web analytics and SEO campaign management tools
Sound technical understanding of how search engines, web servers and user agents work
Up-to-date understanding of organic search trends, including search engine algorithm changes, the latest tools and technologies
Excellent presentation, communication, analytical and problem-solving skills

Job Title:

Location:
US, California, Santa Clara
Role Overview:


McAfee is looking for a seasoned SEO Manager who is ready to take the next step in their career to join its performance marketing team that is responsible for driving customer acquisition for its consumer business. This is a high impact and high visibility role in the organization with the mandate to help transform the way Organic Search drives customer acquisition. As a senior member of the marketing team, the person will be responsible for developing innovative and impactful acquisition strategies across multiple global regions.This is fast pace role with high bar for SEO, analytical skills and ability to drive full-funnel marketing to acquire and engage customers.

This is a unique opportunity to build and lead comprehensive and innovative SEO program for an industry leader in Cyber Security. The role requires hands-on, agile and resourceful problem solving & prioritization of both day to day management and investment in long term strategic innovations. This position reports to the Head of Search Marketing and has global ownership of SEO.

Company Overview

From device to cloud, McAfee provides market-leading cybersecurity solutions for both business and consumers. McAfee helps businesses orchestrate cyber environments that are truly integrated, where protection, detection, and correction of security threats happen simultaneously and collaboratively. For consumers, McAfee secures your devices against viruses, malware, and other threats at home and away. With the mission of capturing the biggest market share in the area of cyber security, network security, endpoint security, threat research, malware research, cloud security, we work together for a common goal of shaping the companys future by designing and building best in class cyber security solutions.

About the role:
Own and drive a revenue & operations for Organic Search with defined quarterly and yearly growth targets by up-leveling the SEOs core infrastructure, content, and links globally. As an SEO lead, you will run a cross functional team of engineering's, content managers, agencies to hit monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
An entrepreneurial, self-starter who conveys a balanced sense of urgency, drives issues to closure, and gets things done
Be fiercely competitive and stimulate a sense of urgency, creativity, and curiosity to build best in class SEO capability that not only outperforms competition but also sets the benchmark for best practice globally
Understand how changes in cybersecurity, consumer needs and competition impact SEO strategy and execution to stay ahead of the trend
Sophisticated ability to assess disparate data streams and distill them into meaningful and actionable strategic recommendations
Deep understanding of customer lifetime value, recurring revenue and subscription-based business models
Lead daily agile pods to manage and measure performance across campaigns, keywords and initiatives with defined Objectives & Key Results (OKRs)
Influence a cultural change at McAfee including new page development processes, on-page optimization, structure data, global navigation, etc.
Lead engagement with cross functional stakeholders to drive smart infrastructure evolution and be the driving force behind building a reliable foundation of SEO technology and content program.
Identify trends and opportunities to drive higher rankings and search coverage. In addition, conducting regular audits to evolve and advance SEO tech & content
About you:
Senior level experience in digital marketing, with active / hands-on experience in Organic Search
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills to structure complex & at-times ambiguous problem into meaningful and actionable work plan
Proven track record of leading a large global team and digital transformation
Powerful communicator with ability to engage and influence senior management
Deep understanding of SEO and market dynamics driving rank and visits
Familiarity with core performance marketing platforms and other marketing analytics tools, including any of:
Google Search Console, Adobe Analytics & Marketing Cloud, SEM rush, etc.
Passion for technology, marketing and its influence on consumer behavior
Company Benefits and Perks:

Our corporate culture and values are central to McAfees philosophy. Every day we embrace a more diverse workforce and inclusive environment. We are encouraged to bring our true selves to work. Our wide range of social communities & programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits, all allow our employees to feel valued as people, while enjoying positive and challenging work.

Check out more: Careers & Life at McAfee.

Pension / Retirement Programs
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage Programs
Paid Time Off
Support for Community Involvement

We're looking for a data-driven, creative, and collaborative SEO Manager to drive organic growth.


The Asana marketing team is focused on driving growth and building a brand that customers love. We focus not only on acquiring users, but also on creating content and campaigns that nurture existing teams and drive them to upgrade. Our team is growing rapidly, and includes team members focused on product marketing, content creation, partnerships, ads, and lifecycle marketing.


What you'll achieve


As an SEO Manager, you will be responsible for identifying and executing technical and content-driven organic initiatives to acquire Asana users. You will operate throughout Asana's organization to deliver search insights that can shape and improve our global marketing programs. You will partner closely with our entire Acquisition team as well as our various marketing and creative teams in San Francisco.
Build a roadmap of experiments and initiatives to drive organic traffic, signups, and revenue and measure the impact of these initiatives.
Work with in-house and agency web development teams to implement technical SEO updates.
Partner with Asana's content teams to create best-in-class content that solves user needs based on search intent data.
Present a strong perspective about what good SEO looks like, and create a system that ensures teams throughout Asana are aligning with SEO best practices.
Monitor the organic performance of Asana properties as well as competitor sites.
Partner with our Marketing Analytics team to create and deliver SEO performance reports, and provide actionable insights for partner teams.
Lead and work with Asana's SEO agency and external partners to drive results
About you
5+ years of SEO experience working with a complex website
Expertise in the tactics of both technical and content SEO across all major search engines
Strong data-driven approach to problem solving
Ability to collaborate and build relationships with in-house content and technical stakeholders
Ability to deliver organic results without compromising the brand experience for users
Working knowledge of BI and SEO tools. (We use Looker, Redshift, Google Analytics, Google Optimize, Search Console, Stat, and SEMRush.)
About us


Asana is a leading work management platform, helping more than 70,000 organizations and millions of users across 195 countries organize and manage all of their work, including AB-InBev, Airbnb, AllBirds, KLM Air France, Kohl's, NASA, Panera, Sephora, Uber, Viessmann Group and Vox Media. Asana has been named a Top 5 Best Place to Work by FORTUNE three years in a row, and one of Glassdoor's and Inc.'s Best Places to Work. Headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Dublin, Sydney, Vancouver, and Reykjavík, Asana is always looking for curious, collaborative people to be a part of our inclusive culture and help us achieve our mission.


Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of all educational backgrounds, gender identities and expressions, sexual orientations, religions, ethnicities, ages, citizenships, socioeconomic statuses, disabilities, and veteran statuses, and we'd love to learn about what you can add to our team.

Website Optimization SEO Manager
Parsippany , NJ

As a Sr. Technical SEO Analyst at The Home Depot, you will provide the key building blocks for the entire organic search marketing team. Position reports to Search Account Manager.
No direct reports

Company: Cimpress/Vistaprint

From its brilliant but modest start, Vistaprint has grown into an e-commerce powerhouse. Through a groundbreaking business model supported by patented and proprietary technologies, Vistaprint does what no one else can. Vistaprint's Search Engine Optimization team strives to grow organic traffic in innovative and sustainable ways. If you're a problem solving data enthusiast who is interested in sharing your passion with other people and growing your skills in SEO you will love your role here. Taking advantages of different sources of data to provide clarified storytelling with data.

Experience with Google Analytics and any of PowerBI / Tableau / Looker an asset.

Self-Starter with the ability to quickly learn, influence others and inspire change
