Company Description

As an Etsy employee, you can do the work you love, be yourself, and make an impact in the lives of millions. Our commitments to diversity and inclusion, team culture and the spaces where we work all reflect our mission to keep commerce human.

Job Description

We are looking for a high-impact product manager to help build out the future of SEO at Etsy, laying the foundation for organic buyer growth for years to come.

As a Product Manager for SEO you'll own the execution of site-wide projects focused on increasing organic traffic to Etsy, fueling future growth for our creative sellers. You'll partner closely with the Marketing team and Head of SEO to develop and execute a strategic SEO roadmap. The position is a full-time position located in Brooklyn, NY.

About the Team

The SEO team is part of Etsy's Growth product team, focused on fueling future growth for our millions of creative sellers around the world. Whether a buyer is browsing for an occasion, finding something they already have in mind or shopping for someone else; the page they land on should make it easy for them to find exactly what they're looking for. Our team partners closely with various marketing teams to make our vision come to life and to connect offsite marketing with onsite product experiences that match buyer expectations.

Qualifications

About the Role
Lead key products & initiatives focused on increasing organic search engine traffic Build strategic partnerships with Etsy's marketing and related product teams.
Integrate user research, market analysis, and community feedback into product requirements.
Inform product decisions with quantitative and qualitative data on user behavior and experimentation (a/b testing).
Define and articulate guidelines, principles, expectations, goals and success metrics for each product.
Work closely with a passionate team of product designers and engineers in order to build and iterate on key features.
About You
You have worked on a user growth or marketing related product team.
Have 2-3 years of product management experience.
Have experience working in environments which employ agile development methodologies.
Have an inspiring and engaging communication style.
Are a natural collaborator who knows how to drive crisp decision-making.
Are data-driven but able to make strategic decisions in the absence of data.
You've balanced business needs and strategy with product requirements seamlessly.
You've worked closely as a partner to our high-performing engineering, design, research and analytics teams.
Additional Information

At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We welcome people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.

The Motley Fool’s mission is “To make the world smarter, happier, and richer." For 25 years that has meant providing impartial and informed investment recommendations that aimed to cut through the noise and jargon and help everyday individuals make the best decisions possible.

Ever the insatiable Fools that we are, our coverage is expanding beyond investments. The Motley Fool has launched several new brands to deliver that same high caliber, credible content in areas where misinformation runs rampant and the Fool voice can make a difference. In addition to helping you become an all-star stock market investor through Fool.com, we can also help you:
Identify the top providers to find the right credit card, consolidate your student loan debt and open your first brokerage account (The Ascentand MyWalletHero)
Cut through the jargon and guide your first foray into commercial real estate investments (Millionacres)
Identify the software tools and solutions that will effectively grow your small to medium sized business (The Blueprint)
Reach all of your personal finance goals like paying down debt, making extra money on the side, creating a rock-solid budget, travel hacking your way around the world, and retiring early (Soapbox)
Find the best pho restaurant within a 50-mile radius (we can dream, right?)
Since each of our new ventures are growing quickly, we’re actively hiring in each of these business lines. Our goal is to get to know you first and as our conversations continue, we’ll figure out which area is the best fit!

If you think you’ve got what it takes to make the cut, enter the gauntlet by applying below.

Some of the things you’d potentially do:
Engage and optimize in areas like site architecture, page load speed, and indexing.
Perform on and off page technical SEO audits.
Collaborate with various disciplines (content, social media, tech, business intelligence, etc.) to implement SEO strategies.
Monitor daily performance of site rankings with a focus on defending and maintaining those rankings.
Regularly review traffic and conversion data to gain insight into keyword and landing page performance.
Assist with building and optimizing the internal linking strategy to maximize rankings.
Conduct competitor analysis to identify gaps in our content coverage and areas of opportunity.
Conceive and execute link building and outreach efforts.
Perform keyword research and grow our targeted keyword portfolio.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of SEO in line with industry trends, creatively keeping us a step ahead of our competitors.
Preferred Qualities:
Passionate about SEO and proactive in staying up-to-date on all the latest trends and best practices.
Exceptional organizational and project management skills.
A self-starter who learns quickly and is comfortable with rapidly evolving expectations. Be prepared to frequently face new challenges and adapt accordingly.
Relentless pursuit of self-improvement. We want candidates who continually desire to be better.
Passionate about data-driven problem-solving.
A nice-to-have is interest in the stock market and financial space.
Candidate must “get” Foolishness, have a sense of humor, and work well in a collaborative environment.
Position is full-time, in-house, in Alexandria, Virginia. We will not consider a “work from home” scenario. We want to see your shining face.

Education and Job Knowledge:
Undergraduate degree in any relevant field. Equivalent experience may substitute.
1-3+ years experience in an agency or a similar SEO-related role for a more junior-level role. 5-10+ years experience for a more senior-level role.
Experience with industry tools (e.g. SEMRush, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Deepcrawl, Moz, Ahrefs, BrightEdge, STAT, ScreamingFrog, Adobe Analytics, Searchmetrics).
Functional knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

The Motley Fool’s mission is to “make the world Smarter, Happier, and Richer.” We are now expanding our coverage to include real estate investing through Millionacres, which aims to do for real estate investing what The Motley Fool did for equities. We provide comprehensive and unbiased guidance for real estate investors of all sophistication levels, spanning free content available on Millionacres.com to paid premium services that include specific recommendations on investment opportunities.

You’ll be charged with optimizing the hundreds (soon thousands) of pieces of content published for organic traffic on our free site, Millionacres.com. You will have to frequently audit our rankings, defend our winning pages, and modify our articles in moderate positions to rank more prominently. Whether that means improving internal linking, rewriting the page, creating mixed media for the page, adjusting H2s, and everything in between, you will have the resources needed to catapult our content from position 7 to 2 on a daily basis.

Primary Responsibilities:
Assists in analyzing Google Analytics, Search Console, and SEO tool data to discover SEO opportunities.
Monitors Google Analytics, Search Console, and SEO tools to identify and investigate existing or emerging issues that may have a negative impact on SEO.
Builds internal links between content pieces.
Optimizes search listings for the highest possible CTR, including writing/rewriting meta-titles and meta-descriptions and enhanced snippet optimization.
Reconfigures post layouts for best SEO optimization practices.
Optimize images as needed, including title, ALT tags, and sizing.
Conducts keyword research and analysis, as needed.
Conducts content briefing for new articles, as needed.

Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in SEO (content marketing also a plus!).
Passionate about SEO and proactive in staying up-to-date on all the latest trends and best practices.
Experience with industry tools (We’re super users of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMRush, Moz, DeepCrawl, Ahrefs).
Exceptional organizational and project management skills.
Experience working with large brands driving outcomes for highly trafficked websites.
A self-starter who learns quickly and is willing and eager to adapt as the business does.
Relentless pursuit of self-improvement.
Passionate about data-driven problem-solving.
Candidate must “get” Foolishness, have a sense of humor, and work well in a collaborative environment.

The Manager will be responsible for SEO strategy, reporting, and consulting for three leading clients in the Global Beverage and Insurance verticals. The ideal candidate must be able to proactively communicate ideas and opportunities, as well as conduct in depth analysis to support recommendations and insights. They are responsible for executing strategies, and filling the role of an industry SME. This role requires a high degree of inter-agency collaboration, balancing demands across clients, and engaging directly with senior client leadership.

Responsibilities:
Develop detailed optimization strategies that increase the company's search engine results rankings
Research SEO keywords to use throughout the company's website and marketing materials
Set measurable goals that demonstrate improvement in marketing efforts
Monitor daily performance metrics to understand SEO strategy performance, and prepare/present client performance presentations
Efficiently communicate with other marketing professionals to align goals
Collaborate with others within the marketing department to manage SEO strategy
Update content and website links for maximum optimization and search engine rankings
Conduct linking and technical website audits
Consult internally on all matters affecting SEO
Contribute to industry research and POVs as needed
Stay up to date on search news and trends
Required Skills

5+ years of experience in successfully developing and executing SEO/SEM campaigns
Outstanding ability to think creatively, strategically, and identify and resolve problems
Understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods
Experience with SEO industry programs, such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Knowledge of keyword research and data mining tools
Able to complete competitive analysis of other companies within the industry
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable analyzing high volumes of data on a daily basis
Experience working with CMS and building/administering content in CMS environments
Ability to work on multiple clients/assignments simultaneously
Motivated, self-starter
Tools (encouraged but not required)
Google Search Console
MOZ
Screaming Frog

Required Experience

PMC: E-commerce SEO Manager


Penske Media Corporation (with leading content brands such as Variety, Rolling Stone, WWD, Deadline, Hollywood Life, Robb Report, and more) is looking for a multi-talented candidate to work with content creators, editors, product managers and web developers across the entire portfolio of our online properties to lead our e-commerce SEO strategy.


This position will report to the Director of SEO and work closely with PMC editors on a daily basis to optimize commerce focused content. The E-Commerce SEO Manager will work with industry-leading websites and make a direct impact to the bottom line of well-known brands.


Responsibilities:



Editorial
Drive e-commerce SEO strategy across a portfolio of high profile brands
Work closely with PMC content creators to maximize the search traffic potential for each piece of e-commerce content published on our sites.
Conduct e-commerce keyword research to inform content strategy
Educate and provide regular feedback and recommendations on headlines, image tags, meta tags, URL structure and related aspects of SEO
Come up with strategies to address common e-commerce SEO issues like duplicate pages and thin content
Conduct competitive analysis and inform editorial teams on current market trends
Have a working knowledge of top e-commerce sites (Amazon, Target, Best Buy, etc.) and stay informed on how their strategies evolve over time
Provide content analysis reports on the performance of specific pieces of content and seasonal e-commerce campaigns
Technical
Analysis and implementation of best practices for on-site SEO including: site taxonomy and architecture, URL structure, internal linking structure, XML sitemaps, duplicate content, meta data, structured data, redirects, content overhauls and more
Working knowledge of http status codes and how best to implement/address them
Monitoring and managing the health of sites by leveraging tools like Google Search Console, Google Analytics and other industry tools and services
Working knowledge of WordPress
Assist in QA process of new SEO related plugins, front end changes, etc.
Product
Collaborate with product and business teams to propose new products, changes to existing site structures and content offerings to further maximize search traffic potential
Provide SEO feedback during development of new products and site features.
Document e-commerce SEO guidelines/best practices and educate in-house teams to keep the latest SEO techniques top of mind.
Stay abreast of notable search product updates, changes to the Google algorithm, and related industry trends and SEO techniques
Have working knowledge of the rules around Google News and ecommerce content
Traffic
Provide ongoing reports to executive management related to search traffic and keyword performance, ROI, website traffic levels and customer acquisition
Find new opportunities to maximize SERP rankings for groups of strategic e-commerce keywords
Develop e-commerce link building strategies and/or direct marketing relationships with off-network sites.
Qualifications:


Minimum 3-5 years of e-commerce SEO related work experience.
Demonstrated results increasing site rankings and search traffic
Experience with SEO analysis pertaining to keyword trends and performance
Demonstrated success with increasing organic referral growth
Self-motivated individual who is driven towards continual improvement of projects
Must be entrepreneurial and require minimal oversight
Must have good communication skills
Must be detail orientated with the ability to multi-task in an ever changing environment
Analytically focused with the ability to recommend and implement optimization from review of performance data.
Vital Tools: Google Analytics, Google Search Console, WordPress, Keyword research tools, SEOMoz, SEM Rush, Deep Crawler, Screaming Frog, etc.
About PMC:



Penske Media Corporation (PMC) is a leading digital media and information services company whose award-winning content attracts a monthly audience of more than 180 million and empowers more than 1 million global CEOs and business thought-leaders in markets that impact the world. Our dynamic events, data services, and rich content entertain and educate todays fashion, retail, beauty, entertainment and lifestyle sectors. Headquartered in New York and Los Angeles with additional offices in 11 countries worldwide, Penske Media is the way global influencers are informed, connected, and inspired. To learn more about PMC and its iconic brands, visit www.pmc.com.

Be Challenged

Visiture is a rapidly growing eCommerce agency headquartered in Charleston, SC with a thriving office in Midtown Atlanta as well. We are looking for an extraordinarily talented individual to join our team.

We are seeking someone who craves a challenge and is passionate about increasing conversion rates and increasing revenue. Visiture markets its services to a broad range of online merchants looking to increase their online sales and profitability including SPANX, Just for Men, Title Nine, Mitchell Gold Bob Williams, and more.

Position Summary

Visiture is seeking an Account Manager responsible for Content Coordination to be part of our SEO services team. The Account Manager will drive strategy and be responsible for content creation and production.

You will work closely with the SEO Client Services and content writers to implement the initiatives underlying our Client’s SEO strategy.

Principal Responsibilities

You will report directly to the Manager of SEO Client Services. You will be managing client relationships and relationships with the writers. This includes advising clients on SEO best practices, topic selection, content writing, and posting.

Qualifications

2+ years' experience as a full-time search engine optimization specialist or related position.

A comprehensive knowledge of SEO tools such as SEMRush, Ahrefs, AdWords (keyword tool), and Google Analytics.

Strong knowledge of online retail (eCommerce) businesses and website migrations or re-platforms a huge plus.

Strong knowledge of SEO and the “white hat” way.

Advanced knowledge of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) strategies and techniques.

Ability to set and execute strategies to improve the organic rankings of Visiture’s SEO clients.

Keyword research to identify and discover new targeting keywords and explore content strategy.

Conduct market research and competitive analysis to assess strength, weakness, opportunities, and threats of online marketing strategy.

Work with the SEO team to monitor, track, and analyze ranking performance on an ongoing basis. Ability to pivot/optimize SEO campaigns as necessary.

Keep abreast of the latest SEO tools and techniques and communicate learnings to non-SEO experts in a mentoring role.

Solid work ethic, adaptable to a fast-paced environment and works well under pressure.

Very detail oriented.

Strong, solid team player.

Strong self-motivator with the ability to prioritize and multi-task independently.

Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with internal and external customers.

Excellent professional, communication skills both verbal and written.

Resourceful–with the ability to research and solve problems independently.

Proficiency in MS Office Suite and/or Google apps (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is a must.

A bachelor’s degree in a field of study around marketing or computer science.

Preferred

Certification with Google Analytics and Google AdWords.

A strong knowledge of Brian Dean and Neil Patel philosophies.

A proven track record of successfully optimizing eCommerce SEO efforts.

A master’s degree in a field of study around marketing or computer science.

Customer Service experience.

Our Perks

Highly competitive compensation package (including 401K, comprehensive health/dental/vision package, paid parking) and opportunity to work for a fast-growing digital marketing firm.

Laid-back office, casual attire. Jeans and a t-shirt always okay, though we have some pretty snappy dressers on this team. The choice is yours.

A culture we care about deeply. People should be happy in their jobs and lives. There is a balance to strike to achieve this, and we respect it.

You’ll receive a laptop (MacBook Pro) with appropriate software installed to complete your work.

Free healthy snacks and drinks.

Ergonomic desk options from top to bottom.

Oh, and did we mention the unlimited vacations?

How to Apply

Email cover letter and resume to: career AT visiture dot com (preferred method) with subject “SEO Content Strategist” or submit via Indeed.

About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers trillions of requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About the Opportunity

We are looking for an SEO Lead to drive SEO strategy and execution globally. You will join a team of content marketing and SEO strategists focused on growing our audience and deepen customer engagement throughout the lifecycle. This role is located out of our growing Austin, TX office.

As the SEO Lead, you will be responsible for strategizing and executing technical and content-based organic initiatives to acquire Cloudflare users efficiently and drive revenue growth at scale. You will partner closely with our Growth teams, as well as the rest of our Product Marketing, Engineering, and Creative teams in San Francisco and in offices across the globe.

You thrive in a rapidly changing environment, are invigorated by the idea of solving complex SEO challenges, strive to raise the bar, and use the insights of the larger Marketing team to make a huge impact across the organization.

Key aspects of this role include utilizing data to understand customer behaviors, developing and driving SEO experiments, and executing results-focused projects at scale.

Responsibilities include:
Drive strategy for all SEO on Cloudflare.com, including internationalization, site structure, tagging, internal linking, and performance
Create strategic SEO plans on a quarterly and yearly basis, along with a technical SEO roadmap
Own international SEO strategy for APAC, EMEA, LATAM, and other regions, including managing regional SEO agencies
Work closely with the Content Marketing team to integrate SEO projects into an overall content strategy
Identify, prioritize and execute scalable web platform and page-level SEO projects based on traffic and revenue growth opportunities
Design, execute, and report on SEO experiments, evaluating them against business KPIs
Forecast SEO performance, set SEO targets, build reporting, and communicate pacing towards targets to leadership
Partner with the Marketing Technology team to ensure we have the services, implementations, and analytics necessary to work at scale
Requirements
Minimum of 5-8 years of SEO experience, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment
A strong technical and analytical background
Experience driving SEO for international markets including Naver, Baidu, and Yahoo Japan.
Validated results driving SEO initiatives in a fast-moving, dynamic, international organization
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate under pressure on time-sensitive initiatives
Program management experience, including planning and prioritization
Expertise with SEO tools (i.e. Google Search Console, Google Keyword Planner, Conductor, Deepcrawl, Google Analytics, etc.)
Deep understanding of the SaaS lifecycle
BA/BS degree, preferably in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field
What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.

Project Athenian: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.
1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!

What is Chegg?

An 'always on' digital learning platform.

Chegg puts students first?Everything we build in this company is student-focused, making us the leading student-first connected learning platform. Chegg strives to improve the overall return on investment in education by helping students learn more in less time and at a lower cost. This is achieved by providing students a multitude of educational tools from affordable textbook rentals to Chegg Study, which supplements their learning through 24/7 tutor access, step-by-step help with questions, and more. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG.

Why do we exist?

Students are working harder than ever before to stabilize their future. Our recent research study called State of the Student shows that nearly 3 out of 4 students are working to support themselves through college and 1 in 3 students feel pressure to spend more than they can afford. We founded our business on provided affordable textbook rental options to address these issues. Since then, we've expanded our offerings to supplement many facets of higher education learning through Chegg Study, Chegg Math, and Chegg Internships and more to support students beyond their college experience. Job Description

The role of the Senior Search Analyst is to be the day-to-day steward of search media for assigned brands responsible for monitoring and maintaining search campaign development, activation and innovation. The Senior Search Analyst is required to develop and maintain a strong knowledge of their clients' business and apply their search understanding accordingly to help deliver against the clients' needs/objectives. The Senior Search Analyst will work closely with their manager in the development and communication of all search recommendations.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Gather and analyze keyword research necessary to build a new campaign
Responsible for gathering necessary data for plan development
Group keywords into ad groups and develop relevant ad copy and extensions with little direction from Manager
Responsible for presenting recommendation, soliciting and applying client feedback to keyword and copy proposal prior to client signoff
Upon campaign approval, responsible for building flowchart and loading authorized buys in Prisma
Generate paperwork necessary for purchase authorization and ensure vendor counter signature is received
Primary party responsible for trafficking approved plan into search engines
Primary party responsible for QA of all campaign components prior to launch
Monitor and maintain campaign budgets, pacing and bid adjustments
Proactively advocate for campaign adjustments based on performance trends
Active monitoring and management of performance and competitive landscape
Development and implementation of optimizations and/or testing plans (e.g. search query reports, negative keyword maintenance, keyword overlap, testing implementation)
Pulling and analyzing data to inform campaign reporting and develop strategic insights with clear actionable items
Build clear, concise and cohesive quantitative analyses inclusive of strong data visualization
Active participation in client status and reporting calls, including presentation of reporting
Responsible for granular maintenance of monthly billing cycle, including invoice tracking, buy actualization in Prisma, and compiling draft billing for manager approval
Responsible for resolving all billing discrepancies in partnership with client strategy and billing reconciliation team
Responsible for learning all relevant tools for reporting, analytics and competitive analysis - bid management platforms, Benchtools, Google Trends
Mastery of all core search metric calculations and relationships (e.g. CPC, CPA, CTR, SOV, weighted averages)
Serve as subject matter experts for Search Analysts and be a resource for training and ad hoc questions
Develop strong working relationship with client teams and partner agencies (where applicable) by helping to create a seamless communications process
Establish professional, productive rapport with sales representatives/media vendors
Demonstrate creativity and agility when problem solving
Work closely with manager to establish priorities and manage workload
Timely delivery of all work
Successful completion of training programs and requisite certifications

Job title: Reprise- VP, SEO, Central & West US
Description:
About Reprise

Reprise is among the media industry's fastest growing digital agencies servicing Fortune 500 brands -thanks to our culture of innovation, excellence, personal growth, and fun. We're transforming digital experiences for our clients every day and reinventing digital marketing so that it finally works like it should.

Job Summary

Reprise is seeking an energetic, proactive, and analytically-minded person to lead a region of our SEO accounts. The VP, Group Director of SEO oversees multiple teams in different cities and reports to the SVP, Head of SEO, US. The role is ultimately responsible for helping clients improve their performance in organic search and recognize the substantial value of business intelligence that our enterprise SEO offering delivers. The job includes a great deal of client contact and cross-team collaboration with paid search, content production, social media, design, web development, as well as other online and offline channels. Applicants must be comfortable presenting to C-level executives.

Job Responsibilities
Oversee multiple accounts from Reprise's growing SEO client roster
Translate client business goals into successful search engine optimization strategies that drive measurable ROI and ensure client retention
Provide strategic and tactical support to team members by improving processes and overseeing deliverable templates that both fulfill client requests and benefit the entire department
Maintain accountability by supervising the quality of all core initiatives such as technical optimization, content strategy, competitive analysis, and research
Direct team processes in the optimization of various site elements including content, server performance, and user experience
Envision new customer reports and business intelligence insights to impact both qualitative and quantitative trends for ongoing efforts
Identify when projects either conflict or overlap to either resolve or increase efficiency thereof
Shift resources when necessary to complete work at hand and avoid team burnout
Improve project management processes to help teams better manage multiple concurrent projects
Ensure SEO gets its seat at the table when it comes to project planning, budgeting, and meetings
Contribute to AOR RFPs and pitches as well as support SVP on business development initiatives
Ramp up new clients as they are brought on to ensure smooth transitions
Management Expectations
Responsible for management of direct reports as well as overall team success and development
Lead, develop, and manage staff; offer guidance, support, direction, and opportunities
Ensure team has received all tools and training to excel in their roles
Main team contact for questions or problem solving
Accountable for team development, including utilizing organizational tools such as learning and development, creating internal opportunity and challenges for staff, maintaining positive morale, and partnering with HR and business leads on supporting organizational objectives
Cascade information and empower the team to action
Define and execute on corporate culture initiatives
Job Qualifications
8+ years of experience working in digital marketing, specifically in search engine optimization
Business acumen that goes beyond traditional SEO metrics to affect larger investment decisions
Key hard skills such as technical experience in HTML or JavaScript, knowledge of how search engines work, and familiarity with the search industry including key players, vendors, and technologies
Excellent soft skills to work with senior marketing leaders and proven ability to manage a team of digital professionals, as well as collaborate with team leads from other departments
Strong communication skills with an ability to effectively convey technical concepts to those in non-technical roles
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
Understanding of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
Experience in the financial industry would be preferred
Strong grasp of Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

Red Ventures is seeking advanced marketers experienced in content marketing and technical SEO skillsets to partner with our world-class brands and creators to drive natural search growth for our growing portfolio of owned and operated assets.

As a Director of SEO, you'll support and lead one or more of our organic strategy teams and drive innovation for some of the biggest sites in a wide range of verticals ranging from home services and healthcare to financial services, and more.

Being a Director at Red Ventures means doing all the things you have always "wanted to do" but never had the time or resources to do at your previous job. It means working alongside a data science and engineering team fully dedicated to creating SEO products and tools that give you access to more data and better insights, meaning you spend less time on SEMrush and more time making decisions that impact the business.

What You'll Do:
Make decisions that affect critical aspects of your business and interact regularly with company leaders and C-level executives.
Test, innovate, and build custom solutions with our world-class digital marketing, data science, and big data talent.
Analyze organic search landscapes to find opportunities that drive valuable traffic and bottom-line value for the business in collaboration with our experience and business teams.
Set and experiment with content promotion strategy with experience and creative teams using a wide array of digital tools and channels
Leverage our proprietary primary source marketing stack to report on everything from operational (production) progress to upper funnel demand capture, rank position, and full funnel visibility to conversion and P&L metrics.
Keep our sites and pages technically optimized for mobile users and search performance - including information architecture, schema management, semantic HTML, page speed, and other components of crawling and indexing performance.
What We're Looking For:
A proven leader and developer of talent with a track record of driving strong performance and growth from your team.
Always curious, with strong communication skills, confident, and ability to work with a variety of different, and cross-functional, teams.
Passionate about innovating in organic search, don't accept theories at face value, and enjoy testing to prove effectiveness of tactics.
A self-starting, proven performer with at least 5+ years of experience in SEO.
Innovative, on-the-spot, creative problem solver who demonstrates both technical and analytical skills; candidates must be comfortable measuring, interpreting, and making fast-paced decisions based on large volumes of sales and marketing performance data.
Very comfortable working in the weeds with data using tools such as Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Power BI, Tableau, Google Tag Manager, and other common reporting platforms.
Ability to work with HTML, CSS, and JS necessary to optimize page load speed.
Familiar with a number of SEO suites and tools including: STAT, Moz, SEMRush, Majestic, Botify, Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, Brightlocal, and DeepCrawl.
Comfortable working with business leaders in forecasting, budgeting, sensitivity analysis, and business modeling.
Even Better:
The ideal candidate will have strong data analytics skills with at least conceptual experience of data cleansing/wrangling/munging, joining disparate data sets (Bonus points for proficiency in R, Python, GREP/REGEX, or command line chops).
Experience with Google Cloud Projects/Big Query, Google Search Console, SQL.
At home in a fast-paced, hands-on environment.
A passion for training, L&D and driving process.
A great person to work with (https://blog.redventures.com/inside-rv-life-as-a-red-ventures-seo-pro/)!
Who We Are:

Founded in 2000, Red Ventures is a portfolio of growing digital businesses that bring consumers and brands together through integrated e-commerce, strategic partnerships and many proprietary brands including Bankrate, AllConnect.com and Reviews.com. Headquartered south of Charlotte, NC, Red Ventures has over 3000 employees in offices across the US, as well as London and Sao Paulo. For more information, visit www.redventures.com.

At Red Ventures we believe that diversity makes us stronger - at work and in the world. Red Ventures is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at Red Ventures is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications.

Squarespace is looking for an SEO specialist. You will build and execute strategies to lift Squarespace’s organic visibility internationally and across devices. You will not only improve Squarespace’s SEO and accessibility for all users, but consult into future SEO releases that will further help all Squarespace websites. You will be encouraged to work with both the product and marketing teams to ensure Squarespace SEO is within our roadmap and our prioritized marketing efforts.

The SEO strategist will collaborate with the content marketing and product marketing teams to ensure SEO best practices throughout releasing new experiences for our users. This is an opportunity to reach a massive audience creatively while building a technical foundation for our digital properties and that of our users.

The SEO specialist will report to the Head of SEO.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with content, customer operations, and product to produce SEO-enriched content across Squarespace digital properties
Manage our keyword growth strategy across numerous TLDs and sub-domains
Optimize backlink profiles of Squarespace properties and building hierarchical relationships between our owned content
Provide technical insight into Squarespace SEO performance and identifying actionable opportunities along with enterprise level audits
Consult with your partners to build SEO strategy for Squarespace product marketing
Help shape the future of Squarespace SEO for our properties and that of our customers
QUALIFICATIONS
You have a minimum 4 years’ experience developing and executing SEO strategies and processes
You have experience managing a keyword strategy, tracking keyword growth opportunities, and integrating a content marketing plan into overall keyword and traffic development
You have an advanced knowledge of SEO platforms, tools, and services
You have an understand of web standards such as HTML, CSS, Javascript, JSON-LD and their relative effects on SEO
You have experience with web analytics platforms and how they integrate organic and direct traffic (ex: Google Analytics, Adobe, Splunk)
You have experience managing the relationship between organic and paid search (and other marketing channels). Hands on PPC-experience is a plus
You have experience publicly sharing SEO insights and performance throughout a large organization as a representative of the channel
You have strong quantitative skills and are experienced manipulating and analyzing large sets of data
You keep up to date with search engine marketing trends, algorithm updates, and user interface enhancements

Vanguard's Institutional Marketing division is conducting a search for an SEO/SEM Manager. As an SEO/SEM Manager, you will develop and implement a consistent, department wide SEO/SEM strategy and conduct SEO assessments and organic traffic analysis. Provide recommendations and translate them into technical and/or copy requirements and partner with appropriate groups to implement. You will compile SEO guidelines and provide training to crew members on SEO best practices. Staying abreast of search engine algorithm changes and assess impact and remediation needed for appropriate IIG sites is also a key priority for this position.

In this role, you will:
Work independently, initiates and / or leads channel marketing programs, initiatives, promotions or research projects.
Develop, implement, and monitor channel marketing plans. Contributes expertise to major channel marketing deliverables, milestones, and required tasks.
Ensure channel marketing plans are aligned with the overall department strategy. Assists with defining the appropriate success and effectiveness of channel marketing initiatives and drafts in-depth reviews of channel marketing effectiveness.
Identify and analyze varied sources of data and information to inform planning decisions. Develops and executes regular reporting, providing actionable insight to the business.
Proactively communicate status and issues of channel marketing activity regularly to stakeholders, including sales professionals, business leaders, team members, and senior managers.
Build and maintain effective relationships with various parties including sales professionals, business leads, and key decision makers. Proactively fosters communication between stakeholders.
Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate risks on channel marketing activities.
A design experience that delivers

Institutional Marketing is in the midst of a unique transformation. The Institutional Marketing leadership team, along with business partners across the enterprise, have spent the last several months designing a brand new future state organization focused around Agile marketing principles. Why are we transforming? We have a goal as a department to become a strategic partner to the IIG business and drive results using data-driven decisions and innovative marketing capabilities. This is an extremely exciting time to be joining marketing. We welcome your experience, expertise and ideas!

What it takes:
Minimum five years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree in Marketing or equivalent experience required.
Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Description
Position at Ziff Davis

SEO Manager (Austin, TX)
:

We are seeking a highly talented and motivated SEO Manager who is an expert at developing and executing organic eCommerce campaigns that drive traffic and revenue. Fantastic communication and people skills are a must in this role. The SEO Manager we seek to add to our fast-growing team will support our SEO efforts out of our Austin, TX office but will collaborate closely with the SEO team based in our New York office.

In the role of SEO Manager, you will have the primary responsibility of iteratively developing, implementing and continually optimizing SEO strategies in order to directly and measurably improve our organic search results. You will have SEO ownership of individual web properties from Ziff Media Group's portfolio of ecommerce sites. You will work with multiple internal teams and departments, including engineering, product, UX, PR and editorial. You will provide leadership and strategy for the direction of the web properties you oversee while acting as a collaborative partner to Ziff Media Group's larger SEO team and Audience Growth department.

Responsibilities

Evangelize the crucial role of SEO in driving incremental traffic and positive business outcomes across the organization.

Partner with key stakeholders in Marketing, Product, Engineering, Merchandising, BI and PR to implement best practices that will optimize and grow our SEO presence and performance.

Keep abreast of SEO trends, best practices and search news, particularly regarding algorithm changes that impact organic search results.

Gather and draw insights from data that can help identify and define areas of improvements and optimization.

Leverage various internal and external tools to measure/report on organic search performance and to identify/troubleshoot technical issues that might be affecting our overall rankings.

Identify and communicate technical aspects of site that require enhancements for SEO and monitor changes (redirects, canonical tags, META data, page speed, etc.)

Write SEO product requirements, QA and review all aspects of site code releases to ensure there are no negative SEO implications or impacts.

Lead comprehensive SEO site audits that address UX, navigation, optimizations, mobile functionality that drive business metrics in a meaningful way to impact conversion and revenue.

Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to establish and implement site/content taxonomies and product data standards/guidelines/best practices in order to optimize onsite search relevance.

Lead internal training of search optimization best practices to increase overall search knowledge across the organization.

Perform keyword research, write optimized HTML tags and provide recommendations for internal linking, content promotion, content creation and implementation of schema mark-up.

Identify and implement internal link optimizations of existing and new content to aid SEO efforts.

Collaborate with editorial team to create high-quality content around important, relevant terms.

Work closely with PR to manage off-page optimization by providing best practices for overall improvement to search

Monitor and report on onsite search metrics and KPIs.

Rely on both qualitative and quantitative analyses to identify and execute opportunities for improvements.

Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of experience in SEO, preferably in-house.

Experience optimizing eCommerce websites to build organic traffic and drive revenue.

Experience utilizing a wide variety of SEO tools such as SEMRush, Brightedge, Conductor, Ahrefs, Google Search Console and others to perform analyses.

Experience with site crawlers and log file analysis.

Proficient and experienced with technical SEO (ex: XML sitemaps, canonicalization, hreflangs, robots.txt, URL redirects, etc).

Strong written & verbal communication skills.

Highly motivated, strategic, curious and innovative but also willing to roll up your sleeves and get in the weeds of the tactical execution that drives progress for search audience growth.

Role Number:
200154982
The people here at Apple don’t just build products — we craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that supports the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

At Apple ideas have a way of becoming products, services, and customer experiences. Apple Retail is looking for a WW SEO Program Manager, based in our Cupertino office, to lead all aspects of our organic search efforts. You will work with data to understand program trends and identify/stack-rank new business opportunities required to deliver the SEO commercial targets.

The position requires a hands-on, get-the-job-done, attitude. You understand SEO standard methodologies and can conceive, plan, and deliver projects that drive the business forward. You understand that our organic search presence is an extension of Apple’s marketing - and need to be at the same level of quality. And you’re great at handling ambiguity and forming relationships with key partners across the Apple organization to deliver solutions necessary to deliver the necessary business results.

You’ll be part of the core digital marketing team responsible for crafting the voice of the Apple products across organic, paid and internal search. This means you will work with a cross-functional team across marketing, engineering, product management and merchandizing.
Key Qualifications
7+ years of experience with SEO for a global enterprise or digital agency.
Solid experience leading complex international, large-scale, and time-critical technical projects.
Proficiency in the latest SEO standard methodologies across all major search engines worldwide.
Excellent communication skills, especially an ability to simplify complex data into actionable insights.
Expert knowledge of SEO analytics. Ability to define program metrics and collaborate with analytics on program reporting.
Strong organizational, time management, and prioritization skills.
Very strong attention to detail.
Self-starter, proactive with the ability to work independently.
Experience working with a global brand preferred.
Experience deriving business insights and finding opportunities through data.
Description
- Responsible for crafting the organic search strategy for Apple products and services across several of Apple’s digital platforms, including but not limited to Apple’s marketing site, Today at Apple, and BeatsByDre.com.
Lead the organic search feature backlog and bring SEO technical projects from ideation to production with different developer teams at Apple.
Work with Apple’s interactive team to ensure new product launches are optimized for search from the moment of launch.
Regularly analyze search trends and provide insights and opportunities for Apple that will deliver the commercial, strategic and brand goals.
Responsible for meeting SEO revenue targets by implementing relevant optimization decisions in collaboration with the regional marketing leads.
Work in close alignment with other program managers to continuously find new business opportunities.
Be an evangelist for SEO programs and projects globally, presenting the impact on Apple’s brand and financial goals.
Be a great partner with the SEO Agency and responsible for allocating the available resources for projects across the AMR and EMEA region in close collaboration with the SEO program managers.
Be responsible for the prioritization, execution and reporting of focus areas on a quarterly basis, and the communication of these to the partner.
Develop appropriate critical metrics for SEO related projects and build the necessary reports to communicate performance.
Education & Experience
BA/BS required. MBA desirable

OVERVIEW

Our digital marketing team is highly analytical, moves fast and is focused on delivering quantifiable results. In this role, you will be responsible for getting more people to shop for groceries using Instacart. This person will be working directly with senior leadership across different teams and will be making a big impact on overarching company goals.

ABOUT THE JOB
Oversee SEO and ASO strategy and collaborate with senior leadership to set quarterly goals
Provide both content and technical recommendations to improve organic rankings
Develop a channel strategy to meet both short term and long term acquisition goals
Track, report and share channel performance with internal stakeholders on a regular basis
Partner with Analytics team to conduct marketing experiments and AB tests frequently
Prioritize initiatives with internal stakeholders across Marketing, Product, Engineering and Data Science
Serve as a thought leader and educate internal teams on all things related to SEO and ASO
ABOUT YOU
3-5 years managing SEO at a fast growing consumer brand
Excellent quantitative and data analysis skills
Thorough understanding of acquisition marketing fundamentals
Experience working with cross functional teams and creating alignment
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Technical knowledge of website architecture (experience with HTML Markup, CSS, XML)
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Bonuses:
Experience in the on-demand economy
Proficiency in SQL

The SEO Strategy Lead will be responsible for various digital marketing activities, primarily focused on Search Engine Optimization (SEO), and other organic marketing. and Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO). This will include site research, keyword research, campaign development, optimization, and performance analysis for our clients.

Roles & Responsibilities

Deliverables
Reporting: Outline key insights and takeaways from reports. Effectively articulate results of recommended optimizations and initiatives and formulate next steps accordingly (whether positive or negative).
Tracking & analytics: Aid in setup and maintenance of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager tracking.
Technical site health: Regularly assess technical health of client sites, communicate findings to the client, and provide recommendations for improvement.
Strategy & Project Management
SEO Strategies: Craft SEO strategies and provide proactive recommendations for clients tailored to their unique goals, strengths, and challenges. Prioritize initiatives by impact and ease of implementation
Deliverable Timelines: Formulate timelines for key deliverables. Delegate and assign deadlines for key deliverables to supporting team members.
Cross-team communication and strategy: Work cross-functionally with web, paid, and creative teams to ensure on-time delivery of initiatives and cohesive digital strategy.
Account monitoring: Monitor monthly retainer and project hours to ensure client receives maximum value for retainer without significantly overspending on hours
Additional Responsibilities
Continued learning: Keep up-to-date with and proactively research news and trends in SEO, CRO, content, analytics, UX, and organic amazon and share with the team
Business development: Identify opportunities for and pitch clients on up-sells to aid in growth of SEO business.
Team training: Identify opportunities for team growth and take charge of learning through regular presentation of team learning lessons and one-on-one training with junior team members
Process improvement: Present ideas for new processes and initiatives for the team and proactively put together tangible plans to see these to fruition.
Business development: Identify opportunities for and pitch clients on cross-sells to aid in growth of Logical business.
Requirements
Demonstrate expertise in all areas of Logical SEO & Analytics, including technical SEO, CRO, content, analytics, UX and organic Amazon
Advanced knowledge of primary tracking and analytics platforms (STAT, Screaming Frog, Moz, Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Search Console, My Business, Data Studio)
Deep understanding of SEO implementation within a Wordpress environment.
Understanding of and experience in local search optimization.
Understanding of basic HTML as it relates to SEO.
Ability to implement foundational SEO recommendations in a Wordpress environment.
Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills
Attention to detail and ability to effectively manage multiple clients and deadlines simultaneously
Bachelors Degree
At least 4 years of experience in SEO

Job Description:

Youve been building web applications for years. Youve mastered Javascript and have strong opinions on React, Vue and Angular. You enjoy prototyping new ideas just to see if theyll actually work. You frequently take the lead on important projects and have strong opinions on team process. Youve dabbled with mobile app development and maybe youve even written and deployed a lambda function or two.

Youre also a news junkie. You get push notifications from several news apps when something newsworthy happens. You might have even published a few pieces yourself. Youre looking for more than just another engineering job. You firmly believe in the public mission of journalism and its importance in our society. You want your work to have an impact.

You will play a key role as part of the Product and Engineering and Technical SEO teams at The Wall Street Journal, one of the worlds leading publishers. Specifically, you will work across The Wall Street Journal branded sites with the Product Managers, Newsroom, and Technical SEO team, and engage with other engineering teams. Our work is about driving the loyalty, engagement, and expansion of our audiences the lifeblood of any news organization sitting at the intersection between marketing, editorial, customer insights, tech, and product.

Come join our team at The Wall Street Journal!

Were looking for you to:
Design, develop and test web applications for The Wall Street Journal.
Work closely with journalists, designers, data scientists, product managers and other engineers to build innovative solutions to current and future newsroom challenges.
Help set technical direction and long-term strategy for future mobile initiatives.
Play an active role in the product development process.
Keep an eye on technical innovations and changing trends in the mobile landscape.
Wed like you to have:
2-3 years general web development experience with HTML, CSS, and Javascript. Experience with React and Node.js is a huge plus.
A strong background in software engineering and computer science fundamentals.
Familiarity with API design for highly scalable services.
A natural curiosity and desire to understand and even contribute to the entire technology stack.
A passion for storytelling and creativity to introduce new ideas and technologies. If you have a background in journalism, even better!
Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the worlds top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barrons, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Youre looking for more than just another engineering job. You firmly believe in the public mission of journalism and its importance in our society. You want your work to have an impact.

You will play a key role as part of the Product and Engineering and Technical SEO teams at The Wall Street Journal, one of the worlds leading publishers. Specifically, you will work across The Wall Street Journal branded sites with the Product Managers, Newsroom, and Technical SEO team, and engage with other engineering teams. Our work is about driving the loyalty, engagement, and expansion of our audiences the lifeblood of any news organization sitting at the intersection between marketing, editorial, customer insights, tech, and product.

Come join our team at The Wall Street Journal!

Were looking for you to:
Design, develop and test web applications for The Wall Street Journal.
Work closely with journalists, designers, data scientists, product managers and other engineers to build innovative solutions to current and future newsroom challenges.
Help set technical direction and long-term strategy for future mobile initiatives.
Play an active role in the product development process.
Keep an eye on technical innovations and changing trends in the mobile landscape.
Wed like you to have:
2-3 years general web development experience with HTML, CSS, and Javascript. Experience with React and Node.js is a huge plus.
A strong background in software engineering and computer science fundamentals.
Familiarity with API design for highly scalable services.
A natural curiosity and desire to understand and even contribute to the entire technology stack.
A passion for storytelling and creativity to introduce new ideas and technologies. If you have a background in journalism, even better!
Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets .

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com . Business Area: TECHNOLOGY - ENTERPRISE & CUSTOMER

Job Category: IT Development Group

About Us

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the worlds top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barrons, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

Req ID: 19949

UNIQLO is a brand of Fast Retailing Co., Ltd., a leading global Japanese retail holding company that designs, manufactures and sells clothing under seven main brands: Comptoir des Cotonniers, GU, Helmut Lang, J Brand, Princesse tam.tam, Theory, and UNIQLO. With global sales of approximately 1.14 trillion yen for the 2013 fiscal year ending August 31, 2013 (US $11.62 billion, calculated in yen using the end of August 2013 rate of $1 = 98.36 yen), Fast Retailing is one of the world’s largest apparel retail companies, and UNIQLO is Japan’s leading specialty retailer.

UNIQLO continues to open large-scale stores in some of the world's most important cities and locations, as part of its ongoing efforts to solidify its status as a truly global brand. Today the company has a total of more than 1,200 stores in 14 markets worldwide including Japan, China, France, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Russia, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, U.K. and U.S. In addition, Grameen UNIQLO, a social business established in Bangladesh in September 2010, opened its two first stores in Dhaka in July 2013. UNIQLO operates an integrated business model under which it designs, manufactures, markets and sells high-quality, casual apparel. The company believes that truly great clothes should be supremely comfortable, feature universal designs, are of high quality and offer a superb fit to everyone who wears them.

With a corporate statement committed to changing clothes, changing conventional wisdom and change the world, Fast Retailing is dedicated to creating great clothing with new and unique value to enrich the lives of people everywhere. For more information about UNIQLO and Fast Retailing, please visit www.uniqlo.com and www.fastretailing.com.

Position Overview:

As the Manager of SEO, you will be responsible the technical and content SEO for uniqlo.com/en/us, working with global technology, product, and design teams to improve search engine handling of our site. In this role, you will be a key part of strategic website updates and initiatives, partnering with teams to evolve the site while maintaining SEO best practices. By devising and running experiments onsite to improve conversion and performance metrics, you will improve users’ experience and drive business results. Collaboration, prioritization, and analytic thinking are keys to success for this position.

Core Job Responsibilities:
Lead technical SEO, working on projects to improve search engine crawlability and indexation
Play an integral role in planning strategic website updates by participating in planning, analyzing, measuring and reporting on global initiatives such as page template creation, navigation/IA changes, UX/UI changes, A/b testing, and other technical enhancements
Conduct SEO crawl and log file analysis that are then reviewed, prioritized, and put into sprint with various teams
Partner with technology organization to create SEO best practices and processes that ensure website changes either neutrally or positively impact organic search performance
Lead research and insights for SEO industry trends, including voice search, algorithm updates, AMP, and schema
Work closely with Head of Organic Marketing lead to ensure technical SEO is best-in-class and driving global SEO performance forward
We’re excited about you if you have…
Job Qualifications/Requirements:
3-5 years SEO experience, either at an agency or in-house
Past-proven experience at successfully managing and implementing technical SEO initiatives for multi-lingual, multi-national websites
A comprehensive knowledge of organic search and how SEO activities influence search engine ranking algorithms
Demonstrated ability to gather information, prioritize initiatives, and achieve results on time
Experience with Open Graph, Schema.org, Google Tag Manager, Search Console, Google Analytics, Conductor Searchlight, DeepCrawl, Botify, Splunk, and other SEO technologies
Prior development experience or a background in computer science preferred

The Role

BuzzFeed.com is looking for an experienced and data-minded SEO expert and content strategist to develop, implement and manage BuzzFeed's SEO strategy.

You Will
Advise writers and editorial leadership on Google Search and Discover strategy for breaking news, pop culture events, seasonal lifestyle, and shopping content
Support training editors and writers on all things SEO including best practices and how to effectively optimize content, develop reporting and perform case studies
Regularly report on trends and performance using Google Analytics and SEO tools such as SEMRush and Moz
Conduct keyword research and competitive analyses to identify white space opportunities and ranking declines
Perform regular audits of URL structure, internal linking, AMP errors as well as any content-related SEO optimization efforts, such as adding links, descriptions, keywords, and headlines
Partner with product, and data teams to guide the technical roadmap
Design and implement new content experiments that help teams learn about successful search traffic acquisition strategies
You Have
5+ years planning, developing and implementing SEO strategy
Demonstrated experience developing and implementing successful content experiments focused on search traffic optimization
Experience with Looker or similar BI tools is a plus
A deep passion for data and insights and the ability to excel in a fast-paced digital publishing environment
Expert-level skills in keyword research, deep passion for data, and experience using industry-leading SEO tools including Google Analytics, SEM Rush, MoZ
Life at BuzzFeed

At BuzzFeed, we believe our work benefits from the diverse perspectives of our employees. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment. As a BuzzFeed employee, you can expect:
A supportive, inclusive atmosphere on a team that values your contributions
