Job Posting Title:
SEO Manager
Job Description:


Who We're Looking For

Out of an abundance of caution due to the concerns surrounding the current situation with the Coronavirus (COVID-19), we will be conducting our hiring process completely virtually. That means that all interviews and onboarding activities will be held online or over the phone. The health of our employees and candidates is our main priority and we hope you will forgive any inconvenience that may arise from this non-conventional approach. While the day-to-day approach has changed a bit during this time, our commitment to hiring the best talent in the industry and helping them to thrive both personally and professionally is stronger than ever.

Our SEO Manager is integral to the development of the SEO Channel, training of our SEO Specialists and close oversight of ongoing strategies set for all our web properties.

The SEO Manager works closely with the Director of Earned Media and individual SEOs on each team in the planning, testing, and executing of SEO initiatives, developing process, and ensuring adherence to best practices.

The SEO Manager excels at coordination with Marketing Managers and each of the other marketing functions to advocate for SEO considerations and ensure consistency in SEO strategy and implementation across multiple properties.

Working to streamline SEO workflow the SEO Manager engages regularly in analysis, reporting, training and implementing SEO best practices for ongoing optimization, troubleshooting complex issues and having both a direct and indirect impact on Clearlink’s profitability achieved via organic search.

Breaking Down Your Day to Day
Develop and execute SEO strategies for Clearlink and our partners, including optimizing current web pages and working with various channels on projects that are being developed or planned.
Create performance reports using Google Analytics or other similar tools.
Review and analyze Clearlink and Brand Partner sites for areas that need to be improved, deleted, revamped, etc; prepare detailed SEO strategy reports for management.
Carry out SEO functions, including keyword research, site audits, information architecture planning, domain valuation.
Identify keyword targeting opportunities for Brand Partner and Clearlink sites; organize and run projects and campaigns to improve website search result listings.
Opportunity, competitive and market analysis
Proposal development and partner communication
Conduct analysis to evaluate the performance of search engine optimization strategies; identify and evaluate current site goals and link building strategies;
Research data for future projects
Provide training and strategic oversight of SEO Specialists
Review and approve SEO strategies, forecasts and tactics
Other duties may be assigned as required.
What You Need
BA in Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing or a related field
4-6 years SEO experience in a B to C environment
Expert-level knowledge of SEO methods and best practices.
Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
Demonstrated ability to manage details, efficient work habits, and overall flexibility
Must be able to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to accept interruptions as part of the routine
Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives and willingness to take on additional responsibility
Proven ability to manage a diverse team excelling in identifying and capitalizing on individual contributor strengths
Advanced SEO tool, Google Analytics and Excel skills for data analysis and reporting
What We Offer

At Clearlink, our goal is to create opportunities for our people; if you're smart, hungry, and love to get things done, this is the perfect opportunity to build on your career in digital marketing. You'll have the opportunity to sharpen your skills by working with some of the biggest brands in the country.

We are an established and growing company with a start-up atmosphere, which means you'll have the opportunity to create and execute enterprise SEO strategies and the freedom to approach them in creative ways.

About Clearlink:

Clearlink’s team of 1,700+ employees is headquartered in Salt Lake City and has been creating marketing content services for Fortune 500 companies for over 13 years. Clearlink has been recognized as a great place to work with awards such as Utah Business Magazine’s Fast 50, Inc. Magazine’s 500/5000 List, Salt Lake Tribune Top Workplaces, Utah Chapter of the American Marketing Association – Internal Campaign, and many more. We are proud to offer our employees:
Up to 100% healthcare for your entire family
Over two weeks paid time off
Paid ski days, wellness activities, and team outings
Fully-stocked break room
Award-winning wellness program with free health coaching
All-expense paid vacations for top employees
Location:
Salt Lake City

Thursday, February 6, 2020


At over 45 years old and counting, B&H has built a reputation as the trusted resource for photography and videography enthusiasts via its NYC SuperStore and its award-winning website. Long known as "The Professional’s Source", B&H is recognized by savvy consumers worldwide for its honest, knowledgeable guidance, expert tips and articles… and always-great prices.

B&H offers competitive salaries, medical benefits, a 401K plan, employee discounts and opportunities to grow within a high-energy, low-attitude environment. Make your move to B&H today!


The SEO Expert is responsible for maximizing search engine rankings for B&H product/listing and landing pages, as well as increasing the overall volume of organic traffic from search engines to the B&H Website. The SEO Expert leverages data analytics to develop and deploy effective search strategies aligned with business objectives. Due to the dynamic environment produced by constant changes to search algorithms, the SEO continuously learns, tweaks skills and experiments to develop working methodologies. They will take necessary steps to stay on top of latest trends and shifts in the industry.

Essential Responsibilities:
· Develop a viable/robust SEO strategy based on SEO best practices and data analytics
· Conduct regular Technical and On-Page SEO audits to determine opportunities and identify areas for improvement
· Monitor and set up maintenance/alert system for when things break or are underperforming (crawlability, site structure/technical, speed, XML Sitemaps, canonical tags, meta data, redirects, etc)
· Prioritize projects, initiatives and areas of focus based on data analysis
· Conduct keyword research for individual projects
· Track and provide regular status reports on ranking positions
· Request appropriate content and/or refresh existing content to support Search engine ranking needs
· Request additions and/or modifications to existing category and/or landing pages
· Develop and implement link building and interlinking strategies
· Coordinate with other departments (e.g. Social, Buying, Categorization, IS, OLM, etc.) to support SEO related initiatives
· Provide guidance on website projects/initiatives to ensure compliance with SEO strategy and best practices

Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
· Strong analytic skills, high attention to detail and accuracy
· Ability to prioritize, multi-task and work with multiple teams on a variety of projects
· Ability to effectively interact with all levels of end users and technical resources
· Strong project management and communication skills
· Energetic and self-motivated

Preferred Experience:
· Proven SEO experience
· In-depth experience with website analytics tools (e.g, Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends)
· Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
· Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms
· Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO and SEM


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons shall have the opportunity to be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex or gender, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

We will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. If you believe you require such assistance to complete this form or to participate in an interview, please let us know.

Thriveworks Counseling is seeking a highly effective online marketing professional with advanced-level experience in white hat SEO including content syndication, online public relations, link building, on page SEO, off page SEO. Advanced training in local SEO, google news, and technical SEO is preferred. Competitive applicants will also provide a well-documented track record of engaging customers and growing online users.

Benefits:

-Competitive compensation package
-Group health and dental insurance benefits
-Disability, life, and liability insurance benefits
-A 401k program with a 3% employer match
-Professional development opportunities
-Career advancement opportunities

Successful Thriveworks employees believe in our mission to help people live happy and successful lives. They also embody our core values, of which focus on the importance of adapting, raising the bar, acting with integrity, achieving our goals, and working together. If you think you fit the bill and belong on our team, apply today!

WITHIN is seeking the expertise of a Senior SEO Manager that will be responsible for the day-to-day management of both on-site and off-site strategies, and focusing on thought leadership through strategy development / innovation.

What do we actually do?

We are Performance Branding experts. WITHIN works with some of the coolest brands and hottest startups across the country, including international brands like Nike, Spanx, Shake Shack. We leverage digital channels and inspiring creative to fuel clients' growth, using data every step of the way to drive our decision making.

What makes us different?

Our founders come from the client-side, so we think and operate like business owners, strategizing marketing objectives as tangible business objectives. WITHIN works with brands to collapse the funnel between performance and brand marketing to unify objectives, targets, and strategy. Partnered with a brand’s unique value proposition, WITHIN’s integrated media and personalized content solutions are designed to prioritize profits and growth over mere channel optimization. That means we take a strategic, holistic approach to their marketing programs, training each employee across every channel. We also use some of the best technology available along with our proprietary tools to deliver the best performance for our clients. Our team of experts will train you to develop your own expertise in the field and help you become an innovator in your own right.

This is a unique opportunity in a rapidly growing company. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Quickly gain an understanding of the client’s product market, goals, and growth opportunities
Develop, manage and execute implementation of SEO strategy to achieve client goals
Communicate strategy, timeline and results with end client.
Perform keyword research to optimize existing content and unlock new opportunities
Recommend and execute strategies for content development to achieve client goals
Develop and execute link-building strategies and campaigns
Implement and administer search engine programs (XML sitemaps, shopping feeds, webmaster tools) where applicable
Evaluate and report on performance of SEO campaigns.
Join sales meetings and lead SEO-specific business development efforts
Teach team members on SEO basics and how to communicate strategy/benefits to end clients
Collaborate with marketing team to develop SEO-specific case studies and marketing materials
Anticipate client needs and questions with the ability to quickly address concerns and assist other team members in developing client responses
Attend client and company meetings to present long-term results, campaign strategies, and incremental tactics
Stay current with industry trends and best practices, focusing on how these changes can be leveraged to drive material account improvements
Requirements

What should YOU bring to the table:
3+ years of hands-on SEO experience, paid search and/or social experience is a plus
Proven track record of successful SEO strategy and implementation with clients of differing sizes and industries
Solid educational background in critical thinking, quantitative analysis
Ability to drive initiatives forward with limited supervision
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with all levels of employees
Conversant with all terminology used in SEO
Extensive working knowledge of SEO research tools
Strong Microsoft Excel skills - pivot tables, chart building, macros, etc.
Positive, can-do attitude; must be experienced at effective communication and fostering teamwork
Comfortable working in dynamic, time-sensitive environment with numerous competing priorities
Develop positive relationships focused on retaining clients and employees
Ability to analyze complex issues to develop relevant and realistic plans and recommendations to solve client challenges
Benefits

We offer a competitive salary and benefits based on ability level including:
Salary DOE
FULLY paid Visa sponsorship
Unlimited vacation policy
Anniversary vacation bonus
FULLY paid health insurance premiums
Monthly transportation & phone stipend
Daily lunch & Monday morning bagels
In-office monthly massages, haircuts, & manicures
Free uber when coming in early / leaving late
Dog friendly office

FanDuel Group is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media, including FanDuel, Betfair US, and TVG. FanDuel Group has a presence across 45 states and 8 million customers. The company is based in New York with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon, and Scotland.

About the role

The SEO & ASO Manager will form part of the SEO team which will be responsible for Search Engine Optimization & App Store Optimization for selected group brands across Fanduel Group. Reporting to the Director of SEO & ASO, the primary responsibility is to meet the agreed commercial and campaign demands of the selected brands. This is a fast-paced, technical and analytical driven position and the successful candidate will become an SEO expert for the Fanduel Group.

What you'll do
Implement and assist in the development of SEO & ASO strategies that drive growth and ROI
Responsible for leading SEO audits and sharing SEO recommendations, analyzing deliverables and results to internal teams
Manage both on-page and off-page SEO for selected brands within the group
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and changes with SEO and major search engines.
Master the architecture, content taxonomy, and technical constraints of the Fanduel Group websites.
Leverage customer insights and analytics to continually optimize campaigns
Track and analyze technical factors affecting search visibility, crawling and index coverage, providing insight and recommendations for improvement.
Discover and report on potential systemic technical problems in indexability, canonicalization, redirects, HTTP errors, etc.
Accountable for improving our app store rankings and conversions from App Store to download for various mobile apps.
Continually innovate to drive improvement by leveraging the latest technologies.
Identifying, approaching and negotiating with websites to build up a unique network of links.
Manage link building campaigns, conducting backlink profile analysis across all domains.
Who we're looking for
Experience (3+ years) in Search Engine Optimization role in a competitive industry
Excellent knowledge of the SEO and ASO industry, search engine algorithms, and app store ranking strategies.
Understanding of web analytics & reporting tools
Experience with SEO/ASO tools (e.g. Google Search console, Screaming Frog, SemRush, Ahrefs, Itunes connect, Appannie, etc..)
The ability to create reports; understands ROI; and select relevant data for analyzing future actions.
Excellent analytical skills and outstanding attention to detail.
Experience in agency management and contract negotiation
Excellent communication skills and team player.
Desirable Skills & Experience
Good knowledge of American sports (football, basketball, etc..) and horse racing is a big plus
Always informed of emerging trends in the SEO & ASO landscape
Highly analytical, focused and results-driven
Ability to work independently and in a team as well as ability to take on responsibility for own projects
Comfortable within a changing and developing environment
Confidence to make own decisions and manage 3rd party relationships
Ability to prioritize, organize and multi-task
Must have flexible attitude and the ability to work under pressure
Motivated, enthusiastic and focused on a career in marketing
What you get in return

Beyond working with such a great team?
An exciting environment with real growth
Contribute to exciting products used by a highly passionate user base
Personal learning and development opportunities
Flexible holiday allowance
401K plan with company match
Attractive health insurance plans
There's more, but we don't want to go on and on.

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer. Diversity and inclusion in FanDuel means that we respect and value everyone as individuals. We don't tolerate bias, judgment or harassment. Our focus is on developing employees so that they reach their full potential

Who we are:

Reprise is among the media industry’s fastest growing digital agencies servicing Fortune 500 brands –thanks to our culture of innovation, excellence, personal growth, and fun. We’re transforming digital experiences for our clients every day and reinventing digital marketing so that it finally works like it should.

Who You Are:

You will demonstrate significant knowledge of organic search including content strategy, technical knowledge, and tactics necessary for delivery of complex SEO programs. Just as important for this role as discipline knowledge will be the ability to build client relationships as the main day-to-day contact. This involves presenting training sessions, leading conference calls, adhering to action plans, guiding clients to completing their projects, and writing strategic points of view. The associate director will also be expected to contribute research to benefit both clients and the internal team. The right person for the role will be a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter who has proven success and can thrive in a fast-paced environment. It is expected that the candidate will be ready to manage people and pull in other help when needed.

What your day-to-day requires
Clearly define elements of SEO projects to set expectations of what is and is not in scope
Aid the director and project manager in scoping both future projects and staffing
Work seamlessly with cross-functional teams including paid search, paid social, content production, and web development from multiple agencies within the IPG family
Lead the development and presentation of audits, training, and reporting
Build out cutting edge SEO services such as content gap analyses and reputation improvement
Verbally, literally, and visually provide strategic and tactical guidance on SEO best practices
Identify new opportunities for service line evolution and development
Maintain good working relationships and sell in new projects where it benefits the client
Share new developments within the team and thereby enable superior service to our clients
Lead, develop, and manage Manager, Sr. Analyst, and Analysts
Offer guidance, support, and direction as well as provide development opportunities and ongoing feedback
Ensure direct reports have received access to and training on research and reporting platforms to excel in their roles
Main team contact for questions or problem solving
Assist team with conflict resolution, conference calls, and meetings where necessary
Coach and mentor team; responsible for performance evaluations and regular feedback
Evaluate staffing needs and make recommendations for direct reports’ training and development
Support and drive corporate culture initiatives
What you bring to the table

Education:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Work Experience:
5+ years of digital marketing experience with an emphasis on SEO
Experience with tools relating to web analytics, SEO reporting, link and technical analysis
Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the know-how to translate detailed knowledge into key takeaways for all positions from analysts to C-level executives
Demonstrated track record of moving client partnerships forward to generate results
Solid understanding of HTML and dedication to white hat techniques
Highly analytical with the ability to internalize the importance of performance KPIs such as ROI
Comprehension of site development from conception and wireframes to build and development
Familiarity with how both front end design and back end servers can affect SEO performance
Reliability to develop agendas, set up conference calls, and present either in-person or by phone
Consistent organizational skills, attention to detail, and accuracy when working with numbers
Strong grasp of Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Past background with financial clients is a plus
Why join us:

You’ll be working alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business in a fun and dynamic environment. At Reprise, success is celebrated and hard work is rewarded. Our people are smart and driven, all working together towards one common goal. You’ll learn, you’ll grow and you’ll be exposed to career opportunities you can’t get anywhere else. Plus, you’ll have fun doing it.

Noom Inc. is a leader in mobile health coaching. We combine the power of technology with the empathy of real human coaches to deliver successful behavior change. Our direct-to-consumer mobile applications have reached more than 45 million users worldwide -- and counting. We've leveraged our behavior change platform to incorporate the CDC's Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP), and have expanded to programs for diabetes management, pre-hypertension, and hypertension. The Growth team is at the forefront of this mission, tackling one of the hardest challenges in healthcare today: getting people to take that initial (and biggest!) step towards living a healthier lifestyle… And this is where you come in!

Noom is looking for our first Search Engine Optimization Manager to drive organic growth. This is an exciting opportunity to develop a strategy and own the execution. Our leadership team is thinking long-term and we're all in agreement that SEO plays a large part in our continued success.

What You'll Be Doing:
Leading the scaling of Noom's nascent SEO efforts in an industry that's incredibly broad and constantly evolving
Developing and executing upon a framework for determining keyword and content prioritization
Leveraging Noom's data infrastructure to develop robust SEO analysis
Building out resources - both internally and externally - to produce world class content
Project managing with Engineering to implement technical SEO improvements
Optimizing existing content to improve domain expertise and SEO customer volume
Collaborating with the paid, brand, and PR managers to ensure Noom is broadly optimized for SEO
Analyzing and adapting efforts to ever-changing market trends
What We're Looking For:
Extensive experience (4+ years) with both technical and content SEO
Deep understanding of subscription eCommerce space and it's particular challenges
An analytical mindset and strong prioritization skills
Fast learner with excellent problem-solving ability
Self-motivated team player willing to work very hard
What Makes This Job Amazing:
You'll be helping millions of people lead healthier lives every day
You'll be a part of Noom's rocketship-- revenue has grown 20x in the last 2 years and our team is growing fast.
You'll have wonderful benefits including healthcare/dental, wellness budget, daily gourmet meals prepared by our onsite chefs, and onsite yoga
You'll experience huge learning & professional growth opportunities. Noom believes in supporting your professional and personal growth: we'll cover the cost of books, courses, conferences… you name it!
You'll add to our transparent, high-performing, and close-knit culture

Job title: SAP Concur SEO Marketing Sr Specialist
Description:
Requisition ID: 241011

Work Area: Marketing

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Professional

Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That's why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it's the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people's lives.

The world's leading provider of travel, expense and invoice management solutions is seeking a Marketing Manager to join our existing world class SEO team to help drive a digital evolution at SAP Concur. Core to this evolution is a heavy investment in Search Engine Optimization (SEO), a strategy at the heart of SAP Concur's efforts to increase digital demand generation capabilities and efficiencies.

Reporting to Director, Search Marketing, the SEO specialist will support SAP Concur's organic search strategy globally, focused on driving qualified traffic and demonstrate measurable results. The SEO specialist will work to increase SAP Concur's website visibility on search engines through instituting best practices for organic search programs.

This person's communication and collaboration skills must be first class in order to help drive and implement a worldwide SEO strategy. They must be a self-starter, someone who can work autonomously yet collaborate with many teams around the world. And they must embrace and champion change and be comfortable with ambiguity.

Responsibilities:
Work with the other SEO managers to define and support the global SEO strategy
Implement SEO tactics including keyword research, authoring meta data & headlines, audit competitor websites, and more.
Optimize on-site content for SAP Concur websites to ensure maximum visibility
Manage and fix technical SEO elements on the websites, including hreflang tags, canonical tags and site errors.
Report advanced technical issues to the web development team.
Help to implement a robust link-building strategy.
Monitor and maintain monthly tracking tools and perform website analysis to ensure business goals are met and provide insights and future actions.
Optimize website source code for search engines.
Research, report on and address search engine algorithm changes.
Research competitors in the search landscape and deliver innovative ideas on how we can outperform them.
Qualifications:
BA required with focus in Marketing or Business.
3+ years of SEO experience in a corporate business-to-business environment.
Understands SEO best practices and emerging trends, including knowledge of search engine ranking factors and algorithm updates.
Knowledge of HTML, CMS, CSS, structured data and website administration.
Ideally has experience with SEMRush, Adobe Analytics, Tableau, Drupal, Google Search Console.
Familiarity with localization processes and best practices.
Strong written and verbal communications.
Ability to work autonomously; produce work in a timely manner with extensive project management skills.
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you're searching for a company that's dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Job title: Sr Analyst Insights + SEO, CNN Politics
Description:
*175051BR**
*Posting Job Title:**
Sr Analyst Insights + SEO, CNN Politics
*WarnerMedia Business:**
Turner
*Posting Job Description:**
*This is our story**
We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.
*See what it's like to work at CNN!** Follow us on Instagram at http://bit.ly/CNNCareersInstagram , Twitter at http://bit.ly/CNNCareersTwitter and Facebook at http://bit.ly/CNNCareersFacebook .
*The Team**
Would you like to work for a leading global media organization? If so, we'd love to hear from you. We are currently recruiting a Sr. Analyst, Insights & SEO to support CNN Politics by partnering with teams in Editorial, Programming, Audience Development, Product & Technology and more with the goal of providing insights to help grow our digital audience.

CNN Digital is seeking an individual who is passionate about digital audience insights, SEO, analytics, audience development, and journalism. CNN's portfolio of news and information services is available in five different languages across all major TV, internet and mobile platforms reaching more than 392 million households around the globe.

CNN International is the number one international TV news channel according to all major media surveys across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, the Asia Pacific region and Latin America. The CNN digital network is consistently one of the top news and current affairs destination on the web.

As a member of the audience development team, you will work in close collaboration with CNN's editorial team to drive audience growth and increased engagement through our insights and SEO efforts.
*The Job**
The ideal candidate will have 3-5+ years' experience with gathering, visualizing, and providing insights from various data sources, as well as a good understanding of SEO principles. The ideal candidate with have an analytical mind with enthusiasm for data, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

The candidate best fit for this role will have experience working cross-departmentally and will have the ability and willingness to speak up to push for results. Experience in digital media publishing organizations is preferred.
*The Daily**
+ Develop workflow recommendations to include the data necessary to inform content and programming decisions in order to quickly move on opportunities that will grow CNN's search audience and increase their loyalty.

+ Leverage knowledge of the online news and information landscape to execute audience development plans to acquire CNN Digital's desired target audience segments.

+ Partner across multiple teams to coordinate and improve on CNN's audience development and SEO strategy, tying together editorial calendars, social calendars, business priorities, product launches and more.

+ Provide real time analytics feedback to Editorial and Programming teams to help provide the right content at the right time to CNN's audience.

+ Identifies scalable strategies, tactics and channels for audience growth.

+ Develop & champion improved processes for insight collection and dissemination across Audience Development, Product and Editorial teams.

+ Support short term Content Planning processes with editorial and programming teams.

+ Conduit between Content Teams and Audience Development Teams sitting within the CNN Newsroom, bridging editorial with audience development and analytics.

+ Focus on partnership with Editorial leaders to establish and define specific channel roles and guidelines for content and distribution.

+ Document usage and requirements for real-time analytics tools in coordination with Optimization & testing team, providing recommendations for relevant data and analytics enhancements.
*The Essentials**
+ Proficiency in data analysis, visualization, and translation for groups with varying levels of knowledge and understanding.

+ Able to identify, create and coordinate scalable strategies, tactics and levers for digital audience growth in consultation with key stakeholders across multiple teams.

+ Provide useful feedback -- both real-time and deep-dive -- to editorial and programming teams, supporting and helping to define their efforts and editorial strategies to deeply understand and expand CNN's complex audience.

+ Identify the best workflows for integrating real-time and reflective learnings to editorial and programming teams and fine-tune these processes regularly.

+ Experience successfully working cross-departmentally, effectively communicating across groups with varying levels of knowledge, including leadership.

+ Ability to perform keyword and trends research to identify what keywords to target for CNN's search audience, and explain the value of key phrase selection to writers and editors.

+ Must have ability to train editors and newsroom staff on how to optimize pages and articles through page titles, SEO descriptions, headlines, alt text, linking,etc.

+ On the forefront of updates within the SEO atmosphere - keeping the audience development, product, and business teams aware of any upcoming changes that would affect our business.

+ Staying current on Search Engine Optimization topics by monitoring search industry websites, forums, blogs and news sources.

+ Reviewing rank reporting, analytics, webmaster tools and other SEO resources to educate and explain fluctuations and metrics to varying teams.

+ Strong communication, presentation and organizational skills and ability to collaborate and work well with others.

+ Basic knowledge of digital media technologies, particularly a good understanding of capabilities and limitations.

+ Strong project/process management skills with experience managing workflow between different departments.

+ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced newsroom environment.

+ Experience with analytics tools such as: Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Chartbeat or similar.

+ Experience with SEO tools such as (or similar to): SEM Rush, Conductor, Brightedge, Google Search Console, NewsDashboard.

+ Advanced data collection and visualization skills with tools such as Microsoft Excel and Tableau.

+ Desirable: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Political Science, Marketing, Journalism or a related discipline.

+ Experience working in a global editorial organization.

+ Passion for news.
*The Perks**
+ Paid time off every year to volunteer

+ Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies

+ 2018 Best Company for Working Mothers at https://www.workingmother.com/best-companies-turner

+ 2018 Best Company for Dads at https://www.workingmother.com/best-companies-turner

+ An in-house learning and development team at https://tbcdn.talentbrew.com/company/1174/v1_0/docs/TPD-One-Pager.pdf to help shape and grow your career

+ Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Job title: Senior Amazon E-commerce Content and SEO Specialist
Description:
Marketing is one of the largest teams at SharkNinja. The team includes Digital, Brand, D2C, Media, PR and Creative. Each team focusing on how we give our consumers the ultimate product experience. Marketing is for the person that is not afraid to dive deep and show a genuine interest into the world of Consumer Goods. These are the people that are consistently asking themselves what can we do to we make things even easier for our consumers. Marketing at SharkNinja is for the person who is never satisfied with creating anything less than the best product on the market.

The E-commerce Content and SEO Senior Specialist is a vital role and requires an individual who is motivated, has great organizational skills, and SEO / e-commerce content experience. This role is responsible for leading the creation and execution of new product pages on Amazon, and maintaining that experience long-term. This person will manage and own the content for both Shark and Ninja products on Amazon.

Additionally, this person will be responsible for contributing to and executing the SEO strategy defined by the e-commerce Content and SEO Associate Manager.

Duties and Responsibilities
Own the execution, maintenance and optimization of all Amazon PDP content across both the Shark and Ninja brands
Bring an informed understanding of the overall retail digital strategy to the day-to-day processes and executions
Proactively monitor content health and identify the opportunity for content improvement
Coordinate with internal brand, creative, digital, legal, product, and sales teams to develop best-in-class content and creative assets that convert
Be accountable to ensure digital e-commerce and retail partner best practice guidelines and standards are met, and approvals obtained, for marketing content and assets.
Upload online content to Vendor Central
Ensure 100% perfect execution of our brand, category and product pages on Amazon
Conduct regular audits to ensure existing brand, category and product pages maintain accuracy. Create optimization plans to increase product ranking and manage through resolution
Own VINE program execution
Own Amazon content health reporting for content accuracy, page rank and keyword optimization
Experience, Requirements, Knowledge & Skills
Experience using Amazon Vendor Central and Brand Registry
Photoshop or Indesign experience (ability to edit images and create web banners)
3+ years of relevant work experience, including web content management, web project management and content optimization
1+ year of SEO experience with an understanding of how search engine crawlers and websites work
Strong attention to detail with the ability to focus on task completion for a variety of competing priorities
Must be organized and adept at handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction
Having an entrepreneurial spirit and mindset a "make it happen" way of thinking
Excellent organizational and time management skills; ability to manage multiple priorities
Proactive: able to note things that need to be done without being prompted
Who is SharkNinja?

At SharkNinja, our purpose is to positively impact people's lives every day in every home around the world. We work very hard to provide our consumers with high quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation, and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to create the next big thing. We take a team approach to our projects, where everyone has a voice. We want individuals to push limits, look outside the box and think the unthinkable. With the explosive growth we have been experiencing, we're looking for motivated individuals to join us on our exciting journey. People need to think big, move fast and want to make a significant impact. Are you ready?

We believe the economy is better when everyone has access. When everyone has room to grow. No one should be left out because the cost is too great or the technology too complex. Google Cloud, AWS

Machine learning and statistical modeling frameworks

Our Opportunity:

Chewy is seeking a highly motivated, goal-oriented, and dedicated Director, SEO to join our exciting and fast-paced company in Dania Beach, FL or Boston, MA. Our team is growing and if you are equally passionate about data analysis, digital marketing, e-commerce, and career growth, an opportunity at Chewy.com may be a great match!

In this role, you will be directly responsible for growing our organic search performance across multiple search engines. As single-threaded leader of the channel, you will manage a team of technical channel experts, own the channel roadmap, and partner with Product and Tech capabilities to deliver against roadmap needs. You will be accountable for quantifiable objectives focused on organic search visibility, traffic and new customer acquisitions and so a data-driven mentality is critical.

You will prioritize the most scalable opportunities and site optimizations. Leveraging your deep understanding of major search engine algorithm updates, and a combination of on-site and technical optimizations, you will develop the Organic search channel as a complementary, integrated, and critical component of the total site and new customer acquisition channel portfolio. In this role, you will partner with other Chewy leaders to ensure our product, content and engineering roadmaps align with our SEO strategy and audience growth goals. You must learn quickly, move fast, quickly run and analyze experiments, and make decisions prioritized by business impact. You will need the right balance of marketing and technology experience, as well as business judgment and technical aptitude.

What You'll Do:
Develop, manage, and evolve our SEO strategy, roadmap u0026amp; vision to meaningfully grow our audience
Work across the organization to develop working relationships with all product and engineering teams evangelizing and ensuring that Chewy builds and maintains an SEO-first platform
Own responsibility for developing SEO product and technical priorities, working with our content product team to prioritize the product roadmap and balance organic growth with user experience
Own growth and strategy for the organic search channel and owned channel content across web properties
Assume ownership of key performance metrics and reports to measure successes and opportunities
Conduct keyword research and provide recommendations for content creation across owned properties
Develop best practices for on-site and technical enhancements and work with the product and tech teams to make sure all new pages comply with SEO best practices
Manage efficiency and optimization of page titles, tags, descriptions etc. and make sure they are optimized for proper keyword focus and provide content to match search intent.
Create and oversee a link generation program to improve rankings
Responsible for the management and submission of the sitemaps
Conduct site audits and competitive analysis to proactively discover areas of opportunity
Monitor and improve rankings across top keywords
Be the thought leader on search technology and search industry changes, gaining a deep knowledge of desktop, mobile and social search
What You'll Need:
10+ years of hands-on SEO experience and understanding of ranking factors, algorithms and core SEO principals
Deep understanding of HTML, CSS, and Javascript for SEO purposes as well as site and network architectures
Experience working with engineers and driving technical implementations for SEO purposes
Obsessively organized and detail oriented
Strong leadership and communications skills (written and oral) with specific examples
Self-directed and effective working independently, yet equally comfortable contributing in a fast-paced team environment.
Bachelor's degree in marketing, statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or related field
Advanced in Google Analytics, Brightedge, Moz, and other search monitoring tools
Advanced Excel user, ability to create dashboards that drive decisions, and tell stories with data
Position may require travel

Company Overview


Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), major media brands (NBC Sports, CBS Sports, FOX Sports) and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea, Manchester City). Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events.


About the Team


Join our world class digital marketing team at Fanatics! Our team uses detailed measurements to execute and optimize our digital marketing and advertising strategies. The team is a significant growth driver for the company and is proud to push the envelope through innovations using a test and learn approach. To scale at a global level, the team utilizes best in class technology, machine learnings, and deep analytics to identify and push growth opportunities from our investments. The team also ensures that our customers have not only relevant, but the best experiences through data personalization.


Summary: Fanatics, Inc. is seeking a Sr. Director of SEO & Organic Growth to take our program to the next level.


As a thought leader, strategist and industry expert you will be defining our Search and Social Growth best practices for the industry. You will lead a team of highly skilled SEO and Content experts on all aspects of operations at a global scale. You will have P&L responsibility of the program and will be setting the strategic paths and goals in place to take our Organic Growth initiatives to the next level.


This is a unique opportunity to make a lasting impact on a fast-growing company. The ideal candidate has exceptional leadership skills and experience leading large-scale SEO teams, Organic Social initiatives, and other quantitative marketing channels at a medium or large ecommerce company.
Responsibilities
This role will set the strategy and lead the current team to generate growth and demand through Search and Social organic growth channels on a global scale.
Lead the strategic direction and execution of the SEO and Social Organic Growth functions
Be the SEO subject matter expert to your team and partners across the business and technology teams.
Define and execute the strategy to accelerate organic growth in social channels like Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Twitter, YouTube, Reddit and other emerging platforms.
Partner with the digital marketing team and business leaders to drive the right traffic to increase customer acquisition, orders, and ultimately revenue.
Develop and execute a comprehensive SEO strategy with both technical and non-technical opportunities to grow our organic traffic.
Work closely with the Product and Engineering teams to develop roadmap for new tools and scalable solutions/processes to address growth opportunities.
Leverage analytics and data to prioritize projects within the overall product roadmap
Research, measure, design, and report on the impact of SEO projects and a/b tests, while embracing a mindset of test and learn to improve future performance.
Extract insights, identify relevant trends, and provide proactive recommendations from overall organic performance, algorithm changes, and competitive actions.
Leverage the value of content, imagery, video, user reviews, and author sourced content and make recommendations which help reach more visitors.
Be a believer in the power of optimizing core SEO basics, constantly.
Evaluate SEO tools which can be used to further traffic goals.
Select and manage third party vendors and experts to identify additional opportunities to maximize SEO growth.
Work with product and technology teams to ensure that SEO considerations are factored into other projects and features.
Recruit, retain and develop high-value team members within SEO & Organic Growth group.
With the global scope of this role, you will have team members in Chicago, Jacksonville, and Manchester UK. Some travel will be expected.
Requirements
10+ years of SEO & demand generation experience from a medium to large scale ecommerce consumer facing company
Advanced understanding and knowledge of SEO best practices, toolsets, and the latest search engine algorithm updates
Industry expert in the Organic Social field
World Class team and people manager, with a proven track record of having managed a +10 people team of marketing professionals
Ability to analyze data and identify patterns to drive your work with exceptional organizational skills and rigorous attention to detail
Strong track record of launching successful Organic Social marketing campaigns and driving qualified leads in the funnel
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment with tight deadlines
Extensive work and knowledge with SEO and analytics tools
Ability to collaborate effectively and productively across marketing, product, business and technology teams
Take full P&L responsibility for the program, and work with Finance & Strategy teams to set goals and projections for the future of the organic growth business
A great communicator, boiling complex concepts down into clear, actionable instructions
A true collaborator, working with multiple stakeholders across teams to educate, influence, and execute
Be a team player - One Fanatics - win as a team!
Tryouts are open at Fanatics! Our team is passionate, talented, unified, and charged with creating the fan experience of tomorrow. The ball is in your court now.

We are looking for a passionate Senior Software Engineers to expand our audience and increase our reach. With strong focus on growth, Wish is looking for engineers with extensive experience in web development and driving user acquisitions through SEO. The person should have good hands-on experience in Web technologies and different tools related to SEO. The person should have proven track record of driving the user acquisition based on his/her analytical, problem-solving and engineering skills. As a Senior Engineer, you will work closely with other Engineers in the web team as well as Marketing, Growth, Content and Data team to optimize web user acquisition, conversion, international expansion, dashboard automation and data pipelines.

Job Summary

The Senior Manager, Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is responsible for driving the SEO program for Populus Financial Group and its suite of brands. In this role, you will lead all SEO efforts by educating and evangelizing SEO principles and best practices across the organization. You will be expected to build strong cross-functional relationships across the organization (eCommerce, IT, Product, Marketing, PR) to ultimately drive organic growth through the development and execution of clear and prioritized roadmaps for SEO. Ability to properly quantify and articulate the value of SEO and SEO initiatives is of paramount importance for this role. Heavy knowledge and passion for SEO is also required. This position reports to the Director of Digital Marketing.

Major Responsibilities
Develop, represent and drive the strategic direction for SEO initiatives for all PFG’s brands.
Demonstrate strong leadership and influence and communicate a clear vision to other organizational functions.
Lead and optimize all PFG’s website footprints to meet consumer search needs.
Evangelize SEO and organic growth strategies with business and functional partners (eCommerce, IT, Product, Marketing, PR).
Educate and guide eCommerce, IT, and Marketing on how to maximize digital experiences for performance in search engines.
Lead the development and execution of SEO strategies across the organization.
Oversee overall link building strategy to increase authority for all PFG websites.
Implement and improve organizational processes and workflows to support SEO.
Develop a holistic search strategy in partnership with other marketing teams.
Continually monitor and report on industry trends, including demand curve, search algorithm and result layout changes, SEO best practices, and the competitive landscape to identify opportunities.
Develop and maintain reporting on all SEO efforts (including but not limited to, ranking reports, link profiling and domain authority).
Manage team of two in the execution of SEO and Local SEO strategy for all PFG brands.
Lead the design and execution of analytically sound marketing tests (A/B or multivariate); drive click- through rate and conversion rate improvements across digital marketing campaigns for SEO and Local SEO.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including Creative, BI, Product Management, Analytics, Operations, Risk, Legal/Compliance and IT.
Assist with the development of monthly business reviews for executive management presentations.
Key Competencies
Leadership
Communication Proficiencies
Technical
Project Management
Organized & Detailed
Analytical
Driven & Self Starter
Minimum Qualifications
Passion for SEO while working in a fast-paced digital environment is a must.
Bachelors’ degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Information Technology, UX Design or related field.
Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in SEO with consistent track record of delivering successful SEO improvements.
Minimum of 2 years managing people in a corporate work environment.
Minimum of 6 years’ experience in consumer web analytics. Must have expert knowledge in Google Analytics.
Expert understanding of on-page optimization, link building, ranking factors, and technical factors that influence SEO performance.
Strong Familiarity in suite of SEO tools (Google Search Console, BrightEdge, Conductor, Moz Pro, Moz Local, SEMRush, Majestic, Ahrefs, etc..).
Extraordinary data analytics and articulation skills with experience setting and measuring SEO KPIs.
Experience working with business listing management platforms, such as Google My Business or Yext.
Self-starter and independently driven with a willingness to take initiative and work well with ambiguity.
Experience developing audience and market insights through keyword research and topic modeling.
Comprehensive understanding of the SEO landscape, both through a technology and competitor lens.
Superior relationship-building with cross-functional teams to deliver results through excellent partnership, communication and negotiating skills.
Excellent written/oral, organizational, analytical skills, and attention to detail.
Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand or walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop or bend; and talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.

About ManyChat

ManyChat is marketing automation and chatbot platform that is changing how small businesses talk to their customers. We're helping over 500,000 small businesses bypass slow and inefficient channels like email and connect in real-time and at scale with millions of customers. Our goal is to disrupt the $5BN+ email marketing industry by bringing the convenience of messenger products from our personal lives into business-to-customer communication. We grew 5x over the last 12 months and are powering over 3 billion monthly conversations. ManyChat was founded in 2015 and is based in San Francisco with venture funding from Bessemer Venture Partners and was recently named "America's Best Startup employers 2020" by Forbes.

The Senior Manager of Website & Search Engine Optimization will be a strategic leader on the Global Customer Marketing team responsible for leveraging organic search and website to drive demand and conversion to our platform. The person will also build a best-in-class, modern website and search engine optimization discipline, infrastructure, and processes to help us become a leader in chat marketing.

The Global Customer Marketing team is a nascent group within Mancychat charged with the responsibility to grow our customer base, increase comprehension and usage of the product among our existing customers & launch new products.

This person will be a leader on that team, responsible for developing and executing our organic search strategy, driving all-star initiatives to improve rankings and grow organic traffic. The person will also be responsible for partnering with product marketing, paid demand generation, insights, and our content and creative team to optimize the website for conversions. You will also be responsible for implementing the ad tech, instrumentation & tracking infrastructure, in partnership with engineering/analytics to track and report performance.

This is an opportunity for a candidate with a consistent track record of optimizing global websites in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, both highly analytical as well as adept at working cross-functionally at all levels of the organization. You are someone who enjoys building web strategy and experience, analyzing SEO data, is an authority at both technical and content-driven optimization, and has the technical, creative and people skills to lead complex initiatives to improve SEO and CRO performance and map web vision and strategy to revenue goals.

You will report to the Head of Demand Generation and will be based in San Francisco.

Responsibilities
You will create a robust SEO and CRO strategy, including a roadmap of initiatives to drive organic traffic, signups, and revenue and measure the impact of these initiatives.
You will work closely with the product and engineering teams to make sure the company's infrastructure, architecture, and site features support and enhance the effectiveness of our SEO.
You will partner with the content team to create best-in-class content that solves user needs based on search intent data.
You will generate test concepts, refine testing methodology and roadmaps across homepage, blog and landing pages.
You will drive personalized web experience to prospects & customers depending on their stage of the funnel.
You will execute and deliver A/B & multi-variate experiments in the website optimization according to budget, scope, and schedule.
You will measure web performance and report to cross-functional stakeholders.
What we're looking for:



5+ years of experience in digital marketing, SEO, and CRO.
Proven track record in managing SEO projects from inception to completion.
Experience with owning web analytics (Google Analytics), A/B testing (VWO, Optimizely, etc), and personalization.
Demonstrated track record of building and optimizing web experiences driving growth.
Experience with b2b marketing, SaaS, or subscription products.
A strong data-driven approach to problem-solving.
Ability to collaborate and build relationships with in-house content and technical stakeholders.
Ability to deliver organic results without compromising the brand experience for users.
Basic knowledge and understanding of HTML and CSS knowledge and have partnered with web developers is a plus.
Benefits
Competitive salary and stock option plan
Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
Healthy office snacks and weekly team lunch
Flexible work schedule with flexible time off
Team building events and more
401k plan available for individual contributions
ManyChat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We're committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. About Us

All Web Promotion has been helping clients develop successful web presences locally and across the globe for 20 years. We are a web design and marketing agency in the Illinois Valley.

Schedule

This is a full-time position on site in our Peru, IL office. Standard hours are Monday - Friday from 8AM - 4:30PM. You may be required to work outside of these days and hours depending on business needs.

Culture

We work in an open office environment and with a strong emphasis on team collaboration. We are a group of professionals that are also fun and laid back. This is definitely not a corporate-like atmosphere with strict rules and stuffy meetings. We are able to maintain this pleasant and creative culture by focusing on hiring individuals that will balance the lack of formality with strong personal skills that drive success.

Candidate Qualifications

We're looking for a detail oriented individual with a drive to learn new programs, processes, and technology. Our ideal candidate will be a self-starter always on the lookout for opportunities to grow, learn, and expand his or her skillset. This talented worker should be confident with sharing ideas, knowledge, and solutions. Self-discipline and personal responsibility are critical.

Personal Skills
Research & Analytical Skills: Sherlock Holmes, but with SEO.
Confidence: You don’t have to be Chuck Norris, but you could be ;)
Verbal & Interpersonal Skills: Warning - sales calls and occasional speeches required
Copy Writing Skills: 8/10 minimum. Not quite legendary, but efficient and professional
Attention to Detail: How many typos did you catch in this post?
Project Management: Multitasking and strong organization. Being an octopus would be handy.
Adaptation Skills: Mongoose like reflexes. Must be able to react to algorithm changes and other rapidly changing situations to recover quickly.
Position Responsibilities
Use SEO tools:
Analyze metrics
Measure KPIs
Keyword Research
Discover errors
Creating SEO strategies
Backlinks
Make data driven decisions
Write SEO optimized copy including product descriptions, blogs, articles, meta data, and more.
Work with developers to implement technical SEO improvements.
Work with designers to plan features and designs.
Sell SEO services and discover new leads.
Present webinars, workshops, and meetings.
This is not a comprehensive list of job duties. We all wear many hats at All Web. Your job duties are flexible and will change over time and with business needs. Your duties will go beyond the scope of SEO.

Bonus Points if you…
Proudly identify as a nerd or geek
Like to play with puppies
Like food days
Are good at playing Connect 4
Deal Breaker if you…
Have no SEO experience
Are not a team player
Are happy being an average employee
Are not dependable or reliable
Education

Degree not required. We find that many of our most talented employees are self-taught. We are more interested in your proven ability to do the job. Google certifications are a plus.

Why You Should Work for All Web

We’re awesome. Seriously, check out our Facebook page to see some of the shenanigans we’re up to.

Also, we offer:
Performance based raise after 60 and 90 days.
IRA Plan with company match
Health Insurance / Vision Insurance
Company Paid Life Insurance
Paid Vacations
Paid Holidays
Closed Weekends

Guild Mortgage Company, closing loans and opening doors since 1960. As a mortgage banking firm we are dedicated to serving the home owner/buyer. Our goal is to provide affordable home financing for our customers, utilizing the best terms available while providing a level of professionalism and service unsurpassed in the lending industry.

Position Summary

The Search Engine Optimization Specialist (SEOS) plays an important role in the organization by performing a number of activities directly related to the company’s marketing functions. The role is primarily responsible, under moderate to intermittent direction for implementing the digital tagging and analytics measurement strategy for Guild's digital footprint, including websites, blogs, mobile apps, and reporting applications.

Essential Functions
Centralize digital tracking, analytics, and associated data quality
Direct data layer implementation on the existing and new sites and pages across all digital properties
Create and maintain documentation related to data layer implementation requirements for digital properties
Develop and maintain processes for tag requests/approval and management
Partner with front-end development team for user acceptance testing and implementation
Manage tags via tag management platform (GTM)
Diagnose issues with existing platform configurations and tags, and provide recommendations for improvement
Work with third parties and business units to resolve discrepancies or platform issues (RIO, React)
Maintain working knowledge of industry best practices and changes in analytics platforms
Meet and work with developers, as needed, to communicate what an implementation is designed to accomplish; define JavaScript functions and modules that need to be executed
Implement site personalization tags and testing - targeting tools
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including agency partners to ensure we are following analytics and measurement best practices
Update existing web content to include more keywords (WordPress) and work with SEO strategists on keyword trends
Publish press releases and blogs including adding meta tags regularly (WordPress)
Administer search engine programs (XML sitemaps, analytic goals, groups, conversions and webmaster tools) for purposes of diagnostic reporting on digital initiatives
Propose and implement data linking strategies
Perform other duties as needed
Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required, along with 1– 2 years’ experience with Search Engine Optimization
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Knowledge of best SEO practices is required
Google certifications strongly preferred: Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Data Studio, Google AdWords, Google Firebase, Google Optimize
Familiarity with other analytic tools is strongly preferred.
Basic knowledge of front-end development and WordPress is required
Extremely proficient writing abilities
Dedication to staying updated with new developments in the industry
Strong interpersonal skills and passionate about delivering excellence in customer service
Highly organized and detail oriented; ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Self-motivated with a strong attention to detail
Ethical, with a commitment to company values
Requirements

Travel: 0%
Physical: Work is primarily sedentary; mobility in an office setting.

Manual Dexterity: Frequent use of computer keyboard and mouse.

Audio/Visual: Ability to accurately interpret sounds and associated meanings at a volume consistent with interpersonal conversation. Regularly required to accurately perceive, distinguish and interpret information received visually and through audio; e.g., words, numbers and other data broadcasted aloud/viewed on a screen, as well as print and other media.
Environmental: Office environment– no substantial exposure to adverse environmental conditions.

Guild offers a pleasant work environment, competitive compensation and excellent benefits package; including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, LTD and 401(k) with employer match.

Guild Mortgage Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Bachelor's Degree in related field - Required

Excellent collaboration and team building skills.

Experience managing people.

The SEO Strategist will work with our existing Search Engine Optimization team to provide strategic SEO services for our clients. The SEO Strategist will be responsible for researching, identifying and implementing emerging SEO trends and tactics.

This role will manage all aspects of day to day SEO strategy for clients. This position requires a deep understanding of analytics and identifying relevant insights, a strong ability to audit technical website issues, as well as hands on experience in on-page optimization, social media strategy and link development.

Success metrics will be based on growth in overall qualified organic traffic for client sites and ranking of specific keyword phrases.

The ideal candidate should also be comfortable in a client facing role with strong written and verbal communication skills. This individual will be required to present SEO audit findings and implementation plans to our clients via conference calls. Candidate must possess organizational and time management skills as they will be responsible for the management of several advanced SEO campaigns.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Creates and reviews reports with clients of their current and historical SEO campaigns.
Performs client specific keyword research and competitive analysis.
Performs technical SEO Audits of client websites.
Identifies, recommends, and implements on-page website SEO optimization.
Performs Back link analysis, opportunity identification, solicitation and optimization.
Analyzes client websites and provides well-defined strategies to improve site conversion and ROI.
Creates and presents written recommendations for SEO performance improvements.
Performs day to day client relationship management, if needed.
Manages SEO projects including kickoff, requirements analysis, development, testing and launch.
Researches and analyzes industry changes/developments in search engine optimization.
Contributes to the company SEO blog.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

A BA/BS Degree preferred. A minimum of one year of experience. Experience with advanced Search Engine Optimization is preferred but not required. Candidate must have strong verbal and written communication skills.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

The incumbent/candidate must have a detailed work ethic, be highly motivated, well organized and be able to communicate effectively with a diverse group of individual customers, as well as all levels of employees. Candidate must have solid time management and written/oral communication skills. Computer skills are required for this position. Mastery of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, needed. A strong understanding of HTML, CSS, Javascript, server side data and PHP is preferred but not required. Knowledge and experience in SEO is preferred but not required. Organizational skills and ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects and resources are required.

Manager, SEO

The Ovative Group Manager, SEO position is an opportunity for an experienced candidate to take the next step in a leadership role at a fast-growing company that has the highest standards for talent, fun, and client success. The ideal candidate demonstrates great critical thinking and prioritization, sophisticated understanding of the digital media landscape, phenomenal client management, and inspiring team leadership. Their role will play a pivotal role in helping Ovative continue our journey toward measuring and optimizing search to the true enterprise impact, not solely ecommerce impacts.

Responsibilities of a SEO Manager:

Performance-driven SEO program management & execution:
Possess deep, results-oriented SEO subject matter expertise with a proven track record of driving organic performance in enterprise settings
Lead day-to-day management of client Search Engine Optimization (SEO) programs across an enterprise client portfolio including:
Technical auditing and optimizations on large sites (>100k pages)
On-page optimization activities, such as keyword research, metadata development, and more
Off-page optimization activities, such as link building, link reclamation, and outreach
Content activities, such as content auditing, gap analysis, strategy execution, and more
Weekly and monthly reporting
Be effective in driving change - navigate ambiguity and large organizations with ease to maximize the impact of our work
Regular analysis and effective communication of program performance at granular levels to audiences ranging from day-to-day stakeholders up to C-suite
Cross-functional strategy & thought leadership:
Have a strong voice and be a driving force in evolving best practices and channel innovation
Connect disparate dots, and proactively identify and execute on opportunities to connect SEO efforts to other channels (paid search, site optimization, etc)
Develop and drive forward multi-channel digital media strategies and roadmaps aligned with client program growth goals
Support higher level, cross-functional marketing strategy projects by providing deep media expertise
Client relationship management:
Own, manage, and grow the overall relationship of some of Ovative Group's largest clients
Deliver Ovative's unique client experience by making their Ovative interactions the best part of their day
Team leadership and employee development:
Lead, manage, and grow an exceptional team of high-performing direct reports
Provide meaningful, impactful feedback proactively to direct and indirect reports
Review deliverables, align on strategies, be a thought partner, and remove roadblocks
Conduct regular development checkins to ensure goals are on-track, including quarterly 360-degree feedback sessions
Manage, train, and support recruitment efforts of new Ovative team members
Requirements of a SEO Senior Manager:
6+ years of experience directly responsible for enterprise-level Organic Marketing (SEO) programs
Proven track record of success driving strong positive results through SEO marketing programs
Proven mastery of the following:
Performance-based, direct-response marketing programs
All analytics tools (Adobe analytics, Google Analytics / Google Search Console, server log analysis, etc)
Visibility monitoring tools (STAT, Conductor/Brightedge, etc), Auditing tools (DeepCrawl, Screaming Frog, Botify, etc), Keyword research tools (Adwords, Ahrefs, SEMRush, etc, and other analysis tools
Previous experience in enterprise SEO programs, performance marketing, retail, eCommerce, etc. preferred
Experience managing direct reports
Benefits of working at Ovative Group:

We provide strong, competitive, holistic benefits that understand the importance of your life inside and out of work

Culture:

Culture matters and we've been recognized as a Top Workplace three-years running because of it. We demand trust and transparency from each other. We believe in doing the hard and complicated work others put off. We're open in communication and floor plan. We're flat - our interns sit next to VPs, our analysts work closely with senior leaders, and our CEO interacts with every single person daily. Put together, these elements help foster an environment where smart people can support each other in performing to their highest potential.

Compensation and insurance:

We strive to hire and retain the best talent in the Twin Cities. Paying fair, competitive compensation, with a large bonus incentive, and phenomenal health insurance is an important part of this mix. We're rewarded fairly and when the company performs well, we all benefit.

Tangible amenities we enjoy:
Flexible paid vacation policy
401k match program
Free parking and on-site fitness center with locker rooms
Sabbatical program
Charitable giving via our time and a financial match program
Shenanigan's day
Working at Ovative won't be easy, but if you like getting your hands dirty, driving results, and being surrounded by the best talent, it'll be the most rewarding job you'll ever have. If you think you can make us better, we want to hear from you!
