Description Job Summary
The Senior Manager, Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is responsible for driving the SEO program for Populus Financial Group and its suite of brands. In this role, you will lead all SEO efforts by educating and evangelizing SEO principles and best practices
across the organization. You will be expected to build strong cross-functional relationships across the organization (eCommerce, IT, Product, Marketing, PR) to ultimately drive organic growth through the development and execution of clear and prioritized roadmaps
for SEO. Ability to properly quantify and articulate the value of SEO and SEO initiatives is of paramount importance for this role. Heavy knowledge and passion for SEO is also required. This position reports to the Director of Digital Marketing.

Major Responsibilities
• Develop, represent and drive the strategic direction for SEO initiatives for all PFG’s brands.
• Demonstrate strong leadership and influence and communicate a clear vision to other organizational functions.
• Lead and optimize all PFG’s website footprints to meet consumer search needs.
• Evangelize SEO and organic growth strategies with business and functional partners (eCommerce, IT, Product, Marketing, PR).
• Educate and guide eCommerce, IT, and Marketing on how to maximize digital experiences for performance in search engines.
• Lead the development and execution of SEO strategies across the organization.
• Oversee overall link building strategy to increase authority for all PFG websites.
• Implement and improve organizational processes and workflows to support SEO.
• Develop a holistic search strategy in partnership with other marketing teams.
• Continually monitor and report on industry trends, including demand curve, search algorithm and result layout changes, SEO best practices, and the competitive landscape to identify opportunities.
• Develop and maintain reporting on all SEO efforts (including but not limited to, ranking reports, link profiling and domain authority).
• Manage team of two in the execution of SEO and Local SEO strategy for all PFG brands.
• Lead the design and execution of analytically sound marketing tests (A/B or multivariate); drive click- through rate and conversion rate improvements across digital marketing campaigns for SEO and Local SEO.
• Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including Creative, BI, Product Management, Analytics, Operations, Risk, Legal/Compliance and IT.
• Assist with the development of monthly business reviews for executive management presentations.

Key Competencies
• Leadership
• Communication Proficiencies
• Technical
• Project Management
• Organized & Detailed
• Analytical
• Driven & Self Starter


Requirements
Minimum Qualifications

• Passion for SEO while working in a fast-paced digital environment is a must.
• Bachelors’ degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Information Technology, UX Design or related field.
• Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in SEO with consistent track record of delivering successful SEO improvements.
• Minimum of 2 years managing people in a corporate work environment.
• Minimum of 6 years’ experience in consumer web analytics. Must have expert knowledge in Google Analytics.
• Expert understanding of on-page optimization, link building, ranking factors, and technical factors that influence SEO performance.
• Strong Familiarity in suite of SEO tools (Google Search Console, BrightEdge, Conductor, Moz Pro, Moz Local, SEMRush, Majestic, Ahrefs, etc..).
• Extraordinary data analytics and articulation skills with experience setting and measuring SEO KPIs.
• Experience working with business listing management platforms, such as Google My Business or Yext.
• Self-starter and independently driven with a willingness to take initiative and work well with ambiguity.
• Experience developing audience and market insights through keyword research and topic modeling.
• Comprehensive understanding of the SEO landscape, both through a technology and competitor lens.
• Superior relationship-building with cross-functional teams to deliver results through excellent partnership, communication and negotiating skills.
• Excellent written/oral, organizational, analytical skills, and attention to detail.

Drive the strategy and execution for search and social advertising

Monitor marketing effectiveness and identify opportunities across a range of KPIs and report on a weekly basis.

Job title: Specialist, Search Engine Optimization and Online Analyst
Description:
We Are Hiring

Specialist, Search Engine Optimization and Online Analyst

Marketing and Communications

Austin, TX

Do you have a minimum of two years online marketing experience, particularly in search optimization? Are you proficient in Google platforms including Google My Business, Google Search, and Google Analytics? Then this is the job for you! Come join our team in Austin, Texas!!

Why Join Ascension?

Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the leading non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, especially to those most in need. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs.

Ascension includes approximately 156,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. The national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care – including 151 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities – in 21 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension’s own group purchasing organization.

What You Will Do

The Specialist, Search Engine Optimization and Online Analyst on the Marketing and Communications team is responsible for managing data and analytics to support organic localized search optimization strategies that drive campaign performance, conversion optimization and creative paths to results for the organization.

Responsibilities:
Set-up and manage day-to-day operations of online business listings projects (inclusive of search, directories, ratings and reviews) across multiple markets, lines of business and campaigns
Serve as a proficient marketing data steward and campaign analyst dedicated to off-site search engine optimization functionality and performance
Understand off-site search engine optimization strategy within an integrated marketing approach that drives conversion through paid search (SEM), display marketing, social media advertising, and traditional advertising and be a subject matter expert within the Marketing and Communications team on the topic
Effectively communicate to internal stakeholders the opportunity for, and value of, website changes, updates, and content optimizations.
Stay updated on new tools, trends and best practices on all search engine algorithm updates (primarily Google) and the SEO industry
Work with outside partners as necessary and be able to manage sub-projects related to various data types, in order to populate business listing profiles
Define, monitor, and analyze key performance indicators for data sprints providing reports for both internal and external use - and collaborate with other team members to provide reporting across multiple online business listing channels
Use appropriate metrics and measurement strategies to examine, evaluate and optimize listings, campaigns and marketing plans based on performance, efficiency and growth priorities
Collaborate with broader marketing and media teams to provide necessary information for business listing and online directory development to ensure SEO efforts are effective
What You Will Need

Education:
High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree required
Bachelor's degree preferred
Work Experience:
Minimum two years online marketing experience, particularly in search optimization
Proficient in Google platforms including Google My Business, Google Search and Google Analytics
Proficient in Google Sheets, Microsoft Excel and other database capabilities
Equal Employment Opportunity

Ascension is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet. For further information regarding your EEO rights, click on the following link to the “EEO is the Law” poster:
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf”
Please note that Ascension will make an offer of employment only to individuals who have applied for a position using our official application. Be on alert for possible fraudulent offers of employment. Ascension will not solicit money or banking information from applicants.

1fb.net inc is an internet development company that focuses on developing internet channels, product strategies and robust technologies for delivering the Bank's products and services to its customers. 1fb.net inc is a wholly owned subsidiary of 1st Financial Bank USA.

Title: SEO Manager

The SEO Manager will develop, implement, and continually optimize SEO strategy, improve organic search results, and shape existing and new content to increase and convert visitor traffic for CollegeData, a service provided by 1st Financial Bank USA (1FBUSA).

This position requires being proficient with Search Engine Optimization (SEO); organic search strategy; paid search marketing; content optimization; key word research; website monitoring and user analytics; and link-building. This needs to be coupled with proficient analytic skills and the ability to connect the user behavior and content on CollegeData to the business goals of the site.

Helping to optimize content and maintain SEO best practices, the ideal candidate will have a significant impact on the growth of visitor traffic on CollegeData, developing new ways to engage and retain our target audience, implement business initiatives between CollegeData and 1FBUSA, improve the site's authority on the web, and provide our users with an exceptional college planning resource.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Report to and work with VP of Business Development, company management, and subject matter experts to run a fully integrated SEO strategy for CollegeData
Leverage web analytics, visitor analytics, and customer data analytics to monitor weekly site performance as well as competitors', improve the site's organic search results through tactics such as white-hat link acquisition, retarget visitors, and help the site achieve its business goals
Develop high performing organic and paid campaigns
Research and keep management and the CollegeData team abreast of new and emerging SEO and digital marketing trends
Work closely with the site's content director to develop and maintain optimized content and key word strategies
Define success metrics for the site's content strategy, ensuring that relevant data is collected in analytics and used correctly to improve search results
Review technical SEO issues and work with the CollegeData engineering team to resolve issues
Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent experience

Experience and skills:
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in developing SEO and digital marketing strategies across multiple marketing channels (including social media) to optimize SEO, increase engagement, conversions, and other positive user behavior
Expert in state-of-the-art and emerging SEO/SEM strategies
Data-driven approach to measuring performance, making decisions, and achieving business goals
Superior written and oral communication skills
Technical/Reasoning/Mathematical or other specific skills:
Proficient with SEO tools including Ahrefs, SEMrush, and other related tools
Proficient with Google Analytics including Google Search Console, and other web analytics tools
Experience with email marketing and online advertising networks
Familiarity with website infrastructure and CMS platforms
Preferred Candidate Characteristics:
Demonstrated experience working with SEO subject matter experts, content creators, marketers, UI designers, engineers, and data analysts
Ability to identify, analyze and clarify multiple options for SEO strategy
Ability to meet project deadlines and commitments and follow directions from senior management
Experience with blogs and/or content sites
Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Experience developing content marketing strategies for college bound high school students
Knowledge of college planning, admission and financial aid from professional experience
We provide a highly competitive and comprehensive compensation and benefits program including affordable medical/dental/vision insurance, generous paid leave program, 401(k), health savings account, tuition reimbursement, financial childcare assistance and much more!

Nurture and develop relationships with writers, reporters and web editors
Write effective web copy for the purposes of marketing websites in diverse verticals
Frequent outreach to bloggers and press outlets for the purpose of growing online visibility
Do whatever it takes to grow the online presence of our clients
Required Skills
3+ years in a content marketing role
Proven outreach experience with high volume campaigns and ability to efficiently prospect and pitch media, ideally with a high DA of 30 or better
Intermediary SEO skills with working knowledge of popular SEO tools

Who We Are

We?re America?s largest mortgage lender, closing loans in all 50 states. J.D. Power ranked Quicken Loans ?Highest in Customer Satisfaction in Primary Mortgage Origination? for the past nine consecutive years, 2010 ? 2018. If you?re tired of stuffy, bureaucratic workplaces, then you?ll be delighted to find something different here. We strive to make a creative, fun and collaborative environment you simply won?t find anywhere else. Quicken Loans was named #1 in ESSENCE Magazine?s first ever list of ?Best Places to Work for African Americans? in 2015. We were also ranked #14 in FORTUNE Magazine?s list of "100 Best Companies to Work For" in 2018, remaining in the top-30 for the past 15 years.

Senior Analyst, Digital Marketing Search Engine Optimization

About Ovative Group

Ovative Group is one of the only firms in the country uniting strategy, media, and measurement under one roof to drive enterprise results. Our teams work together to drive business impact for clients such as General Mills, maurices, United Healthcare, Facebook, and more. Recognized three consecutive years on Star Tribune's list of Top 150 Workplaces and the past two years on Inc.5000's list of the fastest growing private companies in America, we pride ourselves in always over delivering for our clients, our teams, and our communities.

About the Role

Digital Marketing is a critical part of every consumer journey, but many companies only measure its impact on their digital outcomes. Our approach to SEO at Ovative Group can't be found anywhere else. We measure and optimize at the enterprise level, both online and offline. Our clients are household names that span multiple industries, including retail, healthcare, education, CPG, and hospitality.

The Ovative Group Senior Analyst, SEO position is an opportunity for an experienced candidate to take on an early stage, leadership role at a fast-growing company that has the highest standards for talent, fun, and client success. The ideal candidate demonstrates great critical thinking, solid understanding of the digital media landscape, and is motivated by driving results for our clients. Their role will play a pivotal role in helping Ovative continue our journey toward measuring and optimizing to the true enterprise impact, not solely ecommerce impacts.

Responsibilities of an SEO Senior Analyst:


Cross-functional strategy & thought leadership:
Act as a subject matter expert for SEO strategies by continually evolving Ovative's approach to best practices, vetting and partnering with new technology companies, managing planning and execution tools, and staying on top of emerging trends
Develop and drive forward multi-channel digital media strategies and roadmaps aligned with client program growth goals
Understand and find synergies across digital channels within the client mix in partnership with other team members
Performance media management & execution:
Heavy data analysis of SEO program performance
Lead day-to-day management, strategy, and optimization of client SEO programs, including:
Technical auditing and improvement plans for sites over 100k pages
On-page optimization activities, such as keyword research, metadata development & more
Off-page optimization activities, such as link building, link reclamation & outreach
Content activates, such as content auditing, gap analysis, strategy execution, seasonal research & more
Weekly and monthly reporting
Translate analyses into clearly communicated insights via slides, documents, and emails to the client
Client relationship management:
Seek to understand the client's business/industry and understand how their work connects to the broader project and client goals
Lead development and delivery of client-facing solutions, including:
Clearly defining program objectives, tactics and KPIs
Developing and delivering client communication
Build display-specific strategies for clients and lead tactical planning and execution
Effectively manage & grow client relationship and establish trust and credibility
Strive to be the best interaction of the client's day
Team leadership and employee development:
Manage work independently with initial direction from manager
Regularly speak up, ask questions and express your POV
Recruit, train and manage new Ovative team members
Foster a culture of open communication and 360-degree feedback
Requirements:
2+ years of experience directly responsible for enterprise-level SEO related programs
Proven track record of success driving strong positive results through SEO programs
Proven mastery of the following:
Performance based marketing programs and multi-channel attribution
External partner management
Google Analytics / Google Search Console / Bing Webmaster Tolls
SEO tools such as, SEMrush, Screaming Frog/Xenu, Moz, Ahrefs, Conductor/Brightedge/STAT/Linkdex and other SEO auditing/analysis tools
MS Excel / Powerpoint
Solid understanding of search engine ranking factors
Great communication and client management skills
Sound conceptual and analytical problem-solving skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to work independently and drive efforts from start to finish
Preferred:
Strong digital agency experience or digital lead on the client-side
Previous experience in performance marketing, retail, eCommerce, etc.
Adobe Analytics experience
Benefits of working at Ovative Group

We provide strong, competitive, holistic benefits that understand the importance of your life inside and out of work

Culture:

Culture matters and we've been recognized as a Top Workplace three-years running because of it. We demand trust and transparency from each other. We believe in doing the hard and complicated work others put off. We're open in communication and floor plan. We're flat our interns sit next to VPs, our analysts work closely with senior leaders, and our CEO interacts with every single person daily. Put together, these elements help foster an environment where smart people can support each other in performing to their highest potential.

Compensation and insurance:

We strive to hire and retain the best talent in the Twin Cities. Paying fair, competitive compensation, with a large bonus incentive, and phenomenal health insurance is an important part of this mix. We're rewarded fairly and when the company performs well, we all benefit.

Tangible amenities we enjoy:
Flexible paid vacation policy
401k match program
Free parking and on-site fitness center with locker rooms
Sabbatical program
Charitable giving via our time and a financial match program
Shenanigan's day
Working at Ovative won't be easy, but if you like getting your hands dirty, driving results, and being surrounded by the best talent, it'll be the most rewarding job you'll ever have. If you think you can make us better, we want to hear from you!

This position is based in NYC and we respectfully request that you inquire if only committed to working in our NYC office. Due to current circumstances, we are on-boarding new employees remotely but viable candidates will need to live in the NYC areaSEO Manager
Ai Media Group is looking for an SEO Manager to take a lead role in creating and delivering Search Engine Optimization and Search Engine Marketing Strategies across our client portfolio. This individual must be deadline, target and results driven and thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.

Required Experience

· Solid and demonstrable SEO background

· Minimum of 3-5 years proven SEO and SEM marketing experience, preferably in an agency environment

· Experience in editorial copy writing in the English language desirable

· High degree of understanding and familiarity across all digital channels

· Experience in managing multiple projects with a multitude of stakeholders

· Deep understanding of HTML and programming knowledge

· Ability to evaluate and modify HTML and JavaScript for SEO purposes

· Working knowledge of PHP and/or CSS, a plus

· Experience with local listings management (LLM) and local SEO, a plus

· A thorough understanding of key search engine ranking factors

· Ability to conduct relevant keyword research and make recommendations

· Excellent communication skills and ability to liaise with clients

· Good numerical and analytical skills

· Experience using and setting up Google Analytics and SEO tools

· Strong understanding of website architecture

· Experience with keyword research and content optimization

· Proven track record of successfully optimizing eCommerce sites for competitive head terms and long tail terms

· Experience with Google Search Console and Google Analytics

· Familiarity and experience with Screaming Frog, MOZ, SEMRush, Brightedge, Conductor, and/or other industry tools

· A history of presenting SEO recommendations to clients in a clear, concise, and thoughtful way

· Master presentation and storytelling skills

· Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills

· Fast learner

· Must be a team player

About the Company

At Ai Media Group, we specialize in defining, managing, and executing online marketing strategies. We are marketing professionals, business consultants, and technology experts dedicated to doing whatever it takes to help our clients succeed. Our cutting-edge tools and comprehensive approach provide clients with real-time information and immediate results.

Hey There!Love speaking with clients about SEO? Do you believe the key to successful sales is providing genuine value as well as excellent service?

EXCELLENT WORK FROM HOME OPPORTUNITY.. WITH FLEXIBLE HOURS IF REQUIRED!

Outreach Frog provides organic search engine optimization services to clients throughout the world. We have a growing number of business and agency clients seeking help with out SEO services. We offer link building products designed to be resold by other agencies or purchased directly by end users - most self serve and order online.

While many customers choose to self order over the phone, the growing size of the business has driven the need for a dedicated salesperson to help with customer support and generating results. Our team is highly experienced and geographically dispersed. You will be the first person at this location - and can provide a flexible work schedule and remot work.

OutReachFrog focuses on high quality backlinks and help clients rank their websites higher. This role is great for someone who understands SEO and is looking to work more on existing clients rather than having to go out and source new business.

Also we can provide training in SEO for someone with a basic understanding but who a great personality for sales. We like to provide support to our clients and understand their needs to best tailor a solution for them, rather than a pushy sales approach.

The role can progress to a bonus / commission component in time where you will earn recurring revenue from customers.

As this is a growing company you get to play a part in the future of the organization - and can even lead to a sales manager role for the right applicant.

Job Duties

Handling in phone scheduled appointments from existing clients and new clients who have contacted us from our website.

Responding to inbound enquiries from new clients

Building relationships with existing clients to keep them using our services

Preparing proposals for clients

Communicating regularly with the CEO to provide feedback to better improve our product offerings.

Required Skills

Excellent interpersonal skills

Well organized

Ability to build trust with customers and provide excellent service.

Understands SEO and marketing in general

Previous success in closing sales and revenue targets

• Must have a clear, pleasant and professional speaking voice (over the phone)

Content Marketer / SEO SpecialistIWD Agency is a leading eCommerce agency with a fun, energetic, innovative and exciting culture. We believe in the GSD method: get shit done, and this has led to continuous growth. Our focus is in online retail and we are damn good at it. We are looking for energetic, passionate people to join our team.

IWD headquarters are in Austin, Texas, but our team is distributed remotely. As a leader in the online retail industry, we work with many high profile clients and international brands. We are enthusiastic about our culture, work, and delivering the best results. Our team members enjoy great pay and benefits.

Core Values

Everything we do at IWD centers around our core values. To be considered for any position, you must have the following in your DNA:

• Innovative
• Accountable
• Passionate
• Team Player
• Perfectionist

You will be a good t for this position if you never say "that's not my job", relentlessly optimiic, work hard, bleed your company colors, and thrive in a fa-paced environment. Oh, and you want to have a lot of fun while you're doing it!

Are you a wiz of exceptional SEO practices? Do you have loads of experience monitoring web

analytics and generating reports? How uent are you in HTML5, CSS3, and design products? What about email campaigns? Tell us about Bronto, Klaviyo, and Marketo. We are looking for someone who is an ace Content Marketer and SEO Speciali. You should be a good writer and a visionary. Are you ronger in one area than the other, but willing to learn and grow in another? We want to hear from you too. In order to be considered for this role you mu demonrate quantiable results and provide examples of your excellent reporting.

EMAIL MARKETING

• Establish email marketing strategies and ensure timely execution of email marketing initiatives
• Set cadence of delivery times, build out audience segmentations, manage promotional calendar and communication for all email campaigns
• Work with in-house creative teams to coordinate production of email design, subject lines and copy
• Coordinate approvals with brand and sales teams and implement any necessary edits
• Monitor and report on email analytics through tracking codes and A/B teing. Provide actionable insights and recommendations for future improvements
• Develop rategies to improve open rates and click through rates for both campaigns and behavioral emails
• Research and benchmark again market/competitors in order to develop competitive edge and provide recommendations based on rategic insights and learnings

Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with experience structuring and performing complex analysis within organic search to drive efficient growth

Job title: Sr Analyst, Insights & SEO - CNN Business
Description:
This is our story

We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.

See what it’s like to work at CNN! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.

The Job

Would you like to work for a leading global media organization? If so, we'd love to hear from you. We are currently recruiting a Sr. Analyst, Insights & SEO to support CNN Business by partnering with teams in Editorial, Programming, Audience Development, Product & Technology and more with the goal of providing insights to help grow our digital audience.

CNN Digital is seeking an individual who is passionate about digital audience insights, SEO, analytics, audience development, and journalism.

CNN's portfolio of news and information services is available in five different languages across all major TV, internet and mobile platforms reaching more than 392 million households around the globe.

CNN International is the number one international TV news channel according to all major media surveys across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, the Asia Pacific region and Latin America.

The CNN digital network is consistently one of the top news and current affairs destination on the web.

The Daily
As a member of the audience development team, you will work in close collaboration with CNN's editorial team to drive audience growth and increased engagement through our insights and SEO efforts.
The ideal candidate will have 3-5+ years’ experience with gathering, visualizing, and providing insights from various data sources, as well as a good understanding of SEO principles.
The ideal candidate with have an analytical mind with enthusiasm for data, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

JOB SUMMARY
As a Manager of Content Strategy / SEO, you will work cross-functionally with our Digital Marketing, Creative, Product and Development teams to lead Content and SEO initiatives to create a seamless customer journey throughout the entire shopping experience while driving organic growth across all web properties. This individual will manage our top-tier SEO agency and ensure we implement SEO best practices to grow traffic and increase conversion rates and revenue. You will be an expert in optimizing content, develop link-building initiatives, maximize keywords, and manage our copywriters to ensure that all our online marketing content is written with a direct-response focus, follows brand guidelines, and in a tone that helps customers through their buying process. In this role, you will be an integral part of our strategic marketing process so that our services (Spectrum TV, Internet, Voice, and Mobile) are accurately depicted throughout our websites. In addition, by owning this content, you will enable all pages to have improved search engine crawlability and indexation. As a high impact and highly visible position, there is strong support from the executive team to invest and succeed in driving continuous organic growth, as well as engineering resources to implement site enhancements.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with people in a variety of UX design-related jobs to shape our customer's experience by creating useful, meaningful copy and help set the vision for content and drive cohesive product narratives across multiple websites.

Achieve a unified voice across websites so that customers are easily lead through their buying decision.

Experience leading usability studies, working with user research and analyzing customer feedback.

Ability to help define and maintain brand voice and tailor content for mobile experiences.

Write and maintain a Content Strategy and Offer playbook that clearly explains how we speak to our customers, what our Products entail, required legal language / disclaimers, and how we go to market within digital marketing.

Own the responsibility for the strategy and execution of large-scale organic search projects for America's fastest-growing TV, Internet and Voice provider.

Dive into SEO-relevant data to transform data sets into actionable insights and develop tactical next steps to drive organic acquisition.

Creation and ownership of overarching SEO strategy for various properties. Ensuring website technical health adheres to SEO best practices. Execution of on-page product and template meta data content optimization.

Provide strategic guidance and critical thinking for organic initiatives, serving as a key consultant for multiple groups with different goals and processes.

Partner closely with copywriters to create compelling content rooted in organic search data and best practices

Build relationships with and educate individuals on the value of organic and content marketing to turn strategies into actions.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Experience leading SEO strategy.
Experience developing relevant content.
Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with stakeholders across the company and facilitate communication between teams.
Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and analytics to determine page performance, opportunities to optimize sales and plan new testing strategies.
Strong attention to detail, balanced with the ability to think strategically.
Advanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint; proficient in other desktop applications.

Education
Bachelor’s Degree and/or equivalent experience

Related Work Experience
SEO experience (agency side preferred); 3+ years
Managing website development; 3+ years

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Knowledge of cable television, high speed Internet and phone products and services preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment

Job title: Sr Analyst, Insights & SEO - CNN Business
Description:
Posting Job Description

This is our story

We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.

See what it's like to work at CNN! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.

The Job

Would you like to work for a leading global media organization? If so, we'd love to hear from you. We are currently recruiting a Sr. Analyst, Insights & SEO to support CNN Business by partnering with teams in Editorial, Programming, Audience Development, Product & Technology and more with the goal of providing insights to help grow our digital audience.

CNN Digital is seeking an individual who is passionate about digital audience insights, SEO, analytics, audience development, and journalism.

CNN's portfolio of news and information services is available in five different languages across all major TV, internet and mobile platforms reaching more than 392 million households around the globe.

CNN International is the number one international TV news channel according to all major media surveys across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, the Asia Pacific region and Latin America.

The CNN digital network is consistently one of the top news and current affairs destination on the web.

The Daily
As a member of the audience development team, you will work in close collaboration with CNN's editorial team to drive audience growth and increased engagement through our insights and SEO efforts.
The ideal candidate will have 3-5+ years' experience with gathering, visualizing, and providing insights from various data sources, as well as a good understanding of SEO principles.
The ideal candidate with have an analytical mind with enthusiasm for data, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
The candidate best fit for this role will have experience working cross-departmentally and will have the ability and willingness to speak up to push for results.
Experience in digital media publishing organizations is preferred.
Develop workflow recommendations to include the data necessary to inform content and programming decisions in order to quickly move on opportunities that will grow CNN's search audience and increase their loyalty.

Shopbop, a premier online shopping destination for high-fashion apparel and accessories, is looking for an experienced Senior Traffic Manager, Acquisition Marketing to spearhead engagement of potential customers both on and off Amazon. The ideal candidate will have a proven ability to create and execute effective online marketing strategies, develop/launch/optimize new marketing programs, manage complex projects, partner with internal teams, interface with senior stakeholders, measure results and optimize against myriad KPIs. This role will focus on leveraging various performance marketing platforms to grow Shopbop s business both on and off Amazon The ideal candidate has had deep experience running Search Engine Optimization and Paid Search marketing campaigns with 8 digit budgets in the retail space. This individual will manage performance marketing efforts designed to drive a mix of revenue generation, new customer acquisition and high value actions, such as generating mobile app installs, retargeting, and first-time purchases (on/off Amazon) The team is looking for top notch marketers who can create a set of channel strategies, execute a set of well-structured tests, deploy campaigns, and optimize performance over time against a clear set of measurable goals This person will work closely with the team tasked with managing, growing, and deepening brand engagement with the Amazon customer base A successful candidate will need to both see the big picture and be able/willing to execute rapidly

Basic Qualifications

S/he will understand both the art and science of online marketing and have proven experience setting up structured marketing tests and analyzing results for actionable insights. S/he will have proven success in driving substantial results, ideally in B2C eCommerce customer acquisition, lead generation and/or revenue generation This role requires comfort working with complex challenges, appreciation of white space, and understanding the value of a rapid test and learn approach. S/he will have the ability to work closely with team members across marketing functions as well as with cross functional teams such as creative, creative operations, and technology Every member of the marketing team at Shopbop takes on responsibility outside his/her specific domain, and pulls his/her weight on analytics needs as well. As such, this candidate will have the opportunity to influence multiple channelsResponsibilities Design, implement and measure the effectiveness of on/off Amazon marketing initiatives to drive new customer engagement Do so primarily by employing Shopbop Traffic s own budget, but also by pitching/executing custom marketing programs catered to our brand partners (i. e. co-op) Participate in the conception and refinement of our global new customer acquisition/engagement strategy Leverage analytics tools and other data assets to understand customer behavior and inform new projects Generate high-impact, innovative ideas to stimulate customer growth Delivering results at the tactical level (project execution, testing and learning, pitching/launching/optimizing new marketing programs)



Preferred Qualifications

8-12+ years of relevant work experience in online marketing and/or a highly quantitative, analytical, and results-driven environment, such as investment banking or management consulting BA/BS degree in marketing or a quantitative field.
Deep understanding of Google and Bing
Deep understanding of Search Engine Optimization strategies and implementation


Please have familiarity with Yahoo, Baidu, Naver, and Yandex


Have understanding of search marketing tools and algorithms
Preferably SEMrush, Google search console, Adobe Advertising

Summary:

Global Payments is looking for an experienced marketer with a proven track record of success to lead our SEO and SEM strategies and initiatives. This role will be responsible for developing, implementing and managing the company’s overall SEO strategy. As the SEP/SEM Manager you will be responsible for keyword strategy development, organic search ranking acceleration, link building and content optimization. You will closely monitor rankings in Google Search Console, identify content requiring further optimization, and work directly with our content development team to optimize content accordingly.

In addition, this role will also be responsible for the implementation and management of our company’s SEM/PPC campaigns. The SEO/SEM Manager will directly manage paid search campaigns on Google, Yahoo, and Bing, as well as other search and display marketing engines. The successful SEO/SEM Manager will effectively manage the paid search budget and work with internal business stakeholders and fellow marketing team members to maximize campaign ROI, drive web traffic, and create leads for sales follow up.

The Global Payments Corporate Marketing team operates as a Center of Excellence to the many business units and GEO regional teams that are within Global Payments. The SEO/SEM Manager will be the primary point of contact to our business units and GEO regional offices, sharing our overall SEO and SEM strategies to ensure alignment across businesses.

This role will report directly to the VP of Global Digital Marketing and Automation and will be based in our Atlanta, Buckhead offices.

Job Details:

Responsibilities:
Plan, develop and implement Global Payments overall SEO strategy
Work directly with key contacts within our Business Units and Geo regional offices to ensure understanding of the SEO strategy
Work directly with key contacts within our Business Units and Geo regional offices to identify areas of synergy to reduce potential keyword conflicts and optimize spend per BU/GEO
Work towards organic search optimization and ROI maximization
Regularly perform thorough keywords research
Identify key SEO KPIs
Monitor redirects, click rate, bounce rate, and other KPIs
Stay up to date with the latest SEO and digital marketing trends and best practices
Drive the development of effective paid search strategies
Implement and manage SEM/PPC campaigns
Oversee SEM/PPC accounts on search platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook, LinkedIn, Bing, and Yahoo
Drive keyword selection and audience targeting
Monitor budget and adjust bids
Prepare and present reports and dashboards regularly
Track KPI’s to assess performance and pinpoint issues
Requirements and Qualifications:
7+ years of experience as an SEO and SEM Manager or similar role
Google Ads certified
Ability to provide history of proven success in driving ROI through SEO and SEM
Hands on proficiency with popular SEO tools such as SEM Rush
Familiarity with multiple platforms (e.g., AdWords, Facebook, Bing & Yahoo) is preferred
Strong working knowledge of analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Google Search Console
Familiarity with Sitecore CMS a strong plus
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript a plus
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, make quick decisions and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience in data analysis and reporting
Proficient in MS Office (particularly Excel)
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Analytical thinker
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Digital Media or a related field is required
Global Payments Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

Global Payments provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.

Job Description


Wirecutter is seeking an insightful Technical SEO Manager to support the next phase of our search strategy.

Search is essential to Wirecutter’s mission to save people the time and stress of figuring out what to buy. Every month millions of people start with Google to inform their buying decisions. This role will report to the head of product in the digital department and work in concert with the Manager of SEO and Strategy on the editorial team.

Google is constantly changing the game, and the technical aspects of our website’s search-friendliness need to be as high-quality as our content. We are working toward our mission of being the most trusted and helpful recommendation service. You will use your knowledge and skills alongside your team members to help us get there.

We have a respectful and inclusive culture that values learning, creative problem solving, supportive teamwork, and shipping value. At Wirecutter we focus on scale, reliability, performance and product agility, which means picking the right tool for the job, while also being pragmatic and flexible as needed.

Responsibilities
Identify and specify strategic search projects for cross-functional digital teams (engineering, design, product)
As the domain expert for technical search performance, weigh impact against effort to help prioritize the most valuable work
Proficiently use Google Search Console, Sitebulb and Screaming Frog to measure progress against goals and identify opportunities. Identify and vet additional tools that should be in our toolbox.
Collaborate with data analytics and data engineering to create clarity and transparency around search projects for stakeholders
Consult on tooling for the editorial team to make it easier to deliver search-optimized content
Qualifications
2-4 years experience contributing to search strategy, either as an in-house SEO or as the search expert in product or engineering
The ability to sit at the intersection of current technical search best practices and the implementation details to achieve them.
Ability to translate between technical and non-technical partners and stakeholders, and helping to weigh the impact of technical SEO work on UX
Experience working with an editorial team in a news organization is a plus
Experience using competitive SEO tools (i.e. Ahrefs, SemRush, Sitebulb, Screaming Frog)
Wirecutter helps people buy the right things for the way they want to live. The site was founded by journalists in September 2011 and was acquired by The New York Times Company in October 2016. Our recommendations are made through vigorous reporting, interviewing, and testing by teams of veteran journalists, scientists, and researchers. Consider us a best-of list for everyday things; a curated gallery filled with only interesting, useful objects; a thank-you note to the designers and engineers who create the stuff that makes our lives better; a geeky friend with next-level research skills who tests everything they buy so you don’t have to. The point is to make buying great gear quickly easier so you can get on with living your life.

We pride ourselves on following rigorous journalistic standards and ethics, and we maintain editorial independence from our business operations. Our recommendations are always made entirely by our editorial team without input from our revenue team, and our writers and editors are never made aware of any business relationships. Wirecutter is mission driven and reader supported; learn more about us here.

Our Company Principles:

Our principles help us create a work environment that breeds trust, respect, learning and is one that we all are excited about showing up to each day.

Seek Understanding: We are lifelong students who want to understand the world around us. We are curious to understand our readers, how we get better at our own disciplines and how we can work better together. This means we are active listeners, information hunters and empathetic.

Explain Why: Because we seek to understand, we value the importance of explaining our ideas and our understanding. This means we are constructively candid, sharing our perspectives and the thought process behind it. And then learning from the conversation that ensues. We are all teachers and students, helping each other grow.

Solve Things: We love to solve things, whether they are our own problems, our readers problems or our colleagues problems. While we often can solve problems on our own, we believe our best results come out when we solve them together.

Get It Done: We are passionate about getting things done. Whether it is our own individual work or teamwork, our instinct is to forge a path forward and learn as we go. This means we continually focus on how to turn work into achievable chunks, communicate those effectively to the team and efficiently execute against them.

Make It Better: We aren’t satisfied with perpetuating the status quo. We’re always looking forward. We live to change the world around us for the better, making a difference in our own lives and our readers’ lives. If we are being ambitious enough, this means that we will both fail and succeed and we take pride in owning both of those outcomes as long as we are learning.

Locations:

Even with our offices in New York City and Los Angeles, Wirecutter remains a highly remote friendly culture, and proud to employ incredible people across the country. Right now, we are eligible to hire in AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, GA, HI, IA, IL, MA, ME, MI, MN, MO, NH, NJ, NY, OH, OR, PA, TX, VA, WA.

Overview of Benefits at Wirecutter and The New York Times Company:

Though Wirecutter has physical locations in both NYC and LA, the company promotes and encourages a remote workforce, so that our employees can work in flexible and comfortable ways. We are committed to career development, supported by a formal mentoring program as well as tuition reimbursement. The New York Times Company offers frequent panel discussions and talks by industry leaders (Sheryl Sandberg, Melinda Gates and Ta-Nehisi Coates are a few recent examples), that we encourage our employees to attend.

We believe diversity fuels innovation and creativity, and we have a variety of employee groups and task forces across The New York Times Company and Wirecutter dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

#LI-GC1

The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. The New York Times Company will consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local \"Fair Chance\" laws.

Job title: Director of Digital Search SEO Operations
Description:
Lobster Marketing is seeking a Director for Digital Search Operations. This position would involve oversight of organic and paid search personnel. The primary focus of the position would be to help Lobster Marketing further the development of SEO & SEM business processes during a time of rapid growth. Lobster prides itself on providing a learning and training environment that is built on integrity and respect. This position must help facilitate and direct such an atmosphere within the search teams.

Lobster’s clientele primarily consists of pest control companies positioned across the US. Lobster’s search team is required to monitor and enhance the success of their campaigns through auditing, analysis, problem solving and continued education. The following skills and requirements should be considered by candidates choosing to apply for the position:

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Management of Paid and Organic Search Teams

Excellent Leadership, Communication & Project Management Skills

Job Description
The International SEO Manager is responsible for clarifying and communicating The Times’s unique search strategy in our target international markets. They will identify the biggest search opportunities for Times coverage in select markets and make editorial recommendations for how to meet search demand and optimize our existing coverage. Additionally, they will work closely with the core SEO team and prioritize technical enhancements to improve our international search footprint.
They will also be responsible for setting goals for our International markets and scaling SEO breaking news and evergreen training, tools and tactics to our International bureaus.
Responsibilities:
Manages our international SEO roadmap and initiatives, both editorial and technical
Identifies priority coverage areas for select international markets for optimization and monitoring
Project manages the rollout of technical SEO initiatives aimed at improving our international visibility
Run on-going audits; unmasking technical bugs, AMP errors and structured data fixes
Provides monthly reporting on our International search performance in Google News carousels, Google News, Google Discover, and desktop vs. mobile
Regularly benchmarks our performance against competitors in international markets
Monitors changes in the Google search environment in international regions
Qualifications
Must have 5+ years of SEO experience; with heavy emphasis on the technical side
Solid understanding of international SEO and demonstrated experience developing SEO strategies for different regions and languages
Extensive knowledge of the search engine industry, best practices for news search and knowledge of search engine algorithms
Expert-level analytics skills and experience using industry-leading SEO tools

The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. The Challenge


Adobe Spark is a team of passionate storytellers, technology innovators, and change agents. Adobe is incubating our startup-like business with a mission of “helping the world communicate with impact." We’re re-thinking (from the ground up!) the way people create and publish content, on devices and in the cloud. It's our aim to deliver magical experiences that allow students, teachers, non-profits, small businesses - really anyone with something to say - to make something that will stand out and impress their audiences, and have fun doing it. Join us!


The Role


As an Outreach Manager on Spark’s SEO team, you will own the end to end link building pipeline, be expected to expand our link acquisition efforts, and assist in driving organic traffic to Spark through off-page optimization strategies. You will help source, contact, and build relationships with relevant influencers and digital content publishers to further grow the brand awareness of Adobe Spark. You will also develop and initialize new link building strategies, campaigns, and tactics. And you will work collaboratively with marketing, content, and design teams to execute on all of these initiatives to help scale our SEO efforts.

Our ideal candidate will be a self-starter with an outstanding work ethic and a positive attitude. This person will be both creative and analytical, and is comfortable working both collaboratively and autonomously. We're looking for someone who is passionate about building relationships, focused on making business impact, loves to "nerd out" on SEO, and is naturally curious about how to move the needle for organic user acquisition.


Responsibilities:
Develop new link building strategies and tactics to scale our outreach efforts
Research competitors' link profiles and content to identify link acquisition opportunities
Build, maintain and manage a database of relevant and vetted prospects
Ensure the quality of prospects, outreach emails, and backlinks
Help craft pitches, and connect with journalists, media outlets, bloggers and others to build mutually beneficial and long-term relationships
Coordinate and manage a team of outreach specialists around the world to help scale Spark’s link building efforts globally
Occasionally assist with other SEO and growth marketing tasks when needed
Qualifications & Requirements:


Excellent communication, writing, and verbal skills, especially when it comes to writing persuasive emails
Data-driven, has strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Demonstrates ability to work collaboratively in a team and manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously
Previous outreach management and/or SEO experience
Excellent time management skills
Previous customer service experience is a plus
BA/BS degree, marketing, communication or any analytical field is a plus
Knowledge of SEO concepts and best practices is a plus
Previous experience with Google search console, Ahrefs, SEMRush, Omniture / Adobe Analytics, or Amplitude is a plus
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon’s media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we’re transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for an engineer to join our development team to focus on SEO (search engine optimization) growth initiatives across all of our iconic brands. In this role, you will focus mainly on building and executing SEO best practices, building internal tools to support SEO for both editorial and product teams and contributing to greatly enhance the reach of our content through growth and development initiatives via SEO.

Ideal candidate should have the following:
Solid experience with modern web application development, including HTML, CSS & preprocessors, JavaScript, and React.
Strong learning skills to be able to learn new algorithm changes, new tools, new practices on the market and by competitors.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals.
Eager to learn about new technologies and implementing these ideas in a production environment.
A strong sense of ownership over the work you produce and the ability to work equally well independently as well as within a team of engineers.
Experience in SEO is a plus but not required - we believe in training and learning and will help you grow.
Job Responsibilities:
QA SEO fixes and new features instrumented by engineering team to make sure it works as expected.
Diagnose SEO issues and come up with recommendations, eg, missing content in sitemaps.
Build SEO plugins to be used in PnR and Athena, eg, Google trends scrape and recommendation engines.
Governance: Ensure SEO best practices are in place by conducting regular audits (not each team has SEO person) and by building process for teams with SEO experts.
Create and maintain internal tools, explore external tools that help SEO team and other teams to drive search audience growth across out sites.
Execute best practices thoroughly across all regions and supers.
Evangelize SEO among engineering teams and help contribute to build SEO culture among VZM.
Contribute to the company’s content partnership strategy to ensure SEO is not jeopardized or at least will be compensated to favor VZM.
Look into Ahrefs insights to find out our performance vs. competitors and whether there is any learning we can get to optimize in order to outrank them.

The 9thWonder LA team is looking for a passionate SEO Specialist with the ability to effectively sell the benefits of SEO to our diverse portfolio of clients. In addition to developing custom SEO strategies based on the business goals of each client, youll also be responsible for managing the tactical implementation of those strategies in collaboration with our website, design, UX, development, and content strategy teams.The right candidate understands that SEO is not a silver bullet or short-term strategy. SEO is a marathon, not a sprint. While SEO conversations can get extremely complex and in the weeds, we need someone who understands what clients care about and can explain SEO concepts in clear, easy-to-understand language. The SEO Specialist will also be empowered to shape 9thWonders SEO offering, with the goal of elevating it to the next level, helping win and retain enterprise SEO relationships.

Your Responsibilities:

• Provide custom SEO strategies for 9thWonders SEO clients
• Oversee the tactical implementation of those strategies. This may involve managing others to perform SEO tasks or rolling up your sleeves to accomplish them yourself
• Develop and implement processes to ensure 9thWonder can deliver best-in-class service to enterprise clients
• Work with 9thWonders website, design, UX, development, and content strategy teams to ensure SEO best practices inform all these disciplines and their deliverables
• Elevate 9thWonders existing SEO services in terms of knowledge and scalability to contribute
• Deliver Foundational SEO as part of website projects, as well as ongoing enterprise SEO services (including monitoring and consulting) to drive continued improvement in KPIs
• Cross-sell SEO services into 9thWonder accounts that are not yet leveraging our SEO services
• Contribute to new business development pitches to win SEO, website, and content work from new accounts

Your Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:

• BS/BA required, Marketing, Communications, Advertising/Media preferred; or equivalent experience

• Keyword Strategy - competence in researching, planning, strategizing and implementing keyword strategies across various industries
• Well-versed in specialties like eCommerce SEO or multi-location/franchise SEO
• Deep knowledge of ongoing SEO support including local citation submission and hygiene, review monitoring, GMB posting, link outreach/link building
• Identifying KPIs that drive business results beyond traffic volume or specific keyword rankings
• Reporting on results in service of business KPIs. Deep understanding of SEO keyword research and tracking tools, Google Analytics, CRM, to demonstrate the value and impact of SEO services.
• Excellent interpersonal skills understands how to manage client relationships and expectations through effective communication

Does this sound like you?

Nice! You must be super-talented, so wed love to hear from you. Send your resume to with SEO and your location in the subject line. No phone calls, please.

Job Posting Title:

SEO Manager

Job Description:

Who We're Looking For

Out of an abundance of caution due to the concerns surrounding the current situation with the Coronavirus (COVID-19), we will be conducting our hiring process completely virtually. That means that all interviews and onboarding activities will be held online or over the phone. The health of our employees and candidates is our main priority and we hope you will forgive any inconvenience that may arise from this non-conventional approach. While the day-to-day approach has changed a bit during this time, our commitment to hiring the best talent in the industry and helping them to thrive both personally and professionally is stronger than ever.

Our SEO Manager is integral to the development of the SEO Channel, training of our SEO Specialists and close oversight of ongoing strategies set for all our web properties.

The SEO Manager works closely with the Director of Earned Media and individual SEOs on each team in the planning, testing, and executing of SEO initiatives, developing process, and ensuring adherence to best practices.

The SEO Manager excels at coordination with Marketing Managers and each of the other marketing functions to advocate for SEO considerations and ensure consistency in SEO strategy and implementation across multiple properties.

Working to streamline SEO workflow the SEO Manager engages regularly in analysis, reporting, training and implementing SEO best practices for ongoing optimization, troubleshooting complex issues and having both a direct and indirect impact on Clearlink's profitability achieved via organic search.

Breaking Down Your Day to Day
Develop and execute SEO strategies for Clearlink and our partners, including optimizing current web pages and working with various channels on projects that are being developed or planned.
Create performance reports using Google Analytics or other similar tools.
Review and analyze Clearlink and Brand Partner sites for areas that need to be improved, deleted, revamped, etc; prepare detailed SEO strategy reports for management.
Carry out SEO functions, including keyword research, site audits, information architecture planning, domain valuation.
Identify keyword targeting opportunities for Brand Partner and Clearlink sites; organize and run projects and campaigns to improve website search result listings.
Opportunity, competitive and market analysis
Proposal development and partner communication
Conduct analysis to evaluate the performance of search engine optimization strategies; identify and evaluate current site goals and link building strategies;
Research data for future projects
Provide training and strategic oversight of SEO Specialists
Review and approve SEO strategies, forecasts and tactics
Other duties may be assigned as required.
What You Need
BA in Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing or a related field
4-6 years SEO experience in a B to C environment
Expert-level knowledge of SEO methods and best practices.
Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
Demonstrated ability to manage details, efficient work habits, and overall flexibility
Must be able to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to accept interruptions as part of the routine
Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives and willingness to take on additional responsibility
Proven ability to manage a diverse team excelling in identifying and capitalizing on individual contributor strengths
Advanced SEO tool, Google Analytics and Excel skills for data analysis and reporting
What We Offer

At Clearlink, our goal is to create opportunities for our people; if you're smart, hungry, and love to get things done, this is the perfect opportunity to build on your career in digital marketing. You'll have the opportunity to sharpen your skills by working with some of the biggest brands in the country.

We are an established and growing company with a start-up atmosphere, which means you'll have the opportunity to create and execute enterprise SEO strategies and the freedom to approach them in creative ways.

About Clearlink:

Clearlink's team of 1,700+ employees is headquartered in Salt Lake City and has been creating marketing content services for Fortune 500 companies for over 13 years. Clearlink has been recognized as a great place to work with awards such as Utah Business Magazine's Fast 50, Inc. Magazine's 500/5000 List, Salt Lake Tribune Top Workplaces, Utah Chapter of the American Marketing Association Internal Campaign, and many more. We are proud to offer our employees:
Up to 100% healthcare for your entire family
Over two weeks paid time off
Paid ski days, wellness activities, and team outings
Fully-stocked break room
Award-winning wellness program with free health coaching
All-expense paid vacations for top employees
Location:

Salt Lake City

Noom Inc. is a leader in mobile health coaching. We combine the power of technology with the empathy of real human coaches to deliver successful behavior change. Our direct-to-consumer mobile applications have reached more than 45 million users worldwide -- and counting. We've leveraged our behavior change platform to incorporate the CDC's Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP), and have expanded to programs for diabetes management, pre-hypertension, and hypertension. The Growth team is at the forefront of this mission, tackling one of the hardest challenges in healthcare today: getting people to take that initial (and biggest!) step towards living a healthier lifestyle And this is where you come in!

Noom is looking for our first Search Engine Optimization Manager to drive organic growth. This is an exciting opportunity to develop a strategy and own the execution. Our leadership team is thinking long-term and we're all in agreement that SEO plays a large part in our continued success.

What You'll Be Doing:
Leading the scaling of Noom's nascent SEO efforts in an industry that's incredibly broad and constantly evolving
Developing and executing upon a framework for determining keyword and content prioritization
Leveraging Noom's data infrastructure to develop robust SEO analysis
Building out resources - both internally and externally - to produce world class content
Project managing with Engineering to implement technical SEO improvements
Optimizing existing content to improve domain expertise and SEO customer volume
Collaborating with the paid, brand, and PR managers to ensure Noom is broadly optimized for SEO
Analyzing and adapting efforts to ever-changing market trends
What We're Looking For:
Extensive experience (4+ years) with both technical and content SEO
Deep understanding of subscription eCommerce space and it's particular challenges
An analytical mindset and strong prioritization skills
Fast learner with excellent problem-solving ability
Self-motivated team player willing to work very hard
What Makes This Job Amazing:
You'll be helping millions of people lead healthier lives every day
You'll be a part of Noom's rocketship-- revenue has grown 20x in the last 2 years and our team is growing fast.
You'll have wonderful benefits including healthcare/dental, wellness budget, daily gourmet meals prepared by our onsite chefs, and onsite yoga
You'll experience huge learning & professional growth opportunities. Noom believes in supporting your professional and personal growth: we'll cover the cost of books, courses, conferences you name it!
You'll add to our transparent, high-performing, and close-knit culture

SDL2017

Our Story: Papa Murphys is different on purpose. Not only because we make our pizzas completely from scratch with fresh ingredients at over 1,300 locations nationwide, but because we do it with swagger. We know our product is better than our competitors. The fact that our pizza is take n bake adds to the quality of our pies and to the convenience for our guests. At Papa Murphys, we dont think its cheesy to love where you work. Bringing happiness to guests one fresh pizza at a time is a great start, but the SEO/Website Manager role has many other rewarding benefits as well.

Position Overview: In this engaging role, the SEO/Website Manager champions Papa Murphys commitment to quality, service, integrity, and teamwork by:

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Strategy & Execution (35%)

- Bring a passion for developing tactics and campaigns that drive business goals: new customer acquisition & online sales

- Drive Papa Murphys organic search strategy including but not limited to: local listings, content marketing, voice search, video, technical SEO, etc.

- Research and implement SEO techniques to maximize how customers find Papa Murphys online against competitors, we know its more than just keyword strategies

- Optimize both on-site and off-site SEO: restaurant location pages, delivery partners, menu syncing, link building, etc.

Website Management & Optimization (35%)

- Serve as the primary contact for website related requests: updating website content, building landing pages, working on privacy updates

- Audit websites www.papamurphys.com and order.papamurphys.com and identify areas that can be optimized by working with internal teams

- Manage website technical integrations with third party vendors (ex: email or loyalty providers)

Performance & Analytics (20%)

- Make data-driven decisions based on first and third-party insights to identify opportunities that add value to the business

- Dig into web analytics to inform optimization tactics to improve user experience and drive conversions

- Develop a test and learn timeline and communicate results to internal and external stakeholders in a timely manner

- Collaborate with teams to develop clear objectives, KPIs, and instructions for digital campaigns

- Proactively and regularly report on the results of SEO campaigns and overall website performance

Agency Relationship & Management (10%)

- Manage the day-to-day relationship and performance of local listings provider

What we bring to the table:

- We are hungry for someone with big ideas to join! Pun intended

- Your next career move and a chance to strategize and execute performance driving SEO and website optimizations for our unique brand

- Competitive employee benefits and 401k, flexible working hours

- Opportunity to work with amazing teams

- PIZZA!

What you bring to the table:

(Position-specific knowledge, skills, abilities, and more)

- Analytical mindset, understand business logic and can identify a good return on investment

- A proven track record of growing a brands website presence. You can speak to how you achieved specific goals and the results.

- Proficient knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, and other website optimization tools like Optimizely

- Comfortable with large sets of data and keywords

- Experience optimizing user flow to drive conversions including but not limited to: AB/heatmap testing, UX design, building landing pages for search campaigns

- Proficient in excel. Pivot tables are your thing

- Thirst for all things digital. Youve got SEO news sites book marked on your computer and are eager to teach best practices

- Execute your work flawlessly and find ways to make repetitive tasks smarter and better

- Ability to form and influence cross-functional relationships with a broad variety of groups

- Comfortable with ambiguity and a rapid changing environment

Foundations of your career:

- Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Marketing, Computer Science, and/or Analytics

- 3-5 years work experience with SEO (technical & content) and website management and optimization preferably with e-commerce brands

- Experience in a multi-unit restaurant, franchise, or retail organization is a plus

Please Note:
