The Motley Fool’s mission is “To make the world smarter, happier, and richer.” For more than 25 years, that has meant providing impartial and informed investment recommendations with a healthy dose of personal finance guidance on the side. Ever the insatiable Fools that we are, our coverage continues to expand as we seek to empower everyone with the knowledge, tools, and confidence to attain financial freedom.

Does our name sound familiar? Probably. We’ve been spreading the word to millions of readers each month by publishing hundreds of articles each week at our award-winning Fool.com site. You know us as your one-stop shop for analyzing the latest earnings reports and finding your portfolio’s next home run stock.

But you may not know that The Motley Fool has launched several new brands to deliver that same high caliber, credible content in areas where misinformation runs rampant and the Fool voice can make a difference. In addition to helping you become an all-star stock market investor, we can also help you:
Identify the top providers to find the right credit card, consolidate your student loan debt and open your first brokerage account (The Ascent and MyWalletHero)
Cut through the jargon and guide your first foray into commercial real estate investments (Millionacres)
Identify the software tools and solutions that will effectively grow your small to medium sized business (The Blueprint)
Reach all of your personal finance goals like paying down debt, making extra money on the side, creating a rock-solid budget, travel hacking your way around the world, and retiring early (Soapbox)
Find the best pho restaurant within a 50 mile radius (we can dream, right?)
These five new Motley Fool brands take high quality, engaging content just as seriously as their Fool.com counterpart, so each team is seeking a qualified SEO Content Specialist to uphold that high bar and introduce their respective sites to millions of new readers. As your brand develops, you will be expected to grow with it and be a driving force in that change. You’ll be managing and curating our content, while optimizing for organic search, on-site engagement, and partner distribution. Not only will you be expected to learn which topics are most relevant for our target audience, but you will then use that knowledge to publish to the highest value opportunities for our business and constantly monitor performance to inform our overall strategy. The Motley Fool is a well-established brand, and you are a key player in building these new brands into something equally as significant. Do you see the opportunity lying in front of us? Are you ready to get started?

Primary Responsibilities:
Plan new content verticals and optimize content strategy for increased organic visibility.
Work with editorial team to research and assign key content to our team of writers, optimizing for potential organic presence.
Map out site architecture and content URLs for new and existing verticals to ensure optimal search visibility and user experience.
Perform keyword research, grow our targeted keyword portfolio, plan new vertical content, and assign content to writers through editorial workflow.
Conduct competitor analysis to identify gaps in our content coverage and areas of opportunity.
Ensure that our content meets regulatory guidelines and keeps us compliant with our partners, regulators, and our internal legal and compliance teams.
Collaborate with various disciplines (content, social media, tech, business intelligence, etc.) to implement SEO strategies.
Monitor daily performance of site rankings with a focus on increasing and defending our rankings.
Make recommendations and work with developers to implement site architecture and design improvements with the goal of improved search visibility, page speed, and mobile-friendliness.
Audit our internal linking on an ongoing basis to improve the search visibility for our highest value pages.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of SEO in line with industry trends, creatively keeping us a step ahead of our competitors.
Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in SEO (content marketing also a plus!)
Passionate about SEO and proactive in staying up-to-date on all the latest trends and best practices.
Exceptional organizational and project management skills.
Experience working with large brands driving outcomes for highly trafficked websites.
A self-starter who learns quickly and is willing and eager to adapt as the business does.
Relentless pursuit of self-improvement.
Passionate about data-driven problem-solving.
Previous personal finance, real estate investing, SMB owner/entrepreneur, or international SEO experience/knowledge is a huge plus.
Candidate must “get” Foolishness, have a sense of humor, and work well in a collaborative environment.
Experience with industry tools (We’re super users of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMRush, Moz, DeepCrawl, Ahrefs)
Positions are located in: Alexandria, VA; Lakewood, CO; and Philadelphia, PA. Let’s talk about your experience and match your SEO skillz to the right team!

At Chatter Buzz, we pride ourselves on innovation; on standing out among the rest and enabling our clients to do the same. We do this by offering best in class marketing strategy, backed by data, and driven through a variety of interactive tools that fuel our passion for the digital space.

You, the SEO Associate of our dreams, are a creative-minded analyst at heart. Even though you love exploring new ideas, you believe that strategic decisions should be backed by data. You are able to uncover potential roadblocks and map solutions. There’s no doubt that you bring a unique perspective to the table. You are innovative, explorative, and a bit of a perfectionist (in the best way possible).

Here are some highlights of what you’ll be doing
You’ll drive traffic and increase ROI for Chatter Buzz clients by doing competitive analysis, Keyword research, content creation + link building
You’ll measure the effectiveness of Chatter Buzz strategies by reporting from a variety of resources including Google Search Console, SEMrush, Google Analytics, and AHREF
You’ll keep close tabs on your clients’ online presence by tracking + reporting changes in traffic, rankings, trends, and conversions
You’ll share your insights with clients through email, conference calls or face-to-face meetings.
You’ll always tie everything back to business goals. Whether you’re analyzing a report or identifying trends in the data, you never lose sight of ROI for your client
The Skills
You have a passion for Digital Marketing but you view business and marketing from a holistic perspective
You’re able to use SEO skills, such as keyword research, to get a better understanding of your clients’ customers and their online habits
You have some technical SEO chops, as well (HTML,Javascript, CSS, iframes, etc.)
You are expert-level in Microsoft Office. Excel is your middle name!

When it comes to SEO trends, you pride yourself on being ahead of the curve. You love reading up on industry blogs and sharing your insights with others (team members, clients, your network, Chatter Buzz Blog Post etc.)
While your role is primarily focused on execution, you’re eager to share your opinion and give strategic recommendations
You know how to get your point across. Whether you’re writing an email or giving a presentation, your communication style is always concise and effective
You approach your work with a sense of urgency and you don’t need to be micromanaged to meet deadlines
You don’t just find problems, you find solutions! You anticipate potential hiccups and provide proactive solutions.
Whoever said ‘The only constant is change’ was probably talking about Chatter Buzz. Things move at lightning speed around here and you are able to handle the fast-paced environment.

Worked in a fast-paced, digital agency- let’s talk!
Created awesome content for specific audience personas? Sweet!
Bringing some Technical SEO skills like HTML or Javascript? Jackpot!

Job Description

The SEO Manager is responsible for managing every aspect of Davids Bridals organic search and local search presence, including technical applications to site content development, analytics and insights, agency and local listings management. As the subject matter expert, the SEO Manager will partner with marketing and digital, merchandising and technical teams to build page authority, increase rankings/results, and drive revenue and appointments in a highly competitive SEO environment.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:

• Manage SEO agency and work closely with digital marketing team on bidding strategies to optimize ROAS and increase conversion
• Use analytics and SEO best practices to increase qualified traffic to site; work with digital content and web merchandising to ensure an optimal landing page experience and conversion
• Write Requirements/QA/Review all site releases to ensure no negative SEO impact on new site changes or updates
• Identify and communicate technical aspects of site that require enhancements for SEO and monitor changes (redirects, canonical tags, meta data, page speed, etc.)
• Research and understand market changes due to impact of mobile, consumer search habits, site authority, and algorithms on SEO
• Drive change to increase site authority, brand awareness, and competitive positioning within the bridal and social occasion markets
• Work closely with internal analytics to identify opportunities for customer acquisition, engagement, and conversion
• Through regular site audit, identify technical SEO issues, recommend and project-manage fixes with product management and IT teams; work closely with technical resources to ensure SEO project prioritization and completion
• Optimize content (copy, images, video) through keyword and landing page analysis, and use competitive research to help guide content marketing strategy
• In conjunction with SEO agency, build and manage guidelines for blog, website content, products, and landing page copy using analytics and keyword expertise
• Manage off-page optimization projects (e.g. link-building) and local listings to ensure accuracy in content and optimal customer experience
• In conjunction with SEO agency, provide weekly and adhoc reporting on traffic, rankings, indexed pages, crawl reports and other SEO aspects
• Keep abreast of SEO and integrated marketing trends, best practices and news, particularly changes to the engines that impact organic search results
• Collaborate with editorial team to create high-quality content around important, relevant terms. Work with PR and social media to leverage The Blog, Pinterest, influencers and UGC to build site traffic, appointments and revenue

Other Duties & Responsibilities:
• Monitor competitors and prepare analysis on a regularly scheduled cadence.
• Stay abreast of SEO best practices and industry insights; educate and socialize SEO value and best practice throughout the organization
• Partner with web merchandising team on hindsight analysis and presentations
• Work closely with vendors to maximize best-in-class SEO marketing solutions

Years of related experience: 5-7+

Required Qualifications:

• Experience with leading web analytics tools (e.g., Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google Search Console)
• Experience using SEM Rush, Conductor, and/or other SEO monitoring tools
• Proficiency in MS Office Suite, with advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint
• Demonstrated understanding of key interactive marketing principles
• Ability to create actionable results under tight deadlines
• Demonstrated experience in optimizing an eCommerce website to build organic traffic and drive revenue
• Experience and understanding of high level SEO concepts such as faceted navigation and how that impacts indexation
• Ability to gather and evaluate information; industry, competition, market, and historical
• Ability to identify and execute priorities with a sense of urgency (makes it happen)
• Commits to results and maintains focus, solving roadblocks and delivering results
• Ability to quickly sense and communicate the best plan of action to accomplish a goal
• Organizes and expresses ideas clearly, concisely and accurately, verbally and in writing
• Ability to adapt the content, tone, style, and form to the reader, the subject, and the purpose of the communication. Uses plain talk to explain complex or technical concepts
• Must be comfortable implementing changes directly into a CMS
• Goal oriented: Owns the process, plan and results
• Sought out by others for advice/solutions

Job Posting Title:

Job Description:


Who We're Looking For
Sr. SEO Strategist- Seattle, WA

COVID-19 Precaution:

Out of an abundance of caution due to the concerns surrounding the current situation with the Coronavirus (COVID-19), we will be conducting our hiring process completely virtually. That means that all interviews and onboarding activities will be held online or over the phone. The health of our employees and candidates is our main priority and we hope you will forgive any inconvenience that may arise from this non-conventional approach. While the day-to-day approach has changed a bit during this time, our commitment to hiring the best talent in the industry and helping them to thrive both personally and professionally is stronger than ever.

Description:

Are you passionate about SEO and ready to take the next step in your career by joining a premier digital marketing agency and working with exciting clients from a variety of industries? As a Senior SEO Strategist at Portent, you will have strong expertise in SEO, a strategic mindset, in-depth technical knowledge, and excellent communication skills. You’ll collaborate heavily with clients and work with other internal teams (Content, Analytics, Outreach, etc.) to deliver SEO recommendations that reflect industry trends that align with client goals. Portent sets the bar high for SEO experts. This role is fast-paced and is a unique opportunity for someone who is passionate about driving growth and pushing the boundaries with innovative SEO.

Breaking Down Your Day–to–Day:
Partner with the SEO Team Lead to develop strategic recommendations for organic opportunities, including technical SEO, onsite SEO, offsite SEO, goals, campaign strategies, and tactics
Monitor client sites, seek out organic growth opportunities, and provide broad strategic insight around established SEO marketing goals
Track, measure, and report on all campaign work each month, partnering with Portent’s Analytics Team when needed
Manage client communication and interaction with the team in a timely and consistent fashion
Contribute to the Portent blog and marketing initiatives
Stay current with industry trends and best practices
What You Need:
4-6 years of SEO marketing experience
Minimum of two years working at a marketing agency
Advanced working knowledge of search engines, how they work, and the factors involved in rankings
Strong and constantly growing knowledge of all aspects of SEO
Advanced knowledge of SEO tools including Google Analytics
Superior written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to effectively collaborate with senior management and staff
Ability to execute on assigned initiatives promptly
Excellent time management skills
Self-reliant, excellent problem-solver, results-oriented
Ability to collaborate with multiple departments independently to problem solve
A cover letter demonstrating your interest in Portent, this position, and your written communication strength
About Portent:

Portent, Clearlink’s agency team, is comprised of 50 digital marketers with offices in Seattle and Salt Lake City. We’ve been supporting Fortune 500 companies with their digital marketing for over 20 years and relish continuing to learn about our ever-evolving industry.

At Portent, you will have opportunities to work with people who are as passionate as they are talented, develop yourself and your skills, and work on challenging and rewarding projects. We thrive on our inclusive and empowering work culture, where everyone has the support to do their best work and grow in their careers.

We believe that energized, well-balanced people with interests outside of work make the best employees, which is why we offer the following benefits:
Flexible work from home schedules
Up to 100% healthcare for your entire family
Over one month of paid time off to start
12 weeks paid maternity/paternity leave
Matching 401K
Get paid every Friday!
Monthly wellness activities
Quarterly company outings
One Friday a month dedicated to skill development and training
Fully-stocked lunch room and gourmet coffee
Award-winning wellness program with free health coaching
Monthly employee recognition awards
All-expense paid vacations for top employees

Description

Bulletproof Overview:
Bulletproof is an omni-channel content driven consumer products company. Our vision is to tap into the unlimited power of being human and we do this by holding true to our mission of creating products and providing information that radically improve lives. Bulletproof helps people live better by providing information and products that help them use fat for fuel, say goodbye to sugar and supercharge mitochondria increasing their energy.

Bulletproof has a team of experienced entrepreneurs and biohackers working to make high performance a daily reality for everyone on the planet. While our culture is casual and our workplace flexible, the team is passionate, customer driven, meaningfully connected, smart, and results focused.

Our customers know that our coffee, beverages, food, and supplements are the purest you can get anywhere, and you can expect to feel a difference in how you perform the first time you experience them. Environmentally conscious and ethically sourced products build a sustainable foundation for future generations to thrive. Bulletproof coffee has developed a cult following across the nation as a drink that provides sustained energy, while also programming your body to burn fat for energy. In addition to providing convenient access to products through eCommerce, brick and mortar retail stores (e.g. Whole Foods Market) and Bulletproof Cafes, Bulletproof has developed a specialized diet, which is based on eating high amounts of healthy fats, moderate amounts of high-quality protein, and tons of organic vegetables eaten at the right time in order to create unbelievable levels of energy and weight loss.

Position Overview:
Bulletproof is looking for a SEO Manager who loves the exploration and challenges of optimizing natural search traffic to Bulletproof.com and it’s sub-domains. Position reports to VP of eCommerce and is responsible for crafting the strategy and executing the levers across technical, content, and credentialing solutions to drive branded and non-branded organic traffic.

You will work closely with the ecommerce, content, brand, and marketing teams to build a SEO roadmap. This will require a keen ability to build strong cross-functional relationships, develop and communication strategy, and manage outside agencies. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with day-to-day responsibilities ranging from diving into Google Analytics, auditing page structure and tags, diving into search console for ranking/ impression data, and participating in site architecture questions.

This position requires a detail-oriented individual who has project management skills and an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have ability to set and meet deadlines, collaborate with a distributed workforce, and hit/ exceed core metric.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, strategize and prioritize implementation of SEO recommendations for Bulletproof’s website.
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords, and work with developers to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented with newly developed code.
Define, measure and report SEO KPIs on current and new initiatives and identify opportunities based on these metrics.
Stay on top of search innovations/trends; identify and propose new search opportunities appropriate for the brand.
Retrieve, aggregate, and analyze large data-sets from various sources to assist in providing actionable insights and recommendations to optimize site content.
Work with content creators to identify and coordinate information needs, and provide ongoing analysis and recommendations.
Assist in developing and maintaining dashboards, metric reports and other ad hoc analyses.
Deliver regular reporting on key metrics, site enhancements and other change impacts.
Understand critical paths, conversion events, segmentation types, referring channels, marketing campaigns, and specific attribute correlations.
Research and recommend potential content partners to drive SEO, Domain Authority, and brand awareness with our target audiences.
Create and manage agency partnerships for technical SEO, link-building and overall onsite development.
Identify and implement UI/UX and testing opportunities to increase on-page engagement through in-house or agency expertise, and implement tracking innovation (objects, scroll mapping) to aid in mapping user journey


Qualifications:

5+ years of experience analyzing website and third-party data for an online editorial or ecommerce brand, with an understanding of how to leverage data to make informed decisions.
3+ years of experience in SEO programs and principles.
Experience scaling SEO-driven traffic and revenue for an ecommerce and/or editorial site, and can articulate the operational, strategic and tactical approach on how it was achieved.
Deep understanding of E-A-T principles, both content-based and technical
Understanding of the inputs and outputs for Google’s knowledge graph, entity extraction, and schema.org markup.
Experience with advanced SEO techniques, tracking/reporting tools, algorithms, analysis and ranking factors.
Strong PowerPoint and spreadsheet abilities, including the ability to use formulas, functions, pivot tables, and the ability to analyze and compile performance reports.
Proficiency with web analytics and industry-standard web analytics platforms such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics.
Experience with Google Search Console, search analytics software (e.g. Moz.com) and social listening tools (e.g. Crimson Hexagon).
Background in A/B and multivariate testing, leveraging tools such as Optimize or Optimizely.
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Proven ability in collaborating with cross-functional partners.
Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills.
Working knowledge of Shopify and WordPress a plus.
Working knowledge of SQL and Big Query a plus.
Knowledge of nutrition, health and human performance a plus.
Experience in paid search (SEM) or other online marketing experience a plus.


Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for all Bulletproof employees:

Exhibits excellent judgment
Entrepreneurial problem solver with strong troubleshooting skills
Vocally self-aware and curious
Results oriented
Ability to effectively manage time, multi-task, and prioritize projects to meet established deadlines
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and written
Has relentlessly high standards
You love learning, and it’s one of the things you do to make yourself better every single day


This is a full-time position based in the Seattle area. Maximum fun, maximum knowledge, and maximum performance are a part of the job description, and you’ll get to work with the team on a regular basis to upgrade your game, your mental performance, and your life. This is a great opportunity to grow with a company.

Think you’ve got what it takes?

Let’s talk!

Description:
Take Your Career to the Next Level

Hey, SEO expert! Yes, you!

If you want to work someplace that’s fun and rewarding — and at the forefront of the industry — you should check this out.

You'll be leading the charge, and guiding successful and unique search engine optimization (SEO) marketing strategies. You’ll be our client’s “partner,” and serve as their main point of contact managing strategies, deliverables and a team of SEO Specialists.

Do what you’re great at, and get rewarded for it.

Grand Canyon Education, formerly part of Grand Canyon University, became its own entity in July 2018 after the HLC approved GCUs application to become a nonprofit institution. GCE will work in close partnership with GCU. Moreover, many positions with GCE are located on GCUs main campus.

Grand Canyon Educations Marketing department is seeking a full time Digital Marketing Specialist (DMS). This position will report to a Marketing Manager but work independently, collaborate with assigned marketing partners and University clients in planning, executing and overseeing digital marketing initiatives on GCEs web properties. The DMS progressively will work on complex digital marketing initiatives and will work with higher visibility web properties as this role progresses through the department. The DMS a clients overall marketing campaigns, and works collaboratively with the marketing team project lead or the client on the implementation of web marketing plans which support the clients total marketing strategy. Web marketing refers to marketing efforts that use website properties, which are leveraged to promote the Universitys educational services and objectives.

Responsibilities:
Applies broad-based knowledge of digital marketing principles, techniques and project development in advising and assisting assigned University client group(s) in developing and implementing well-thought out and creative web marketing strategies and initiatives to meet the clients organizational needs.
Builds, develops and maintains effective business relationships with University client(s) and marketing partners.
Serves as a key liaison with assigned client group and is perceived by key client as one of the strategic marketing representatives.
Facilitates and presents at all key client meetings in either developing or presenting web initiatives or strategies that would enhance the end-user experience with web properties.
May represent the digital marketing department with executive level groups in the University as needed.
In collaboration with the marketing campaign lead, interprets clients needs and creates project plans for campaign launches to execute on time and accurately. Includes project planning, project plan creation and ongoing management, execution and implementation of web initiatives.
Coordinates with internal cross-functional project teams to create a strategic web marketing plan by utilizing both digital and traditional marketing methods/channels (i.e., brochures, flyers, posters, postcards, direct mail, billboards, apparel, emails, landing pages, micro sties, social media, radio, etc.), in order to create a cohesive and optimal user experience on web properties.
Responsible for the building, updating, publishing, status reporting, and stability of web properties that support the client, ensuring high quality standards delivery that meets or exceeds the clients expectations, and the end-users needs.
Ensures defined brand strategy is consistently applied during development of web properties.
Supports the campaigns creative and messaging are connecting with the appropriate target audience(s), to research competitors, and find new and innovative ways to elevate the Brand, through web properties.
Develops performance metrics and reporting for ROI on designated web properties and recommends areas of improvement to marketing management.
Reviews effectiveness of implemented digital marketing projects and adjusts plans as necessary with project lead and/or clients; prepares and interprets associated digital marketing performance metrics.
Collaborates with other departments, including IT, to ensure that web projects are executed to their full potential, within deadline.
Provides advice, guidance and mentoring to prerequisite Digital Marketing Specialists as needed.
Manages web projects from start to finish, with designated University partners.
Stays abreast of current concepts, techniques, technology to offer contemporary solutions.
May provide direction, oversight and mentoring to less-experienced Marketing staff members, and student-workers.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in marketing, communications, public relations, journalism or related field required from a regionally accredited institution. Masters degree preferred.
A minimum of 5 years professional experience in web marketing.
Proven experience executing digital marketing campaigns for a variety of audiences.
An equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience may be substituted upon hiring mangers approval.
Highly proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, (Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint), MS Project or similar project management software, social media platforms.
Proficient with Photoshop, Google Analytics, HTML/ CMS platforms.
Excellent interpersonal skills to develop relationships at all organizational levels.
Excellent presentation skills to present a variety of information from simple to complex.
Excellent oral and written communications; a good command of the English language and ability to provide clear communications among all stakeholders.
Ability to think quickly and respond immediately in strategy and information meetings.
Demonstrated knowledge of AP writing style.
Excellent planning, organizational and successful project management skills in order to translate, define, coordinate and manage project requirements based on stakeholders input.
An ability to help clients to clearly define needs and objectives.
Good attention to detail, analytical and networking skills.
Knowledge of media placement processes among multiple media channels.
Applied knowledge of marketing analytics, ROI metrics and earned value assessment.
An ability to work independently on a project or collaboratively as a team player and able to integrate with a diverse team with varying opinions and ideas.
Well-defined knowledge base in sales, marketing and business development concepts.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and cope professionally with changing priorities.
Willingness to work occasional evenings and weekends required.

If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.

Job Description

Overview

TXU Energy is creating a new Technical SEO Expert role with an opportunity to join a growing, fast-paced digital team at a market-leading retail electricity provider. This is a chance to manage all aspects of SEO strategy and provide meaningful insights and optimization recommendations that can have a profound impact on our company sales and service goals. You’ll be part of a team working with various internal and external stakeholders concentrating on continuous improvements.
This role will be responsible for leading technical site audits, analysis, and implementation of recommendations to improve organic rankings and traffic to all our web properties across multiple brands throughout the U.S. You’re ideal for this role if you have a strong understanding of how search engines work and how to influence them. You should also be eager to experiment and have a desire to remain on the cutting edge of SEO.

Responsibilities

•Oversee technical website audits, analysis, and implementation of technical recommendations for all our online properties, including, but not limited to URL recommendations, robots.txt updates, XML sitemap maintenance, backlink review, page speed optimization, and site crawls.
•Accelerate organic search growth through the necessary tools, processes and tasks needed to build a successful program.
•Optimize on-site search experience including keywords and featured results, using metrics such as clicks, and CTR.
•Provide oversight and technical guidance into product releases, site migrations and redesigns.
•Research and analyze industry trends/best practices, advanced SEO techniques, and competitive landscape to identify actionable opportunities to drive organic rankings, site traffic and app findability.
•Create monthly reporting focused on performance of on-page technical SEO KPIs including page load speed, Google Search Console errors and Googlebot page download trends.
•Develop and utilize HTML/CSS/JavaScript to provide A/B and multi-variate testing support to various teams within the marketing and sales organization.
•Recommend new SEO content to drive additional site rankings
Requirements

•High School Diploma or GED, BA/BS preferred
•4 plus years relevant experience in SEO/SEM required


•Applied knowledge and experience in the following areas:
•This is a technical position so coding experience and strong understanding of on-page ranking efforts is a must
•Proficient in HTML/CSS/JS, with an emphasis on how they impact SEO performance
•Experience optimizing robots.txt files, implementing canonical tags, pagination pages, and identifying/ fixing redirect loops
•Experience using keyword research tools
•Experience with implementing and troubleshooting tags (via Dynamic Tag Management or GTM)
•Capable of providing detailed but easy-to-understand analysis and recommendations

Marketing

Irving, TexasTexas

Job title: SEO Scholars - San Francisco Development & Marketing VISTA
Description:
SEO Scholars - San Francisco Development & Marketing VISTA


SEO Scholars is a free eight-year academic program that gets motivated, low-income public high school students to and through college with a rigorous out-of-school supplemental academic curriculum, college guidance and the leadership development necessary to gain admission to, and succeed at, competitive colleges and universities. At SEO Scholars we have a proven track record of success: 90% of our Scholars graduate from college. The impact of a college degree is well-documented. College graduates are estimated to out-earn their peers by more than $1 million over the course of a lifetime, thus breaking the cycle of poverty within their families. Over the next 3 years, we anticipate increasing the number of students served in the Bay Area and will look to grow our revenue goals each year to meet this need.

SEO Scholars San Francisco is seeking a motivated individual to join a small, fast-paced team committed to executing our mission with excellence every day. This individual will support and help drive fund development efforts in three major areas: engaging our community of supporters, branding and marketing, and database management. The ideal candidate is meticulous and detail oriented, passionate about our mission, and a quick learner.

In addition to the AmeriCorps application, please send your resume and cover letter to jacqueline.smith@seo-usa.org
Further help on this page can be found by
clicking here.


Member Duties : In collaboration with the Development team, implement and coordinate the annual fundraising events (Advisory Board, Leadership Council and alumni). Implement community building efforts via volunteer recruitment, and research prospective partners who align with our mission.

Lead efforts to ensure donors’ gifts are documented, processed and acknowledged in an accurate and timely fashion, recording all gifts in our fundraising database, Salesforce. Streamline and document database processes, provide support during database implementation and develop a clear onboarding manual.

Continue to build off the work of the previous VISTA member to enhance marketing and communications efforts for our community of supporters and partners. Contribute to our marketing & branding strategy; develop marketing content that aligns between our website, blog and social media channels.

Workshop Digital, headquartered in Richmond, Virginia, is a fast-growing digital marketing agency focused on building handcrafted strategies that help our clients achieve their business goals. Our Search Engine Optimization team is currently looking for an experienced, enthusiastic Senior Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Analyst to join the team.

Our people are doing high-end work for high-end clients, but with the autonomy and client access that only a boutique agency can offer. As a Senior SEO Analyst, you shepherd clients’ success through careful research, strategy, execution, and analysis. Your data-backed contextual insights and subject-matter expertise guide clients’ business decisions, helping them achieve and exceed their goals.

We need a hungry, tenacious SEO professional to manage large and complex clients. We need someone who can effectively communicate and successfully implement custom SEO strategies to our clients. We need someone who sees an ever-changing industry rife with challenges, obstacles, and puzzles to solve and says, “Bring it on!”.

This is a full-time position located onsite in our Richmond, Virginia office.

Key Responsibilities
Use your expertise in analysis to pull and develop forward-looking reports and logically explain them to the client
Foster a trusting relationship with your clients with clear and consistent communication
Take full ownership and accountability of your clients performance by hitting and exceeding client expectations and KPIs
Manage your own workflows to develop and implement actionable, long-term SEO strategies for your assigned portfolio of clients
Optimize client websites through a blend of technical and content updates
Perform keyword research, analyze and report on competitor and keyword data to clients
Claim, update, optimize, and manage local listings for clients
Write, optimize, and syndicate content on behalf of clients
Generate content ideas for clients including blog ideas, articles, or any other content
Leverage various SEO software tools such as Ahrefs, Moz, Whitespark, SERPs, or any other software purchased by Workshop Digital to aid in client results
Grow personal and internal SEO strategies
Contribute thought leadership content to Workshop Digital blog and the industry
Mentor junior SEO team members by training and developing other team members
Stay up to date with the SEO industry by reading industry blogs, books, whitepapers and attending conferences
Experience and skills we like to see
Minimum of 3 years experience executing hands-on SEO work for large or complex websites
Proven track record of driving killer results through ethical SEO practices
Experience with Google Analytics or other comparable web analytics platforms
Demonstrable skills in analyzing data, transforming numbers into actionable insights
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Superlative written, verbal, and visual communication skills
Lifelong learner – You’re driven to stay informed on the ever-developing worlds of SEO and Content Marketing
Hands-on experience with SEO tools such as Ahrefs, Moz, Screamingfrog
Confident and articulate presenter
Strong technical experience in web development or SQL a plus
What To Expect From Us
Flexible vacation days along with your typical paid holidays
Ability to attend industry events and conferences
Comprehensive training programs available for cross-training & new advertising platforms
Health, Vision, and Dental insurance along with life/disability insurance
401k with employer contributions
Quarterly check-ins to discuss your career path
A safe, fun, challenging, and collaborative work environment
We Weave Our Core Values into Everything We Do
We are ethical
We are accountable
We are transparent
We are eager to learn and willing to be wrong
We are empowered to be awesome in work & life
We go the extra mile for our clients
Workshop Digital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Workshop Digital provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

Position Overview

The primary role of the Technical SEO Specialist is to analyze and execute search engine optimization campaigns for a small portfolio of client websites. This must be done within a defined scope, time and cost based on the requirements and constraints of specific campaigns.

The Technical SEO Specialist works closely with the Marketing Analyst, Digital Strategist and Digital Marketing Manager to consistently improve client ROI. While the primary focus of the role is on complete SEO-based work, conversion rate optimization (CRO) is also a part of the role.

Although this is primarily a technical role, you will be required to attend all internal meetings and the occasional video call with clients.


What You Will Do


Work closely within a team to provide value to clients
Complete all assigned technical SEO tasks
Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaigns
Track, report, and analyze website analytics and social media and campaigns
Manage campaign expenses, staying on budget, estimating monthly costs and reconciling discrepancies
Optimize copy and landing pages for search engine optimization
Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimization
Research and implement search engine optimization recommendations
Research and analyze competitor websites and online presence
Develop and implement link building strategy
Work with the development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code
Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content programming
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords


What We’re Looking For


"A" players
Proactivity, ownership, confidence and motivation to grow
Ability to create digital marketing strategies and break them down to the task level
An ability to stay organized, meet multiple deadlines and pay attention to details in an open, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment
Proven technical SEO experience
Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
A true love of organization and keeping things organized
Data driven thinking as this is a very technical and data rich environment
Excellent communication skills - within the team, other departments and with external clients
Experience with optimizing WordPress websites
Ability to follow up on tasks so they get completed, without nagging team members
In-depth experience with common SEO tools (Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Majestic, Moz, DeepCrawl, etc)
Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms
Manage client budgets and campaign resources
Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets for data analysis including function mastery and pivot tables
Ability to create and help the team execute on digital marketing strategies
Experience working in the digital marketing and SEO industry
Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition
Ability to manage multiple campaign projects, clients and deadlines
Understanding of the legal industry and how law firms work is a plus
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO, SEM, PPC and social media
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Experience with Agile project management methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc) is a plus
A quiet dedicated home work environment with reliable high-speed internet access


What We Offer


A competitive salary based on your experience.
A great PTO package.
Quarterly profit-sharing bonuses and 401k participation after your first year of employment.
Health insurance benefits after your first 60 days with options for dental and vision.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company
In-house training and professional development through seminars and conferences (tell us what you want to learn, and we’ll give you our support)
Our annual company conference, with training sessions, team-building activities, contests with fun prizes (an Amazon Echo or iPad, for instance), outstanding meals and highly competitive softball and bowling tournaments.
The opportunity to work with passionate, determined online marketing experts from across the country and around the globe who bring not only their talents to the table but their unique personalities and interests as well.

Job title: Senior Online Search Marketing Specialist-(SEO and SEM)
Description:
Position Summary:

Johns Hopkins Medicine created the Internet Strategy and Web Services team to serve as a central strategic leader in the exploration, development, execution, and analysis of a digital strategy that connects the people of the world to the people of Johns Hopkins Medicine. Serving all aspects of the three-part mission of research, education and patient care, the team leads the creation and execution of a comprehensive online strategy including content creation and distribution, user-centered design and development, Internet marketing and social engagement, and data-driven performance analysis.

The Senior Online Search Marketing Specialist reports to the Manager of Internet Marketing and Social Engagement and oversees departmental and enterprise level search marketing activities, inclusive of SEO, SEM and the optimization of business listings (including hospital locations, faculty and departments). This position performs research on new techniques, technology and competitors to enhance SEM and SEO capabilities and identifies areas for improvement for an array of healthcare centric clients and service lines. The senior specialist will create strategies with prominent search engines, develop and test new keywords, manage Pay-Per-Click campaigns, analyze click-through data, conduct research and identify synergies between SEO and SEM. This person works closely with agency partners to unsure that campaigns and projects are managed effectively and optimized where necessary.

Education:

Requires a Bachelor's Degree preferably in Marketing or Communications. Equivalent experience and training, in digital communications, web marketing or social media, beyond the work experience requirement may be substituted on a 2:1 basis.

Work Experience:

5+ years experience in managing paid and organic search marketing campaigns.

Shift:

Day Full Time (40 hours)

8:30 am 5:00 pm

Exempt

Required Licensure, Certification:

AdWords Certificate is preferred.

Johns Hopkins Health System and its affiliates are drug-free workplace employers.

It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon’s media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we’re transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for an engineer to join our development team to focus on SEO (search engine optimization) growth initiatives across all of our iconic brands. Mindstream Interactive is a fully integrated customer experience agency with roots deep in digital marketing. Based in Columbus, Ohio, we work with amazing clients across the U.S. and Canada. Creating meaningful brand interactions is never far from our thoughts, nor are the virtues of learning and innovation. We are looking for a SEO Director to join our growing team.


JOB DESCRIPTION


The role is that of a hands-on leader who sets and implements SEO-focused strategies with a multi-functional team, ensuring Mindstream delivers the best possible Customer Experience for its clients and customers.

The Director of SEO is expected to be an advocate and go-to expert for a wide range of SEO-related activities, projects and initiatives spanning Technical, Content and Off-site SEO. This person must be comfortable meeting with and presenting big-picture planning to clients and new business prospects, as well as rolling up her or his sleeves to bring strategic recommendations to life in partnership with copy- and code-focused counterparts. He or she will also be the leader and core driver of Mindstream Interactive's growing SEO team.

Responsibilities

The Director of SEO is responsible for ensuring that all sites and other relevant experience components under Mindstream's purview are optimized to attract, engage and convert right-fit customers.

She or he will align with leadership on SEO-focused business goals, and will work daily with Strategists, Analysts, UX Architects, Copywriters and Social Content creators to realize them. The right candidate will also be capable of regularly collaborating with an extended team of Social Media Specialists, Account Service Managers and Web Developers in order to fulfill his or her duties.

Typical activities and deliverables will include:
Develop annual, quarterly and project-level SEO strategies designed to maximize performance across Technical, Content and Off-site SEO to achieve business goals
Create short- and long-term SEO recommendations for clients, based on an overarching strategy, that incorporate keyword findings, content recommendations, site structure updates as needed, and or technical enhancements
Conduct ongoing keyword research to apply a customer-first lens to marketing and merchandising strategies and product content; use these insights to support strategic and tactical recommendations across clients' digital ecosystems
Audit client sites through a technical, content and off-site lens to ensure that they consistently adhere to SEO best practices
Define program-specific KPIs and partner with Analytics team to monitor, analyze and report out on search performance on an ongoing basis in formats and fidelities that engage a range of audiences from the front lines to the C-Suite
Maintain and manage search tools to identify site issues and collaborate with technology to resolve defects
Ensure alignment between paid search and natural search strategies
Partner with social team to support social listening efforts by way of organic search insights
Advise working teams on which content types to explore to maximize clients' search rankings
Provide training to others in the organization on issues important to SEO
Constantly monitor and communicate changes in industry trends and search engine algorithms to the organization, including up-to-date search marketing considerations related ADA compliance as required
Estimate and support the sell-in of new SEO initiatives, in conjunction with Business Development and Account Service team members
Develop working plans for upcoming and in-motion SEO engagements (weekly/monthly resource planning, initiative prioritization, key milestones, etc.)
Assign and oversee skill level-appropriate responsibilities for SEO and supporting team members
Work with the VP, Strategy to regularly re-visit and evolve Mindstream's organic search offering
A working knowledge of social and/or digital media strategy and storytelling through analytics would be valuable but is not required.

Qualifications

The qualified candidate will meet as many of the following preferred skillset requirements as possible, with the understanding that on-the-job training will be provided to round out the candidate's skillset if necessary:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, MIS, Journalism, Computer Science or related field
7+ years of professional experience focusing on SEO (SEM experience will also be considered)
Expert-level knowledge of at least 1 core SEO area of emphasis (Technical, Content and Off-site) with strong working knowledge of best practice for remainder, and a willingness to continue to extend knowledge
Expert level knowledge of key SEO tools (SEMRush, Screaming Frog, BrightEdge, Ahrefs)
Working knowledge of SEO-supporting tools (Google Keyord Planner, Google Search Console, Google PageSpeed Insights, Optimizilla, Answer the Public, and more)
Working knowledge of Google Analytics and similar analytics platforms, and how to use insights from them to uncover meaningful insights and inform SEO recommendations
Working knowledge of eCommerce best practices
Strong knowledge of the web development process and fundamentals of digital marketing and how to integrate SEO to support them
Ability to manage multiple projects at once, including capability to balance competing priorities in fast-paced environment
Problem-solving mindset with high attention to detail
Proven ability to interact & collaborate across multiple disciplines to accomplish a common goal
Able to effectively operate and complete complex tasks with minimal oversight
Comfort with and a desire to support new business initiatives a plus
Proven experience effectively managing and mentoring team members a plus
Agency experience a plus
Proven track record of successfully presenting search data and recommendations to clients in an approachable, expert way

Description:

Sr. SEO MANAGER, DIGITAL MEDIA & SEARCH

About us:

Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of Americas leading retailers.

Fueling the continued success of one of the worlds most beloved and recognized brands is a distinctly capable, creative and innovative Marketing organization. Target Marketing is well known for inspiring and surprising guests, and we pride ourselves on connecting them to the products and experiences they expect and deserve from Target. We study our guests to discover new needs and insights, and then craft every interaction to build brand love. We are market experts who insist on a clear and cohesive understanding of our business objectives, guest segments and behaviors, strategies and tactics, overcoming obstacles and measuring success. Our commitment to partnering both internally and with external agencies gives us a wide range of capabilities, from award-winning creative work to exciting and unique promotional marketing. Leveraging our collective assets and fostering a healthy, supportive and open team culture, we deliver a holistically gratifying experience that guests can only get at Target.

A role with Target Digital Media & Search means being close to the action of delivering profitable sales to Target.com and bringing the businesss multichannel vision to life. Youll create and implement industry-leading digital media plans for Brand & Category Marketing while staying on the cutting edge of emerging digital media innovations. Cultivating an environment of full-team engagement, leadership and personal development, youll be a champion for open communication and program transparency.

As a Sr. SEO Manager youll manage and lead the implementation of Targets overall SEO strategy. You will work closely with product teams, creative partners and site merchandising teams to drive organic traffic and sales growth. You will drive prioritization and uncover new opportunities around taxonomy, linking and content for all of Targets digital properties. Youll leverage large data sets and synthesize into actionable insights to better understand evolving guest search behaviors and intent. You will be accountable to auditing and monitoring Targets overall SEO program, communicating results and executing scalable tactics to drive brand and performance results. You will create training for partners, improve workflow processes and identify defects quickly in order to maintain visibility and coverage in the search engines. You will also be responsible for improving overall crawl budget and ensuring our most important digital content is rendering by the search engines. You are expected to keep pace with SEO and overall digital marketing trends and translate relevant industry developments into enterprise strategies for Target.

About you
4-year Degree in Advertising, Business, Marketing, Finance, Economics, Mathematics or related areas of study or equivalent work experience.
6-10 years experience in Technical SEO, Content Planning, Web Development, and/or Ecommerce.
Preferred experience with SEO tools that include crawling, keyword research, keyword rank tracking and backlink analysis (i.e. Botify, Deepcrawl, Moz, Stat Analytics, Google Search Console, Keyword Planner, SEMrush, BrightEdge, AHREFs, Screaming Frog, SearchMetrics).
Solid understanding of HTML, SSR, JavaScript, Structured Data Mark-up, XML Sitemaps, etc.
Strong analytical skills with experience in a variety of analytics tools including Adobe and/or Google Analytics.
Advanced computer skills, including high-level proficiency in Excel (including, but not limited to, pivot tables and VLookups).
Excellent problem solving skills with high levels of autonomy and self-motivation.
Highly detailed oriented with excellent organizational skills while managing multiple projects.
Comfortable navigating through ambiguity
Strong sense of prioritization

Hearst Magazines is looking for a creative and talented SEO manager to work with our Enthusiast brands — Runner’s World, Bicycling, and Popular Mechanics. Combined, these sites generate more than 15 million users each month who are as obsessed with our brands as we are. From millennials to marathon runners, tech nerds to space geeks, you’ll be able to help shape content creation each and every day.


As a company, Search plays an important role and produces a healthy variety of traffic. We’re seeking a rock-star of sorts that can assist our associate SEO director to bring our strong Search foundation to the next level. Working directly with our digital editors, you’ll get a front line view of the latest gadgets, record-breaking athletes, ecommerce everything, and at times, you’ll get to help be part of the testing process (hello, new running shoes).


While this is mainly an SEO role, we are also looking for someone with an analytical mind. As we continue to make smarter decisions based on data, this role will be responsible for providing insights to help shape content strategy, whether that be organic search, paid, or even newsletter.


Here’s what you’ll be responsible for:


Create a unique SEO content strategy for each site that seamlessly mixes into their editorial calendar and voice. Sure we’re talking about keyword ideas, but also new areas of content opportunity overall, emerging trends, ever-changing seasonal opportunities, and innovative takes on what’s buzzing on the InterWebs. #TourDeFrance


Optimize content on the regular, whether it’s on-page headlines, meta titles, slugs, or body copy, you know what the page needs to rank in Google.


Work directly in our CMS updating meta info, creating URLs, working on all sorts of internal linking, creating collection pages, and monitoring redirects.


Use our analytics tools to provide reporting to stakeholders on what’s working and what’s not working. Analyze data to provide recommendations on what we should be doing more of.


Keep tabs on keywords that have been assigned, completed, and published. You’ll see a story through from start to finish.


Live and breathe all things Search. Stay on top of the industry, test out new product features, and ensure we’re always playing nicely with every algorithm update. You’re basically like the algo police.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

The world’s leading provider of travel, expense and invoice management solutions is seeking a Marketing Manager to join our existing world class SEO team to help drive a digital evolution at SAP Concur. Core to this evolution is a heavy investment in Search Engine Optimization (SEO), a strategy at the heart of SAP Concur’s efforts to increase digital demand generation capabilities and efficiencies.

Reporting to Director, Search Marketing, the SEO specialist will support SAP Concur’s organic search strategy globally, focused on driving qualified traffic and demonstrate measurable results. The SEO specialist will work to increase SAP Concur’s website visibility on search engines through instituting best practices for organic search programs.

This person’s communication and collaboration skills must be first class in order to help drive and implement a worldwide SEO strategy. They must be a self-starter, someone who can work autonomously yet collaborate with many teams around the world. And they must embrace and champion change and be comfortable with ambiguity.

Responsibilities:
Work with the other SEO managers to define and support the global SEO strategy
Implement SEO tactics including keyword research, authoring meta data & headlines, audit competitor websites, and more.
Optimize on-site content for SAP Concur websites to ensure maximum visibility
Manage and fix technical SEO elements on the websites, including hreflang tags, canonical tags and site errors.
Report advanced technical issues to the web development team.
Help to implement a robust link-building strategy.
Monitor and maintain monthly tracking tools and perform website analysis to ensure business goals are met and provide insights and future actions.
Optimize website source code for search engines.
Research, report on and address search engine algorithm changes.
Research competitors in the search landscape and deliver innovative ideas on how we can outperform them.
Qualifications:
BA required with focus in Marketing or Business.
3+ years of SEO experience in a corporate business-to-business environment.
Understands SEO best practices and emerging trends, including knowledge of search engine ranking factors and algorithm updates.
Knowledge of HTML, CMS, CSS, structured data and website administration.
Ideally has experience with SEMRush, Adobe Analytics, Tableau, Drupal, Google Search Console.
Familiarity with localization processes and best practices.
Strong written and verbal communications.
Ability to work autonomously; produce work in a timely manner with extensive project management skills.
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). In the role of SEO Manager, you will have the primary responsibility of iteratively developing, implementing and continually optimizing SEO strategies in order to directly and measurably improve our organic search results. You will have SEO ownership of individual web properties from Ziff Media Group’s portfolio of ecommerce sites. You will work with multiple internal teams and departments, including engineering, product, UX, PR and editorial. Responsibilities

Gather and draw insights from data that can help identify and define areas of improvements and optimization.
Leverage various internal and external tools to measure/report on organic search performance and to identify/troubleshoot technical issues that might be affecting our overall rankings.

Lead internal training of search optimization best practices to increase overall search knowledge across the organization.
Perform keyword research, write optimized HTML tags and provide recommendations for internal linking, content promotion, content creation and implementation of schema mark-up.
Identify and implement internal link optimizations of existing and new content to aid SEO efforts.
Collaborate with editorial team to create high-quality content around important, relevant terms.
Work closely with PR to manage off-page optimization by providing best practices for overall improvement to search
Monitor and report on onsite search metrics and KPIs.
Rely on both qualitative and quantitative analyses to identify and execute opportunities for improvements.
Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of experience in SEO, preferably in-house.
Experience optimizing eCommerce websites to build organic traffic and drive revenue.
Experience utilizing a wide variety of SEO tools such as SEMRush, Brightedge, Conductor, Ahrefs, Google Search Console and others to perform analyses.
Experience with site crawlers and log file analysis.
Proficient and experienced with technical SEO (ex: XML sitemaps, canonicalization, hreflangs, robots.txt, URL redirects, etc).
Strong written & verbal communication skills.
Highly motivated, strategic, curious and innovative but also willing to roll up your sleeves and get in the weeds of the tactical execution that drives progress for search audience growth.

We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Product Manager to lead the development and ownership of our growing suite of SEO Business Intelligence (BI) systems. What's In It For You


If you've made it to this point in reading this post, then you are probably already thinking, “this is all great, but what's in it for me?”

At Arteric, you will work side-by-side with our incredibly seasoned and talented developers to identify new and unique ways to apply data science and machine learning to SEO challenges. For example, we have used AI technology to build proprietary tools to help inform our SEO work. One tool uses machine learning and natural language processing to identify signals hidden in hundreds of thousands of user interactions. Another tool analyzes competitors' content vs our client's website to assess relative power and authority across topics.

With those same teams, you will work to identify best practices for technical SEO that can be standardized into Arteric's technology-development process. This will allow you to expand your SEO skills with advanced analytics techniques in a one-of-a-kind way.


About Us


At Arteric, our mission is to explore the boundaries of the possible and create life-changing experiences through feature-rich, defect-free deliverables that work everywhere and every time. We do this every day by connecting patients, caregivers, and healthcare providers to the information patients need to live longer, healthier lives.

The hallmark of our work is superior execution and the relentless pursuit of quality. In 2018, Arteric was named to MM&M's Agency to Watch list. In 2019, MM&M included Arteric in their Agency 100, a list of the top 100 healthcare marketing agencies in the US. Earlier this year, Gartner described Arteric as an agency that is creating value with AI and machine learning. This was in recognition of the thought leadership on SEO and AI that the firm has demonstrated with speaking engagements at 20+ digital marketing conferences over the past two years. Additionally, in 2018 Arteric won 15 design/UX Awards and powered through the year with 40% growth, a trend that continues in 2019.

We do all of this without office politics and BS. We take pride in having a culture that is friendly and supportive. We know that together we can and do find the answers that we need for creating value and growth for our customers—because together, we are the experts in digital marketing.

This is an onsite position at Arteric's office in Summit, NJ.

Big Footprint’s Director of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is an expert digital marketer with a specific focus on driving overall SEO performance for a wide variety of businesses. You’ll be responsible for architecting and executing digital content and SEO strategies (and communicating the value we drive to Clients). You’ll be measured by your ability to produce high quality, optimized content for clients.

You're a proven SEO leader who can analyze technical, on-page, and offsite SEO scenarios in order to architect a project plan to improve organic rankings and traffic quality. You are also a practitioner, able and willing to personally execute SEO tactics while also directing other team members' contributions. Lastly, you are an excellent communicator, capable of leading weekly SEO calls and highlighting performance changes, correlations, and illustrating project progress.

You will be proactive, drive our recommendations forward, and be intuitive and dynamic in a sense that you can work with different personalities and a broad range of customers who are in different phases of the customer lifecycle.

Responsibilities
Analyzing existing client websites, content, and linking for opportunities to improve and optimize for search engines and end-users
Conduct and leverage keyword analyses to drive content recommendations and on-site optimizations
Manage page level optimizations across client websites, ensuring a systematic and data-driven approach to improvements
Conduct full technical SEO audits and outline recommendations
Work with our in-house dev team, or the client's, in order to execute technical SEO recommendations
Lead weekly meetings focused around SEO performance, trends, and project progress
Establish a trusting relationship with clients, allowing your recommendations to be heard and taken to heart
Interface and collaborate with other teams (both Big Footprint and the Client) to complete project goals
Communicate our value and manage aspects of client engagements
Develop ongoing reporting focused on optimizations and content improvement
The Ideal Candidate
You are an excellent writer, you have a deep knowledge of grammar and can adapt your writing style to various situations.
You believe grammar and editing is not subjective – there is a correct way to write, and you know how to.
You have the ability to research and write from scratch, or edit others work.
You are deep SEO-practitioner who keeps up with all the latest industry changes and Google news
You love technical SEO and can quickly identify issues, and debug deeper issues on websites
You can synthesize complex situations and problems in order to find solutions.
Anything done “half-assed” offends you.
You can manage client expectations and relationships, while still contributing to, and demanding more of the team around you.
You’re comfortable working with and are very proficient with spreadsheets, word processors, and content management systems like WordPress.
You know how to properly research a topic you are unfamiliar with, until you achieve deep knowledge.
Perhaps most importantly, you understand how to communicate and illustrate value to clients.
Requirements
4+ years of SEO experience
Experience working on the agency side
Experience with, and the ability to illustrate your research skills (digging into and understanding hard problems)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills – able to simplify complex strategies and topics in a friendly, approachable manner and present complex topics to Clients in person
Flexible and able to juggle and complete multiple priorities and projects (internally and externally)
Expert knowledge of Google Analytics and keyword research tools
Expert knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets and other data tools
Organized and able to develop a system to optimize content over time.
Team player and self-driven to get things done
Live in the Denver/Front Range area
Benefits

Big Footprint’s entire existence is based on our ability to drive value directly for our customers. Everything we do must drive this value or it detracts from our success and our client’s success. As a result, Big Footprint ties employee compensation to an employee’s ability to drive success.

When combining salary, performance bonuses, wellness incentives (i.e. ski pass), health reimbursement arrangements, and other perks and contributions, the total compensation package at Big Footprint is meant to be bring the best people here.

We thrive as one business, one unit, and each member of the team must contribute value.
The starting salary for this position will be determined based on the candidate’s breadth of knowledge, experience, ability to fill the role, and drive ROI.
Compensation will include the opportunity to take part in a Health Reimbursement Arrangement, which can be used to cover health insurance premiums. Other benefits may also be available.
Employees receive the opportunity to earn commission on projects they refer to the company and may be eligible for profit sharing or partner status based on contribution throughout their career.
Employees receive 15 days of paid vacation per year in addition to many standard US Holidays.
Employees also receive an allowance toward purchasing an annual ski and snowboard pass.
Employees are eligible for performance bonuses based on client results, these goals are identified on a case by case basis.

Job Description

We are looking for a creative and forward-thinking digital marketer to join our growing team as an SEO Account Manager. This position that requires a solid understanding of search engine optimization best practices and strategies. The ideal candidate possesses the ability to speak to these strategies to clients and the skills to execute the strategies.

The Bluetent Marketing Services Team provides clients with SEO, SEM, social media, content, and comprehensive digital strategies that are aimed at driving qualified traffic, enhancing the user experience, and increasing conversions. The SEO Account Manager plays a key role in crafting search engine optimization strategies for our clients in the vacation rental industry. This is a client-facing role that requires exceptional critical thinking skills and communication. The SEO Account Manager will also handle SEO setups for new website builds, as well as SEO audits and tasks for assigned clients.

The SEO industry is constantly evolving, and we work hard to stay at the forefront of best practices, technology, and tools!

In this role you will:
Work closely with a portfolio of clients to develop unique SEO strategies based on individual client needs and business goals
Prepare monthly Google Analytics reports to communicate progress and strategy to clients
Complete SEO setups for new website projects, including 301 redirects, on-page optimization, Google Analytics configuration, and XML sitemap configuration.
Comfortable working in Drupal CMS to add new content, optimize content and metadata, and configure modules.
Write new website content or help generate content strategies for clients
Perform keyword research, competitive analysis
Conduct SEO audits to uncover places on the site where the client is not following SEO best practices
Collaborate with internal teams including Bluetent web developers, project managers, advertising specialists, and strategic account managers
Keep up with SEO industry blogs and news to apply best practices or new recommendations to client work, as well as share information with team members
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Minimum of 2 years agency or in-house SEO experience
Excellent communication skills – both verbal and written
Proficient in Google Analytics and Google Search Console
Experience with keyword research and tracking keyword rankings
Strong understanding of search engine optimization best practices and the Google ranking algorithm
Knowledge of local search ecosystem
Ability to manage multiple client accounts and SEO setups at once, while keeping track of client initiatives, to-dos, tasks, and communication
Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
Must have general understanding of crawl errors, indexation, pagespeed, and other technical SEO elements
Driven to achieve great results for clients
Experience working with Drupal a plus
Experience working with Google Tag Manager a plus
Able to both independently and in a team setting, with a willingness to help where needed
Enthusiasm and a passion for digital marketing
Ability to relocate preferred
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you find yourself enthusiastically nodding “yes”, then there’s a good chance we’ve struck a match. Inflow is looking for an experienced SEO Strategist to create and execute inbound marketing strategies for our eCommerce clients. If you’re an SEO expert, we want to hear from you!


Responsibilities (Your Mission):
Strategize, prioritize, plan, and manage execution of SEO strategies for multiple clients
Consult effectively with clients on all things SEO, including keyword research, technical SEO, architecture planning, and more
Uncover, analyze, and recommend fixes for technical SEO problems with websites

Get your hands dirty executing client SEO work and deliverables
