Perform audits and analysis across a wide range of SEO best practices Identify and help execute opportunities to grow client accounts and retainers
Identify and help execute opportunities to grow client accounts and retainers
Write about your adventures and eCommerce marketing for our blog readers


What We Must Have (No, Really):


Experience: 2-3+ years experience SEO experience with a focus on organic SEO, content marketing, eCommerce and/or inbound marketing
Demonstrated technical SEO expertise. Technical and content audit experience on large (preferably eCommerce) sites is a must. Penalty analysis and recovery assistance a huge plus.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently or with a team. Bet you’ve never heard that one before.
Client and Project Management: Semi-ridiculous drive to serve clients. Juggle. Execute. Manage. Demonstrate value. Memorize dogs/kids names. Know channel preferences.
Superb Google Analytics and GTM experience – cross-domain tracking, eCommerce tracking, and measurement protocol
Team-Building: No ropes course, but you must egolessly manage copywriters, designers, programmers, and promoters so we can get it all done and still have time to play air hockey or table tennis (ping-pong for the laymen).
Marketing Consultant Laws: Not only familiar with but kind of obsessed with
Lifelong Learner: The world’s a changing. Like every day. Desire to expand knowledge is critical


What We Dream About (Among Other Things)
Agency experience (know our pace--keep up)
A well-rounded T-shaped marketer, preferably with depth in technical and/or eCommerce SEO
Marketing Automation Hotshot: Ability to create and measure campaigns in WindsorCircle, Klaviyo HubSpot and/or other marketing automation systems. (Workflows, forms, campaigns, content, etc.)
Email marketing experience
Some experience with conversion optimization, including A/B testing




And About Culture. . .
We know that culture isn’t really about beer meisters and beanbag chairs. It’s about people. And wanting to come to work. And the F word. No the other one–freedom. To be yourself. To make mistakes. To laugh out loud. To break into random applause when someone leaves this office in the evening. To work 40 hours and not need to check your email from the top of Bierstadt, or on the drive back to Denver. To be surrounded by talented people with multiple superpowers.


Happy hours don’t necessarily happen every week. We got kids and dogs and stuff. But we do replenish and celebrate. Beers. Bowling. BBQ. Rockies games.


Why We’re Perky
Competitive salary
Paid vacation and sick days. Festival-fanatic? Boarder? Hockey mama? Flu bug? No problem.
15Five takes the pulse of our company. We listen, consider and respond. Every week. Period.
Quarterly culture surveys, to help us always get better
Quarterly Profit Sharing – we share the success with you.
The whole insurance thing: retirement contributions, short-term, long term disability, life and health.
Build-your-own perks: get a bucket of cash and spend it on what you want (mostly). As long as it benefits you or your family, it’s yours to spend.
Family Support: New kiddo? Take 6 weeks, on us, to get to know your new family member. Maternity/paternity leave, along with adoption and reproductive assistance.
We love pets. Our office is dog-friendly! (Cats, not so much.) We also offer a one-time pet adoption fee reimbursement.
Rooftop deck: Take a break or work from the building rooftop deck. Lawn chairs included.
Stand up: All staff have desks that can become stand-up desks at the push of a button.
Stocked fridge. Breakfast Burritos, Maria Empanada, and Upslope.
Free parking!
Gym Membership: Go rock climb, cycle, stretch, or lift heavy stuff on us at Movement.
Paid Holidays – you start out with 7 but after year 1 you’ll pick up more floating holidays to use for what’s important to you.
Dude, it’s a well of expertise around here. Ask and you shall be educated. Plus, we have a lot to learn from you, too. Teach us your ways.
Birthdays are a big deal. Desserts (or breakfast burritos, your choice) are served. Stick around long enough and it becomes a paid day off!
Publish and build your personal brand via our blog and social media. Stand on our shoulders. Get noticed online. Mix with fellow industry geeks. You matter.
Don't take our word for it... look at what our employees say about us on Glassdoor!




But Enough About You, What about Us?


For the fifth consecutive year, Inflow has been named one of the Denver-area’s fastest growing private companies PLUS we’re one of 200 Google Managed Agencies AND one of only 50 firms worldwide to be named as a “Moz Recommended Company”. This year is the third time in a row we made the Inc. 5000 list.


Awards get boring, eh? So what’s our story?


Mike Belasco (great guy whose daughter is obsessed with Star Wars) founded the company back in 2003 when he saw this huge, honkin, Royal-Gorge size gap between agency offerings and client needs. Originally, seOverflow (our previous brand) was just that—an SEO outsourcing company. Now we bring inbound marketing (i.e. omni-channel marketing that puts the customer first with deliberate, non-interruption-based tactics) to the ecommerce world.

Oh and don’t mess with Mike. His grandfather engineered the first space shuttle toilet and he doesn’t eat raspberries. No one knows why.

Company Overview

AdCellerant is a tech-enabled services company focused on making Madison Avenue level digital advertising solutions available to Main Street marketers. We focus on finding the smartest, most experienced candidates, that is a perfect fit for the position, and the companys culture. As a company, we focus on our team above everything else and know if our team is motivated all the companys business objectives can be achieved. After 5 years, our focus on team first has led to being recognized as an Inc. Magazine Best Workplace for two years running and a Denver Business Journal Best Workplace.

Over the last 5 years, AdCellerant has grown from a few founders to a team of over 70 talented, hard-working individuals leading the industry in supporting local marketers. This team helps execute sophisticated digital advertising campaigns in Programmatic, Native, Video, Mobile, Search Engine Marketing, Email, and Search Engine Optimization.

Benefits

AdCellerant offers full-time employees paid vacation, paid sick days, health/dental/vision benefits, 401k retirement plan, paid maternity/paternity leave, flexible work environment, and most importantly, a fun downtown Denver location.

Job Overview

Now active in 5 countries and over 300 markets, the AdCellerant team is looking to hire an SEO Channel Sales Manager to help strategically guide and execute the teams 2020 budget initiatives. The SEO Channel Sales Manager will be required to manage Search Engine Optimization (SEO) sales efforts. This will include interacting with internal and external resources to develop and execute sales and campaign tactics, manage revenue and facilitate trainings, site audits and sales demonstrations for AdCellerants partners and advertisers.

The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and communication skills supporting a deep understanding of the organic marketing space. Day-to-day tasks will vary from high-level strategic planning to detailed training and sales prospecting, and candidates must be comfortable with this broad range of responsibilities and activities. Above all, the SEO Channel Sales Manager must be self-motivated and collaborative, with a desire to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.




Job Responsibilities

Strategy: Work with the Director of SEO to develop and implement current and new sales plans to grow revenue among our 250+ resale partners.
Execution: Work with AdCellerant Account Managers to prospect opportunities, conduct SEO audits and presentations, and execute sales plans that align with the SEO teams budget. This could include strategic digital advertising proposals, in-market visits, and training for our partners.
Account Management: This position will be responsible for overseeing the health of all partners and advertisers running SEO campaigns, looking for ways to improve campaigns, increase revenue or troubleshoot questions and concerns. Duties also will include offering strategic support, analysis, and customer service where needed to retain and drive revenue.
Communication: Internal communication with the team will be a crucial responsibility of this role to ensure the team is clear on its goals and strategic plans to drive revenue through our partner resellers. External communication will include maintaining and elevating our standards of superior customer service, presenting complicated digital advertising information in an easy-to-understand format for our partners, their clients, and the public.
Reporting: Providing status updates to the Director of SEO weekly on sales efforts, revenue, gap-to-goal, and overall health of the business.
Team Building: As a growing company we hope that all individuals will contribute to the future growth and acceleration of our business. What are your ideas to help us continue to grow at a very rapid pace over the next year?
Troubleshooting: When problems arise, it will be necessary to perform troubleshooting steps to ensure that issues are properly resolved. Also, it will be part of your responsibility to document best practices so if the same issue arises in the future the team is better prepared to handle it.


Requirements:


Qualifications

4+ years of experience in selling or managing SEO campaigns
Experience executing SEO campaigns can apply, including conducting keyword and competitive research, technical auditing, and content analysis/editing
Agency experience a plus
Strong knowledge of search engines and Search Engine Optimization (SEO), including an understanding of search engine ranking factors and algorithm updates
Proven sales executive experience, meeting or exceeding targets
Ability to communicate, present and influence all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level
Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close
Proven ability to articulate the distinct aspects of digital products and services
Proven ability to position products against competitors
Demonstrable experience developing client-focused, differentiated, and achievable solutions
Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
BA/BS degree or equivalent

Summary:

This is an opportunity for you to demonstrate your passion in presenting beautiful, actionable data as part of a high performing SEO team! As the SEO Data & Analytics Lead you are responsible for developing and driving SEO data strategy to inspire action across Under Armour’s Digital organization. In this new role, reporting to the Sr. Global SEO Manager within Global eCommerce, you will partner with SEO and cross-functional teams to develop data capabilities in support of the company’s organic growth objectives. You will educate, evangelize and ultimately drive organic growth by combining your passion and knowledge of data with your ability to build strong relationships, while supporting and executing on prioritized roadmaps and initiatives.

Responsibilities:
Facilitate and report on progress of strategic initiatives aimed at organic growth.
Unlock data views that allow SEO and partner teams to understand business health, progress against strategic objectives, and to inspire action.
Ensure all strategic objectives are tied to specific and measurable key results.
Collaborate with SEO team members to conduct opportunity assessments and build measurement plans for strategic initiatives.
Own the development and management of initiative retrospectives and develop a socialization strategy for key partners and leadership.
Drive seasonal and annual forecasting efforts for all regions globally.
Manage data priorities and enhancement roadmap with internal, external partners across all regions.
Increase the visibility of data for key stakeholders to inspire actions that drive organic growth.
Format reports and create a regular cadence of reporting on the results of past and current efforts to “close the loop” and communicate these to cross functional teams.
Identify gaps in data availability and partner with internal and external data sources to find solutions.
Develop detailed use cases and user stories to communicate the presentation or application of data.
Proactively monitor SEO health across a range of KPIs and share wins and opportunities.
Define standards and drive adoption of SEO data capabilities through documentation/training.
Continually monitor industry trends, including search algorithm and result layout changes, SEO best practices, and the competitive landscape.
Passion for data and growth while working in a fast pace agile digital environment is a must!
Qualifications:
Minimum 7 years’ experience with 3 years performing SEO at Strategist/Lead level or above.
Experience with Tableau, Google Data Studio and Big Query.
Must be familiar with JIRA, comfortable writing JIRA tickets and knowledgeable about agile workflows.
Extensive experience working with Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, Bing Webmaster Tools, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Majestic, Google Trends, Stat, etc.
Solid analytical skills. Google Analytics certification required. Familiarity with Adobe Analytics a plus.
Strong project management and organization skills, with a keen eye for detail, requiring minimal supervision
Familiarity with RegEx required and ability to write API calls a plus.
Technical background with deep understanding of technologies including SQL, Python and APIs.
Demonstrated experience enabling interactive analysis of massive data sets.
Experience with common search engine data platforms, including Google Search Console, enterprise web crawlers, and Google keyword data is preferred.
Ability to provide clear, concise communication in verbal and written formats.
Superior relationship-building with cross-functional teams to deliver results through excellent partnership, communication and negotiating skills.
Exceptional data analytics and articulation skills with experience setting and measuring KPIs
Expert data visualization skills using both Excel and Google Sheets
Outstanding written/oral, organizational, analytical skills, and attention to detail
Clear, concise and persuasive communication style that earns stakeholder buy-in and compels action.
Ability to provide clear direction, set measurable goals and give insight on industry trends.
Strong passion for sport and love for athletes!

THE COMPANY

Founded in 2008, Adept has grown to be a team of 35+ digital marketing specialists with experts in strategy, SEO, paid media, web design & development, conversion optimization, analytics, video production and content development. Adept has been named a Central Ohio Top 10 Agency, according to Columbus Business First, and our growth over the years has earned us a place on The Agency Post’s list of fastest-growing companies, three times to the Inc. 5000 List of America’s Fast Growing Companies, and four times to Central Ohio’s Fast 50.

While some agencies specialize in a certain industry, a marketing channel, or a particular digital tactic — we specialize in growth. Internalizing each business and its goals, we build collaborative relationships with our clients around data-driven marketing that delivers measurable results. It’s an approach that enables us to work with growth-minded brands across a variety of verticals — including healthcare, retail, education, finance, construction/engineering, real estate, and professional services.

Do you dream about rel= canonical tags and how to optimize a site built with Angular.js?
Can you go big with SEO strategy, client account management, and execution, but still know enough about analytics, code, and UX to be dangerous?
You may be our next Senior SEO Strategist!
Responsibilities (Your Mission):
Lead the strategy, prioritization, planning, and execution for client SEO strategies
Consult effectively with clients on all things SEO, including keyword research, technical SEO, site architecture planning, and so much more
Uncover, analyze, and recommend fixes for technical SEO problems with websites
Set proper client expectations & target goals and work against them for clear, results-proven ROI
Train, develop, and mentor junior SEO strategists & coordinators to build their skillsets - share your depth of SEO knowledge with team members and assist with SEO strategy development and technical expertise
Identify, evaluate, recommend and help implement tools and/or processes that could benefit the SEO team and achieve client goals
Support & conduct SEO ‘Sales Engineering’ work such as preliminary analysis of prospective client websites to help Sales lead close new SEO deals
Build and manage editorial/content calendars for clients
Identify and help execute opportunities to grow client accounts and retainers
Be an SEO thought leader for Inflow, Inflow’s clients, and within the greater SEO industry. Blog about your adventures in eCommerce, write case studies to show off your awesome SEO skills.
What We Must Have (No, Really):
Experience: 5+ years SEO experience with a focus on eCommerce SEO, content marketing, and/or inbound marketing
Demonstrated high level of technical SEO expertise. Technical and content audit experience on large (preferably eCommerce) sites is a must. Penalty analysis and recovery assistance a huge plus.
Confident directing the work of other top performers in a high-level oversight, non-micromanagey, "everybody go" type of way.
Account and Project Management: Semi-ridiculous drive to serve clients. Juggle. Execute. Manage. Demonstrate value. Memorize dogs/kids names. Know channel preferences. Keep the ball rolling.
Team-Building: No ropes course, but you must egolessly manage copywriters, designers, programmers and promoters so we can get it all done and still have time to play air hockey or table tennis (ping-pong for the laymen).
DEEEEEP Google Analytics and GTM experience – cross-domain tracking, eCommerce tracking, and measurement protocol
Marketing Consultant Laws: Not only familiar with but kind of obsessed with
Lifelong Learner: The world’s a-changing. Like every day. Desire to expand knowledge is critical
What We Dream About (Among Other Things)
Agency experience
A well-rounded T-shaped marketer, preferably with depth in technical and/or eCommerce SEO
Strong social media experience, including paid social advertising
Marketing Automation Hotshot: Ability to create and measure campaigns in WindsorCircle, Klaviyo HubSpot and/or other marketing automation systems. (Workflows, forms, campaigns, content, etc.)
Email marketing experience
Experience with conversion optimization, including A/B testing
And About Culture. . .
We know that culture isn’t really about beer meisters and beanbag chairs. It’s about people. And wanting to come to work. And the F word. No the other one — freedom. To be yourself. To make mistakes and laugh at yourself. To break into random applause when someone leaves the office in the evening. To work 40 hours and not need to check your email from the top of Beirstadt, or on the drive back to Denver. To be surrounded by talented people with multiple superpowers.
Happy hours don’t necessarily happen every week. We’ve got kids and dogs and stuff. But we do replenish and celebrate. Beers. Meditation. Bowling. Rockies games. Yoga. Band practice. We’re an eclectic bunch of nerds.
Got Perks?
Competitive salary
Paid vacation and sick days. Festival-fanatic? Boarder? Hockey mama? Flu bug? No problem.
15Five takes the pulse of our company. We listen, consider and respond. Every week. Period.
Quarterly culture surveys, to help us always get better
Quarterly Profit Sharing – we share the success with you.
The whole insurance thing: retirement contributions, short-term, long term disability, life and health.
Build-your-own perks: get a bucket of cash and spend it on what you want (mostly). As long as it benefits you or your family, it’s yours to spend.
Family Support: New kiddo? Take 6 weeks, on us, to get to know your new family member. Maternity/paternity leave, along with adoption and reproductive assistance.
We love pets. Our office is dog-friendly! (Cats, not so much.) We also offer a one-time pet adoption fee reimbursement.
Rooftop deck: Take a break or work from the building rooftop deck. Lawn chairs included.
Stand up: All staff have desks that can become stand-up desks at the push of a button.
Stocked fridge. Breakfast Burritos, Maria Empanada, Sweet Action, and Upslope.
Free parking!
Gym Membership: Go rock climb, cycle, stretch, or lift heavy stuff on us at Movement.
Paid Holidays – you start out with 7 but after year 1 you’ll pick up more floating holidays to use for what’s important to you.
Dude, it’s a well of expertise around here. Ask and you shall be educated. Plus, we have a lot to learn from you, too. Teach us your ways.
Birthdays are a big deal. Desserts (or breakfast burritos, your choice) are served. Stick around long enough and it becomes a paid day off!
Publish and build your personal brand via our blog and social media. Stand on our shoulders. Get noticed online. Mix with fellow industry geeks. You matter.
Don't take our word for it... look at what our employees say about us on Glassdoor!
But Enough About You, What about Us?
For the fifth consecutive year, Inflow has been named one of the Denver-area’s fastest growing private companies PLUS were one of 200 Google Managed Agencies AND one of only 50 firms worldwide to be named as a “Moz Recommended Company.”
But awards get boring, eh? So what’s our story?
Mike Belasco (great guy whose daughter is obsessed with Star Wars) founded the company back in 2003 when he saw this huge, honkin, Royal-Gorge size gap between agency offerings and client needs. Originally, seOverflow (our previous brand) was just that—an outsourcing company. Now we bring inbound marketing (i.e. omni-channel marketing that puts the customer first with deliberate, non-interruption-based tactics) to the eCommerce world.
Oh and don’t mess with Mike. His grandfather engineered the first space shuttle toilet and he doesn’t eat raspberries. No one knows why.

Position Responsibilities:

Digital Strategy and Execution Management:
Leads the Digital Marketing Team in development and activation of digital marketing initiative and annual plans.
Ensures that the agency delivers solutions that are on-strategy and consistently produce measurable results that exceed the client’s expectations.

Responsible for driving traffic, conversion and ROI for all digital acquisition channels.

Oversees the generation of periodic and ad hoc reports, data analysis and makes meaningful observations and recommendations.

Ensures digital marketing team is making ongoing optimizations across all digital channels

Industry and Client Leadership:
Accountable for the measurable success of programs, campaigns, and projects develops for our clients.

Communicates effectively with all disciplines to ensure client alignment
Communicates effectively with all disciplines to ensure client alignment.

Assists in defining project specifications based on client needs and requirements.
Conducts research into clients’ industries as needed.
Identifies opportunities for the client to enhance the consumer experience online and drive conversion, launch new products and lead brand/product campaigns.
Evaluates vendors within the digital space to ensure best-in-class partners.
Keeps current in digital marketing and industry trends to champion best practices across all channels.
Qualifications:
A minimum of 7+ years’ experience working in digital marketing agency.
Ability to define objectives and work with a team to develop a cohesive strategy that drives campaign and business results.
Experienced using digital marketing tools such as, but not limited to, Google Analytics and AdWords, paid social platforms (Facebook Ads, Pinterest, LinkedIn, etc.), email marketing (Mailchimp, HubSpot, Dotmailer, etc.), and programmatic technology.
Knowledge and experience with online marketing tools and best practices.
Basic knowledge of web design procedures.
Leadership skills and strategic vision.
Exceptional collaboration, teamwork, and interpersonal skills
Exceptional written and oral communication skills with strong executive presence Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced and changing environment.

Position Description:
1SEO.com Digital Agency is looking for an ADVANCED SEO Strategist to work alongside our innovative and growing digital marketing team. The candidate will be responsible for delivering and managing search engine optimization efforts to support the SEO team. Daily workload includes, but is not limited to, link building, social media posting, campaign auditing, metric reporting, keyword research, on-page optimization, website/code editing, and web development. This is a full-time position based in our HQ in Bristol, PA.
Responsibilities:
Audit accounts from the ground up. Dive into comprehensive reporting and metrics to develop strategies that allow accounts to perform online.
Research and make keyword recommendations based on trends, value, and competitors.
Recommend both on and off-site tactics to have accounts perform online.
Build and outreach to high quality link sources and make professional relationships with webmasters.
Remove links that cause site optimization issues by means of removal outreach to webmasters.
Participate on client calls and take inclusive notes to report back to the SEO team with.
Utilize and understand how to leverage multiple digital marketing tools.
Maintain project reports and spreadsheets.
Research and stay current on industry trends and topics.
Work alongside peers to fully cater to clients’ needs.
Adhere to many other processes and procedures necessary to uphold the agreement between 1SEO.com and it’s clients.
Required Skills and Experience:
MUST HAVE 5 years or more of SEO experience. Agency experience is preferred, but not required.
Experience and understating of SEO, including keyword research, audit reporting, on-page, and off-page tactics required.
Must have great organizational skills and attention to detail.
Must have a strong willingness to learn & the ability to work as a team or independently.
Must be able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.
Must have excellent planning, analytical, and personal management skills.
Must have the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously with a sense of urgency.
Must have the ability to quickly adjust priorities to respond to pressing demands.
What You Can Expect From 1SEO.com Digital Agency & Shock I.T. Support:

After 90 days of Full-time employment we offer our full-time employees:
* 100% funded healthcare benefits for the employee + supplemental health care insurance at a reduced cost
* Earn up to 2 weeks PTO with an additional week given at year 3 AND another week at year 5.
* You can join the 401K after your 1st year of employment. No matching % 's here, we provide 3% regardless of how much or little you contribute.
* Generous incentive program for each anniversary you celebrate.

As an SEO Manager, you will assist the Head of SEO in day-to-day management and long-term projects related to organic search programs. You will be collaborating with Partnerships, Product, and Engineering teams to optimize/create content throughout websites, while working with other Marketing and PR team members to execute on link building. Technical SEO experience and skills, such as scripting, data mining, and automation, are required for this role.


We are seeking a talented and highly motivated SEO Manager who is excited about advancing our mission to provide universal access to the world’s best education. You are a strategic thinker and have a go-getter mentality. In addition, you are eager to learn and develop new skills, including technical skills, and feel comfortable working in a performance-driven environment, while maintaining a strong sense of team and collaboration.
Your responsibilities:
Analyze internal unstructured and structured data to identify opportunities, both short and long-term.

Audit and perform backlink analysis to maintain a diverse and healthy link profile.
Work with stakeholders to improve the quality of existing pages.
Generate SEO performance reports that synthesize data across multiple web properties and inform stakeholders about the health of the SEO program.
Evangelize SEO to elevate awareness and to develop/promote a SEO mindset within cross-functional teams.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Product, Content Strategies, Partnerships, etc. and innovate the SEO program.
Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in SEO, Content Marketing, and Digital Marketing and share out the learning with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams.

4+ years of managing and leading SEO initiatives with demonstrated results in a similar role
Strong understanding of search engines and link structure of the Web
Solid understanding of on-page optimization best practices and techniques
Deep understanding of keyword research process to identify opportunities
Experience with managing relationships with external websites, building lead lists, and successfully acquiring backlinks
Proficient in writing meta description and writing product description in English language. Experience in content marketing is a plus
Excellence in managing large amounts of data with the ability to interpret and extract meaningful insights. Operational knowledge of Excel formula or SQL required
Strong understanding of web markup, including HTML, CSS, and Schema
Experience in testing hypotheses to discover which optimization techniques work for different websites
Expert-level knowledge of Google Search Console and other analytic/research tools, such as Google Analytics, Conductor, SEMRush, or equivalent
Passion for education is a plus

Alo Moves is looking for a data-driven, results-oriented Digital Marketing Specialist to manage our search campaigns on Google, Bing and App Store. The SEO team at Amazon has end-to-end responsibility for one of the largest managed marketing channels in the world. Our team optimizes the Amazon retail websites for search engines and manages the landing page experience from search engines for our customers. Our organization is comprised of Marketing, Product, Engineering and Business Intelligence teams, and we are truly international with members of our teams in Seattle, Palo Alto, London, Paris, Madrid, Dubai, Bangalore, Sao Paulo, Beijing and Tokyo.
Insights drive our business, and we invest in developing proprietary technology to help uncover them, such as an experimentation system for measuring and driving SEO changes. We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Product Manager to lead the development and ownership of our growing suite of SEO Business Intelligence (BI) systems. The successful candidate will lead the SEO teams BI program for Amazon's WW Retail websites such as Amazon.com, and directly undertake some of the teams most challenging deep dive investigations.
You will own the BI product roadmap and have a vision of what additional systems and/or enhancements are needed to support our Marketing, Product and Engineering teams gain insights from their efforts. You will collaborate across these teams to source requirements for BI systems, lead the prioritization of the BI roadmap, and product manage the development of analytics solutions that generate insights, drive product strategies and identify business opportunities. As such, you will have a highly analytical mindset, data savviness, and the vision to devise analytical product solutions.
When not driving forward the BI roadmap, you will deep dive into solving some of the SEO teams most challenging business questions, providing insights that inform our teams roadmaps. As such, this role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, who is a talented problem solver with an aptitude for generating hypothesizes and evaluating them with data analysis. In this role, you will work with diverse, complex, and very large data sets. If an analytical solution does not exist to be able to conduct a deep dive, you will design a solution and work hand-in-hand with Data Engineers, Business Intelligence Engineers, Data Scientists and Software Developers to build a product that enables you or team members to do so. You will have a solid understanding of business intelligence software such as Tableau, be fluent in SQL, and have an excellent ability to use data for statistical analysis.
The successful candidate may currently be in a Business Analyst role and looking to transition into a Product Management role, or are a Product Manager with a Business Analyst background who enjoys spending your days solving intensely challenging problems, or building new systems to do so. You will frequently advise WW teams conducting experiments and product launches on effective A/B and MVT measurement methodologies. To guarantee your success, you will have the support of Data Engineers, Business Intelligence Engineers, and Data Scientists, and you will be coached by a strong team of leaders in the SEO field, who will work with you on your strengths and weaknesses to guide you to success. This position will be located at Amazon's Seattle HQ only.
The SEO Business Intelligence Product Manager (Business Intelligence) responsibilities include:
Responsibility for creating and delivering our BI roadmap, with objectives to help solve complex SEO problems that can have a material difference to our commercial performance, and develop systems that help reduce time spent on manual analysis
Liaise with your internal Marketing and Product customers to understand the problems they face and ensure that they have the correct self-service solutions for measuring experiments, product launches and analysis of channel performance
End to end product management of BI systems, including scope, design, QA, delivery, global scaling and training of new technology
Partnering with engineers and data scientists to build analytical solutions for measuring experiments, and automated cause-effect systems
Providing support and guidance to Marketing and Product managers to ensure their use cases can be addressed with existing systems, or gather requirements for developing additional functionality
Perform deep dive analysis of complex business questions using large scale data analysis, requiring you to gain an understanding the problem space, design an analytical solution, execute against it, and incorporating learnings into your product roadmap
Participate in reviews of audits and deep dive analysis of the wider SEO team, providing feedback and direction as necessary
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required
4+ years' experience in the Business Analysis and/or Product Management fields
Minimum 2+ years' experience in the Business Analysis field
Expert with SQL & Tableau
Advanced data analysis skills and ability to identify actionable insights from large datasets
Proven track record assuming ownership, moving quickly to implement ideas, and delivering results and in a fast-paced online environment.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, drive rationale and identify opportunities
Ability to drive clear, thoughtful, and comprehensive analyses of marketing programs
Excellent communication skills - written and verbal
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across business and technical teams to deliver results

The Amazon Prime Video Search Engine Optimization team manages one of Amazon's largest marketing channels worldwide. PACIFIC is founded on the premise that the massive amount of data readily available to brand advertisers can be combined with the best practices of search engine optimization to deliver a more relevant and engaging experience to consumers.

PACIFIC is looking to change the way brand marketers view SEO. To us, it’s no longer about results on a page. Instead, we believe it’s about:
Crafting delightful and engaging digital experiences for visitors.
Extending brands beyond websites and into mobile, social media, and the open web.
Understanding the influence of geography on shopper behavior.
Translating discovery to action.
We are seeking an SEO Manager to join our San Diego Team. The Organic Search manager will play a key role within our company. The position is for someone who has an entrepreneurial attitude, is passionate about all things related to organic search, social and digital, and deeply cares for their team and their clients. In short, if you consider yourself a digital marketer, curious about exploring the connections between search, technology, and consumer behavior, then let’s connect.

We’d like you to be very familiar with the best practices of the search marketing industry. You understand the core concepts behind the best available practices of organic search, know how to develop and execute keyword rich on page content, and know how to pull intelligence from analytics.

If you can do all these things, then drop us a line. You’ll love it here.

The core responsibility for the role will be to understand, communicate and execute all things related to organic search. You’ll be involved with our clients in all aspects of their business activities, from reporting to executing strategies originating from campaign performance:
Convey key fundamentals of SEO to both technical and lay persons alike.
Be a specialist in your space by staying on top of current search news, search engine feature and algorithmic adjustments.
Work closely with the Head of Organic Search to conceptualize and implement SEO projects including, but not limited to on-page and off-page optimization activities.

Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.

Work independently to recognize areas of opportunity and growth.

Proficient in keyword research and build-out.

Experience with traffic and analytics tools.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.
